Reviews.Title: “Good service, but rooms need some updating”
Reviews.Author: dm713
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Fairmont and it is a good hotel for business people. It's right in the downtown Singapore business district and convenient to shopping areas. It is suitable for business travelers and that's about 90% of the people who stay here. We were here for a trade show at the Singapore Expo, and it's a good 20 minute cab ride away. The rooms are in need of some updating. There's a nice large flat screen TV, but everything else in the room is dated. Bed is comfortable. The service at the Fairmont is really good, all staff are friendly and helpful. My favorite is the older gentleman who opens the door to Prego each morning. Always a smile and wave! Oh and yes, that's one of the best breakfast buffets around. Do go here, not to the poolside buffet. The hotel is attached to the Raffles City mall and is right about the MRT for easy transportation. It's also across the street from the Raffles Hotel (home of the overpriced Singapore Sling) and Chijmes (great walking around/restaurant options). For a more relaxing/holiday trip, I'd suggest a different hotel out of the central business area. In particular, the pool area is really small as they have to share it with the Swissotel. Again, great service but the rooms are just average. I hope to see some changes before my next visit,

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable and relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: Warooka
Reviews.Content: First time in Singapore and spent 4 nights at the Fairmont. Special occasion (aniversary and birthday celebration) and the hotel provided us with a room upgrade and a few special touches - cake and candles, bottle of wine, hand written cards and rose petals in the form of a heart and a love message on the parquet floor! One of the most comfortable beds we have ever slept in and the down pillows were a delight. Very hot and very busy location but room was beautifully and quietly cooled and incredibly quiet. Balcony overlooked Raffles and with the door open the noise of the busy street below was very audible but closed - not a sound. Staff very friendly and helpful, check in and out easy and quick. Came back to our room one lunchtime to find it still being made up so went down to the pool area to sit and wait. When staff found out the room wasn't ready, could not apologise enough and insisted on coffees and iced water on the house while we wait. Huge choice at breakfast buffet. Would happily return,

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Mika C
Reviews.Content: First stay at Fairmont Singapore. Business trip. Within 2 hours I checked in, I already recieved the worst experience I ever had 1. Mediocre facilities, desk lamp even broken 2. Keep you waiting all the time: when request to repair the desk lamp or change another room, wait for 10+ min on the line. In order to get it done, I almost missed dinner time (fortunately there is foodcourt just downstairs, which I guess is the ONLY good thing) 3. Unfriendly attitude of the "premium customer" front desk: when I reflect all the problems I had experienced, the front desk personnel just asked "Oh sir, are you our premium customer? If not, please go to the other front desk!" Definitely the worst response I have ever heard! 4. Can't even do the fundamentals right: when the front desk change a new room, they even forgot to set up the new key right. So I couldn't even get in my room. And all of these problems happened within 2 hours after I checked in..... Amazing! Honestly I would say, based on my experience (~200 nights in China, HK, Taiwan, Singapore), it could be easily the worst experience I had ever. Simply just very disappointed...

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Could use an update.”
Reviews.Author: jrw859
Reviews.Content: The Stamford is right next door. Breakfast is varied but the same everyday. Great service.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive stay”
Reviews.Author: Viraphol
Reviews.Content: An impressive stay for family of 4. Minutes away from Raffles City Mall & Suntec City and 4 MRT stops to Orchard Rd. Only SGD 6 by taxi to Singapore Flyer and SGD 17 to Jurong Bird Park. We stayed for 2 nights at Room No. 2132 that offered stunning scenery of Marina Bay. Actually I don't like to write review. But this hotel made us impressive until I can't resist to write. The staffs are very helpful from doorman, Asst. Mgr., Receptionist, H/K staffs and cashiers. They posess richful smiles and sincere eye contacts. They made us feel very comfortable and warm. I am not reluctant to recommend this hotel. We for sure will be the repeated guests of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in the "colonial" quarter - nostalgic but modern!”
Reviews.Author: s1m0ne192
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family of four during Easter and overall, we rated this hotel quite highly. However, when we first checked in, we were disappointed that they had not provided a family room as requested even though this was specified on the booking! That got sorted out quite quickly though and everything went well. The hotel is in a brilliant location opposite Raffles Hotel and Chijmes, and right on top of Raffles City shopping mall and food court with a ColdStorage supermarket on hand. Easy to get around to all the main tourist attractions by MRT or even walking. I would recommend this hotel if you like modern decor with the more tradiional Raffles nearby - the Long Bar is just across the road! The rooftop pools are lovely with happy hour between 5.30 pm and 8.30 pm when drinks are more reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SydneyRabbit66
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights of a six night stay in Singapore at the Fairmont. We planed on using this hotel as our base for exploring Singapore, and our second location as our pampering rest location (Shangri La Singapore). As it turned out, the Fairmont was a much more enjoyable stay. The location is excellent, being perched above excellent food outlets, shopping and the MRT. As this was our 1st visit to Singapore, the lovely lady on reception upgraded us to a harbour view room, which was fantastic. The light show from our balcony was great. All in all, the Fairmont was a first class hotel with excellent service. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a 5 star base to explore Singapore. PS. Breakfast by the pool was a great way to start your day of sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bussiness Hotel, Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Mankster
Reviews.Content: I have stayed numertimes in this hotels under its previous brandings - Westin Plaza and Raffles the Plaza. Havimg made the PanPacific my regular haunt in Singapore, I tried the Fairmont for the first time under its new rrebranding/owners. I am glad to report nothing much has changed from service to the decor. I upgraded from a regular room to a Signiture room at check in for S$50 a night, much cheaper than booking the higher grade room from the start. This room is larger, has 2 blaconies and a separate walk in wardrobe area. This hotel is perfect in just about every way, from service to its location giving covered access to a high end mall with cheap eats and an MRT interchange station. Only the rather small pool (shared with the neighbouring Swissotel Stamford - so 2000 rooms in total) lets it down. Breakfast in the Marketplace Cafe is great, but with all 5* Singapore hotel buffet breakfasts, they are only worth while if its included in your room rate, especially if there are two of you. Internet costs an arm and a leg, but if you sign up for the Presidents Club, its free. Well worth the 1 minute form filling. Though I would class this as a bussiness hotel, I stayed with family and would reccomend this hotel those looking for a central 5* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this well-located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Libby08
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location for tourists, directly opposite Raffles and you can walk to both City Hall and Esplanade MRT stations through the adjoining shopping centre. We were upgraded to a deluxe room which was still a little small, although very well furnished with a comfy bed and excellent bathroom. Breakfast was included in our rate and the buffet offered a huge choice of good-quality options. Service from all the hotel staff was outsanding. Our flight left late in the evening, and we were able to use the hotel spa to shower and change after check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: David12810
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with this hotel. Suspect this hotel has a 4 star rating however it felt superior to us. From the moment we checked in when our bags were whisked away, we were all provided with fresh mango juices and the children given balloons, until we checked out, we had a wonderful stay. Staff (and there were many of them!) were incredibly helpful and genuinely friendly. Staff made several bookiings on our behalf at no cost. The room facilities were excellent, in our case including 2 king single bed (suitable for 2 children to share one and 2 adults in the other. Everyone commented on the comfort of the beds. The swimming pools (family and adult) were perfect, the adult one boasting a depth of 1.8 metres at the centre. We had many swims but never found either of the pools overcrowded. Breakfast by the pool was ideal with a wide range of delicious food options. The hotel is located centrally, adjacent/above a mall which included an excellent supermarket. Staff very happy to provide us a late check out. The hotel also provides use of a 'Hospitality Lounge' if you need it, post check out - very handy if flying out late in the day.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Des L
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our 2 night stay at this central city hotel. Great comfort withfriendly,obliging staff. Conveniently located as part of the Rafflec City Shopping Complex - everything available an elevator ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: fas73
Reviews.Content: Positives: Location - specially with regards to business. Not very ideal for tourists whereby Orchard Road or Clarke is recommended. Facilities and Staff - of a good standard. Facilitated late check out. My flight was at 11 pm so i checked out at standard time, kept my luggage with them and when i returned to the hotel at 8 pm, they allowed me to use the spa for changing and freshening up. Negative: The room wasnt that big despite the fact that i requested for a double/ king bed, the preallocation was for a twin room which was changed when i checked in. The room was indeed very small (compared to what was shown in pictures) and odd dimensional one since most of the space was taken up by a narrow doorway (atleast 15sqm) leading to the room. Bathroom was nice sized leaving very little movement space in the room itself. The parquet flooring leading to the room was not carpeted (obviously) giving a dusty feel. I dont think it was mopped even during my entire 4 day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore holiday”
Reviews.Author: Jenny W
Reviews.Content: Had a 5 night stay in March 2012. South tower 24th floor overlooking the pool. Not the beautiful view to the east but never the less it was not a problem. The bathroom was very modern, room was sufficiently big enough, plenty of storage space, courtesy bottled water, staff very attentive. The foyer was refreshingly cool and smelled like lemon grass. Location was perfect, easy distance to all tourists attractions. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service, great location”
Reviews.Author: kaiah04
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed 3 nights at the Fairmont recently. We had both a Fairmont and a Deluxe Room. The Fairmont Room was really large and had everything we needed including robe and slippers but was a little dated. The Deluxe room was a little smaller but much more modern and had a great big round shower head in the bathroom. The turndown service was a nice surprise, with a weather forecast card placed on my pillow and a bottle of water and glass placed on my bedside table. The staff were exceptional, giving my daughter a balloon on check-in and all staff making a bit of a fuss over her. The location was great with a huge mall underneath with a great food hall and plenty of restaurants to choose from. My only complaint would be lack of free wifi. I was kind of expecting this but it seems Singapore as a whole doesn't freely offer wifi. I did manage to connect for free via the Starbucks underneath the hotel however it was a bit inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “A substandard Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: clavier88
Reviews.Content: very good location right above the City Hall MRT station and the Raffles City mall. 15 min. walk to the Merlion. we had a deluxe room which was very big and clean. Very comfortable beds and pillows. new bottles of water every day. However, the quality of the hotel is not like a Fairmont that I had expected. we stayed in the South Tower which was renovated not long ago. the bathroom was nice and modern, but the rest of the room could really benefit from an uplift (e.g. the closet door was chipped, and other wood furniture needs some serious touch up). the staff at the reception was polite and courteous, but perhaps because they were too busy, they didn't follow up with our request about the Preidents Club application and send me the temporary membership card to my room was promised twice. The hotel charges for the wifi. But if you sign up for the free Presidents Club membership at checkin, your internet fee will be waived at check-out (make sure you inquire and confirm about it at the reception). on one of the nights we stayed, there was a firework at the water front. I could see a bit of it which was nice as I didn't expect that. However, a big part of it was blocked by the Pan Pacific Hotel and the Conrad (I think? Or was it the Sheraton...). anyhow it was a bonus. at the time of our stay (February 2012), there was a big construction in the front, so not a nice view when i looked down from the balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, simply cannot fault”
Reviews.Author: Cliff B
Reviews.Content: My family and I have spent a total of 9 nights at the Fairmont hotel with a break of 4 days in the middle (trip to Phuket), and the Fairmont simply feels like a home away from home. Every staff member has been outstanding to all of my family, especially our two young children, from the cleaners to the doormen to the reception staff. The hotel is absolutely spotless and the location is one that is simply ideal for both shopping, attractions and breathtaking views of the city. Will definitely be staying here again for both a family getaway and as a stay-over for further destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Very handy location”
Reviews.Author: br40
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Fairmont Hotel in Singapore some 6 years ago and liked the hotel and location then, so decided to stay there again in March 2012. We were a little apprehensive as some recent reviews had been critical of the hotel condition and lack of maintenance. This was unfounded, and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We booked a Signature room, and our room on the 25th floor was great - unobstructed views through to the Marina Bay Sands hotel and adjoining areas. The location was very handy, walking distance to the Singapore Flyer etc; opposite Raffles Hotel; and with a good shopping centre and MTR station as part of the hotel complex. The Prego restaurant in the complex was great for breakfast and dinner, with good food and efficient and friendly service. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Gavin0198
Reviews.Content: The location of Fairmont Singapore is very good, close to the Singapore river less than 10 minuts walk. The room is really nice and view is good. Especially the food court can provide many kinds of Asian food, it's convenient and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Singapore -great location”
Reviews.Author: TravellingThruTime
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont Singapore for 2 nights prior to our cruise. The hotel was spotless and the staff extremely helpful. Stayed on the Executive floor and the lounge and the breakfast was first rate. The view is quite good--overlooking the Singapore Flyer and Raffles. The hotel is very well situated for sightseeing and shopping. Would stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Manav D
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights on a business trip. Rooms are much nicer than the adjoining swissotel property. Overall it was a comfortable stay, however Internet speed was awful

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to be... location, food, views...”
Reviews.Author: kashyapgrover
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for about 4 days. The location is a plus point. Close to Orchard, train station, restaurants, shopping etc. Good size rooms with very clean environment. Service is very nice and staff is very courteous. The buffet breakfast was fabulous. The poolside restaurant was awesome. Great spa in house and very nice concierge. The staff arranged local tours without any difficulty at good prices. The shopping mall in the complex is very high end with all big brands. Its a very nice place to be with the family. The adjoining roads are not very crowded, so getting a taxi in peak hours is not a very big problem. Staff was very friendly. The chef and manager in restaurant was very courteous and offered lot of things. Staff was always smiling and greeted every time. My recommendation to the management would be to upgrade their entertainment systems in room. TVs were bit outdated and need to replace it. And also need some activities for kids, like games and poolside goodies. Overall it was very good experience, would love to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for Singapores attractions”
Reviews.Author: Hector1
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel mid morning after a cruise along with about 60 or so other cruisers from Cunard. I was expecting check in to be a bit of a nightmare due to the number of us, but it was extremely well organised and we were in our room within about 20 minutes of arriving at the hotel. Our room was on the 14th floor in the North tower and our friends were on the 22nd floor. Their room was better than ours due to its higher location (fantastic views over the city), but also it had been recently upgraded, whereas our was a little dated. Having said that everything worked and it was a good size room with a large bathroom, so we had no complaints. The thing I most liked about this hotel is that it is so well located, close to Raffles, Orchard Road, Shopping Malls, and not too far to walk to the harbour area. In fact we walked everywhere except when we ventured over to Sentosa Island. We were on a room only basis, and decided to take the breakfast in the hotel at around £20++ This turned out to be a good move as the breakfast was fabulous, with really excellent service. We were on a late flight back and I was a little worried about checking out at noon, wondering how we would freshen up for our journey home. The hotel however had laid on a courtesy room, complete with tea/coffee facilities, and gave us use of the spa to shower and change before we left the hotel. I would also recommend Chimes across the road for dining. There are several restaurants in a courtyard complex around a Church. We had tapas, and it was fab. Would recommend this hotel, but would perhaps suggest you take a look at the room on checking in, particularly if you have not got such a good rate on the price.

Reviews.Title: “It is actually (Un)Fair-mon(ey)-t(rip)”
Reviews.Author: NS_chd
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights on a business trip. Horrible experience with reception staff. The girl at the front desk decided to put on 1000$ as hold (although my room was already paid for) - then after a couple of minutes says "we dont need 1000$ - 400 is enough". So she puts another 400@ on hold and says she will get the 1000$ released 'fast'. I realize later that she ended up putting 2400$ on hold (another 1000$ got put on hold while attempting the first 1000$) - I had a tough time in almost all of my entire stay trying to get the 1000 + 1000 $ hold released including making multiple calls to my credit card company. All the reception staff could say was 'we are really sorry'. Even after checking out, it has taken me almost 3 weeks to get the remaining 400$ released. And they have no uniform policy at the time of check in - a colleague of mine was allowed to check in just like that because he said he neither had enough cash nor a credit card. Their service is poor - I tried couple of times to call room service - no one answered the calls although it kept ringing for more than a couple of minutes The fridge in the room was not working - was on a defrost mode all the time - I wrote a note for the housekeeping to get it fixed but nothing was done The number of channels and TV reception was certainly not befitting a 5 star luxury hotel Overall quite a disappointing experience if one compares it with other chains of similar repute

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Triple C
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Fairmont during the F1 2011 and it was one of the best hotels to be in. The view of the circuit was great. Service was excellent with friendly staff. However, the rooms are a bit old and needs an upgrade soon. Location of the hotel was good and had easy access to MRT station and to shopping complexs. Breakfast also was quite good and we throughout enjoyed our stay throughout. Will definitely stay back in Fairmont if I am back in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel at an Awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: gdavid87
Reviews.Content: The location is amazing. Love the attached mall. The staff are excellent, and pay plenty of attention to detail. Offers a nice view of the Singapore skyline as well!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: WinniethepoohUK
Reviews.Content: If possible upgrade to Executive Rooms. Rooms are as non Executive, but it allows access to Executive Lounge, Breakfast, Cocktails and food in the evening from 17.00 to 20.00 plus complimentary wi-fi. These make the upgrade price fully cost effective. Staff on Executive floor very helpful, friendly and efficient. Lounge with views over the city is very pleasant environment for Breakfast compared with the ground floor restaurant. Sister hotel to Raffles, which is across the road, so meals etc there can be charged to your account, perhaps too convenient !! Hotel lobby is small by other hotel standards, but you do not eat or sleep in the lobby. Rooms may be approaching the tired looking stage, but this is an excellent hotel to stay at in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but needs major refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: HannLyn
Reviews.Content: I first stayed in this hotel in their deluxe room several years ago and remembered it as a really nice comfortable room. However while the bed is still comfortable, the deluxe room has since gone downhill. Floors,walls and furniture were really scratched and the bathroom was quite worn out. It is a shame for the hotel to let the condition of the room to become like this, I thought by Singapore standards, they should place more care on maintainance. The location is very convenient however but if you are looking for a nicer ambience, this would not be amongst the top choices.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location....”
Reviews.Author: markandphilippa
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is in a good location with a great pool area - particularly if you have children. The staff were very good throughout our visit and if you are looking for a decent good value city centre hotel then I wouldn't look any further. We walked to the theatre area / esplanade which was nice and also took a boat ride from Clarke quay to marina bay - both worth doing. The top of marina bay is worth doing but try and go up early in the day otherwise it gets full and you are limited to walking around a very small area at one end. The wheel is good, and if you have younger children the fire station has open doors on Saturday morning - good fun for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Gold star”
Reviews.Author: DEK007
Reviews.Content: This Fairmont lived up to the hotel's reputation. The Gold Level provided personalized, excellent concierge service for sightseeing and travel, and lovely view of the city and harbour from the room in the north tower. Good central location.

Reviews.Title: “Great service but rooms need to be renovated....”
Reviews.Author: Dpak7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont for 4 nights. We were there early so expected the rooms to be not ready but the Hotel has a Hospitality lounge on the 6th florr where we could stay for a couple of hours. This is a brilliant idea as it had coffee machine, soft drinks etc and nice couches with TV and a balcony...this was very relaxing especially after a long night flight. The rooms are not as modern as other hotels of Fairmont or the other good hotels in Singapore but not bad as well. The rooms size is good and they are neat and clean but you can see from the edges it is a bit worn out. The bathrooms are not the most state of art but nice and clean. The concierge of the hotel (especially Shareen) was excellent and the rest of the staff from the morning breakfast to reception were exceptional. House keeping was great as well and the morning breakfast was great too. However, you have plenty of choices near the hotel for breakfast that it does not make sense to pay extra for it at the hotel. The location is great as it is close to all places and is actually attached to the Raffles City mall. There is Chijmes restaurant and bar complex just 100 metres away with a host of good eating and drinking choices. Overall a good place but make sure you have a nice room.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Ayalax
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Hotel in Singapore is attached to the Raffles City shopping mall (with easy access to the MRT) and across the road from the Raffles Hotel. The staff is excellent - always friendly and helpful, obviously well-trained. We had a corner room on a high floor with two balconies, which gave us good views over the city. The room had minimal wardrobe space but otherwise was good with a king size bed, two chairs, sofa, desk and casual chair. The bathroom was slightly tired looking with the shower over the bath, but fine otherwise. Guests are spoiled for choice for restaurants. The hotel itself has a very good Chinese and also a Japanese restaurant as well as the Prego Italian restaurant. The Alligator Pear is the Fairmont's casual eatery which is by the swimming pool. Breakfast is also served here. The Swiss Stamford hotel is part of this complex and there are good restaurants within that hotel including the Equinox Restaurant on level 70. There are many casual eating places within the shopping mall itself. A short walk away is the Chimjes complex which has a mixture of casual and formal restaurants. The Fairmont is a good choice in Singapore for retail therapy, food and getting around.

Reviews.Title: “huge comfortable room with a big bath tab.”
Reviews.Author: Wagyuu
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right next to Raffle City shopping mall and very convenient to go anywhere. It was hot, so we took a taxi and didn't take MRT, but there is a station next to the hotel. Breakfast has Western and Asian buffet style. Asian food was a bit weaker, though. Coffee was good, but there was a long line every morning even there were many empty tables. It's a good hotel with a high price tag and with average service.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geordie_calgarian
Reviews.Content: very central location, right across from Raffles, connected to a huge mall. stayed on the club floor - great food, great service, good meeting facilities. Lovely huge room.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Lou P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were celebrating our 39th wedding anniversary and the Fairmont staff went out of their way to spoil us during our 3-night stay. I would like to thank Cristie and Serena for our room preparation and making us feel at home. Their personal care shown to us was beyond any expectation.The hotel is wonderful and roomy and our view was a real treat. We would certainly stay at the Fairmont again and the value for money rates this as our best yet. L&G

Reviews.Title: “a definite 5 star”
Reviews.Author: doctorj6
Reviews.Content: we just returned from a 6 country tour and stayed in 8 different hotels. this was the best by far with exceptional service large rooms and a good location. this is a great hotel at a reasonable price. best choice in singapore by far.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Travel hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cranky_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week on business, and was very pleased. The rooms were immaculate. The bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom was first-rate. The toiletries were of very high quality. The hotel is in a convenient location and I had a nice view of the harbour at no extra charge. The food was good too, although the breakfast buffet was pretty pricey at ~35USD for a continental breakfast and ~50USD for a hot breakfast. If I had been on vacation instead of business travel I would have bought my breakfast each morning at the Starbucks around the corner. The high-speed Internet was a bit buggy at times, but not enough to be a serious problem. I'd recommend the Fairmont for business travelers to Singapore, but definitely not for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: birtleman
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Singapore off of a Cruise ship and I was required to be admitted to the Hospital. The staff at the hotel went way beyond any requirement to help my wife at every step for the next 10 days. From the front desk staff and Manger to the Doorman and the Business Office staff everyone helped in every way. The hotel itself is in a great location and well kept with great beds and other facilities. We would not stay anywhere else in Singapore and we are very thankful for the outstanding assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but far from the maddening crowd”
Reviews.Author: tj_sydney
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont for a couple of days during a stopover en route to Indonesia.. Staff are very friendly & helpful. We were upgraded to a harbour room with views of the huge ferris wheel & monstrous Marina Bay Sands building. The room was comfortable & well appointed (the bed & pillows were like sleeping on clouds!) and the bathroom was huge. The only downside was the huge shower head didn't work so we had to have showers holding the small handheld device. Despite advising them about this problem it was not fixed. The hotel's gym is fantastic with a separate cardio room, weights room & stretch room. Best I've used in a hotel. Not having been to Singapore before I thought it would be fun to stay in the Raffles areas but this turned out to be a mistake as not much happens here. The heart & hub of Singapore appears to be around Chinatown & Orchard Rd - not far but still a trek in either a taxi or on the metro. If you're in Singapore for shopping (though prices generally seemed much more expensive than back in Australia) or pleasure I'd recommend staying somewhere closer to where the bustle is.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, large rooms”
Reviews.Author: tnu
Reviews.Content: One of Singapore's older "new" hotels still commands a great location at the heart of the city. Rooms are large and have been renovated to a good, but not great, standard. The mall and the subway (or MRT) add to the overall convenience of the location. A solid choice for the business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC spa service!”
Reviews.Author: Aggie_Z
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an older room at the Fairmont in January 2012. Pros: - Location, location, location!! City Hall MRT underneath hotel - Shopping centre underneath hotel, including supermarket, pharmacy, fast food and other restaurants and (my favourite) J.Co Donuts - Raffles Hotel across the road (if you want a Singapore Sling or just a look around) - Bugis Junction a 10min walk down North Bridge Rd - National Museum a 10min walk down Stamford Rd - Very large, comfortable beds - Excellent room cleaning and nightly turn-down service - Quiet - Free spa services (sauna, steam room, plunge pool, whirlpool, showers, hairdryers, deodorant, hairspray, combs, iced water, tea, fruit) - just leave your room key in exchange for a locker - Excellent customer service, especially from Victor the Doorman - Free wifi for members of the Fairmont President's Club (join via the internet before you get there, it's free) - Good views of Singapore Cons: - Older style room - Flickering light in bathroom despite maintenance coming to fix it when we first arrived - No door on the cupboard housing the fridge

Reviews.Title: “Service included”
Reviews.Author: weemacs
Reviews.Content: Just stayed the one night en route to Malaysia. Everything was in the right place. Good comfortable room on the 22nd floor. The shower controls were not very efficient and the lighting system in the room needs a university degree or a computer wizz kid. Ended up taking the card out of the slot at the door before retiring. Great pool bar on the 7th floor and staff everywhere to guide you. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more for this price”
Reviews.Author: Biff3ridge
Reviews.Content: Billed as a flash new hotel. The breakfast was excellent. The room unusual (the hotel's round) with good space. But - the bathroom was poorly finished. The tap on the shower fell off. And it's very dated and apparently badly designed - not sure how you'd solve the very slow draining of shower/bath/sink. very slippery too. Sort of looked like the bathroom belonged in a prison. My iron didn't work which I didn't find out until the morning when I was attempting to iron a shirt and get to the office. Phoned the concierge with an urgent urgent request for another to be sent up. apparently urgent is more than 1 hour and it didn't arrive by teh time I left for the office - un-ironed. Worst for me was my running shoes were taken off the balcony by the cleaners who thought I'd "discarded" them. I hadn't. And the hotel had no process to follow up - they were just "gone" and they "apologized". And then their fast check out box promised to email a copy of the bill to me but didn't. I've just phoned to request it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: EastSussexGemini
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three nights at the Fairmont Singapore en-route to Sydney. All the staff we encountered were friendly and courteous and went out of their way to make us feel welcome. Our room was large and comfortable and had amazing views over the City and Marina. The bathroom was well appointed with high class toiletries. The breakfast buffet was of a very high standard with an extensive array of hot and cold dishes to suit all tastes - it was by far the best breakfast we've had at any hotel throughout our travels. We celebrated our wedding anniversary during our stay, and when we returned to our room after a sightseeing trip, we found a beautiful flower arrangement, a delicious box of chocolates and a heart shaped arrangement of red rose petals awaiting us. It was a lovely surprise and made our day! We ate at the Szechuan Restaurant and the food was outstanding and the service impeccable. We would recommend the Fairmont Singapore to anyone who is looking for modern day comforts and first class service with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: jorden
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 wonderful nights. Our room was lovely and large , with a fabulous bathroom/wet room. We looked onto raffles Hotel, just across the road. The staff were excellent,nothing was too much trouble. Our breakfast was wonderful. The hotel is situated next to a shopping centre with the MRT, but it was also easy to walk to the main areas of this stunning city.

Reviews.Title: “Top choice for Singapore”
Reviews.Author: traveller_au97
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 8-9 times in the last 10 months, everytime I come here, it feels like coming home. I always have the deluxe room, the staff are always polite...this place really cannot be faulted. Room service/mini bar quiet expensive but with so much good food all over Singapore, it would be a shame not to sample it outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Need to improve customer service”
Reviews.Author: stepanka h
Reviews.Content: Here is my recent experience with this hotel. I booked it basically because of the great experience last time (2009 - 2x). However when we arrived (03/04/12 @2:00 AM), a receptionist seemed knew nothing about our request and her attitude was terrible ! I was shocked by the unprofessional & arrogant service of the front desk staff and concierges (03/18/12 @ 9:00 AM) as well. Other hotel personnel are much friendly and helpful (bell boy,door man, housekeeping). Rooms are dated but CLEAN. The location & view is awesome. Overall I was kind of disappointed by my stay at the Fairmont again. Considering the rates at the Fairmont, I won't recommend this hotel. It was not the right hotel to splurge.

Reviews.Title: “great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patricia H
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for 2 nights on our way back from Australia. The service was great, rooms very good, I would like to try club facilities next time, didnt bother this this time as we were not there long enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: valmae
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews on this site we decided to book a deluxe room and were not disappointed. The bathroom was luxurious and the bed comfortable. This hotel has been around for some time but is well maintained and the staff are excellent. The lobby has an intimate feeling compared to the much larger Swissotel next door. The connection to the Raffels City shopping centre is very convenient and you have Singapore at your feet. The only disappointment was the cost of the in room wifi. They wanted SGD38.00 for three days and after just leaving a new hotel in Bangkok with free wifi it was a slap in the face. It seemed dated and old-fashioned. Time for this hotel to get with the times and realise that we all expect full free wifi when we travel. The days of only business travellers having laptops and needing access is well and truly over. So it was the Starbucks in the shopping centre for us when we needed wifi which was annoying. We didn't get to use the pool area but it was very nice too. So great hotel - just do something about the wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Much better Singapore Slings than across the road!”
Reviews.Author: NKarinH
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really lovely, the staff is great, and when we got back from the Raffles' Long Bar, gutted by our experience with their tourist trap Singapore Sling, the Ice Bar at the Fairmont (which isn't the hippest or busiest) rescued the night by giving us a great Singapore Sling served by really friendly staff. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service with good facility”
Reviews.Author: RogerNg123
Reviews.Content: Room is good But service is bad I have contacted hotel to reserve two non smoking twin rooms or connection room. However when I arrive, the reception seemed knew nothing about my request and gave me two double rooms. The attitude of the lady with think black eyeliner in the reception ( night shift) is very disgusting!!! They made the morning call in a wrong time !!! I cannot understand why it can happen in such a five star hotel !!! Ridiculous !!! No one answered call for the room service at night !! Please remember to eat outsider if u will stay in this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: lexi1980
Reviews.Content: This hotel was packed - everyone from business travelers/couples/flight crews/cruisers...Despite a couple of errors made by staff (they sure came around to correct check-in room mistakes), we absolutely loved this hotel. King suite is fantastic with great wrap around balconies and views. Fantastic pools and the best hotel gym (with brand new equipment) I have ever seen. Loved the zen-like lobby. Great location right at City Hall train and Raffles Marketplace underneath. All around excellent.

Reviews.Title: “drop dead beauty”
Reviews.Author: palrn
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel. Good location, room was outstanding in size and bedding was comfortable. Wonderful service. Perfect view of the sea and the city. Only small complaint was that dinner service did not start until and 6:30 pm and we had a very early flight out so were looking to eat and go to sleep early. The shower is a bit hard to manage the flooding but the shower head was great. towels were huge and soft. We were staying after a cruise, nice to have a little more than cabin space.

Reviews.Title: “Very good - will return”
Reviews.Author: Freeeequent
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a few times. Always good experiences. Professional, friendly and helpful staff. Excellent services: business center, transport, dry cleaning etc., room service. Good location. Quite and easy to sleep. Very clean. Singapore is a city with many good hotels so when frequent travellers returns to Fairmont it simply means the hotel is good!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service coupled with good location”
Reviews.Author: orator11
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite hotels whenever I return to Singapore. The service here is always good, and the location is excellent. There is even a pillow menu that you can choose from. It is right smack in the middle of a shopping centre, with good dining, shopping (including the flagship Robinsons and Mark and Spensers) and other facilities right at the doorstep. And if you need to travel anywhere else in Singapore, the Cityhall MRT exchange is located right in the basement, with the Suntec convention centre, Marina Bay Sands casino and the financial district just minutes away and even within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Baul_37
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 4 nights to attend my business meetings over there and its indeed a great place for stay. In room service is awsome, staffs are coordial and smiling. Every moment is enjoyable in this property. One important point I would like to flag up about this hotel is that its deposit during check in is too mamoth which indeed a pboblem.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: abcKl
Reviews.Content: The rooms in the Fairmont were lovely. The staff was friendly. The location was perfect. We stayed only two nights here but it was enough to appreciate the staff's efficiency. They surprised my daughter with balloons and cake for her birthday. The concierge was very helpful with planning some city sights for us. And they even called our room to be sure that everything was suitable and satisfactory. They went out of their way to make sure we had a good visit. I will definitely stay here the next time we are in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “OUR SINGAPORE EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: mareewatson
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Singapore for 3 nights and what a wonderful city ! Our visit was made even more enjoyable by the excellent accomodation and services provided by the Fairmont. All the staff made us feel very welcome and were attentive to all our needs. The attention to detail in the presentation of the hotel's facilities, left us with positive thoughts to return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: woz72
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 x days at this hotel with my wife and 1x year old son to celebrate my birthday. The location is fantastic with the Raffles Shopping complex connected to the Hotel and there is also an MRT station on the lower level. Raffles hotel is just opposite so you can enjoy a Singapore Sling in the long bar. Easy to walk anywhere , the Merlion , Singapore Flyer and Marina Sands Hotel are not that far away . As far as food options are concerned , plenty of choice , we ate in the Hotels Chinese restaurant which was excellent and also the Italian and Indian . Each restaurant went out of their way to accommodate our 1 x year old son , nothing was too much trouble , all the staff in the hotel and restaurants were very friendly and efficient. Breakfast by the pool is good and alternatively try the sister Swiss hotel in the Cafe Swiss , it's all connected to the hotel. Plenty of food options in the mall, including a supermarket. Stayed in a Signature room high up with balcony overlooking Raffles hotel , perhaps not the best room i have stayed in decor wise , long and thin in diameter as opposed to squared but never the less nice , with remote controls for everything , lights, curtains etc. .Think there maybe better views to be had in the hotel towards the Marina and not sure if there is alot of difference between a Deluxe and Signature room , a seat or two would have been nice on the balcony as there is no outdoor furniture Nice pool with a good poolside bar. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would have no hesitation staying here again although there is a huge choice of first class hotels in Singapore to choose from also very child friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Forget the standard room”
Reviews.Author: mct2
Reviews.Content: The standard rooms in the south tower are not on par with those of other S'pore hotels'. They are old and in much need of renovation. They are definitely not 5 star rooms by Asian hotel standards. They aren't even 5 star rooms by North American standards. HOWEVER, their deluxe rooms (most of which are in the north tower) are quite good. They are fully renovated and spacious. The washrooms were updated and the showerhead and water pressure was the best I've ever experienced in any hotel in the world (and I've stayed in my fair share of hotels). The location is awesome too.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Mary C Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have chosen this hotel because of the comment I read from your website. It was slightly expensive when comparing to other hotels of the same grade, but I thought why not if it is clean and comfortable. Very disappointing when I found my room pretty run down, mirror, pantry were very dusty. The bed was too soft. One of the light in the bathroom was blinking. No free wi fi or internet. The second morning, I told housekeeping my concern and when I came back at night, the light was fixed and they did sort of cleaned up. But still pretty dusty. I will not come back ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid”
Reviews.Author: mike453
Reviews.Content: My G/F and I stayed at the Fairmont Singapore for 4 nights over the new year holidays. A solid hotel worthy of its reputation and credentials. The deluxe room we stayed in was what you would expect from an efficient 4/5 star property. Nothing especially extravagant, but the room was of decent size with good amenities, decor was modern and the bed was very comfortable. The location was the best part with the hotel literally connected adjacent to a large shopping mall. There was plenty of food choices as the food court and groceries were one floor below the hotel in the mall area. The mall also connects to the subway system making for access to transportation. Overall, I would recommend the hotel for anyone wishing to be in a central location with easy access to shopping and transportation choices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mchour
Reviews.Content: Location was perfect and had a room have sufficient size with great view overlooking Marina Bay. Staff at the reception extremely friendly. The product is very good value for money and is generally well kept-up. I noticed it is a 5 star hotel but it is not the absolute top of the market in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: AK7811
Reviews.Content: By Far the best Fairmont I have ever stayed at. I had a suite and it was great. The location awesome! The TV however was the only thing lacking, poor cable quality. Beds were awesome and the bathroom was the largest I have ever seen. The hotel has 3 great restaurants and connected to the Stamford which means its a common pool but its a great pool. The willow spa was the best spa I have ever used. Highly recommend all around!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby,disappointing room”
Reviews.Author: beatrizantonini
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont in the last days of our trip to Asia. After staying in excellent hotels in Dubai(Grosvenor House) and Bangkok(Renaissence) we had great expectations about the Fairmont! When we arrived , we were impressed with the big and beautiful lobby, the porters using funny uniforms,and the good location. But when we got to our room , we were quite disappointed !!! The room was small, we could hardly open our second bag, the decoration was plain, we had a partial view of the marina! The bathroom was spacious, but again,no decoration, and a big problem: the shower was separated with just half wall of glass, so water spilled all over !!Of course there were good things about the Fairmont: location excellent,near the marina, service was ok, but one expect much more for a 5 star hotel ,mostly after having payed quite a high rate !We had dinner at one of the restaurants, Prego, what was good but expensive, but the bad thing is that they played the same italian music all dinner long, again and again and again !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Executive club worth it.”
Reviews.Author: BrissyGirl00
Reviews.Content: Just completed 6 wonderful nights at the Fairmont. I highly recommend the executive club rooms. It cost us about AUD$100 extra per night but it included breakfast, the room was newer and we really enjoyed the drinks and canapés from 5 to 8 pm. In fact, there was no need to go out for dinner - the canapés were sufficient. If you do want to eat, I recommend the restaurants in the basement of the Raffles City shopping centre under the hotel. There is a food court on the 3rd level but the food is a bit scary for non-locals. Don't bother checking in downstairs, take your luggage straight to the 23 rd floor to check in. Your executive club room will be on the 22nd or 23rd floor. No big queues. Same for checking out. Make sure you join the president's club before you head to Singpore as you get free wifi and local calls. The location is fantastic and the MRT is under the hotel (head towards the Swiss hotel for the closest entrance).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value, location and view.”
Reviews.Author: John P
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The location is excellent! Just cross the street to enjoy a Sling a the Long Bar or walk ~10-15 minutes to the bay, Merlion, etc... City Hall MRT station is at the base. The view from the south tower, 16th floor, bay facing room was awesome! We could clearly see the Marina Bay Sands, Merlion, and downtown. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Only complaint is that the room was a little old and shabby in places.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Personal Service.”
Reviews.Author: t m
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Fairmont Singapore on a 7 day business trip (Feb 2012). I brought along my wife and 4 month old son... his first visit to Asia and first foreign trip away from our home in London. From the moment we checked in the staff could not have been more helpful and attentive. We were staying in the newly renovated tower, in a very comfortable contemporary room with great views over the city. A cot was already in place, along with plenty of blankets and bedding not to mention a welcome pack including a large number of infant toiletries - a really nice personal touch. We also recevied a couple of phonecalls during our stay to check if there was anything else that could be done to make our stay more comfortable. Also my itinerary changed while we were there. The staff at the reservations desk were extremely helpful in helping me with my change of travel plans. The hotel is in a great central location and is attached to an extensive underground mall. There are also great leisures facilities. My Son had a wonderful time at the Alligator Pear swimming complex and my wife found getting around Singapore extremely easily from the hotel's location. I could not fault our stay at the Singapore Fairmont. We had a wonderful time on our first trip away from the UK as a family. The Staff provided a first class personal service which is very rare in larger Hotel. The accommodation and facilities were perfect for both business and my family. I could not recommend a stay here more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Room Quality and Upkeep”
Reviews.Author: Tomago
Reviews.Content: Ahh, the Fairmont! It's one of those famous international hotel names that just begs you to go there and be impressed. Sadly, in my most recent stay at the Fairmont Singapore, I was very disappointed with the hotel facilities. Let me expalin. For those of you who don't know this location, it's a relatively recent addition to the Fairmont chain of wonderful hotels that are sprinkled lightly around the globe. I've stayed at a number of their other inns, and they were first rate - so let's focus on the Sngapore one, as it's the topic of this review. The Singapore Fairmont started out as The Plaza, linked to the famous NYC Plaza hotel of "Sex in the City" and "The Way We Were" fame. It was later acquired by its highly noted local neighbor, Raffles and then was recently sold to the Fairmont chain. The land and buildings, of course, belong to someone else, but the operator that is responsible for the building is the Fairmont Group. If you go into the lobby of the hotel, you'll see that it is little changed over the past ten or so years and the lobby furniture, though still in good enough shape, is due soon for an upgrade. Attached, as it is, to the large MTR hub in the basement of the adjacent Raffles City shopping mall, the buidling gets quite a bit of foot traffic and is thus subject to the kind of abuse you'd expect from such a location. But it's not the public areas that disappointed me, but instead the condition of my room, especially my toilet and shower. To be blunt: my room was worn out. The carpeting was thin in a number of locations, the walls showed cracks and the room was in bad need of a new coat of paint. But it was in the bath room, that the lack of attention to the infrastructure was evident. Big chunks of plaster were falling off the walls next to the shower stall (an odd design, that always puzzeled me since there's no way to prevent water from coming out of the shower and onto the main bathroom floor - dangerous and sloppy design), grout was missing from the tile walls and the toilet fixture was, let's say, unhappy. If you are looking to stay in Singapore, I suggest that you consider spending a few more dollars and select another hotel - for example, the Fullerton?

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch service and a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ilovebali18
Reviews.Content: I made a mistake with my booking dates and didn't realize it until I was en route to hotel and still on the airplane . The on-duty manager was fantastic, understanding, and very professional. He corrected everything quickly and offered me the same rate for my one- day earlier arrival . The entire staff was excellent and went out of their way to please us. The rooms and bathrooms have been updated. The tub and separate shower head are in a glass enclosure . When you take a shower, the separate tub gets wet, too; this is all the result of renovation and retrofitting to get a separate shower and tub. There are two large round swimming pools that shared with the other Fairmont property . The funny thing is that when people swim laps, they go in circles; but, if someone starts swimming straight across the pool, then everyone starts swimming straight across. The hotel location is prime because it is across from sister Raffles Hotel, near the City Hall subway stop, connects to a mall, and is an easy walk to the Esplanade and many sights. I would return there without any hesitation and will make it my number choice in Singapore when I am paying the bill myself. Hats off to the friendly, professional, and friendly staff that is there to please .

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel....”
Reviews.Author: mulberry888
Reviews.Content: stayed for 1 night with my husband and 3yr child. Room is big and spacious. But corners of the room and non-carpeted areas feels dirty (on my feet) and some parts can actually see the dust and hair. *yucks* Bed is very comfy though. Bathroom is clean. Location is excellent, connected to Raffles City Shopping Centre and the MRT. Thus, good for business travellers. All in all, I find it as average, nothing to shout about.

Reviews.Title: “Well located quality 4*+ hotel”
Reviews.Author: oakleyrd
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a week in Singapore staying at this hotel. I had a large corner room ("Signature") which was very well appointed and very spacious with dual aspect views from two large windows on either side, both leading on to balconies. The only bad point (and this being really fussy) was the room was an older more classic decor than the rooms shown on the hotel website which have a more modern feel. Otherwise though the hotel is well located, the pool a very welcoming size (but lacking in poolside changing facilities). The Raffles city mall above which the hotel is located is also convenient for shopping and provides a generous array of restaurants in the basement level at very reasonable prices and to suit all tastes. Hotel breakfast offered ample choice. The only comment I would say is that there are lots of very nice hotels in Singapore and some would either offer better views (such as the Swisshotel Stamford) or more character and history (such as Raffles Hotel). In summary though a conveniently located hotel which would make a good base tourists and business visitors alike.

Reviews.Title: “Right next door to Raffles and half the price”
Reviews.Author: TIGER8697
Reviews.Content: A really beautiful Hotel on the Bras Basah Road (Marina) Old fashioned style with modern facilities and doorman who have been there since the beginning of time. Really good spacious rooms and very quiet. Overlooks raffles and close to Glutton's Bay food market. Eat breakfast at the Hotel - an awesome breakfast and a really good deal

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel with 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: AudreyTan
Reviews.Content: This is one hotel that is truly deserving of 5 stars. Many hotels claim to be 5 stars but only have 2 star service. Everything about Fairmont is impeccable, from their hotel facilities to reception and guest service. The lobby is beautiful and has plenty of seating. Staff are lovely and courteous, in particular Jesslyn at reception. We got a room on L13 in the South Wing with a brilliant view of Marina Bay Sands and the city. As it is an older hotel, it does have a little wear & tear and the bathroom has a bathtub-shower but the rooms are very spacious compared to some of the newer establishments. The twice daily housekeeping was fantastic, they even leave a note telling you what the weather will be the following day. Beds are extremely comfortable. And the location is fantastic - right above City Hall MRT station with the 2 main lines (red & green) which takes you to all parts of Singapore for less than SGD1 each way. You can catch the MRT to/from Changi Airport to City Hall for SGD1.70 each way. And if you want cheap food, next door at the Basement Level is Market Place food court with plenty of cheap local food. Overall, you can't go past the Fairmont for convenience and quality. We enjoyed our week long stay there very much.

Reviews.Title: “the most comfortable bed i have ever slept in:)”
Reviews.Author: travellingdoctor48
Reviews.Content: fairmont has treated us like royalties from the moment we got out of the airport shuttle to the time we left the hotel. the concierge has been very helpful thus maximising the time we spent in singapore. it is highly recommended for visitors who wishes a really comfortable bed at night after a long and hard day shopping and tasting all the beautiful meals

Reviews.Title: “First time but hopefully not the last”
Reviews.Author: shakeyw
Reviews.Content: What a super hotel.This was our first time in Singapore and our first stay at a Fairmont Hotel.We were not disappointed in either. On arrival the reception lady was exceptional and ensured we were given a late check out as previously requested and she also gave us an Upgrade to a De Luxe room in the South Tower with exceptional views over the war memorial and Marina.The room had all the amenities required and was kept to a very high standard of cleanlieness throughout our stay of 2 days. The breakfast on the 8th floor beside the swimming pool was exceptional and about the best we have had on our world travels. The location of the Hotel is very close to all manner of sights including just accross from Raffles and the Mall below has very good shopping and a very good food court for reasonable meals/snacks. All went well on check out and we were given access to a Lounge whilst we awaited our airport pick up . Well done everyone at The Fairmont for an exceptional short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Sinagpore”
Reviews.Author: Higbie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is top notch. When we checked in, I inquired about an upgrade which was available. We had a superb room with great views of the city. The rooms were very well appointed, loved the cappuccino machine. Clean, quiet, classy, and excellent service – not much more I can expect form a city hotel. You wont be disappointed selecting the Fairmont for your stay in Singapore. Centrally located right across from Raffles where you can go to the Long Bar and have a Singapore Sling.

Reviews.Title: “I have stayed there many times but the service is always first class, unbeatable location is a bonus”
Reviews.Author: James623
Reviews.Content: Over the last 3 years I have probably stayed at the Fairmont Singapore for around 15 to 20 nights annually. The service is always excellent and rooms impeccably kept. We were fortunate enough to be there for the F1 in 2011 and it was a first class touch from the Fairmont. Will keep staying there in the future. You are also situated right above the City Hall MRT station, adjacent Raffles Hotel and across the road from all of the eateries and nightlife at Chijmes. Exceptional service all the time, especially Roslee and Manolo and the team at the Executive Club.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: LondonE3Traveller
Reviews.Content: Absolutely amazing hotel right next door to Raffles! We booked a standard room and were on the 24th floor with views over the marina and the merlion. Room was spotlessly clean with a very, very high standard througout eg electric curtains, nespresso coffee machine, armonatherapy complimentary toiletries etc. Got a good price on the room but it is very expensive if you use the hotel facilities. Had a room only rate but there is a great cafe called Rocky Masters just a few minutes walk away where you can get a set breakfast with eggs, toast, coffee and orange juice for 8 dollars. Pool was really nice but very crowded so if you want to sunbathe get there early!

Reviews.Title: “The beds are so comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: magenta1_12
Reviews.Content: Thay have a room to relax in if you arive before check in. With a shower tv coffee it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tiiti
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in August 2011 and I really enjoyed it. After reading reviews I was expecting pretty worn room but it was nice just like in the pictures in hotel website. It was very clean and there was the best bed I ever slept in! One of the reasons I booked this hotel instead some newer ones at the Clarke Quay was the size of the rooms as they are spacious and have balcony. Lobby is not as comfortable as in many good hotels but it was functional and never too crowded. Hotel was full and everything was working smoothly. The service and staff were great, maybe the consierge was their weakest link. The location is good next to Raffles Hotel, Robinson's Mall, Funan Digitalife mall, the City Hall MRT station and hop-on –hop-off bus-stops. However there are many good locations in Singapore and since we used taxi a lot we could have enjoyed other locations as well. Taxis were easy and cheap and there were always taxis waiting. I would stay here again because of the bed, atmosphere and service.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Hollymount26
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Fairmont in Singapore for 2 nights prior to departing onto a cruise with Royal Caribbean. Have to say this hotel is one of the best we have stayed in, from being greeted at the front entrance to our departure the service could not be faulted. Fantastic rooms we allocated, and even a birthday cake was left out on the first evening as we had mentioned that we were in Singapore for a birthday celebration. Beds were turned down both nights, and oh, the beds were so comfortable. Only draw back was that we did not opt for a bed and breakfast rate, which in future we would do, however, there is a huge shopping mall located underneath the hotel with plenty of places to eat. Perfectly located for all the main attractions and just across the road from Raffles for when you visit the Long Bar for your Singapore Sling. Could not fault this hotel, we joined the Fairmont membership club prior to leaving which we would recommend you do. Will certainly look for a Fairmont brand in the future when travelling. Excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Sing.”
Reviews.Author: Lukic123
Reviews.Content: Fairmont is great place to stay in Sing., evreything is so close from this hotel from marina to orch.road , clark quay, and you have metro st. in hotel lobby.....Rooms? FAB!!! great beds, great view, very very clean...definitly coming back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain about, an amazingly solid stay”
Reviews.Author: dlanods
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a knack of being solid without spectacular. It has very competitive rates for the Singapore CBD, especially when you factor in the convenient location directly above the City Hall MRT station. We were upgraded because of no available rooms with a double bed at the level at which we booked. The room we stayed in was large, with half of it dedicated to a fully featured bathroom. The bed was amazingly comfortable and the room was fitted out very modernly (electric curtains, lights all controlled from the bedside tables, etc). Overall it was a very comfortable stay but lacked that certain something to make it a truly memorable stay - the hotel is really indistinguishable from any other moderately high end hotel. We'll definitely stay there again though.

Reviews.Title: “very good location”
Reviews.Author: romann
Reviews.Content: the room had the best view of the city we could the flyer the new hotel marina bay sans and at night it was magical the bed was soo comfy it was just great the room was very fresh looking evrything was fine housekeeping did a wonderful job yes internet was dear but just go around the corner near macdonalds there is internet cafe very cheap the breakfast was the best from toast and home jam fresh juices pancakes egg anyway you desired dim sum chinese food and rice which was all yummy lunch was very good we had pizza sooo nice service was very good and quick yes the food was hot and thankyou to all there walter raji stephen serana and everyone who mad e us very welcomed if you liked coffee so many to choose from hot or with ice cream by taxi or mrt every thing is close we even walked through the subway to go the shops got lost but that ws part of the fun going to places we had not seen before and enjoing ourselves don't forget to say hello to the doormen victor and ishmal they are 2 lovely gentlemen with a smile on their every day and night and dont't forget the zoo it was very magical even though it rained it was the best time we had mainly the elephant ride so lovely and gentle

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: christly2011
Reviews.Content: We got an upgrade when we checked in, which was nice, but we later found out why! There was construction going on in the shopping mall in which the hotel is located, so at 01.30 AM we woke up to the noise of drilling and hammering. After a long time we got another room in which we could sleep. No deduction in price no nothing. The internet is VERY expensive. At check out the receptionist Jessica was very annoyed about the fact thab we wanted a receipt for the already deducted 200,00 sin$. she sighed loudly! If we ever go back to Singapore, we will definately choose another hotel. Expensive and no value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: Taipaking
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is superb. 30 minutes drive from the airport and close to the business districts and shopping. It is also accessible and linked to the subway. Service is average and the rooms are dated. Expensive Internet charge and would probably try the mandarin oriental the next time round.

Reviews.Title: “Prestige AND Location in one place.”
Reviews.Author: OzzTrekker
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nites in Room 1526, a Deluxe Standard room. From arrival in the taxi, the hotel exudes class, friendly greetings from the guys collecting you lugagge and plenty of staff at the check-in counter. Check-in process was efficient and staff very friendly. The room was in the South Tower overlooking The Raffles Hotel. Lugagge arrived within 5 minutes and was delivered by a bellhop who gave an excellent run down of the room facilities, in particular the central control system, which pretty much controls everything from curtains to lighting. Room size is good (see photos), great bed, call down for your specific pillow request from 7 choices! Desk, nice size TV, Nespresso Coffee maker, steam iron all in the room. Bathroom is interesting with the rainshower outside the tub but in the open area alongside the tub. Different when you see it, no problem when you use it! Good size sink area (single sink) and hairdryer provided. Internet is cable and extremely fast. I always carry an Airport Express with me and was instantly able to WiFi the room for flexibility. Location is fantastic, 2 minute walk to City Hall MRT, Raffles Hotel across the street, and CHIMES restaurant and bar area adjacent. Book online for great deals, overall great place and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Scam in operation...don't stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bigwon
Reviews.Content: There is a scam in operation at this hotel between the front desk staff and In Room Dining Services. After you check out, your credit card will be billed for items from the refreshment center (in room bar) that were not consumed. BEWARE!! STAY CLEAR OF THIS HOTEL. There are many reputable hotels in Singapore. This is NOT one of them

Reviews.Title: “....good for a return visit.”
Reviews.Author: pinoytraveller808
Reviews.Content: The mall attached to the hotel makes it convenient for shopping and alternative eating places....my stay would've been excellent if they were able to accomodate me in my room of choice.... i had a good view from my balcony though.... good for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good breakfast, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Richard K
Reviews.Content: A good quality hotel with great sized rooms and one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in. Breakfast choice was broad, but lunch choice less so being that it is an Italian themed restaurant. I do have a couple of gripes though. The wi-fi is ludicrously expensive. If I'm spending that much a night, why am I even being charged for wi-fi? Also I used the business centre for a couple of prints and scans. $2 a page (plus tax) is similarly ludicrous. Staff were helpful and as other users point out the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andy O
Reviews.Content: Family with 2 young children (aged5&2years)staying 3 nights en route from London to Sydney ...very good hotel...we booked a fairmont room-2 double beds which suited our needs perfectly....balcony with view over Raffles which enabled us to sit out and have a drink once the children were in bed, room was large enough, had a nespresso machine ( nice touch) & an ice bucket which was kept topped up regularly....swimming pools on eighth floor had both adult & children's pools....location was perfect being above & directly connected to a huge air conditioned mall with small supermarket & MRT station......the staff could not have been friendlier to or Moore understanding with our young children.....all in all highly recommended, only misgiving is the charge (S$26) for in room wifi which really should be inclusive at this kind of class of hotel and at this kind of price

Reviews.Title: “Internet”
Reviews.Author: smbeckett1
Reviews.Content: Only problem with this hotel is the extremely slow internet. About the same speed as dial up and to slow to even listen to BBC online.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Singapore without breaking your bank!”
Reviews.Author: jediplay
Reviews.Content: Frankly, many hotels in Singapore is becoming somewhat of letdown with customer satisfaction in my opinion. Many of top class hotels simply charge too much as not provide a great customer satisfaction thus losing its edge in hospitality department. Fairmont hotel is well known worldwide and it is a great hotel for a reason where even Singapore location does not disappoint. Room: It is not truly modern decoration or vast variety of high-tech electronics but, it is comfortable nevertheless and it is good sized considering it is Singapore after all. Bed is very comfortable (single king) and sheets, pillows, and comforter is good quality which it should be. It is also very quiet even with other guests in adjacent room being occupied or guests walking down the hallway. Bathroom: It is large and has nice set of toiletries in case if you are lacking on certain things to pack with you. Shower is good with adequate water flow but there is a flow restrictor installed so do not expect high stream flow you get to experience at some hotels which I love but considering fresh water waste, it is somewhat selfish thing. Air conditioning: It is hot and humid country so certain old hotels do have A/C smell or problem but, not at this hotel and it controls room temperature comfortable. Location: It is next to Raffles hotel and attached to the shopping mall which has luxury shops to popular brand outlets. It also is very close to MRT so if you like to take MRT, it is right next to it. Some folks do not like the location since it is not on Orchard road but more I visit Singapore, less I care for the hotels on Orchard road area. I like less crowded roads and streets. It is very close so MRT or Taxi can take you there. Lobby: It has sizable lobby to meet or greet friends or clients if this is important to you. Food: Room service and dining is top notch but, considering so many great places to eat nearby I do not see the need. Overall impression: This is a great hotel for my taste and it isn’t terribly expensive for Singapore standard nowadays. Occasionally, the hotel will have a promotion or sale so you might spend less than some other hotels. Just avoid visiting Singapore during Grand Prix season which is nightmare for visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Mediocre Rooms”
Reviews.Author: The_Travelr
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Singapore is in one of the most desirable locations in the city. It is right across the street from the famous Raffles Hotel with its Long Bar (and Singapore Sling cocktail), and location on top of Raffles City, a western style mall with a food court and grocery store in the basement. There is also an MRT station that provides easy access to the rest of the city. One of the best features of the hotel is the pool area, which features two circular pools (one for kids, one for adults), a bar area and plenty of lounge chairs. This area is superior to the pool area you will find at most other 5 star hotels. Another great feature is Il Prego, the breakfast buffet restaurant. The breakfast dishes were exceptional, though the staff were sometimes not very attentive to clearing plates and refilling drinks (first world problems, I know!). This breakfast was a great ay to start the day, and included the standard western fare as well as a selection of Asian dishes. My only real complaints relate to the rooms. It appears that the rooms were over-designed for aesthetics rather than function. In both rooms I've stayed in, the shapes were awkward, reducing the amount of usable space. Also, the furniture was uncomfortable (in one room there was a fainting couch that was very uncomfortable and took up space that could have been better used). The worst part related to the washrooms. The showers were designed to be "modern" without a door. Consequence? Water all over the place no matter what we tried. The sink is also strange, with a bowl on top of the counter, all of which is clear glass. The faucet is poorly placed such that water always splashes out of the bowl onto the counter, and because everything is clear it looks 10x messier than need be. The coffee maker uses the little pucks for single serve coffee. I have used these many times but found the systems in place here to be really defective, often requiring a few tries to make it work. Service was mediocre. I dont recall anything exceptional. One more thing: it is about time five star hotels stop charging usurious rates for Internet access. The rooms are already expensive enough! Knock it off already! Overall, you are paying for location. The rooms aren't up to snuff with other five star hotels, and the service isn't really special. The common areas and the food are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC hotel, GREAT location!!”
Reviews.Author: misslolly21
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Fairmont Singapore for 5 nights in October 2011. The location was wonderful, with a mall with a fantastic food court right next door (connected to the hotel underground). The pool is amazing and clean. The hotel lobby is beautiful, as are the comfortable, spacious hotel rooms. The balcony was amazing with beautiful views. We are members of the Fairmont Presidents Club (free to sign up), so free wifi was a great perk. It's within walking distance of many attractions / sights and we would definitely recommend it to anyone planning a trip to Singapore. We will definitely stay there again. The service was superb and Singapore is just a beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent Singapore hotel”
Reviews.Author: GalsworthyLondon
Reviews.Content: We arrived early in the morning off an overnight flight from London not having slept. The receptionist could not have been more helpful and we were in our room by 9 am. The room was on the 13th floor, just over halfway up the building, and had a view out over Raffles Hotel. Interestingly, guests at the Fairmont can sign bills in restaurants in both teh Raffles and nextdoor Stamford hotel and these will then appear on their own accounts at the Fairmont.
