We took the opportunity of dinner in the Tiffin Room at Raffles, giving a flavour of the Raffles experience without incurrung the cost of staying there. The room was comfortable with a generous king size bed. Bathroom was modern and spotlessly clean. There are a range of eating facilities in the hotel and the neighbouring Raffles City shopping complex. There is also a cafe by the swimming pool, which is on the 8th floor level. The swimming pools are provided with loungers and towels. Breakfast was in the Prego restaurant on the ground floor. This was excellent offering extensive choice and tasty food. The hotel is located on a main street, which means taxis are relatively easy to get hold of. Most central sights are a short taxi ride away and taxi fare rates in Singapore are reasonable. An excellent higher end hotel offering value for money.

Reviews.Title: “nice room, nice location”
Reviews.Author: ryan750il
Reviews.Content: room size is big for singapore standard, linens and bedding are nice i think around 600 thread count and above are used, toiletries are from london. and nice coffee machine . everything is perfect , except we got the room facing the office building and blocking the city view. other than that everything is perfect. staffs are nice and attentive. would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay - better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Freq T
Reviews.Content: Originally I was not too keen on Fairmont having heard negative reviews from some friends who had stayed here previously but my husband liked the location so we booked ourselves for a 12 night stay. In fact, we nearly ended up staying elsewhere because after the initial reservation, we got pretty frustrated with not getting an answer to a very simple query I made in relation to leaving prior to my intended departure date despite several emails and a phone call. Thanks to Normal Leong and Noorul Ibrahim, who later responded quickly and efficiently to our queries, we decided to give the hotel a try. I have to say that we had an excellent time here. The room was comfortable, the breakfast selection was excellent and most of the staff we met were friendly/helpful, particularly the porters. Areas of improvement would be that the room is showing some wear and tear (although I understand that the north side is undergoing refurbishment soon) and the occasional desk staff who had an unfriendly/dismissive demeanour (which is a shame as it undoes a lot of the good work from the other staff). In all, we were very happy with our experience and even chose to stay with Fairmont again on our return leg to London. We will not hesitate to recommend Fairmont in the future.

Reviews.Title: “3 stars, but because of the view, i give you 4”
Reviews.Author: globetrekker90
Reviews.Content: okay despite that this is a brand name, this hotel overall is not even close to 5 stars... first they gave us a room that is with all means,,, trashy! carpet look aged and dirty, one bed lamp was broken, overall the room was dirty. Then after arguing with the reception they gave me a better room and often 10 floors higher than the other one. And the view from the balcony was GREAT! I donot recommend you to stay at this hotel, but if you had to, beware of the cheeky receptionist and ask for their best room, of which they wont give it out unless you fight with them! Many other hotels beat this one easily, i moved from there and went to the pan pacific, that hotel deserves 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jashnzindagi
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is convenient. Quite central. But Singapore in general is quite convenient for traveling purposes. The hotel is quite highly rated on trip advisor. Staff is friendly, cleanliness is good. Rooms are okay, with some odd the furnishings, specially in bathrooms seem quite old. That said, all else is good and fault free. I will consider staying here again if I happen to be in Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: oftentraveller45
Reviews.Content: Because I belong to The President's Club (joined because of our stays in 2010 in 3 Fairmont "Classic" hotels in The Canadian Rockies) I was given an Upgrade to a Suite....and It Was Wonderful Fun! (Thanks heaps to N. in Reservations!) The "room" had panoramic views of the harbour,comfy sitting area and bed AND the bathroom...all frosted glass/marble/with a bench to sit on and 2 large potted plants...and including a Sauna! was HUGE! As well, when we arrived early from our Europe flight...we were installed in an Executive Room...to rest in until our Suite was available...with immediate access to the Executive Club...for breakfast. Such Service! The Executive Club here was Even Better than those we experienced in the Rockies...including the Banff Springs Hotel and Chateau Lake Louise! Service in All Clubs was Excellent...BUT the quality and quantity of the food and drinks at the Fairmont Singapore's Executive Club were far better. The bubbly provided gratis was Moet...and it was free flowing..smile...(whereas..any drinks in Canada were charged to our account) The Fairmont is new to Singapore...and there is lots of competition....but based on our Fabulous Stay....I would hope that this hotel Thrives! They certainly deserve to!!! We often travel to and through Singapore...and the Fairmont is now where we Will Stay! Thanks to A. on reception and ALL who made our stay a memorable one!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing View”
Reviews.Author: VitalyM
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at Fairmont Singapore. Stayed at North Tower, and the view from the balcony was simply incredible. The hotel overall is nice and clean. The Italian restaurant at the hotel is just okay, but the connected mall has an array of great options.

Reviews.Title: “A great base in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: DrLivingstone100
Reviews.Content: This site has been through many incarnations but now as the Fairmont, it is up scratch. It is a very big hotel which has more sufficient facilities. Copious restaurants (not that there's a shortage of good and cheap food in Singapore) a good spa and gym and a lovely pool area. The rooms are large enough and many have spectacular views of the down town skyline and the waterfront. The beds are very comfortable and the showers are divine. The rooms in the South Tower are better but they are also more expensive. The hotel is situated on top of one of the main shopping malls in the City with very easy access to the MRT. I have stayed here many times and always relish returning.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the whole experience”
Reviews.Author: BurningSloth
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Singapore and stayed for four nights. I was immediately impressed by the quality of the building and its surrounds, and the professionalism of the staff who were more than willing to offer any assistance. The room contained everything that was required, plus a couple of unexpected extras (mouth wash, toothbrush). It was large and contained a very comfortable king size bed. There were a wide selection of television channels that enabled me to catch up on news from home. I wonderful experience that I could not fault in any way, and will be staying here again...

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel has it all”
Reviews.Author: Joylene365
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend The Fairmont Singapore especially the executive club. We could not have wished for more from a quality hotel. The attending staff, their first priority was to please. You don`t need to be on Orchard Road to get the feel of Singapore, Raffles City is 5 steps away, the Marina district the River district, shopping and eateries are all there. The city and bay views at night are one you will remember. We look forward to our return stay.

Reviews.Title: “We loved staying in this hotel... Fantastic...”
Reviews.Author: Pia123rhan
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel. The service was outstanding every where in the hotel, nothing seemed to be much trouble When the hotels lobby staff heard that my mother was to be having a birthday while we were staying there, the lobby staff sent her a beautiful cake with a candle on it on the day of her birthday.The rooms were spotless and well maintained which I appreciate more than anything else. I travel alot for work and for personal reasons and I was impressed by this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fair grade for Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: bcheong
Reviews.Content: Being a top 10 hotel, I had high expectations going in. This is probably the 2nd best location for shopping next to Orchard Road. There is the Raffles City mall just attached to it, and if you need even higher end wares, walk next door to the raffles hotel shopping arcade. The mall also offers a dizzying array of restaurants and food, so i recommend there's no need to eat at the hotel unless you have to. The lobby is tastefully designed in a modern way. Unfortunately my disappointment starts at check-in. When I entered the lobby, there were only 2 staff, and they were attending to guests. It took about 10 mintutes before a 3rd staff emerged from her hiding place in the backroom and handled me and the rest of the queue that was forming behind me. This hotel has a north and south tower with about 25 stories, and it has the city view or the pool view. There is a taller building attached next door and it is the Swissotel. Both the Fairmont and Swissotel used to be 1 westin hotel, and it probably changed hands and got split into 2 hotels. I entered the room and was disappointed again. It has a 2002 feel to it - dull brown wood design, no standing shower, antiquated switches and phone etc. The next day i went to the pool and again was disappointed. It was a large area and although it looks decent, there was no service. In normal 5 star hotels, you'd expect pool boys or girls to be handling out towels and serving drinks, no such thing here Overall, this hotel has a good location, but i wouldn't stay here again. As one knows, to get a fair grade in school is not good enough

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and good location to MRT and Raffles Plaza.”
Reviews.Author: GTD2008
Reviews.Content: Very good first impression with excellent service at the front desk, with a warm welcome and introduction to our room. The room was fantastic, clean and modern as per 5 star Singapore hotels, with a fantastic view. The location brilliant, in the Raffles Complex, close to Suntec, the Marina and the Riverside with all the restaurants, bars and shopping this entails. Being so near the MTR means that everything is in easy reach without having to resort to taxi. The Fairmont will be the top of the list the next time I stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms and TV are a little dated but a great location”
Reviews.Author: RussS11
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay on a business trip. Use of the hospitality suite in the evening to change before going to airport is great touch.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Yggdrasil98
Reviews.Content: I had previously only stayed in Fairmonts in Canada, so had a high expectation of this chain. We had a slight glitch with our Club preferences not being noted when we reached our room (feather pillows had to go) and it took ages to get our luggage as the tickets were lost by reception. However we requested a room close to the elevator, and we did indeed have this. After those minor, but normal sort of issues than can occur, it was a smooth and very nice stay. Breakfast was absolutely excellent - especially as we are vegetarian and there was so much choice and the standard was 5*. Particularly enjoyed the friendly service of the waiters, doorman and concierge. The location was all we could have wished for, we selected City View Room. Many people used the pool are under our balcony all day long, but that isn't our thing, and we were able to reach everywhere we needed easily. If we required assistance, it was at hand. Nice to to have the Nespresso coffee machine in the room too, though no milk provided is always irritating. The mattress is probably the most comfortable hotel mattress we have ever slept on, it was heavenly as our previous hotel had a mattress like a slab of stone! I wish we could return sooner rather than later!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place!”
Reviews.Author: NatashaSoldatova
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Fairmont for 3 days with my boyfriend. We liked it a lot, because of its location in the city center and we could go a lot of nice places on feet... and you can enter the hotel from the underground - that was really helpful when it was too hot outside. We had deluxe room instead of standard room just because they didn't find any standard rooms free. It was very comfortable with superb kingsize bed... and we even overslept everyday in the morning :) Friendly service staff... and unforgetable citrus fragrance everywhere. And good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite Singapore hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Paul J
Reviews.Content: My last stay at this hotel was during the first week of January 2012. There are quite a number of things I like about this hotel. To list a few: The suite accommodation was great with luxurious amenities and lots of space; The access to the club facilities; prompt and very courteous response to room requests; and The connection to the shopping mall and MRT. The hotel is connected to a fairly large mall where shopping and eating can be fun. During my stays at this hotel, I mostly take MRT to travel within Singapore as it is very convenient. Club room and suites are very good. The staff in the Club are just fantastic in customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and spa”
Reviews.Author: PremiumTravel
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favourite hotels in Singapore due to its location. The hotel is well connected with MRT (subway), Taxi and buses. There is no worry of the lack of food in this part of the town. There are many restaurants in the attached shopping mall offering a wide selection of local and international cuisine. I always go to the food court for a taste of the local favourites at a fraction of what the hotel will charge. The room looks tired but is well maintained. The spa is a must. It is one of the best spa in Singapore. It has a nice relaxation area, steam room, sauna, jaccuzi and plunge pools.

Reviews.Title: “Corporate”
Reviews.Author: Taipan888
Reviews.Content: This is your typical hotel for corporate executives. Good location, good service, good rooms which means not so good value for money as all of the above has a price which is fair. I stayed a week and was upgraded to a large room with a walkin closet and balconies. Nice touch. The hotel was nicely renovated including the bathrooms. Good beds. I had a corporate rate that included free wifi. Thank you. Good choice of restaurants in Raffles City and good shopping. Overall, good stay. Will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for my anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Sovlmer
Reviews.Content: Being an avid traveller for work, it is a nice respite to spent time in Singapore fairmont for my anniversary. This is my third year there, and my wife and I enjoy it very much, especially my 2 sons. So we keep coming back. I am looking forward to my 4th anniversary this year. ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Excellent Hotel, Fair Price”
Reviews.Author: Mr_A_Indonesia
Reviews.Content: Stay in this Hotel for 2 nights on January 2012, The Hotel located on top of Raffles city mall, quiet an extensive mall with lots of shopping store and two food courts, it has a tunnel connected to another mall and to the marina bay, a point of attraction not to be missed. the hotel also located on top of City Hall MRT Station, an interchange between the green line (Airport - West Singapore) and the red line (Orchard -Marina Bay). For me, Fairmont hotel is one of the best located hotel in Singapore. I booked the deluxe bedroom, as its located in South Tower supposed to be best view and newly renovated, The room and the view are delightful, but to get the best view ask for a room floor 20 and up, also room number close to room 34 as its the one facing the river. The service is Great, easy check in, very friendly staff, informative and helpful, on my check out because i have a late night flight, the staff offer a hospitality room, basically a closed common room with sofa, TV, toilet, coffee maker and fridge full of complimentary bottle water. When i was asking information about Taxi, the manager was very helpful and even walk us into our taxi. All in all i was having a wonderful time staying in Fairmont Hotel. Most of the time i always check in different hotel for review, but next time i come to Singapore i think i will stay in this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “A good well located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CGie20
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th stay at the Fairmont Singapore. It was a split visit over 3 and 2 nights in October 2011. We booked a Deluxe double with harbour views. They lost our booking despite us emailling them that we would arrive late. We were upgraded to a Signiture Roomn which although bigger , the view of the habour was further away. We much prefer the Harbour Deluxe double. We found the foyer busier than on our other visits. The Singaporean staff are always helpful and always with smiles on their faces. However, on a previous visit a Canadian Chinese lady who checked us in was quite the opposite. She wanted to put us in a hot sunny, restricted view room and because of our insistance got us, the paid for, harbour view deluxe double. She even wanted to charge more for a room which we had already paid for. We might have condesended too had we not stayed in the said rooms before. Secondly, on that visit we came across an African Parisian consiege who was abrupt and did not know where Singapore's former famous eateyr had re- located. He was still there on this visit! I think a consiege must always be a local person. Breakfast is in Prego Restaurant on the ground floor or at the swimming pool on 8 th foor. Its lovely by the poolside. Breakfast is adequate but I think the kept warm foods can be improved, although there is a egg station to compensate. Location is excellent, with the City MRT, shops, some eatery, in the complex. Walk under ground to the Marina. On street level, walk to the small local bars, cheap nice chicken rice restaurants, small bars behind Raffles Hotel for local colour. Expensive drinks are on main entrance next to Hotel. Cons:. Expect street congestion in front entrance of the hotel on Fri Sat Sunday at around 7p.m., with very difficult entry to Hotel especially when lugging lugguage,.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Jacque W
Reviews.Content: We have been coming the fairmont since our neighbours 4 years ago introduced us to this hotel. We have been coming to Singapore for 20 years now and feel this hotel offers the best service around. The staff are so pleasant and helpful and fulfil your every need. The club rooms are superb. The rooms are large with large king size beds.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: longhaulfromlondon
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a few places in Singapore over the years but this is now my favourite. The location is great, handy for the MRT at Raffles Place, the Raffles Place shopping centre and just over the road from Raffles Hotel for a Singapore Sling of a great curry in the Tiffin Room. Rooms a large by Singapore standards where space is always at a premium and the bathrooms are very well equipped. The breakfast buffet is the biggest and most varied I've seen anywhere in the world and if you stayed ever day for two weeks you would still find variety and things you haven't tried. The pool and gym were both excellent and like the rest of the hotel, well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent location, good service , pleasant rooms”
Reviews.Author: toversti
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very functional , efficient. Maybe not " charmimg" it's a modern building which has been well maintained . Rooms are modern style , may be a bit too "cool" and not really cozy- but therefore clean and efficient. Location is excellent just in front of Raffles Hotel, and shopping arcades . My most preferred location when in Singapore. Try the Italian Restaurant downstairs (Prego)- large , but nevertheless excellent food.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Supsaf
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. The location is great. Initially we were given a room in the North Tower. The Room was dinghy and we had to complain about the toilet not flushing on 2 occasions. They changed our room to the South Tower and what a difference. The room was bigger and we had a view of the River and Marina Sands Bay. The beds were totally awesome and very comfortable. Loved the pillow menu and I think I have to find myself a body pillow. The staff were polite and obliging and the duty manager went out of her way to ensure that we were comfortable. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: vjw011
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived until the moment we (regrettably) left, our experience at this hotel was fantastic. We stayed here for two nights on our way to Europe and one night on the return journey. The hotel's comfort and cleanliness, and the friendliness of the staff was consistent. The check-in staff were very friendly and helpful. Our rooms were very comfortable and the views amazing. The beds were incredibly comfortable for our weary bodies. The cooling was excellent (and necessary). Bathrooms were lovely - clean, large, modern. One of our rooms had a massive shower head - it was like showering in a rainstorm - very nice. If you stay here, make sure you get the breakfast included in your deal. It is amazing! They have sooooo much assorted and interesting foods , there is something there for everyone. On the same premises is a multi-level shopping complex. There is a great variety of shops (including my favourite, Desigual) and eateries, as well as a supermarket in the basement. The only downside was the very expensive internet in their business centre - $10 per 15 minutes and (from memory) $2 per printed page. Boarding passes can be printed at no charge. However, if you join their President's Club, you get free wi-fi in your room. Actually there is one more downside - the hotel and attached shopping complex is so good, we didn't stray outside the building :-) Next time we'll venture further.

Reviews.Title: “Some good points and not so good ones too”
Reviews.Author: Rafflesia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 4 nights in a deluxe room during our transit in Singapore a few days ago. Here is our experience and some tips Join the Presidents club before commencing stay. This will provide you at the very least, free high speed internet and local phone calls which can be useful when making restaurant reservations. Stay here for its location. It is connected to Raffles City mall and City Hall MRT station which will give you easy access to most parts of Singapore. It is also an easy 10 min walk to the malls at Marina square and Suntec city. Ask for a room in the South Tower. Rooms here were renovated and includes a BOSE system and a Nespresso type coffee machine. (3 capsules provided) Be prepared to oversleep. The bed was so comfortable that we overslept for 2 out of the 4 days we were there. From memory, only the beds at the 4 seasons (Singapore) provided a more superior experience. Expect housekeeping to visit your room twice. Once in the morning and another during turn-down. Expect genuine and warm service from the porters, door man (between hotel lobby and Restaurant) and the guys at the taxi queue reception area. I also encountered wonderful service from Julie (Business centre) who helped out in the printing of our boarding passes. Areas for Improvement While many of the staff especially those at the front desk were professional, more training would remind them to establish eye contact when dealing with guest and not make one wait while they complete the previous matter. Simple logic dictates that if one was still busy, not to invite guest to your counter and then have them wait, albeit a few seconds. While training has enabled front office staff to deliver a superior service (and they do deliver what you ask for), not quite sure how they can teach them to adopt a warmer approach towards returning guest. I find the smiles, the small talk and the warmth showered to us by the staff at Pathuwan Princess and the Intercontinental (Bangkok) missing. Perhaps, they were overwhelmed with work or perhaps I was simply unfortunate to have encountered individuals with their frosty approach on multiple days. Management must also address the issue regarding the poor design of the bathroom. (See attached pic). As the glass screen between the rain shower and the vanity area only covers a little section, the next person using the bathroom can expect a wet floor after the first guest showers. Not good for a 5 star hotel Housekeeping must have been so overwhelmed picking up soaked bathmats day after day that lapses has resulted. Forgetting to replace soaked bathmats with fresh ones can be overlooked but finding a dead roach (see pic) in our toilet after returning from a day of shopping is inexcusable. Regardless if Housekeeping forgets to flush, the vermin should never have been found on the 14th floor of a 5 star hotel in the first place. The thought it has crawled from the luggage of another guest or through the sewers is too disgusting to contemplate. Guest with smart phones or tablets planning to make use of the free WIFI should expect slow speeds.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeeFromMoira
Reviews.Content: Arrived close to midnight on 5th January, Staff were very helpful. Lovely rooms, great facilites, not too much hassle getting a sunbed by the pool and the most amazing breakfast spread possible at the downstairs Italian resaurant. recommended to us by Trailfinders and we were certainly not disappointed. Great location too, not far from the shopping and right across the road from Raffles hotel. Stayed in North Tower and the view was impressive.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding service would stay again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: dani73Melbourne
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here recently. we stayed at stamford swiss grande last year and i was able to get a very reasonable rate via splendia website. after reading reviews on trip advisor i e mailed hotel to request rooms in the south tower as i understood that these rooms were renovated and had better views. after e mailing the hotel a few times they agreed to upgrade us to these rooms. we arrived very early at 6.30 am and were escorted to the hospitality lounge. official check in is at 2pm. we were extremely delighted to be given our rooms by 7.30 am. housekeeping was a very high standard and all staff were extremely helpful, polite and happy. great location and very handy to be connnected to a shopping centre and have mrt at your door step. such comfortable beds.... and loved the electric blinds!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: AsimDalal
Reviews.Content: We got upgraded to a signature room and our kids had a adjoining room. We were in the north tower and our room on the 24 th floor had a breathtaking view of Marina Bay Sands Hotel. Very comfortable room with bose music system and a nespresso machine. The hotel is connected to raffles city shopping centre and metro station. The foodcourt has an amazing choice of cuisine. The supermarket and departmental store like Robinson is also located within the premises. All in all a very good location and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Guarantee a come back !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sanjeev B
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family there for 3 nights from 28th December 2011 - 31st Dec and must say felt at home!! We found the staff extremely polite, helpful, friendly and always smiling. The check in was done within minutes and we had a complimentary upgrade to a Deluxe room in South Tower. The room was spacious enough and well cleaned with a great view of the city. The Buffet breakfast was fantastic and full of variety of food to satisfy your hungry stomach. We had a variety of Indian food for that matter. Close to the hotel was a shopping mall with shops, restaurants etc. Am definetely returning to Fairmont without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “A great stop over refresher”
Reviews.Author: g y
Reviews.Content: An excellent property, very luxurious. Rooms excellent standard and vert well appointed. Fairmont is close to everything and makes a great oasis in busy Singapore.Try the breakfast downstairs, perhaps the best I've ever experienced with an unbelievable range and quality. Easy trip to airport from MRT.The only shortcoming I could detect was the time it took to check out. We will be staying at the Fairmont again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent view from higher rooms”
Reviews.Author: Flatty_Ian
Reviews.Content: Located within Raffles City we found the hotel a little hard to find at first after the taxi dropped us off at an entrance to the shopping centre on the other side of the building. You need to work your way through the shopping centre to get to the entrance. Once there the hotel is clearly very upmarket and the lobby on arrival was very busy and we had to queue to be seen. When we were seen though the service was good, although it very much had a strong clinical business feel rather than the personal touch service industry feel. Our room was big and well appointed. The view for room on the 20th floor was excellent, especially at night. The beds were big and comfortable, and there was even a menu for different types of pillows depending on your tastes. Something I've never seen before in my life! We had no complaints for our one night stay here.

Reviews.Title: “a real gem”
Reviews.Author: italyItalia
Reviews.Content: I was very satisfaied by this hotel, location is excellent, rooms are spacious and very well furnished, service is impeccable and sleep quality is over the top. The staff is very kind and helpful and there is a large mall with a supermarket connected to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our first time to Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Kenny L
Reviews.Content: Me and my girl friend stayed at this hotel for 4nights. This was our first time in Singapore. The hotel was very easy to find and situated in a very convenient place. When we got to the hotel we were greeted straight away. We got to the hotel about 2ish but they said our room was not ready. They told us to come back later or go up to their hostel room, so we did we were upstairs for a good hour, we went down to find our luggage was missing which they took off us during check-in, i asked where my luggage was the bell boy said he didn't know. He then checked again and said it was in our room, When we got to the room we were disappointed to find stains on carpets and broken furnitures. Our first night was fine but the second night we could here loud noises coming from the water pipes in the bathroom, they kindly changed our room. overall it was a good stay!

Reviews.Title: “Two Thumbs Up!!!”
Reviews.Author: Aquamarina07
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my little one and I am so glad we chose this hotel. First of all the the service is unbeatable mind you I have never received bad service in Singapore but still fab service. Friendly staff. It started when we checked in. While we waited for our key one of the bell men came out with a little toy Mickey Mouse for my daughter. Room service was lovely and arrived still hot. The second night we ordered room service again and they came with a little cake for my daughter (just a lovely gesture). The breakfast buffet there is out of this world with everything and anything you could possibly want. Apple juice is real apples juiced not from a bottle. They also had little kiddies plates and cups as well. The room was immaculately clean and I can not say enough of this hotel. Another plus is that it is attached to a massive shopping centre that has a huge food court and a mini supermarket which is great if you are travelling with little ones. I am returning again in a few months. I can't recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: rtw99
Reviews.Content: We travelled between Christmas and New Years and stayed in the President's club rooms. Our previous experience with the Beijing Fairmont had been outstanding and we were looking forward to a similar level of service in Singapore. We were disappointed. The club lounge was very crowded and despite having a large number of staff, the service was inattentive. The rooms were ok and the location was great. Overall value for money - weak and I suspect that there are better options. In this hotel, upgrading to the President's level is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: reyne1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Singapore. We stayed 8 nights at the Fairmont in a club room - fabulous. Across the road is Raffles, next door is one of the best shopping centres. The entire experience at the Fairmont was great. Great breakfast in the club room and the night time was even better with lots of Moet and most other drinks you could think of WITH fab food. We would recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back...Perth WA”
Reviews.Author: Anneg_12
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent 9 nights at the end of October to early November. We travel to Singapore every year and this was our first stay at the Fairmont. We had a harbour view club room on 23 rd floor. The staff were lovely. The breakfast buffet was equally good. Our room well appointed with a spotless bathroom that had an extra clean and tidy when they turned bed down of an evening. They had the most confortable beds and we even had the opportunity to select the type of pillow we wanted. The happy hour and special room that was afforded to all who booked a club room was excellent with free WI Fi in lounge, use of computer and printer, drinks papers and magazines and more importantly delightful staff who greeted us on alighting the lift and who always made us feel quite special. Would recommend highly to Business, singles and families. Oh it is very convenient to MRT, shopping, food and strolling down to waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast was superb”
Reviews.Author: ScorpioLondon57
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Fairmont and found our room spacious, with a nice view over the Raffles and the city. Large bathroom with shower and bath, albeit in a weird layout. We did not spend a lot of time in our room. Nice pool and views. Breakfast, I must say was excellent. Great spread of quite literally everything you can think of. Good quality, regularly replenished, friendly and efficient staff. For this alone, I would book this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “just like home”
Reviews.Author: buckets-3eyedfish
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying in a club room harbour view - requested the same room as last visit in July and got it again for NYE. The moment we stepped out of the taxi it felt like we were at home. From the super smooth check in to the service in the club room (Bonn is a superstar), this hotel prides itself on going the extra yard. Forget hotels like Marina bay Sands - too impersonal and trashy for my liking. Do yourself a favour and try this hotel - pay a little extra for the club floor the 3 hour cocktails and canapes each night surely make up for the extra $$ you would spend on dining and a few pre dinner drinks. The food is sublime throughout the hotel, the breakfast buffet in Prego is one of the best I have encounted anywhere in the world. Special thanks to Jamie and George for the great service provided each morning. There is a warm and genuine feeling from all staff we have encountered during this visit without being intrusive. I would not stay anywhere else in Singapore and look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “not quite five star”
Reviews.Author: adoweeee
Reviews.Content: Stayed over new year and never had so many requests turned down at a 5star hotel. anyway, here were some issues i had first, they gave me twin instead of a king size bed which i specifically requested. got to wait for a good 20 min before they could get the room changed. Not sure why they couldnt just change the bed when we were out, many hotels could (sofitel at amsterdam where i last stayed did just that) second, baby crib i asked for wasnt in room, no big deal, they found one. third, ask for a baby high chair in room and was told there werent any. what's the point of serving a extensive room service kids menu and not provide baby chairs? and couldn't they just borrow one from one of the restaurants? fourth, long queue at breakfast. maybe they were full over new year, but i cannot remember waiting that long for breakfast at a top hotel. Breakfast at prego was a good spread though, for SG standards, although the gold standard for hotel breakfast must surely be the kempinski in ST Petes (but that's another story (or review). fifth, asked for an additional complementary car ticket for a friend who came with me to check in, flatly refused. sixth, no turn down service the first night i was there. not sure why. seventh, cotton balls in room had visible dirt in them! that's so not on! all in all, was disappointing. to be fair, room was decent, and view of the fireworks was great. willow spa was good too

Reviews.Title: “Great view, great location, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Handy K
Reviews.Content: Room: larger than average room size, for even the most standard rooms. Ask for the Marina Bay view. Location: below the hotel is a shopping mall, complete with supermarket and restaurants. MRT station is right below the hotel. Away from the over crowded Orchard Road. Service: the moment you enter the lobby, hotel staffs are on hand to serve you until you check out. Restaurant: Prego offers the best breakfast experience. Make sure to try.

Reviews.Title: “It's a memorable experience. 👍”
Reviews.Author: Joanbenji
Reviews.Content: This twar's Xmas is so special thanks to Fairmont. I had to pick between the modern Signature rm or the Classic Signature. I couldn't decide but they were kind enuff to invite me to view the rm beforehand. I was really grateful. I chose the extremely spacious Classic signature rm. even though the room was not the newest thing, but it was still breath takingly big. And the staff was ever ready to serve us. REALLY AWESOME! However I hv sensitive nose and it's either the old carpet or the couch that might hv activated my nose. But overall, I love Fairmont!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - don't use the business center though”
Reviews.Author: saratogamike
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay here. Very clean, in excellent shape, excellent location, very helpful staff. The restaurant in the hotel, Prego, is decent but over priced IMO. There is so much great food in Singapore I would go elsewhere. I used the business center to print some documents and they charged me $2 per page...seemed ridiculously excessive to me, left a bad taste in my mouth. The hotel is on the pricey side to begin with, which is OK, it's nice and overall it's worth it, but it seems like something like this should be included, or at least not be such a ridiculous price. I ended up paying north of $60 to print out some black and white documents. When you pay a lot for a hotel you don't want to feel nickel and dimed, and feel like they're taking advantage of the fact that you need certain things done. Why not charge $40 for a tooth brush, then? I would recommend you ask for the view facing the city, not the pool. Great views everywhere but I faced the pool and the best view for me was to my left, and part of the view was cut off by the building itself. There was sometimes a strong pine scent at the front of the building and the lobby. I assume this was by design, and must have come through the A/C system or something. It was noticable during busier times when people were checking in, and not at other times like later at night. I found it pleasant and confusing at the same time. This had no impact on my feelings of the hotel but I felt compelled to share it nonetheless. I wonder if they change the scent throughout the year (I was there during Christmas season)? Besides the unnecessary price gouging in the business center, I came away feeling this was an excellent place to stay and would recommend it for others. Just get your stuff printed prior to arrival.

Reviews.Title: “To be honest… I had expected quite a bit more”
Reviews.Author: jamesjen25
Reviews.Content: I’ve always associated Fairmont hotels with a five-star experience, but my experience at the Fairmont Singapore was forgettable at best. The staff and service were courteous and helpful, and the location in Raffles City is pretty good, but a few things about the room, as well as the high price, put a damper on my stay there. Due to its location and facilities, it is a decent conference hotel, but in all honesty I would not be able to wholeheartedly recommend this hotel for tourists. +++: Service: The staff was always courteous, and the front desk in particular was efficient and helpful. Check-in and check-out were a breeze, and problems/complaints were handled fairly (which I was grateful for) Location: Connected to the cavernous complex called Raffles City, with everything from shopping, eating, its own metro station, other hotels, and probably its own moon, the Fairmont is conveniently located. However, do note that aside from Mcdonalds, not much is open late, and the mall becomes a little inaccessible entrances and exits close) once the shops close down ---: Room: The room was decently sized, but I’m afraid that’s where the compliments end. The rooms looked quite dated and in need of renovation, with tables, chairs and doors looking a little bit worse for wear and tear. Some amenities – slippers and bathrobes – felt really cheap as well. Cleanliness: The first room they put me in – a smaller room facing the pool – had the huge no-no of having ants on the work desk. Perhaps I’m a bit more stringent with hotel hygiene, but I cannot emphasize how much this put me off. To be fair, the staff was very nice about it, and asked whether they could send someone up to clean the table. I declined and asked to change rooms, which they agreed to and I was grateful for. However, I don’t believe any top-notch hotel should have ants crawling up the table, and this was a huge disappointment. Bathroom: Surprisingly, the bathrooms had a rain shower, and I am still complaining! Firstly, the toilet design feels a little sparse; it reminded me more of a public toilet than an actual hotel one. The utility of it was normal, but the aesthetics left a little more to be desired. However, the utility of the shower – which had a rain shower – was quite terrible. The showers had no doors or curtains, which is fine if you have a long enough shower area. But for some reason the first room they put me in had a short shower area and no door, which meant that while I was showering water got everywhere. Suffice to say the bathroom floor got terribly wet (and a little dangerous, come to think about it). I had laid out a floor towel, but it didn’t really help. The second room they put me in was fine (larger shower area). Value: The hotel itself was a little pricey. I had paid less for a room at the Four Season (at Orchard Road) which gave me a completely difference experience. Perhaps you are paying for the location, but in my opinion it isn’t quite worth the difference. Free wifi was only included after I signed up to be a member.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: chonrock
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to Plaza View suite. Beautiful property with amazing views of the Marina skyline. South Tower rooms are modern and comfortable. Internet was not great during our stay in May.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: Bmyguest75
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend Executive Club Rooms, as they provide Singapore skyline views from a private balcony and the view is really fantastic. The rooms are large and really well decorated and the price is really cheap for an hotel in front of the famous Raffles Hotel. The swimming pool as no real interest as too small and the breakfast is quiet poor and not very good. The staff is very nice, polite and efficient, good point. Don not hesitate to take the executive card to not pay for the WIFI, which by the way wasn't working in the room, only at the door entrance!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, but not at their best”
Reviews.Author: Cynicor
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in September after the F1 in a junior suite using a Fairmont President's Club upgrade voucher. This trip was our 4th stay here over a 2 year period. Overall we found the experience less inspiring than previous visits. The hotel still has the same great location, decor and immaculate rooms but the level of service wasn't up to the very high standards we were used to from previous visits. The room was great, with an amazing bathroom- dual sinks and a shower with rainfall head, normal head and massage jets. The room was also huge with a kitchenette and separate living/dining room. The lounge facilities are decent and the snacks during the evening cocktail hour are more than enough to pass as dinner if you are so inclined. They do not have a cocktail menu, but do make some drinks on request during the cocktail hours. Breakfast can be taken at 3 different restaurants; Prego having a large variety, Alligator Pear the outside restaurant with some 'organic' and free-range options and the club. When we wanted to head out early we asked at Prego if we would be allowed to pack ourselves a breakfast from the buffet and they were happy to oblige, even fetching some take-away containers for us to pack! The pool was quite crowded as it is shared with the massive Swissotel but we were always able to find a pair of free deckchairs. It is mostly non-smoking, and large enough that smoke should not disturb you. We encountered no specific problems this stay, but the hotel overall, and the club specifically, did not have the same feel to it. It felt less welcoming than usual, especially after coming from the Pan Pacific. We will definitely be back as the location is excellent and the service is usually top notch, but on this occasion we were just a bit disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty and Class & Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: Pascal V
Reviews.Content: Spent a month there, trip was great. Only major downside was the lack of real & reliable wireless internet

Reviews.Title: “Beauty and Class. Awesome Location. Ask to stay in the newer wing”
Reviews.Author: CrabisGOOD
Reviews.Content: Overall this place is great. It's right across the street from raffles. You get premium service and feel like you are in definitely in one of the nicest hotels in Singapore. The lobby is very grand and we were very well received. At first our friends were checked into the newer wing and some of us were checked into the older wing, but we asked to be moved. The rooms were a bit smaller in the newer wing, but MUCH nicer. The great thing is this hotel is located on top of a mall with lots of delicious food. It's also connected to the train station, so it's easy to get around. I would highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Does loyalty counts?”
Reviews.Author: Ong63
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 times within a 12-month period (stayed almost 2 weeks each time for the first 2 visits) yet the hotel does not have my record. Got the worst room on my 4th stay as the room feels old (north wing) as it is not renovated. The rooms for my first 3 stay felt a lot better. Will consider another hotel for my next business trip in 2 months time (Feb 2012).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Classy”
Reviews.Author: joecooltoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a couple nights , it was one of the most beautiful hotel in Singapore Service was the best , excellent location Room was very Clean and modern , especially it equipped with an espresso coffee maker in the room very very nice Bed was very nice, much nicer than most of the hotels in Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Great location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: C0000ps
Reviews.Content: Check in was speedy and friendly. Room had great view of Marina Bay and was clean. Beds were meant to be two queens, I'm just under 6 foot and would struggle to get anyone in the bed with me. Had a couple of issues with room which were quickly sorted. Hotel is in a great location for major Singapore events. The Singapore marathon finished in view, the GP track is in view and only a short walk away, Raffles is across the road and food is abundant down below in the shopping centre as well as transport options like mrt stations. Will stay again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: chopeta
Reviews.Content: We had a simple christmas party with small group of friends at the hotel. The lobby itself already speaks of the warmth & hospitality. We had a complimentary upgrade to a bigger room & was given an amazing city view! The room is clean & comfortable. The staff are polite. The location is city center with mrt just below the hotel & restaurants/pubs & shopping areas just a stone's throw away. Overall we enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and lovely room”
Reviews.Author: Christine P
Reviews.Content: I stayed just one night but wished it had been longer. This is the most comfortable hotel bed I've slept in - with perfect pillows and the highest quality linen sheets. Good buffet breakfast beside the pool. As my flight out left late afternoon (and the room had to be vacated by midday), I was offered the use of the hospitality suite if I needed to fill in time: tv, magazines, tea/coffee and comfortable sofas. Staff couldn't have been more helpful. Location is great and my room had a view over the Raffles Hotel rooftop swimming pool. Next door is a shopping mall and the City Hall MRT.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely weekend stay....”
Reviews.Author: bg4777
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just returned from a quick weekend break in Singapore. The Fairmont was a great hotel to stay in. Staff were extremely pleasant and friendly from the moment we got out of the taxi and they were all great with our tired toddler son. The lobby is stunning (particularly with the Xmas tree for the holiday season). Check-in was smooth, we had requested an extra bed which the check in staff called housekeeping about - by the time we had arrived at our room it was there. We paid a little extra for a deluxe room - it seemed worth it, as I could see the difference between the corridors of the North and South towers (deluxe rooms are in the South tower, as mentioned before, the North tower is getting a refurbishment next year). There was plenty of room once we rearranged a few things for the extra bed. Great view of the Marina Bay area. Pool was nice, shared with Swissotel next door. Two pools, one for kids and one a little deeper. I had a massage at the spa which was also quite nice. Location is good, taxis are plentiful, though we did manage to walk back from Orchard St (a bit of a walk, but not unpleasant at all). The hotel is attached to the Raffles Mall which was great as we needed supplies for our son as well as breakfast etc. We did eat room service on our first night which was excellent!! My only annoyance, and this seems to be industry-wide, is the lack of free internet. When will hotels realise this is as important as the free toiletries they provide???? Overall, this is an excellent hotel and I would recommend it for a stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: picca
Reviews.Content: Our family group stayed for 4 nights, we booked three rooms & all were upgraded free of charge to deluxe rooms. We would highly recommend the Fairmont, all service staff we dealt with were friendly and professional. The rooms were clean and comfortable with amazing views. The room is not huge but was adequate in size, bed was very comfortable there is also a pillow menu. Bathroom was quite luxurious, with a fantastic shower. Really enjoyed the pool area, this is shared with the Stamford hotel which is next door. The area has 2 pools, a bar and the cafe Aligator pear. It was very nice to sit there with a cocktail and snack in the afternoon. The Hotel is in a great location, it is part of the Raffles City shopping centre and the MRT station is also there. Overall we had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: nowfreetoroam
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Fairmont, the second time we've stayed there and highly recommend it to anyone staying in Singapore. The staff are excellent, both friendly and welcoming yet very efficient. We were given an upgrade to a deluxe room on arrival at no extra cost and whilst the rooms are not huge they are very comfortable, contemporary in style and well appointed. The pools (two of them) are fantastic, amongst the biggest we've experienced in a city hotel. They're on the eighth floor and have a restaurant (great for breakfast) and bar and plenty of room for lazing around if that's what you want to do. Another big positive is the location. Easy walk to the river, Clark Quay or the Marina Bay area, just across the road to Raffles but also next door to an MRT station if you want to go downtown or further afield. The Fairmont's not a resort style hotel but for stop-over in the city it's a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation”
Reviews.Author: KB2306
Reviews.Content: Me and family stayed in the fairmont hotel and on arrival I was really impressed with the service the design of the hotel and the overall image. We checked in and upgraded our room to the signature room which cost us 50sgd and although I didd'nt see the room we should have been in I was really happy with our room the size and the bed was amazingly comfy. The staff brought our bags to the room and couldn't do enough for us, whenever we left the hotel we were melted and greeted by the hotel staff and it has made our experience in Singapore all that little bit better. Thanks Fairmont

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: midclassvacationer
Reviews.Content: The first time I stayed in Fairmont Singapore was in the year 2007. It was quite a long stay, if my memory serves me right, from December 20 until January 3. My room was at the South tower, on the 26th floor and it was absolutely wonderful. The bed was big and comfortable, the room had such homely ambiance, the toilet was clean and done in a modern way with good lighting and adequate space to roam around, in short, my room was perfect. I love Willow Stream Spa (Professional spa therapists and the jacuzzis are awesome!) . I love having the daily breakfast at Prego (Can get quite packed during the weekend though). I love going to the Executive Lounge on the 23rd floor (Free food and drink with view of the city!). The staffs were (still are) friendly and would do anything to make my stay very comfortable and memorable. Fairmont is conveniently located in the CBD, with a shopping mall and even MRT Station downstairs. In short, Fairmont definitely took my heart away. Now it is 2011 and I've been returning to Fairmont for quite often. I notice that the hotel facilities and rooms are getting a bit dull and worn out. I do hope the management will do something about it. I have stayed in other hotels such as the Marina Bay Sands, Pan Pacific Singapore, Carlton Hotel, Holiday Inn and Wanderlust just to name a few, and none of those hotels can beat Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't live up to my expectations”
Reviews.Author: micol_mca
Reviews.Content: I wonder why Fairmont hotel is highly rated in trip advisor. I had an overnight stay at the hotel. The service was good. I got a room before the 2PM check-in time. The room was pretty old and the carpet was stained. Location is right below the mall and near the MRT. At the price I paid, SGD 280 special corporate rate, breakfast was not included. I'd rather stay at the other similar hotels like the Marina Mandarin. Fairmont is not a terrible hotel, but its nothing fantastic either.

Reviews.Title: “Still not sure why it is so highly rated! Initial room issues continue!!”
Reviews.Author: Beebs11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 12 months ago and the experience was mixed. I thought I would give the hotel another try and, with the offer of a free upgrade from the hotel management to make up for last time, was looking forward to much better experience. Given my previous concerns about the preparation of the room I was disappointed to find that the polished wooden floor was dirty (hair, dust and fluff), the air conditioning was stuck on maximum cooling, five tiles were coming away from the wall in the shower and, though minor, there were three holes in the quilt cover! 24 hours later all the issues were resolved and I was sent a bottle of wine and canapes as an apology. A Nespresso coffee machine was a nice addition to the room and the toiletries are very good products. However, the poolside service of water, fruit and other nibbles seem to have stopped and many of the pool lounge cushions were past their best.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: rmas12
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Fairmont Singapore very early (7am) staff did offer us a room but as we needed inter connecting rooms we had to wait until 2pm, but they did offer us a room where we could have a coffee or water and watch tv while we waited. Rooms were a nice size, very clean and the beds were amazing! Very comfortable. The bar fridge was old and didn't keep things very cold - we were in the north tower and I think they are older rooms. Loved the remote controlled curtains. Bathrooms were nice and well stocked with toothbrush and paste, Plax, comb, shower cap, shampoo, conditioner, shower gel and body lotion. My only complaint about the bathroom is that we didn't get very hot showers one night. Location is fantastic. It is on top of Raffles City Shopping Centre and the MRT which made it very easy to get around Singapore and there are alot of great shops and places to eat in Raffles City. The gym is one of the best gyms I have seen in a hotel - it has a great range of equipment, but does get busy, although I never had a problem getting onto the equipment I wanted. My only complaints about this hotel is that the swipe cards didn't work on the last 2 days, even after we alerted front dest about it and they tried to charge us for items from the mini bar that we didn't use. We were also offered a 10% discount on food as part of our package which they had no record of and I had to produce proof before they would give the discount. Overall I really enjoyed staying at Fairmont Hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Another enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Emelia76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I regularly visit Singapore and often try staying at different hotels in the area. However, this is our 4th stay at the Fairmont as the location, service and quality of rooms is excellent and cannot be faulted. Beds are comfortable, rooms are spacious and if you join their Presidents Club (free to join), wifi is free in the rooms which made it really handy for us as we were there partly on business. Highly recommended for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice touch”
Reviews.Author: tgl73
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the Fairmont about half hour before the regular check in time of 14.00. Although we were at first told that the room would not be available for another hour or 2, staff was very attentive when we explained that our toddler (asleep in the stroller) needed somewhere quiet to rest. Management rapidly reviewed room availability and kindly upgraded us. The rest of our stay was just as pleasant. The hotel has an excellent location near the bay, views of the Raffles, and the room was perfect in terms of furniture selection, ambience and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Paul O
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here regularly and it is a great hotel, in a fantastic location in the middle of Raffles City Shopping Centre, opposite Raffles Hotel . My wife and I Esspesially like to thank the staff in the club room as they allways make our stay a fantastic time,they can not help you enough. As i said we have stayed here before( club room ) and we will always stay here whenever we are in singapore. Again we can't speak highly enough of the staff,i have read only one bad reveiw of this hotel all i can say too the lady who wrote that is in my opinion she was wrong in every aspect . Thanking You Paul and Sue Oliver

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: AndrewEG
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, brilliant service, friendly staff. Will use again for the Grand Prix.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Honest Staff”
Reviews.Author: TimBags
Reviews.Content: Myself & My wife stayed here on our way back from honeymooning in the Maldives. The location of the hotel is perfect being directly above a small shopping center and a metro station, allowing easy access to everywhere in Singapore. We arrived very early in the morning, we were understandably unable to check-in when arriving (8am) the staff allowed us to use the lounge facilities to have a shower and refresh. I left my phone number with the Staff who called me promptly in an hr to inform me that our room was now ready. This was most accommodating as this was many hours before standard check-in was permitted. We also had a late flight leaving Singapore and the hotel was able to facilitate a late checkout for us. The room was spacious, clean & modern. The nespresso machine in the room was a nice touch and beats the instant coffee available in most hotels. We also visited the pool which was large, clean and a nice tranquil escape from the humid Singapore days. The breakfast served in Pregio restaurant was very nice, extensive hot & cold options available for both the western & Asian palette. The juice station was one of my favorites with fresh combination juices available on request. Just prior to checkout, I made the mistake of taking my wedding ring off, being a newly-wed it slipped my mind and I left it on the bathroom counter. I only realized my error many hours after checking out. I ran back to the hotel and was very relieved to discover that the cleaning staff had noticed the ring and had passed it on to security. Within moments I was reunited with my lost ring and this quickly prevented my wife from killing me. The ring is worth $1500AUD so I was impressed by the honesty of the staff in returning it. Overall we were very impressed by our stay at the Fairmont, the rooms, facilitates and staff were all amazing. Very much looking forward to staying here on our next visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Angela J
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in an excellent location, very friendly staff and the room was very clean. All service available on site and nothing was too much trouble for the staff. The location gave easy access to the city centre as well as taxi's to the various business parks. From the room's you also get great views over the city.

Reviews.Title: “Always good - but compare rates to Swissotel”
Reviews.Author: JUDITHbristol
Reviews.Content: I stay here regularly and it is a great hotel, in a fantastic location in the middle of Raffles City Shopping Centre, opposite Raffles Hotel and right in the colonial district. Rooms comfy, beds awesome - great spa with really good treatments. But....if you are a value seeker be sure to check rates at the Swissotel The Stamford too as they are in the same building and whilst rooms are better at Fairmont they have access to all the same facilities. Whilst the Fairmont is worth more than the Swissotel don't pay too much more. Likewise never pay more for the Swissotel than Fairmont. These two hotels are my favourites in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms in South Tower”
Reviews.Author: Meber99
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this Fairmont. It's a great location. The rooms in the south tower are beautiful. The north tower is planned to be refurbished in 2012. The breakfast is nice and the service is as well. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yasserradwan
Reviews.Content: it was a very nice hotel although i had a bad experience with the bathroom , water was so cold and they tried alot to solve the problem but no hope . the location was very nice , the view was marvelous , breakfast was very good .

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: Osnhab
Reviews.Content: Fairmont Singapore is very conveniently located at the happening location in Singapore. With the MRT station located less than 100 m away it is not too far from all the main attractions. Lots of eateries in the mall and a Mac Donald's located just in the mall itself meant that my kids had no issues regarding the food . Breakfast in the hotel was somewhat predictable and repetitive but tasty and wholesome. Staff were warm and friendly. We had taken a room with 2 double beds under their winter package offer and I have to say that the room was very comfortable indeed with an awesome view of the Marina Bay Sands and the Harbour especially at night. We stayed in the south tower which I insisted upon since I had heard that it was far more contemporary than the north tower and the hotel was nice enough to oblige! I wouldn't mind staying in Fairmont Singapore again as I felt that I got a good deal there

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, even better breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: AE1983
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights from 2 November 2011 for our honeymoon, following 7 nights in Langkawi. I can't fault this hotel at all. Great location (opposite Raffles, connected to a mall with great shopping and a very good food court and very close to 2 subway stations), excellent service and the breakfast was the best I've had in a hotel anywhere (buffet style, amazing range and everything was of the best quality). Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: philfamdxb
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay, Signature rooms are spacious and well appointed - large queues for breakfast, try the buffet on the pool deck- v good.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: db1337
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location near the harbor with an incredible view if you are facing harbor side. See the attached photo that I took from my balcony. The basement of the hotel connects to a shopping mall which has a food court and grocery stores/pharmacies. I haven't ever encountered so much convenience from a location before. Club level bookings get a very good lounge, with great views, breakfast include and a small buffet that is suitable for an entire dinner, along with a good bar selection during alcohol service hours (5:30 to 8pm). The gym is very large for a hotel with a good selection of equipment, and is shared with the Swisshotel next door I believe. Spa is also quite large, and guests do not have to pay extra to use the sauna / steam room / hot tub which is a great policy (compare to Mandarin Oriental where you can work out in the gym, but will have to come up with $50 if you want to sauna/steam after). Wifi is free I think if you are a member of Fairmont President's Club. Free to join, so why not? I love enlightened wifi policies (most similar hotels will charge $25 extra... so between sauna and wifi there's a competitive $75/day advantage here). Sleep quality was good with a very comfortable bed, washroom was spacious and beautiful. I had some minor problems during the stay, one of which was completely my own fault (left items behind in the room) and hotel management took it upon themselves to solve them with a full buy in. This kind of responsibility level, where you make the customer's problem your own problem, reflects the best kind of management you can hope for. Problems happen when traveling, it's a fact of life. You will encounter three types of responses, 1. a shrug, so what (useless), 2. a polite letter with regrets (done when they want to appear to be responsive but don't want to take any responsibility and care more about the bottom line than your repeat business) and 3. full buy in where management is sincerely concerned and wants to offer the best possible experience for their guests. This hotel is run on type 3 and for me this is the best situation I can hope for as a guest, knowing that whatever happens, management stands behind their product and their guest. That to me is the single biggest difference that makes a property five star. There are many pretenders but few are worth their five star rating, like Fairmont Singapore is. I highly recommend the hotel and will stay here again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Epicure O
Reviews.Content: We are seasoned travellers and have been to many nice hotels. In Singapore we have stayed in a few hotels already, but prefer the Fairmont as their service is really outstanding. No matter what you need to have changed in your room, or even if you need to change your room in the middle of the night, they will make it possible. The breakfast is also very good, with a great selection of fresh fruit, fresh juices and a good selection of breads.

Reviews.Title: “Best Experience”
Reviews.Author: Euphorigenic
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best Hotels to stay in with a very beautiful view. The Facilities are great too , the food is great too and the restaurants within the hotel is just great need not go out to have your meaa value for money. Excellent service and best rates for the Sea View. I love it

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great service”
Reviews.Author: MoscowBonhomme
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple of nights this October. Very conveniently located within the Raffles City shopping center. Although they can get pretty busy, the gym and pool are quite nice. Rooms are spacious and fresh. Special mention must go to the concierge - very helpful on various requests, even lent me cufflinks for the day as I had forgotten mine. Will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: mindie
Reviews.Content: Staying on the executive level floor usually guarantees a higher level of service. Not true at the Fairmont Singapore. While the facility was very nice, the level of service did not match what we have experienced with Fairmont Hotels in the past. Calls for service were not responded to. We asked for a converter plug three times before it finally came. We waited over 1/2 hour in an uncrowded hotel restaurant for lunch. We had to ask housekeeping to return and clean the bathroom again when we returned to the room at the end of the day to find the floor full of hair and debris in the toilet. (We didn't leave either of them!) These were typical service problems we experienced in our 4 days there. I will stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “do you want to be spoilt”
Reviews.Author: rippercol
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Fairmont once again in October 2011. On arrival we were greeted with a refreshing tropical fruit juice before being escorted to the Raffles club reception on the 23rd floor. We received outstanding service from all the team. The room overlooked the harbour with the Marina Bay Sand Hotel,the Merlion, Singapore Flyer, War Memorial and Parliament House in view, the king size bed was very comfortable, the room was spacious and clean, It was nice to come back to your room after dinner to have your bed pulled back with an orchid on the pillow, slippers by the bed and soft music playing and any used towels etc were taken and replaced with fresh ones thanks to the housekeeping staff. A special thank you to Aaron,Zamri,Crystal and Hosanna for the birthday cake and special treatment on my birthday. The free drinks and canopes each evening are very good as there is different foods to try each night. We found the shopping centre in the complex very good value. There is a food hall on the third floor and more shops in the basement. The MRT is also close by and you can get to Suntec City shopping centre by underground. We really enjoyed ALL our visits to the Fairmont and hope to be back again soon

Reviews.Title: “All inclusive”
Reviews.Author: deetwotee
Reviews.Content: Check in at the hotel with a thrilled feeling because of it is an expensive hotel. But when I entered the room, I realized that all inclusive. A beautiful scenery, ranging from the Singapore Flyer, Marina Bay Sands, War Memorial, The Padang, Esplenade Theater, The Merlion, Marina and The CBD can be seen from the private balcony. Easy excess to Raffless Mall, 24-hour restaurant, and located at a strategic location to go to Bugis, Chinatown, Clarke Quay and the MTR to all areas of Singapore. They put me in level 9 of the South Tower for a smoking room. However, I was there for a tight schedule conference and it was not enough time to enjoy all the facility :(

Reviews.Title: “5 star - quality you would expect”
Reviews.Author: LONDONUK1
Reviews.Content: Very good location, 5 star hotel. Very pleasant if a bit small in some rooms. Wifi lacking in rooms (they say it is coming) Food poor choice - but there is a mall next door.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful which rooms you asked for”
Reviews.Author: whinz_sg
Reviews.Content: Was at fairmont singapore for the weekend in Oct and it was a disappointing stay. Actually wanted some peace and quiet to do some work (as neighbour was renovating). Never will I imagine that I will get the some 'treatment' at fairmont! Apparently, they are also renovating some rooms and my room happens to be right below one of them. I would think that as an act of basic courtesy, a note could be written to inform guest that renovations are being carried out. I didn't kick up a fuss since my intention was to go to the nearby National Library to continue with my work anyway. Evening was okay. Then, on a Sunday morning, was awaken by the renovation noise again! That was the last straw. I checked out. If i'd known earlier that there were renovations going on, I would have checked into other nearby hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, views and modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: PrincessMaz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here again last week, possibly my 20th stay. Rooms in the south tower are modern with great bathrooms, and many have views over to Marina Bay Sands and the city skyline. Avoid the north tower. These are older rooms lacking international power points (well, even a decent number of power points), no decent hair dryer and bathrooms are quite old. If you get a cheap rate, check that it's not in the north tower. Always good service. Great executive club with free flow Veuve each night for a couple of hours. It's located right above an MTR stop and shopping mall with a handy supermarket in the basement, also a Din Tai Fung dumplings branch - best dumplings in town. If you find this review helpful, please give it a helpful vote! thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, great conference venue”
Reviews.Author: AZandDZ
Reviews.Content: Ran a conference here for 500 and the hotel did a first class job, comfortable to stay in too - although a few rooms are a little tired - good food. The Asia cafe had a wide choice for those of us who like got and spicy, preto the Italian choice also enjoyable. The sharing of facilities with the Swiss hotel also extends choice. The willow spa is excellent, with a very good gym - but you will need to be at the gym at 6.15 am in the morning to get your choice of machine ! Enjoyed my stay

Reviews.Title: “The best location in SGP”
Reviews.Author: GaryinSydney
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 nights at the Fairmont - my 5th stay at least at this fantastic property. The views (21st floor) were truly beautiful -directly over Marina Bay, I could not imagine a better view from any hotel in town. The rooms are large and remain modern and stylishly functional in spite of their age in this city of constant makeovers and new developments. The location is also perfect - so great to be part of the Raffles City complex with direct links to City Hall MRT as well. I'm very satisfied with the hotel and I see no reason to change my hotel choice whenever I visit SGP.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for Meetings”
Reviews.Author: BerkhamstedJules
Reviews.Content: We have just held a three day meeting at the Fairmont for 6 people. The meeting rooms are really well equipped with plenty of space, built-in back-projected screen, those special flipchart paper gripper rails, a huge whiteboard and windows which go from clear to opaque at the touch of a button - very James Bond! What really impressed us was the service team, who had learnt all our tea and coffee preferences (which varied by time of day) after the first time of asking and as soon as we opened the door for the breaks, would rush to make them. We also had the usual asian hotel array of eastern and western light bites, which varied each day and were universally excellent. Nothing was too much trouble and any request was enthusiastically responded to, including recovring my reading glasses from the breakfast room. For lunch each day we were escorted to a different buffet or restaurant and enjoyed all the meals. I stayed in the hotel on the club floor and initially was disappointed to find my Presidents Club status had been rewarded by giving me the smallest room on the floor (you can tell from the fire excape notice map...). However a mumbled comment to our meeting organiser produced a spectacular upgrade to a suite on the 25th floor with enormous lounge, huge bathroom with a shower area that would take a football team, walk in wardrobe and large bedroom. The control units take a bit of mastering but do enable you to open and shut curtains (night and day versions) from your bed, as well as all the lights except those in the bathroom for some strange reason. The bed was very comfortable and the air conditioning unobtrusive. There are Nespresso coffee machines in each room, but they don't leave the water tank filled, so if you dont know how to operate these, I bet most people would assume their machine isn't working (both rooms' machines needed expert coaxing from the family's barrista at home to produce a cup). The Club lounge is super, with plenty of staff to sort you out a drink (although you can just help yourself), answer questions about anything really and generally make you feel genuinely welcome. They got to know our names after only a couple of visits too. The breakfast in the mornings is a full set of hot and cold options and the snacks in the evening were also quite an array of good things. Location is great (opposite Raffles) unless you paln to spend your time on Orchard Road, which is a taxi ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: Emufi
Reviews.Content: Fairmont is definitely a notch above the sort of hotel (and price) that I would normally stay in, but the luxury and location was superb and worth the extra $$. I was in Singapore for a conference at the Suntec Centre, so was able to walk via the underground walkways that eminate from the hotel shopping area - very convenient.
