The room was very well appointed. I particularly liked the chaise longe situated a comfortable distance from the TV, in front of the bed. Very comfortable bed and lighting controls that actually do what they were intended to do. When you press the 'master light' switch off from the bedside console, each light in the room turns off one by one, giving you enough time to sink into the bed linen. We ate at the Italian restaurant and I can recommend the meatball linguine washed down with a glass of merlot. Michelle at the Executive Lounge was very pleasant and efficient and Miss Chin (sorry I can't remember her first name) at the Concierge desk was very helpful and a great hospitality professional. One tip? Try to check-in when there isn't an airline crew arriving or departing as you might get temporarily overlooked during the kerfuffle at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, no problems”
Reviews.Author: V Traveler
Reviews.Content: I only spent one day at the Fairmont while in town for a meeting. I would definitely stay there again. The location was good for exploring Singapore - I took the subway a few times and also walked extensively from the hotel. The staff was helpful and genuinely friendly. The bathroom was fine - showing a little bit of age but no problems - and the shower was good. Excellent bed and pillows. Internet was free since I was a Fairmont member - free to sign up so there's no reason not to. Very fast internet as well. It cost me $28 in a taxi from the airport to reach the hotel. It only cost $2 to take the subway back to the airport. Obviously the taxi is easier, but it was only a little faster - 25 minutes by taxi at rush hour compared to 30-35 on the subway. I would not hesitate to take the subway to the hotel next time (to the City Hall stop). Breakfast was included with my room and was excellent. Great selection (and dim sum!) and excellent coffee. Overall it's not necessarily the nicest 5-star hotel, but for $277 I thought the location was great, the food was great and the room was fine. A good value.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: zoeflondon
Reviews.Content: Family holliday for 4- 2 adults and 2 children ages 3 and 1. The hotel could not have done any more, Check in did not take that long at all- 5 mins if that.They gave Crayons and a colouring book to keep our daugeter busy while we did. We were also upgraded to a delux room which was one of the renovated ones and lovely. We had a pull out bed for the 3 year old and a cot for the baby. (NO BED BUGS!!!) Our king size bed was so brilliant- we bought a matress topper on our return home as was so impressed with theirs.Throughout the hotel the staff were really friendly- and it was little things like the fact they bought bottles of water to the room when ever asked. The pool was really good for the children though a little bit cold in the early evening. The hotel even let us store a case and bag at the hotel while we spent a week in Bintan and pick it up on our return. We have visited singapore many times before staying at the Intercontinental- my previous favourite and the Pan pacific. The fairmont was lovely- matching if not bettering the intercontinental. I would love to stay again. NB if booking with children- most internet sites will not let you book for 2 children. We contacted the hotel and asked which rooms were appropriate- then booked this type of room where the best deal was. ,

Reviews.Title: “First-class all the way!”
Reviews.Author: hotasay
Reviews.Content: My wife & I just returned from the Fairmont Singapore and our stay was absolutely outstanding. It was my birthday, so my wife contacted the hotel before our arrival. When we arrived, there were balloons, flowers & chocolates in the room. A cake and card were delivered soon after. The hotel went above & beyond what would be expected for a birthday. My wife & I travel extensively and I have to say that our experience at the Fairmont Singapore was one of our best. Everyone we encountered at the hotel went out of their way to make our stay memorable. I wouldn't hesitate to stay at this hotel again. I look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: j0anna45
Reviews.Content: This holiday was meant to be a very special stay, as it was my daughter's first break after the birth of her little girl three years ago. Therefore we decided to have a break of 4 nights in Singapore. After a lot of agonising I decided to stay in the Fairmont for its very convenient location and it did not disappoint. We were both allocated rooms on the 21st floor, my room was in the South Tower and my daugther was in the North Tower. However, I must have stayed in a "haunted" room with faulty electrical wiring which played up in the middle of the second night, lights going off and on, electric curtains opening on its own accord, doorbell ringing, etc. Consequently I had to get a technician up to disconnect some of the electricity. Needless to say that I did not sleep at all that night, it all was rather disconcerting. The next morning, I requested to have a different room for the remaining nights, which of course was immediately organised and the room blocked out until the wiring system was checked out and fixed. As all this was quite an ordeal, we both received complimentary breakfast for the remainder of our stay plus a late checkout for both rooms. All in all I was more than happy with the way management solved this room problem. The concierge service was outstanding, so was reception. Breakfast was great (try the french toast with orange cream), staff could not be friendlier and making sure that everything was the way we wanted it to be. We had a beautiful stay which we will never forget, thanks to all the staff. Location could not be better, so close to everything within walking distance to main attractions, and the MRT is just literally meters away. As I am a very regular visitor to Singapore, I have stayed in many 5 star hotels in this city and can say that from now on I will make the Fairmont my hotel in Singapore. For me it is the only place to stay, both because of its location and the extreme helpfullness of all staff. If I could give it 6 stars, I would.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay & location”
Reviews.Author: IRISHDRAFT
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 12th floor facing the Raffles hotel, balcony but not really big enough to use & no furniture. Room was spacious & bed very comfortable. Plenty of wardrobe space & spacious bathroom but a little disappointing to have an over bath shower with a shower curtain in this standard of hotel. Iron & ironing board a bonus. Location is good for accessing many area's & the pool area was nice, well maintained, good quality loungers & very clean pool, 5/5 on that aspect. Concierge were helpful. Everything lovely & clean & maid service good. Only hotel restaurant I ate at was the one that does the Sunday Dim Sum A la carte buffet, the standard & service were both excellent. Overall would have given 5/5 if not for the bathroom & poor balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay with unforgettable experience!”
Reviews.Author: ZhannaV
Reviews.Content: Although we stayed at the hotel just 4 days, these days became really unforgettable for us. What really made it happen so is the excellent service of the hotel, which by far exceeded all our expectations! Since our trip was dedicated to a very special anniversary, I had really high demands concerning the entire organization of the stay. Not only that I got very professional and friendly feed-back from the hotel within the shortest time, all my requests were over-fulfilled, starting from the greeting, proceeding with the room decoration, accompanying us, providing explanatory services in our mother language and patient re-booking of thousands changes which we had concerning other organizational details (dinners, internet, etc.). Even more, the hotel sent us per email the pictures of the room decoration to later memories ;-) I myself was working in a travel agency and I know that even within 5-star hotels it is not that easy to find a perfect hotel for a special occasion. This was a perfect service which is definitely a very high benchmark for other hotels. Besides that (but this is anyhow well known) - perfect location in the center of the city makes all key sightseeing reachable by walking, great breakfasts and excellent dinings! Thus, for us it was a perfect stay which we will never forget!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joyce L
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Singapore has to be one of our favourite hotels in the World. The service, rooms, food and location are excellent. Although we live in Singapore, we actually do a stay-cation at the Fairmont at least twice a year for a few days just to get away from it all. Every stay really rejuvenates, pampers and recharges us everytime! Will highly recommend for visitors on business and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location near Marina Bay”
Reviews.Author: AmerPole
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend getaway to Fairmont Singapore (we live in Malaysia). Hotel is in fantastic location. Hotel itself is nice, staff accomodating. Rooms, however, are dated. The furnishings are ok and it smelled very musty. The food in the hotel is good but expensive. In Prego, we were asked by a waiter carrying a basket if we would like some bread. Replied "yes" but were shocked when our bill included an extra price of $12 for the two rolls! My glass of red wine was $23. This is a casual Italian restaurant! Even in the hotel room bar, there's a mini bottle of wine (with perhaps 2 glasses worth) that cost $22. Granted, the wine in Prego was delicious, but again, was just really pricey. Living in Malaysia, we are kind of immune to the higher cost of alcohol. But that was ridiculous. I had requested a higher floor for our rooms (thanks to someone's recommendation on Trip Advisor) and was happy I did - spectacular views. We avoided the crowd at check out by doing the Express checkout. If you join their President's club (free), internet is free.

Reviews.Title: “comfy and good location”
Reviews.Author: Peech
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights since all hotels around Marina Square / Suntec were booked out. Didn't matter, because I could still walk to Marina Square via Citylink Mall and the whole journey was around 15 mins and pretty much all air-conditioned. This used to be the Westin and was built in the 80s. My room was spacious and comfortable, with a balcony overlooking the Raffles Hotel. Bathroom was decent, even though the shower was a little dated. Housekeeping actually did manage to be environmentally friendly, and not change my towels when I hung them up on racks. Reception for some TV channels were a little poor, but I had free internet, even wifi. Very nice and important. They did charge me a few cents for making local calls, which weren't expensive but a little annoying. Reception was courteous and efficient. Happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: WilliamGodley
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with an excellent staff, exactly what one expects from any Fairmont property. In Singapore the location is outstanding, too. One is near some of the best shopping complexes and there are fine restaurants on all sides. I particularly appreciated this Fairmont because I had checked out early one morning in order to catch a train to Malaysia. Because of heavy rains the train schedules were disrupted and I had to arrange for alternative transportation later in the day. When I returned to the Fairmont in order to wait out the delay, reception graciously permitted me to occupy the same room I'd had during the past few nights without additional charges. I simply returned to that room and was able to rest for the next few hours and to make numerous telephone calls relative to the transportation change. The service I received at the Fairmont Singapore that day is what characterizes a truly great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: SunnySide10Jan
Reviews.Content: I sold my apartment and had to stay somewhere for a few nights before my new apartment was ready. I chose Fairmont Singapore as I read that they offer big connecting rooms. It was indeed spacious and comfortable. I booked two Fairmont rooms and to my surprise, the hotel upgraded my family to a Signature room that connects to a Fairmont room. It was a very nice gesture. The connecting guestrooms offers a good size for a family of 4 or 5. The Signautre room has a big bed and the connecting room offers two big beds. My little one slept on an extra bed in between the two big beds. There was also a separate sitting area for watching TV in the Signature room and a writing desk in both guestrooms where my children could do their work after school. It was a 5-night stay and we enjoyed the Fairmont Singapore hospitality. My little boy enjoys the swimming pool while my wife loves the Willow Stream Spa on Level 6. She highly recommend the Relaxation Massage to me but I was too shy to try! My two older children commuted to school by MRT which is located directly below the hotel. Overnight parking was reasonably priced for 24 hrs with multiple entries and exits. It was a great stay and I hope I do not have to sell my apartment to enjoy another stay at Fairmont Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ShoppingShanghai
Reviews.Content: Have just spent 8 days at the Fairmont in Singapore and had a wonderful time. The staff and service was impeccable, we stayed on the 24th Floor with Club Room facilities. The breakfast, evening drinks and canapes were fabulous. Our room had a beautiful view over Marina Bay. The location is very good as you have a large shopping centre under the hotel and the MRT a couple of minutes away. All in all a great place to stay, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Moments turned into beautiful memories...”
Reviews.Author: Kendes
Reviews.Content: I booked a Fairmont Room for my weekend staycation with my hubby for the last weekend. Prior to checking in, I contacted Mr Shaik Shidek (guests relations manager) of Fairmont Singapore and requested for a South tower views as reviews states that south tower rooms are newer and bigger. I also mentioned to them that I was celebrating my anniversary. From my understanding, they informed me that south tower consists of mostly deluxe room and the Fairmont room type which I booked was located in the North tower. To my pleasant surprised, mr Shaik took the initiative and offered me a free upgrade to the deluxe room meaning I could be staying in the south tower. And because I informed that I was celebrating my anniversary, mr Shaik took ownership if the situation and told me that he will decorate my room, and prepare some welcome amenities (chocolate) and a small cake upon my arrival. I liased with mr Shaik through email and I requested for a btl of wine instead if possible as I'll be checking in after lunch, hence too full for the cake. Mr Shaik agreed and he indeed got everything well done upon my arrival. Upon my arrival at the hotel, mr Shaik welcomed me personally and checking in was fast n efficient, upon arriving in my room, I was impressed by the decorations n everything, what surprised me more is after spending the day outside, upon me returning to the hotel at night, i found a box of cake n the table, with a card from mr Shaik. He must be been thoughtful enough to know that since I'll be too full after lunch to enjo the cake, he send it up only in the evening. All in all, I enjoyed my staycation, housekeeping was efficient n the room kept clean n tidy everyday without fail, all the staffs provide great service, even the bellman is super friendly too! A great hotel which is very convenient as it's linked to raffles city. Even though there.s no complimentary parking, but with such great attitudes and services, i m more den glad to pay for the parking n sat n Fairmont!!!! Wll definitely be back,!!! Like in their adverts, Fairmont will turn moments into beautiful memories!!! :))

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous product, fine service and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MrSmith413
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Fairmont Singapore a few times. I love the renovated Fairmont room. It's spacious and offers a good view of Raffles Hotel. The bed is comfortable. The pillows are awesome! The lower units are not renovated so remember to request for renovated rooms. Once they were overbooked or something and ran out of my preferred room type but they offer me a Deluxe with no additional charge. I thought that was very generous. The staff are very friendly and kind. They always offer alternatives. The hotel shares an adult pool and children pool with Swissotel The Stamford. I read somewhere that these 3 brands are under one roof. There are many restaurants to choose from and I love the new Japanese restaurant on Level 3. Breakfast at Prego is delicious but there are other fast food chains or small shops that offers some local delights. The hotel is connected to a 5-storey mall and is right above the City Hall MRT station which is also an interchange. Many tourists stay in this hotel. You will lurve it!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: RSTE1234
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the fairmont for 3 night on business and from the moment i walked in the hotel was problems, arriving just before 1am in the morning check in took 30 minutes due to the dithering of the receptionist and despite my asking to be given a room as i was tired she continued just to do her own thing. On arrival in my room it was freezing, the aircon was set to 17 ! what were they trying to do it was 1am and i just wanted to sleep so used dressing gown and a few bath towels to keep warm. There was also a general damp smell around the hotel with a lot of the corridor carpets starting to look dirty. I used the gym on 2 of the nights and its ok but nothing special with the equipment being a bit old and the cardio machines dirty. Room service, i ordered room service on 2 nights the food was ok nothing special but was not bad either, on the first night i could not get rid of the man delivering he seem to be trying his best to get a tip almost has to push him out the room The room facilities are not well maintained, some of the buttons on one of the phones did not work, the central light and curtain does not all work and on the first 2 nights most of the tv channels did not work. Overall a hotel that i will not being going back to, i was on business and will recommend that we dont use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous Memories”
Reviews.Author: Ming555
Reviews.Content: Fairmont Singapore is the only hotel which I will stay for my trip to Singapore. The hotel provides excellent service all the time. All personnel from different department is helpful and friendly. Hotel location is good as MRT is accessible within the compound. Hotel facilities is great in terms of pool / gym / restaurants etc. I take this opportunity to share the great experiences that I've gathered and strongly recommend to stay in Fairmont (Singapore). Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Good International Hotel Chain”
Reviews.Author: Warwick G
Reviews.Content: Excellent business hotel. Well located next to MRT station and has well equipped gym and spa.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice weekend stay at the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: RaffaelloSingapore
Reviews.Content: Our recent 'weekend staycation' took us to the Fairmont, which is one of my favorite hotels in Singapore. If you are looking for the most swanky, modern, stylish and or 'boutique' hotel experience - this is probably not for you. But if you do enjoy a classic luxury hotel with no nonsense, but very tasteful and well equipped rooms plus efficient and friendly service: you will like this place. The hotel is situated very conveniently within the Raffles City Center complex, and offers an abundance of eateries (very nice Italian restaurant and good Chinese cuisine, too) as well as shared pool, spa and gym facilities with the adjacent Swissotel The Stamford. We enjoyed a Deluxe room, which was spacious enough for a weekend break, and offered a great view towards the Marina Bay area. The room itself offered a classic decor and a very nice bed as well as a functional room design with respect to work space provided, flat screen television and a minibar with coffee/tea making counter. You will not miss anything, and the service offered by the hotel staff is very attentive and always extremely friendly and personal. The Fairmont is like a well known and trusted friend - delivering high quality every time you enjoy the place; if you are looking for a wow factor you might be disappointed, but if you want to enjoy a convenient, high quality accomodation with easy access to shopping, culture and nightlife for a reasonable price: the Fairmont delivers, and does this in style. We will definitively be back.

Reviews.Title: “Service is not up to expectation”
Reviews.Author: GM_LC4674
Reviews.Content: I was contemplating between going back to hotels in Singapore (PanPacific and Mandarin Oriental) which I have really good experiences before vs Fairmont. I eventually chose Fairmont because of the positive comments I read in tripadvisor. Sad to say, the service was a letdown. The hotel stay in Fairmont is supposed to be a birthday gift for my daughter. At check-in, I asked if they have any complimentary cake for the birthday celebration. They said they will check and get back to me. Alas, I waited from afternoon till night, no sign of the cake and worse still, no acknowledgement whatsoever from the hotel on the status of their check. Another minus point is the queue at President Club. I signed up membership for the President Club in view of the benefits (one of them being the express lane for check-in and check-out). To my disappointment, I waited in queue for some time before deciding to move to the queue at the other non President Club counters that were clearing faster than this so-called express lane. Perhaps the hotel may wish to look into providing more counters at the President Club to meet up to the promise of quick check-ins / check-outs. Basic customer service is what I feel is lacking in this hotel. I agree with the previous comment by Fitzlim; just because we did not sign up for their package, we were made to feel as though we are unworthy of good customer service. Given a choice again, I would choose to go back to the better rating hotels like Mandarin Oriental and Pan Pacific. It is no wonder they are ranked 1st and 2nd respectively in terms of customer satisfaction for hotels in Singapore. I really did feel good and pampered in my stay there this year.

Reviews.Title: “A Lousy Service Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fitzlim
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoy our staycations at various Singapore hotels, and Singapore hotels never let us down before. At Fairmont Singapore, this was the worst experience we ever had. We booked a deluxe room at Fairmont Singapore (the classic decor room). When we arrived, we did the check-in as usual but the room was not ready. 2 hours later the room was ready, but we had to queue and re-did the check-in. We requested for high floors during our reservations but got a 6th floor room instead (next to the noisy gym). Upon entering the room, we found that it looked vastly different from the website pictures. No wonder it is slightly cheaper than their modern decor room. The room is old, worn out and ugly. The worst part of this hotel is their service staff. They refuse to do anything for you. Note that there is no complimentary car parking for this hotel! So if you thought they are like other Singapore hotels which offer complimentary parking, you are wrong. We tried to ask the hotel to help us out so that we wouldn't need to pay the extravagant parking fee. All they could say is 'we are sorry'. Try speaking to the manager? It's even worst! He told me if I ever found evidence that they offer complimentary parking to guests, show it to him! Such a rude comment coming from a senior staff. My conclusion is that if you want good service from this hotel, make sure u are staying in their presidential suite. Apparantly, all out requests are turned down because we did not signed on their 'packages'.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: juddtecson
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in so many hotels in Singapore. This is my first choice in the city. Close to almost everything, shopping malls, mrt, restaurants. The rooms are spacious, well planed and have great views. The spa is awesome. Can't ask for more

Reviews.Title: “Great location for F1 and in general, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Bugles
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont for the F1 recently and boy do they have the best view in town for F1. You cannot beat it. You have almost 2 kms of clear track in front of you and the proximity to the track enables you to hear the best man-made sound in the world. The hotel is fairly good. The design is starting to look a bit old. However must agree that the quality of the furnishing is top notch. One thing outstanding was the quality of the bed, it doesnt get much better than that in hotels. The staff is very nice and helpful and were able to deliver great service throughout the stay. I would be happy to recommend this hotel to others. One recommendation to the management would be to try and knock down the wall between the pool area and view of Singapore skyline. Although I am sure they must have thought about it and maybe there is a reason for it to exist. However must stay without that wall I believe the view from the pool area will be unmatched in Singapore. The mall connected to the hotel is also very helpful with good diaspora of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisa R
Reviews.Content: we stayed two nights at the fairmont hotel. on arrival we were able to check in early, which was fantastic and we were upgraded to a deluxe room, the room was lovely but i can not see that it was a "deluxe" room, however i have not stayed in the superior so i cant compare, i would definately recommend this hotel, the staff are lovely from the reception and the door man. we did not eat at the hotel we ate in the ajoining food court which was average, although the organic bread shop was lovley. The room had a slight musty smell but i have come to realise that all hotel rooms in singapore do. the beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was great. the room was very clean and we could not fault it at all. the bathroom was well stocked with lovley toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “It was really, really nice”
Reviews.Author: TKgirl
Reviews.Content: Great hotel smack in the centre of Singapore. This was a great 5-star hotel with all the amenities and great service.My room was on the 23rd floor and I had a great view over the skyline van S'pore. The pool area was very nice, with a decent-sized pool and enough lounge beds. The gym was quite big, 2 floors with a separate workout area. I could go on and on, but let me just say that I found nothing faulty and I would come back here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot in the heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: DRSH_71
Reviews.Content: Location location location! You even get to gaze across the street at Raffles and dream of what might have been..... But Fairmont is a good-quality hotel in its own right with modern, well appointed rooms, high-class toiletries (so I'm told!), top-notch service, views across the City and a great spa (his and hers are seperate). It also has a surprisingly large outdoor pool, considering its prime down-town location. Can't comment on food as we ate out for the couple of days we were in town - I'd recommend a visit to Din Tai Fung, located in the basement of Paragon Shopping Mall, for top of the range dim sum and the likes.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Fairmont Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Tasukete
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a great 3 days in Singapore. Loved the lobby of the hotel and the fact that it is connected to Raffles City, makes it very convenient and allows for more food options. The room was pretty standard but very nice, the only quirk was the faucets in the bathroom which were strange and hard to use. Other than that it was a very pleasant stay and the hotel is located in a great location in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Posh place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DiploConcierge
Reviews.Content: Posh, downtown, within walking distance of the major museums, and there is a metro/underground/subway station (City Hall Station) more or less in the basement. If you stay there or any other Fairmont in the world, by all means join their President’s Club, which is free and provides free internet access and other valuable perks. If you can, spring for an Executive Club Room, which, aside from offering an even more comfortable room, grants access to the exclusive Executive Club Lounge, boasting stunning views of the city and exceptional service. Whether you decide to upgrade, breakfast at Prego, on the ground floor, is outstanding. Their juice bar is our favorite of many wonderful features.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service.”
Reviews.Author: BowlsTom
Reviews.Content: We stayed a quick two nights at the Fairmont and loved it. Had a twin room which was a really good size, didn't feel cramped at all. The bathroom is really quite large too and had a bath and shower. The beds and pillows were super comfortable! Rooms are nice and modern and have small balconies. The hotel is in a pretty good location, walking distance to the marina area (as long as you can handle the heat) and is located adjacent to a large shopping mall. Raffles is right across the road as well as a subway station which will get you to and from the airport. Unfortunately our shower was a bit broken but we advised the staff when we left in the morning and by the time we were back, it was fixed. The staff were always very friendly and efficient. We were checked in and out quickly. The doorman also saw us coming and held a cab back for us as apparently they're hard to get on weekends so that was great initiative... especially as we were running late for our flight!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: frecka
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way to Australia. It was a very positive experience from the moment we arrived until the moment we left. The staff extremely courteous & efficient the rooms are immaculate & comfortable & we had a great view from our hotel room. After the 13 hour flight it was just bliss to throw off our travelling clothes pull on a robe (and a bathing suit of course) & relax in the rooftop pool under the moon followed by the buffet in the attached restuarant. The poolside breakfast was the best & most varied breakfast buffet I have ever had. Having access to the spa & pool after checkout is also a real bonus we were able to spend the day out & about in Singapore, come back & have a swim & shower & head off to the airport feeling fresh. Leaving to go to the airport I reached the very helpful porter a tip & he refused saying it was just the service! First time ever I have ever had a tip refused - it was just a top notch establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed...”
Reviews.Author: razzdazz222
Reviews.Content: This is a very impressive hotel to stay in. Yes, it is without doubt more expensive to others but it is, in my humble opinion, far more impressive to others as well. In general, the extra you'd save with others you can easily quantify or justify towards convenience that this hotel provides. Location for this hotel is simply unbeatable as it has MRT station in it's basements, restaurants and arcades in lower levels, and a myriad of department stores, specialty stores, and even fast food outlets in abundance. This is still only in the same complex of the hotel!!! Stepping outside of this complex, one can easily stride to Funan Computer Centre, or to the Esplanade where concerts, plays, and cultural events are hosted. Access to the MRT system then allows you access to many other shopping areas and precincts the limit of which is only restricted by funds, time, and one's own wish to explore. Hotel itself is vast in size, with great amenities like expansive gym, business centre, multiple pools, and a room with a seaview almost all the time, depending on whether it's the North or South tower. The rooms are typically newly refurbished, with comfortable beds and pillows, exuding a discerning level of poshness and is generously spaced. Members of the hotel club entitles you to complimentary Internet access while staff are always helpful, polite and accommodating. This hotel is great in value although it is in the process of refurbishment. This by no means denotes poor quality rooms only ones with a new paint job, new curtains, and upgraded in-room mod-cons. It is also equally comfortable and accessible by both business people and families with young children alike as it's location allows everyone to enjoy it's comprehensive complement of amenities, as much as that of all it's surrounding environs that is so conveniently amidst of!

Reviews.Title: “attention to detail makes this the best Singapore hotel”
Reviews.Author: ahmlaw
Reviews.Content: This is not my first review of Fairmont Singapore, but my stay at this wonderful hotel last September 2011 merits a second review. The facilities – especially for those who are particular about the bathroom – were spotless and top quality. Those who like the separate rain shower and bathtub will love this feature of Fairmont Singapore rooms. I should mention though that for just a bit more, I would encourage guests to specify deluxe rooms in the south wing: these are the rooms with superior bathroom facilities, and generally better rooms. I should also add that the evening turn-down service is MUCH MORE than just turning down your sheets: you get a replenishment of amenities, towels, bottled water, and coffee items – and the very important (in a shopping town!) full bucket of ice! For weary – and thirsty -- tourists familiar with that little irritant of having to call housekeeping for a bucket of ice (or get it yourself from an ice machine!) , and the usual 15-minute wait for the ice to be sent up, you can appreciate arriving at your room after a long day and having that refreshing little detail ready. Fairmont has an exceptional evening-service: they think of everything; it is practically like having your room freshened up twice in a day. Another tip: join the hotel chain's President’s Club. If only for the complimentary internet, it is worth joining, and the other perks make it an excellent hotel club. For example, often, when you check out early, most hotels will store your baggage until your departure for the airport. Fairmont Singapore does one better for President’s Club members (or perhaps even other hotel guests): it has a lounge where you can rest, have coffee or tea, freshen up, and relax before a trip. Finally, I cannot say enough about the service. From the very efficient hotel manager, to his competent admin and reservation staff who respond promptly to all emails and queries, to the front desk, concierge, wait staff, and housekeeping – the service was beyond superior. In fact, a friend of mine lost her stamped immigration card and was so worried, but the concierge took the time – despite the very busy hour of 1:00 pm – to call airport immigration, get all the details for obtaining a new card, and thereby ensuring a worry-free vacation. Many hotels pay lip service to treating their hotel patrons as honored guests. In this hotel you are made to feel and experience that warm, professional, and first class treatment. Truly exceptional. These may be odd features and services to point out, but for the discriminating traveler, it is the attention to these little details that do go a long way, and set a 5-star hotel apart from their rivals. Fairmont is absolutely in a class by itself. I would never even consider staying anywhere else in Singapore, whether I am there on business, or just to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable as an old pair of shoes (but much better smelling!)”
Reviews.Author: onedumgoy
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Singapore, and I debated if this location was the best place to be. Knowing what I now know, I would recommend the Orchard Road area for a first time visitor ( if you want constant action). The Fairmont, although well located, is in a slightly quieter area, and might be better for the seasoned Singapore traveler. Personally, I enjoyed not being in the center of the universe and there is more than enough to do within walking distance of the property. There is an MRT station in the basement of the hotel, and you can go anywhere easily on this cheap and efficient mass transport system. The property itself is fairly sedate, and it is not as grand as my expectations. I have been fortunate to stay in some very high end properties throughout China, HKG, and Thailand but found the ambience here to be relatively unremarkable.With that being said, I found the staff themselves to be most gracious and there appears to be a high ratio of staff to guests, so service is superb. Dining options are numerous within the hotel itself and the attached mall. You will really enjoy eating yourself into a coma! My ultimate recommendation is to join the Fairmont President's Club prior to your visit. It's a free program, and when you arrive, you will receive complimentary internet ( $22 a day savings) and discounts at the spa. There is a dedicated check in desk for speedy check-in, and I was granted an upgraded room as the room I had reserved was not available. Don't leave home without joining!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: MaccaSydneyAustralia
Reviews.Content: We have travelled to Singapore for over 15 years for business and pleasure. Whenever the travel arrangements are in our control we always perfer to stay at the Fairmont. We recently stayed there for 3 nights on our way back from England. Open checking in we experienced some frustration with obtaining a harbour view room on a high floor. Sheik Shidek hotel manager observed our annoyance and quickly rectified the issue. He truely understands client service. The hotel is perfectly located, you can enter the MRT and shopping mall without even going outside. The hotel unlike most also have balconies which we love. We look forward to returning to the Fairmont, just wish Singapore was closer to Sydney so we could stay there more often. Greg & Jenny MacDonald - Sydney Australia

Reviews.Title: “Three cheers for the Services Manager”
Reviews.Author: sioban m
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Fairmont quite a few times and have found that the staff were very helpful . As our room was not ready we stayed in the hospitality suite and were later treated to dinner, but it made for a tiring night after travelling. Bumping into Sheik Shidek (the services manager) the next day we explained what had happened and he treated us to a nice lunch which turned what could have been bad feeling into a very pleasant stay. We felt that were listened to and appreciated. We will definitely stay at the Fairmont again next time we are in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “One of a good hotels in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: pc752002
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and 1.5 yr old kid for 3 nights. I stayed in Fairmont room (lowest grade) but the receptionist gave me a high floor (north wing) so that I could see the Esplanade and part of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel. It tooks me 10-15 minutes to complete the check in process as my kid is waiting to have his lunch.....Hardware seems old in room and a Nespresso coffee machine appeared in my room only on the last day! Wifi was free at lobby area but not in room so many people browsing the internet at lobby area. Location is too good as it is connected to the Cityhall (or Esplanade as well) MRT station with a very good mall (Marketplace superstore also in there). One special point to be said was a big Barney doll is offered (lent) to my kid during breakfast time which is very warm. I have not much experience of staying in Singapore hotels, so can't compare it with others, but I think it's generally good and I will also recommend my friend to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Friendly Staff, Easy Access to Central Locations”
Reviews.Author: kaotic363
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a signature room and I was quite pleased and impressed with the room quality and interior. One can tell that this hotel has some age but it seemed pretty well maintained. The bed was very comfortable and I sleep well. I could not hear the street nice hardly at all. The only hang-up I had was that the Aircon unit seemed a bit loud but I have experienced this is several other Singapore hotels as well. I enjoyed my stay and would return again on another trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, big rooms - worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: Ajaxajs
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at fairmont 3 times till now! Though I like the hotel I think it needs to improve on a few things... 1) cleanliness of the rooms - the loo needs to be a bit cleaner, tub needs a spruce! Maybe it wasnt clean properly once during my stay. 2) the tine taken to check in is very long! I cud never check in in less than 15 mins... I think thats a bit too much. Rest it seems to be very good.. Breakfast is very nice, Prego is great!!! Dnt mind eaten at the poolside! though the variety is less.. Over all a good stay experience

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: bilka
Reviews.Content: The thing that sets the Fairmont Singapore out is the wonderful customer service. The staff are welcoming, friendly and helpfull. The rooms are large and comfortable. We had a wonderful view from our room and enjoyed the lights of the city at night. The hotel is part of the Raffles City complex and sits next to the MRT and opposite Raffles Hotel. Sightseeing was easy to access and shopping was a plenty. Lots of food outlets are near by.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Veronika_Cologne
Reviews.Content: Incredible service and excellent location. Connects to Raffles City shopping center and right opposite Raffles Hotel

Reviews.Title: “average hotel”
Reviews.Author: alice k
Reviews.Content: efficient check in. but there was a speck of dry menstrual blood on the toilet bowl. the staff did not do a gd job cleaning. the deluxe room is relatively small compared to swissotel superior. location - very strategically located, close to city hall mrt, small room but spacious bathroom, easy access to food and groceries. the front desk is professional and polite but unfriendly. check out took more than 10 minutes due to high volume of guest checking in. prefer swissotel to fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “luxury hotel offers superior service”
Reviews.Author: hinairh
Reviews.Content: In the city center And close to all activities Extension of a shopping mall Excellent staff And work for the convenience of guests

Reviews.Title: “WE'LL BE BACK”
Reviews.Author: BunnyPig1123
Reviews.Content: My husband and me have stayed in Fairmont Singapore from 03/Sep/2011 to 05/Sep/2011. The location is very good: City Hall MRT, supermarket, food court, bank, shopping mall are all within few minutes walk from the hotel; all located in the same building and the MRT entrance is connected via underground so I don't even have to step out of the building. There is free WIFI access in the lobby, just ask front office for the password. My hotel package was including breakfast, the breakfast buffet has a variety of foods (western, Indian, dim sum), and what I like the most is the fresh squeezed fruit juice: pineapple, watermelon, apple, pear, orange … There is one thing that made me unhappy is the bathtub. The drainage of the bathtub was not good, water could not flow away; it did not make any improvement after the repair. But I am satisfied with their prompt action. I left the room after I called the House Keeping at 10:30am abt the bathtub issue. When I came back at night, there was a voice mail from House Keeping (time 11:15am) advising me that they had sent somebody to fix the problem and asked me to contact them again if there was any further problems. In view of the convenient location and their service, I will consider to stay in Fairmont again.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: brooklyngurl
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 11pm and after 10 minutes of waiting on line to check in, we were told that our room wasn't ready. However, the front desk agent compensated this with free breakfast and a harbor view upgrade. We checked in well after midnight only to be brought to a room with a partial harbor view. Incredibly frustrating and after a call down to the front desk, we were finally brought to the correct room. The views were stunning, especially at night. We were able to see the Marina Bay Sands, the Singapore Eye and the Fullerton Bay Hotel. Aside from our room not being ready, we really didn't have any complaints about the hotel. Our room was clean and the beds were comfy. It is centrally located - the subway is just downstairs and it is attached to a shopping mall (one of many in Singapore). There is a Din Tai Fung downstairs which we got as take out one night rather than wait on their long lines. There is also a supermarket downstairs where you can purchase snacks and drinks. We walked to many of the attractions including the Singapore Eye, Marina Bay Sands hotel (a bit of a hike) and Chinatown. Go to the Maxwell Food Center - good, cheap, quality eating!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: AndrewEC1
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Fairmont Singapore at least twice a year since 2008, the service is excellent and you are truly made to feel welcome. You wil have to stay at the property to see and feel the quality and level of service. I can recommend any of the treatments at the Willow Stream Spa.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service to match!”
Reviews.Author: Gbabigurl84
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just completed a 1-week stay at the Fairmont in Singapore. The previous week he had stayed at the Ritz Carlton so we were somewhat sad to switch but The Fairmont did not disappoint. First, the location can not be beat. You're in the heart of the downtown/Marina area with an easy walk to museums, Raffles Landing, Boat Quay, Merlion statue, shopping etc. I even walked to Little India which wasn't terribly bad minus the weather. There's never any issue getting a taxi and the Fairmont always has at least 3 people outside ready to help you with bags, greet you, or simply ask about your day. Hotel is also connected to Raffles City shopping mall which has a pretty good food court, not overly crowded, and some great options for breakfast alternatives (must try J CO donuts!). We did upgrade our room from the standard to have a bit more room and it was quite large. We had two balconies, stand up shower w/ separate bathtub and plenty of space to want to spend time in the room. The housekeeping service (including turndown) was immaculate. My only minor complaint is that if you did not turn off the do not disturb sign before 10AM, you may need to wait until late afternoon to have the room cleaned. This happened twice, maybe some of my fault for getting a late start, but it kind of made you have to leave the room later in the afternoon so they can clean. We also used the pool, spa and had the breakfast buffet. Not a huge buffet fan, but this really a step above. Mainly western foods, but they did always have some dim sum or Indian offerings plus plenty of fresh fruit, juices, and yogurts. Pool area is quite large with two circular pools, one more designated for children which is a plus. Spa is quite large and I must say the service you get just from using the facilities is top-notch. I do recommend getting a treatment though as it was well worth the money ($275 for almost 3 hours).

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: greynomad16
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights on the Executive Club floor. The rooms are spacious and we had a wonderful view of the Marina Bay Sands. Good location - able to walk to Marina Bay Sands and Orchid Road and it is across the road from Raffles. Staff were friendly and efficient. We enjoyed the selection of food on the Club floor and ate here every night.

Reviews.Title: “Good but can be improved”
Reviews.Author: samuelp82
Reviews.Content: It is a nice hotel but a few things can be improved. 1st, they should be able to accomodate customers who want a late check out of 1 to 2 hours. The other thing is that the hotel can do more on security as the lifts can be accessed by anyone thus safety is a little compromised. There is also no car park for self park.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: Kebuh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel on numerous occasions but only just realised I had never posted a review. The Fairmont in Singapore is the old Westin Hotel and directly opposite the road from the venerable Raffles and next door to the Swissotel. Its located on Bras Basah Road which connects to the ever popular Orchard Road. Its too far to walk to Orchard Road but there is a Mass Rapid Transport (MRT) station just next to the Fairmont in a shopping complex called Raffles Place (City Hall Station). Those who have read my reviews in the past will realise that as a smoker, I am partial to Hotels with balconies. Every room at the Fairmont has a balcony overlooking whichever of the four sides your room faces. Being above the City Hall Station, you're either two stops away from Marina Bay (where the new Sands Casino is located) or to Orchard Road (the shopping mecca of Singapore). I've stayed here in the past when attending the F1 Grand Prix and the location can't be beat. Checking in was a breeze and extremely efficient. Got a very good internet rate but this was probably why I was allocated one of the older rooms just one floor above the swimming pool. Having said that, the Hotel has very well constructed balcony doors that cut out any sound from outside. Have stayed here previously on the higher executive floors and the rooms were much nicer. Cant fault the bathroom amenities in the room and the rain shower in the bathroom was great. As in all Fairmonts I have stayed in, the bed was extremely comfortable and TV channel selection still remains one of the best in Singapore. My only negative comment with the Hotel is the lack of wifi connectivity in the room and lobby. In the past when I have stayed at the Hotel, I got around this by using the wifi at the executive lounge. But this time, as it was a holiday, did not bother paying the premium for an executive floor and ended up not having internet access for three days. There is complimentary cable internet access in the room which I couldn't use with my iphone 4 nor ipad. Would definitely recommend this Hotel. Worth noting that within a 10 minute walking radius of the Hotel there are numerous local restaurants in addition to the food court below the Hotel at Raffles Place.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service”
Reviews.Author: GianMariaZ
Reviews.Content: Value for money definitely inadequate. I believe that the quality of a structure turns out to be the exceptions and anomalies. In my room the current was interrupted and had to wait over an hour because someone comes along and the response of the telephone operator was very inking and rude. Even on arrival at registration I had to wait twenty minutes for the room, which was not booked. The hotel is in a pretty good location, good breakfast buffet, very comfortable the bed, despite there was all night a disturbing light by the wall without possibility to switch off.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely place!!”
Reviews.Author: ssrs123
Reviews.Content: Fairmont I have been to many brilliant hotels but I have to say that this was one of my favourite! The rooms were lush and service was impeccable. My husband and I visited Singapore for the first time as a stopover on our honey moon, and when we mentioned this to the staff, they could not do enough for us. The hotel is situated about 15 minutes walk from Orchid Road, and a  short taxi ride from the night safari, Clarke Quay and Sentosa Island.  The hotel itself is very grand, and has a nice pool, but the best thing about this hotel is the spa. Whilst there, my husband treated himself to a massage, and I treated myself to the best facial I have ever had!! The price is high but worth every penny! They create a lovely atmosphere and the small touches such as the warm towels and ginger tea made all the difference. The only tiny downside is that they try to sell you all of their products afterwards. We were also impressed with the room service. They bring in a table and napkins and make it into a grand dining experience. The food was lovely and the waiting staff always smiling and willing to help.  Overall, this hotel was great and I would love to go and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: MrsProcrastinator
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel had not allocated the correct room, they sorted it out quickly, and the rest of our stay went very smoothly. The desk staff are great if you want to plan trips - they seemed to be able to sort out anything we asked. The breakfast is fantastic, we went to the Alligator Pear by the pool for breakfast every day. We went as part of a large group, and we were all delighted with the hotel, especially the pool. The hotel is central to everything in Singapore, and we had amazing views from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: CCHSingapore
Reviews.Content: I was thumbing through the recent reviews prior to posting this review and I was surprised by what I read. On the contrary, I had the most wonderful stay in an excellently-located hotel. Situated in close proximity to the underground station, it was convenient to where I had to go for work. I also experiened exceptionally wonderful service from the manager I happened to speak with one evening. I noticed a rather sharp-looking gentleman in a suit in the lobby and approached him, just to let him know what a wonderful stay it has been thus far. By chance, he asked when I would be celebrating my birthday. I then mentioned that one of the days during this stay happens to fall on my birthday. To my lovely surprise, I received a surprise gift from the hotel with a personalized birthday card from the said manager. What else can I ask for? Although I did not except it, as all I wanted was a nice comfortable room, it was indeed a lovely touch from this gentleman. For the bad reviews that have written, I want to point out that nobody's perfect and services lapses may happen. As a frequent traveller, I have experiened the best and the worst. Fairmont Singapore is definitely comparable to some top-end hotel I have stayed. I highly recommend that if you are celebrating an occasion during your stay with them, write to them prior to your arrival. I am most certain that the hotel will surprise you!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay ...... will be the Natural Choice again!”
Reviews.Author: Syed27
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Fairmont for the 2nd time in August 2011 for 5 nights. I booked a Signature Room under the seasonal offer and was plesantly surprised when walked into the room. Considering the room sizes in Singapore, it was a luxury - it came with a 4 seater sofa, a study table, two balconies and still enough space to comfortably move. My request for an extra bed was happily accepted without any extra charge. As Fairmont President Club member, the broadband internet was free. Our two children enjoyed the stay thoroughly and surely we would stay back again. Like the first time, we were quite pleased with the service and the attitude of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, just make sure they get your reservation right”
Reviews.Author: roberto_jose_10
Reviews.Content: This is really an excellent hotel, on par with the better hotels in Singapore (which is saying a lot), but they made a critical mistake on my reservation which cost me some significant comfort. I got there at 2 AM after a 24 hour flight sequence, only to discover that there had been a mix-up and the non-smoking room i requested online was not available. i probably should have put up more of a fight, but I had meetings in the AM and just wanted to get to bed, so i accepted the smoking room for one night. Of course, they moved me the next day, but I felt terrible all day after sleeping in that room, and I don't think it was the jet lag. I stayed a total of 3 nights and things were fine once I was moved, but the poor sleeping experience really set me back. The only other disappointment was that there were a few messages left for me at the desk and while my lamp on my room phone was lit appropriately, it took 6 calls to the desk to retrieve the messages. I would probably stay here again, but I would make sure first that I called the hotel directly, confirmed that I was getting a non-smoking room, and got someone's name tied to it. I would also make sure my local contacts had my mobile phone number.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed staying here”
Reviews.Author: sos22222
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and good quality. Location is very good to reach fancy downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Fairmont Standard - Stay away if you have kids”
Reviews.Author: Mulliganm
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel frequently with our two young children and have enjoyed staying a quite a few Fairmont. We were on a trip that included a few days in Singapore and decided to stay at the Fairmont. Unfortunately the Fairmont Singapore didn’t live up to our high expectations. I had booked directly with Fairmont four months prior to our stay and had a reservation, confirmed in writing, for a particular category of suite that included a separate bedroom, living room with couch (as we have two young children) and an eating area. After checking in we got our or room to discover that we were in a junior suite with two single beds and no separate living room or pull out couch. The experience trying to get us moved to the category of suite we had reserved was completely exasperating and ultimately unsuccessful. I was provided a series of excuses and explanations by the manger on duty that were simply confabulation. At first I was told that there was only one suite in the hotel of the category I had reserved and that because another guest had decided to stay longer it was not available. When I pointed out that the hotel web site described several suites of the type I had reserved I was that there were, in fact, four suite of the category but they were all unavailable as guests on extended stays were using all of them. I was then told that because of the rate I had booked the category of suite was only a request. When I showed the manager the reservation confirmation I was told that it was a mistake by their reservations department, the hotel was full, and that it would not be honored. After several hours we were moved to a suite several categories below, and less than half the size, of the one which we had reserved. It had two queen-sized beds so everyone was able to sleep, however, the bottom line is that the hotel simply could not honor their own reservation. We were sent a fruit bowl and card apologizing for the problem with the reservation. While a far cry from what we had reserved, the room we wound up in did have an excellent view and a spacious bathroom. The beds were comfortable and the cleaning staff kept everything spotless. When traveling with kids we often book rooms with access to hotel lounges that supply breakfast and snacks as we find that easier than going out to a restaurant. With Fairmont this is often associated with Fairmont Gold floors, however, at the Singapore hotel access to the lounge is included with a suite booking. The staff at the Singapore lounge was generally helpful and quick to offer you a drink when you arrived. Unfortunately, and contrary to all of our previous experiences, we were made to feel unwelcome with our kids. On the second day of our stay, we were having breakfast and my three year old ran over to me while I was getting a glass of orange juice. A grim faced employee came over to me and said, “Please prevent your child from running.” We are attentive parents and actively attempt to ensure our kids are not disturbing other guests. I’m not sure how a 3-year-old running 15 feet to his father would disturb anyone. The next evening, we attended the lounge for an evening snack and the employee at the door announced that they had an apparently new policy preventing children from using the lounge. I told her this was news to me, contrary to all previous experiences with Fairmont lounges, and that we had been using the lounge for the past two days with our kids without any mention of such a policy. She relented and said go ahead but we were made to feel utterly unwelcome. Depending on your perspective revenge was either theirs or ours when my son was served a glass of milk that had gone off and he became ill. My wife felt so uncomfortable with the lounge experience she didn’t attend again for the balance of our stay. I brought breakfast to our room from the shopping mall attached to the hotel for the next two mornings. On the upside, my wife had a pedicure at the hotel spa and reports that it was an enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great place and wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: docbarb46
Reviews.Content: We checked in at fairmont last Aug 17 and stayed up to Aug 21. We were greeted by their excellent staff from the time we were admitted and my children were given crayons and coloring books while we were waiting for our rooms. We booked for a signature room via Agoda (which is also very efficient and a great money saver). They have upgraded us to an executive room at the 24th floor for no extra charge because they know that it is the birthday of my wife. The location is very friendly and great because of the mrt and raffles city plaza which has connecting rooms. The room and bathroom was great but the most fantastic and what really made our stay is the excellent staff. From the booking of our tours to even the most simple requests was granted immediately. We got value for our money and got even more than we wished for. Thank you fairmont hotel for our wonderful stay and when we return to Singapore we will definitely stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Rather a tired room”
Reviews.Author: LondonGenie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before and it was very nice. A few years ago the advice was to stay in the south tower as the north one is un-renovated. Maybe true, as this trip the room was worn and disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Alex168
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights last week. Our first impression upon entering the hotel was good, the lobby was impressive and grand. However, it went downhill from there as the staff at check in was a confused lady who appeared not to know the details of our booking (my sister booked it for us using her AMEX privileges) and she insisted on charging us $900 although our stay costs $600. She was unclear that she was taking our card to charge it rather than just taking an imprint as is normal hotel practice. It took us 4 separate conversations to try to resolve thIs after we discovered they had debited our account and sad to say this has still not been resolved a week later. Additionally they were also holding a deposit on my sister's account. I was unimpressed by the unprofessional service of the front of house staff and this did not reflect well on a 5 star hotel. We had booked a Signature room which was good if a little tired. No complaints except that housekeeping left a cleaning cloth by our bed one day. Overall it was an average experience and for the price we paid it was reasonable. I look forward to getting our deposit back at some point.....

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay at the Fairmont!”
Reviews.Author: Sgsk1978
Reviews.Content: We travelled with 2 children in tow, age 6 and 2. Upon checking in, the children were provided with colouring books and crayons. They absolutely loved the attention. It was a lovely surprise. The view from the room was fantastic. We could see the bay and partial view of the Flyer. The room was spacious enough for the kids to run around. And most of all, the location. Right on top of great shopping and food, easy walking distance to major sights and being on a subway stop links us to everywhere. Loved everything!

Reviews.Title: “Nice view, good location!”
Reviews.Author: Comaxco
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, Raffles Mall, directly accdessible from the hotel. Good breakfast and the Raffles Long Bar is right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and they catered for our early arrival”
Reviews.Author: Clea700
Reviews.Content: Our flight from Greece landed at 5am so we got to the hotel very early. Unfortunately they didn't have a room available straight away as they were at capacity but they had a lounge room area that we could stay in which had a TV, toilet and coffee and tea facilities so at least we could chill out somewhere as the shops don't open until 10am. They informed us that at 7am we could use the shower facilities in the spa area which was very much appreciated after a long flight! After showering and changing we went to Orchard road to try to find a coffee shop to wake us up. We were very, very grateful when they called us at 9:30am to tell us that our room was now available as we'd been going for almost 24 hours with no sleep! The room was huge, the king size bed was very comfortable and they had electronic blackout curtains so we were able to sleep for a few hours in the day. The staff were all very friendly and the hotel is located right near Raffles and a shopping mall. Taxi's into Orchard road are fairly cheap (no more than SIN $10 each way) I'd stay here again - especially as we booked online with the hotel and got a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ChanML
Reviews.Content: Great service from the staff. They try their best to make your stay comfortable. Location is another key sellig point with lots of food outlets all around, MRT station just next to it and big shopping mall adjacent. Just 5 mins walk and you are at the Suntec Convention Centre. You can also take a nice stroll in the evenings, beautiful sight and never short of malls and restaurants around the area. Raffles Hotel is just across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Unremarkable Property”
Reviews.Author: jdr27
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Singapore is a good hotel, not a great hotel and far from a true five star in my opinion. It is a solid four star, possibly a weak 4.5 star but lacks several important things to be a luxury hotel. The rooms themselves are spacious and the bed was quite comfortable. We did find the rooms a bit worn around the edges though, and there was excessive traffic noise (on the 16th floor) due to windows that were clearly not double glazed. We heard cars, busses, trucks, etc rolling by all night. The bathroom was also poorly designed with only one sink (really need a double sink to be considered a five star in my humble opinion) , toilet awkwardly jammed in between the shower and tub, and the shower itself was difficult to operate because of excessive wear and tear (loose parts dangling that couldn't be fixed). The hotel is big (500+ rooms), busy and also a bit of an eyesore - can't imagine what design person dreamed up the exterior color scheme and largely dysfunctional balconies was thinking. All told, when combined with an excessive SGD28/day charge for non-wireless internet service in the room I would not return on my next visit to Singapore. On the positive side, we found the staff (particularly the concierges and doormen) to be extremely friendly, helpful and kind, which helped make our stay a bit better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelbug200
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont Hotel twice within a two week period. On both occasions, the rooms were immaculate and the service impeccable. On the first stay we arrived after 24 hours of traveling. We arrived at 6:00 AM. Our room was ready. We were given all the requested items with excellent serivce. The view from our hotel was great. On the second visit, our view was great as well. We looked down on the CHIMES plaza across the street and beyond. Would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Tired rooms but staff more than made up for it”
Reviews.Author: zerogeewhiz
Reviews.Content: I'll get the negative stuff out of the way first. For nearly four hundred (!) Singapore dollars a night, I expect free internet. I get it free at places far less expensive in less, shall we say, modern cities. The internet was S$30 per day and wasn't even wireless. This is 2011. Right. On with the show. The rooms are, and look, old but everything works and if it doesn't (my safe didn't), a swarm of staff hit the room and fix it straight away. I think I got lucky and scored a large corner room with a view over the park on one side and a view of the city, over the roof of the gorgeous colonial Raffles. The hotel is one of the triple pillared tall hotels built in the 90s that also used to be the twin Westins (now Stamford and Swissotel). I really like the location as it sits on the City Hall MRT but if you're up for a walk, you can get to Orchard Road, the business district (including the delightfully dilapidated Lau Pa Sat) and all the new restaurants and cafes popping up around the place. The real stand out of the Fairmont is the staff - from the door to the person who looks after the floor your room is on, there's always a smile and a hello, offers of help and generous laughs. I've not had a great experience of hotel staff in Singapore over the years - I find them officious or painfully slow - but the Fairmont seems to have something sorted. For those who don't want to go hunting, there's a Lavazza pod espresso machine in the room (I did not partake), plenty of bottled water and a very clean experience all round. If you're doing more than just stopping over for the night in Singapore and you're heading in to the city, the Fairmont is a terrific place if you're not desperate to try out the funky new boutique hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Return visit and will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: LotusEaterNewZealand
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had a stopover in Singapore and spent a night at The Fairmont. We chose the hotel because we'd stayed ther before, and were not disappointed with our decision. The hotel is in a good location, across from Raffles, has a very well-equipped gym, excellent spa, good range of restaurants and well-appointed rooms. Having stayed at the hotel several times, I would say that the service is of a consistently high standard and would recommend this hotel. It is particularly suited to a stopover as everything you'd need to recover from a long flight is on your doorstep. I have found the "travel recovery" massage very beneficial and being able to relax in the spa and use the sauna, steam room and spa pool is a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Great - but 1 huge downside as far as I'm concerned!”
Reviews.Author: MIWSing
Reviews.Content: We've very very familiar with Singapore - lived there, worked there and now travel there frequently. When a deal came up at SGD 208 per night from the hotel directly, it was a no brainer to book a room there for a business trip - in fact we booked 2 rooms for 4 nights. The hotel couldn't be in a more convenient location, above an MRT (train station), next to a huge shopping complex and with many food options close by. It has huge classic rooms, big well-equipped rooms and lots of nice 5 star touches. However they charge $28 per day for the internet or $170 a week - (or a monthly fee). This is ludicrous in a place like Singapore so whatever rate you see the hotel at, add $30 to the room price if you're planning to use the internet. Even though we were on business, we decided to take advantage of the free internet at Starbucks nearby. Most hotels in Singapore offer free wifi so having to pay nearly $30 a day when in most coffee shops it's free, is just a rip-off in my opinion. It's the sort of thing that makes me so angry and they probably won't get our repeat business because of it. I also asked for a safety pin in the foyer and waited 20 mins and they still couldn't manage to get me one. I left for a meeting and came back 2 hours later and they still hadn't be able to locate a safety pin for me. You'd think at a 5 star hotel this sort of request wouldn't be such a problem!

Reviews.Title: “Panoramic view of the city”
Reviews.Author: Jasin3267
Reviews.Content: Fairmont Hotel Singapore is one of the tallest hotels in Asia. So, it has a panoramic view of the city skyline and the islands beyond. The hotel is centrally located with easy access to the MRT (subway), shopping malls and places of interests. The hotel also has great facilities including many restaurants, gym, spa, swimming pools, etc. Hotel room is spacious and clean. A true 5-star hotel with excellent service. The only minus is no free parking for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service for a Great Anniversary Holiday”
Reviews.Author: PakRoti
Reviews.Content: The service at the Fairmount in Singapore really exceeded our expectations. Typically, I really don't like to stay in a 5 star hotel because it is usually such poor value for service. However, our stay at the Fairmount was really fantastic from the moment we arrived to departure. Rooms were really perfect (we stayed on the 21st floor in a king room overlooking raffles) with really nice touches such as a bath tub and perhaps the best shower I have ever experienced. The bed was luxurious and comfortable. Our room was in the tower that is sort of round, so the room had this interesting shape to it as well. The staff truly went out of their way to make you feel welcome and taken care of. I especially enjoyed the two old doormen that were stationed at the passageway to Raffles City - they were really nice fellows. The pool was nice as well, but get there before about 3:30 p.m. as the sun start to get shaded from the surrounding buildings. The only just slight complaint I have is with regards to upon my arrival being told that I would get a room with a double instead of a king as stated on my reservation. I am sure that the fine print on my reservation from Hotels.com does indeed state that the hotel has the right to give you whatever room they feel like, despite what it says you will get in large letters on the reservations. However, when I make a booking for my anniversary/ holiday with my beautiful wife, nothing but a king will do - as stated on my reservation. In any case, Angela Yip at the front counter made it all good after all and "upgraded" our room to a king. I have not complaints about Angela, as she was just doing her job, in fact she went out of her way to be nice and make us feel taken care of. In the end, after the small inconvenience upon arrival, our stay was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SueM8
Reviews.Content: Hotel great and large room and clean.Lovely pool area. Close to shops and MRT which is just a great transport system and so cheap.Remember to get money back on card when end of journey.

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: conversant001
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife and five year old daughter for one night in a deluxe room bay facing high floor in the south tower. The room was of good size with an amazing view of Singapore bay. The property is ideally located for stay in Singapore above Raffles city mall.Before checking in had asked for a extra bed for my daughter to sleep in. Everything was great until at night my daughter got up crying and was scratching herself vigorously. Her whole body was full of bug marks. We put a lotion to her and put her to sleep in our bed. As we had to catch an early morning flight was not able to lodge a compliant with the hotel. Before the night episode i even tried to book the same room for my return to Singapore in a few days time but was told that the hotel was fully booked for those those dates. Boy am i glad they were booked. DO NOT ask for a spare bed. Better look at other hotels in Singapore if not be prepared for BED BUGS.

Reviews.Title: “I was well looked after”
Reviews.Author: DurbanGal
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a business trip and it was good. Staff are very professional and helpful. I enjoyed having breakfast by the pool but not a good idea on the weekend as it is taken over by expats with kids and is not as peaceful as the weekdays. Free Internet only in the Lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional location, service and room”
Reviews.Author: KCsMom
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the 24th floor overlooking the city (small balcony off every room), with views of the Flyer and Raffles hotel next door. Spacious bedroom and bathroom, hi-tech a/v including relaxing CD, great magazines for reading, remote-controlled everything including the curtains, and 1-button push coffee maker. Nice pool and fitness center. Great location with easy access to all of Singapore. The service and concierge were exceptional throughout the hotel. The only room for improvement that we encountered was the service and food quality at the poolside restaurant which we tried twice, but would not recommend. The hotel breakfast buffet was delicious but pricey ($91 Singapore dollars for two), so try to get a rate that includes free breakfast. We can't wait to return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for business or shopping trip”
Reviews.Author: Hillybnz
Reviews.Content: Busy hotel right on top of city hall met. Check in fast and efficient, room had great view and all the facilities expected. Nice large bathroom and very comfortable bed. Pool area nice but crowded in afternoon, still managed to find loungers though. Easy access to everywhere in Singapore via mrt. Breakfast was excellent. Would definitely choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good and great”
Reviews.Author: Mesmar
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed very much my stay in this hotel... it's very conveniently located right in front of the legendary Raffles Hotel, the staff is very professional and the rooms are clean and large.. Add to this a fabulous breakfast place and dear to my heart,a direct connection to the Raffles City shopping center with many restaurants among which the non less legendary taiwanese-born Din Tai Fung and their amazing dumplings!!... What else does a man need?... I forgot to mention that i paid something like 245 SGD a night which is not cheap but not that expensive either for this type of standard.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Singapore...”
Reviews.Author: keithfitz
Reviews.Content: I spend roughly 100 hotel nights per year in Singapore (and I lived here for more than 10 years, so I know the place quite well). While I stay in many different hotels in Singapore, sometimes due to locations of events and meetings, other times due to availability or special deals, the Fairmont remains my favorite hotel in Singapore...Yes...#1.
