It's a true 5-star, and while it might not be iconic, it is the best-run hotel in Singapore (in fact, Fairmont seems to be the best-run hotel chain in the world). They really do get the whole customer service thing right. The competence of the staff is second-to-none. Their facilities are top-notch. And the hotel is great value -- especially if you join their "Presidents' Club" loyalty program Even if you don't travel a lot, it's worth joining, because benefits (especially good rates) begin almost immediately. And, if you fill-out your profile, booking online and having things "your way" on arrival is quite easy. In my opinion, this hotel is the best value stay in all of Singapore. The location couldn't be better (right in the city, on top of a central MRT -- subway -- stop). And, please trust me on this...There are two wonderful door-men, who split shift at the door by the Prego restaurant and the entrance from the hotel into Raffles City shopping mall, Ismail and Victor. Chat with them. They know all you would need to know about the city, and they are two of the nicest, most pleasant human beings you'll find in all of Singapore. They represent what's best about the Fairmont, and they truly make you feel welcome. The rooms are well-designed, clean, and comfortable. The restaurants are great, though the breakfast buffet is quite pricey. Plenty of options downstairs in the shopping center attached to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: Flowertot_9
Reviews.Content: Had 2 nights here on our way to Oz and were very pleased with it! Was initially surprised at room as the family room only had 2 x queen size beds for 4 of us, but they quickly gave us a roll away bed at no extra cost! Room service was very reasonable and tasted fab!

Reviews.Title: “Well organised and maintained hotel with Good shopping”
Reviews.Author: padmavathidevi
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3nights for a conference in raffles centre .surprisingly don't see any one in hotel blocks except inmates and a call to telephone exchange solves all your quaries. Security is well taken care inspite of so many people in the shopping area. .hospitality at reception and at dining are very good my room has fantastic view of marina bay and swimming pool.food is good and rooms are quite with comfortable beds.free net available no WIFI for my I pad. Went all round singapore for shopping and found raffles city has all branded shops and it's waste going beyond this centre.we went by walk to all tourist places around

Reviews.Title: “Sadly not a real 5*”
Reviews.Author: CalvinL88
Reviews.Content: I was recommended to stay at the Fairmont by colleagues. What a disappointment. My room had dirty carpet,very old furniture and antique bathroom fixtures. The internet access, both dial up and wireless, was never available in my room, and the supposed free wireless in the lobby never worked if I tried to log on. To top it all off, the staff at the front desk was unethical. I discovered that my colleagues had much nicer rooms, and when I asked for a room change, they said I had reserved my room under the "lesser" rate, I had to show her the internet booking which I made for the both of us. Get your facts straight before you want to lie to your own customer. Save your money and stay at one of the other fine hotels in Singapore. It is cheaper to stay at the swisshotel in the same compound.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Kawamoto
Reviews.Content: Honeymoon trip. Definitely had a memorable stay with the hotel, in fact it was the best stay ever especially because of the staffs who are exceptionally kind, caring and never forget smiles. Felt very safe, and felt home. Very clean, very refreshing smell and great view from the room, and easy access to many tourism spots, but above of all, just loved the people working there. Proudly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: juliababy
Reviews.Content: Service in this hotel is fantastic. I can highly recommend Prego restaurant -their breakfast is lovely with lots of choice and the Italian food at dinner is really good. I had broadband access in my room via cable and it was very fast. The swimming pools are very popular with plenty of loungers. The Willow Spa offers a great range of treatments and the therapist I had was expert at her job.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the price”
Reviews.Author: kolbstergurl
Reviews.Content: At first we were hesitant to stay at a more pricey hotel given that we wouldn't be spending much time in it, but BOY were we happy that we did! Being situated right next to the MRT and the Raffles City Shopping Mall made vacationing in Singapore that much easier. Additionally, coming "home" from a long day of sightseeing and shopping to soft classical music permeating throughout the room from a Bose system was icing on the cake! Employees were very friendly and professional. Would definitely look to staying there again should I ever return to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “friendly business hotel”
Reviews.Author: basaa
Reviews.Content: The driver failed to pick me up at the airport, probably he was loitering. I took a taxi to the hotel. I was told at 9 PM (when I reached there) my room will be available only after midnight. That's when lost my cool and my piece of my mind to the sponsor. The machine was put on motion and I was given a special room in no time with an apology note from the staff. This was topped with a nice bottle of red wine and chocolates. Oh, it certainly melted my heart! It's a good business hotel as the convention center and other amenities are close by. The room was nice. The hotel charged only S$ 30.00 for my guest breakfast in place of regular S$50.00, at least I was told so.

Reviews.Title: “Raffles tower hotel aka Swissotel Stamford. Now Fairmont Singapore”
Reviews.Author: srikrishnak
Reviews.Content: It's the same old building but Fairmont certainly brought quite good improvements for standards. Also realized some of the rooms (deluxe) were upgraded. This hotel once was the tallest hotel in the world, and if you are not scared of heights then this is one of the good choice in Sinapore. Location is perhaps the best, and its right on top of the City Hall MRT and next to Suntec City. So if you are here for business then your destination may be less than 10 min. If you want to enjoy in shopping then again its the same time for you to reach the shopping belt in Orchard. The new tourist attractions (The RWS & MBS) are pretty close too and you can just take a bus from beach road to reach them. There is lots of options for food within the complex as well as near by and if you want to enjoy 24 hours food, then just a stroll across the road you can enjoy the kopitiams near SMU as well as some late night places in Chijmes. Facilities are not great as this place is not the newest in town and doesn't offer any 'unique' stuff like MBS or RWS.

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional behavior”
Reviews.Author: Kura2011
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff created unprofessional behavior for me. I have booked a room from17th-July to 23rd-July 2011 via Booking.com , but Fairmont Singapore booked a room for me until 22nd-July. after long long negotiation with my confirmation e-mail, finally I could stayed at same room which I have stayed since 17th-July. No apologizing from a front desk lady after all. Additionally a big surprise, when I checked out on 23rd-July, they charged S$390++ to me for Friday night even as my confirmation told me it was 340++ for last night. Eventually I could stayed at this hotel with condition of my confirmation e-mail, but I felt so bad because I spent a lot of time to resolve a problem and I couldn't buy something at Changi airport. What the hell happened to this hotel? So disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit did not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: annemarienz
Reviews.Content: We have been dreaming about returning to the Fairmont since our first visit in 2009 and it did not disappoint. While we were slightly concerned that it wouldn't live up to our memories of the first visit and may have dated in the intervening period, the rooms were exactly as we remembered and the staff as friendly as before - the doorman even paid our cab fare from the airport and helped us find somewhere to get cash when the airport ATM was down and the taxi driver couldn't process our visa. The location of this hotel really makes it the perfect spot for relaxing and enjoying what Singapore has to offer. Really can't imagine staying anywhere else when visiting Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else in Singapore?”
Reviews.Author: alphalau
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay at the Fairmont, with which my company has a corporate rate. Previous personal stays in Singapore (no corporate rate for our company) were at the Fullerton and the Raffles Hotel. To be brief: Rooms are not luxurious but clean and suitably decorated. Beds are very comfortable, one of the best ones I have slept on other than the Westin heavenly beds. Excellent location. Value for money. Effcient and friendly service. Right above a MRT station, taxi stand (at Stamford), mall, suoermarket. Tip: book early and ask for a South Tower room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Family-Friendly Visit...... at Fairmont Singapore”
Reviews.Author: dzj744
Reviews.Content: Just had another 2 amazing days at the Fairmont Hotel in Singapore, with my wife and 2 young daughters. This time we tried a Harbour view room located in the South tower. The room was exquisite – 2 incredibly comfortable double beds that suited my family of 4 perfectly. The view from the room was priceless. The room had a very contemporary feel, very modern and I particularly liked the tropical rain shower. We managed to make breakfast one morning by the Alligator Pear pool. It was a sumptuous buffet with all the tropical fruit in the world, great cereals, fresh bread and pastries – everything we desired – and a lot more – including Western and Asian hot food. When the children had finished breakfast, they went and swam, and left us to finish off their relaxing breakfast – in full view of us. Finally, the staff could not have been more helpful and made us feel special at all times. As per my previous visits, the Resident Services Manager, Mr Shidek, couldn’t have been more onside or accommodating of a few special requests we had made. Again, I cannot rate my stay highly enough – from beginning to end it was perfection!

Reviews.Title: “"Great Location and Fantastic Staff"”
Reviews.Author: restaurantgirl_9
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from another fantastic stay at the Fairmont with my husband, son and his friend. It definitely has the best location of any hotel in Singapore. I (and my husband and adult children) always stay here when in Singapore and always have a executive club room. They are well worth the extra money as they include breakfast and evening drinks (including french champagne) and food. Plus refreshments and snacks during the day. However apart from being a great hotel the main reason we always return here is the staff. They are all fantastic and go out of their way to do anything they can to ensure our visit is a memorable one. Roslee who is the Executive Club Manager is delightful, professional and helpful. So are all the other staff. Manolo-thanks for looking for my lipstick, it is always lovely to see you again. My thanks to Apple, Jacqueline, Elena and all the others on the Executive Floor. As to the review by someone in June about the Executive Club Staff being rude, unfriendly and stuffy. I think maybe they were having a bad day because in all the visits I have had there I have NEVER encountered any staff member being rude etc... I would like to say thank you to George in Prego, he always has a welcoming smile. Also "obrigada" to Miguel in Prego. And of course who can forget the doorman Ismail who is always there with a smile and a greeting. We have recommended this hotel to many friends and the feedback we always get is how friendly and welcoming the staff are. So a big thank you to everyone for another great stay and I will be back in November with my daughter. Can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel, 3 star service”
Reviews.Author: lwk-my
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Fairmont Singapore for 5 nights in early July. I checked in at 9pm (off peak) but the process was slow and laboured. There was only another guest checking in at that time. Generally I have found the front desk staff unfriendly, unaccomodating and not helpful. It seems that no and cannot are their standard replies. Other hotel personnel are a lot more friendly and helpful. Though they have many F&B outlets, they serve the same food everyday with NO menu variation. This is especially so during breakfast. If you need food, it may be a better idea to eat outside the hotel as they are many food outlets in the shopping mall next to the hotel. Room is spacious and clean but mattress and pillows are far too soft for my liking. Internet service in the room is chargeable at S$28/day but WiFi is available in the hotel lobby. As I was there on business, I had the opportunity to evaluate their conference and banquet facility. We used a few rooms as our break-out rooms. During one of the break-out session, we brought food into the room. When we left, we left the unfinished food behind. The next day, when we went back to the break-out room, surprisingly the left-over food were still in the room for 2 consecutive days!!! Overall not impressed as hotel doesn't deliver value for money. I don't think I will stay in this hotel in future as there are many others in the vicinity with better service and value

Reviews.Title: “Stay here it is fantastic particularly if you get it at a bargain price.”
Reviews.Author: happyinoz
Reviews.Content: A very good location just above the Raffles City Centre. We loved this hotel. Free internet by joining the Fairmont President's Club (free) prior to travel on their website. We did this as a mystery deal and paid $240 Singapore Dollars which was cheaper than usual. Singapore is expensive, we walked down to the river where we found a fairly inexpensive meal. Loved this hotel, the service and the wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent hotel, world class.”
Reviews.Author: gooz
Reviews.Content: From the moment our taxi arrived we knew we were in for a quality experience. Three staff to greet us ,open the doors and collect the luggage. Then shown across the beautiful forecourt to be ushered inside by a venerable Indian doorman dressed in golden robes and headdress. Entering the huge beautiful lobby we were then escorted by a lovely young lady passed the towering flower arrangements over to the reception desk where we were offered chilled pineapple juice. All this before we had even checked in.!!! The very friendly and efficient receptionist then offered us an upgrade to a suite.WOW!!We were then escorted by yet another immaculately clad staff member to our suite..There he showed us how to work all the electrics including the huge blinds overlooking the two balconies ,the 42 inch TV and also the coffee machine .He informed us if we needed anything to just call and extra supplies or anything we needed would be provided. The suite was one of the most beautiful rooms i have ever stayed in ,the bed absolutely heavenly, amazing views, huge bathtub,and everything spotlessly clean. Another nice touch I haven't seen before was the party pack they provide. For a small charge glasses ,ice ,nibbles and mixers are provided for entertaining your guests. We also enjoyed a great breakfast by the pool which was an enjoyable experience. Altogether an amazing hotel, totally faultless,exceptional service from immaculately dressed friendly staff. Perhaps the most amazing aspect of our two night stay was that we had booked it as a mystery Wotif deal and a great price. Now we have sampled the Fairmont we will definitely be using the Fairmont hotel again. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “買い物に、観光に、癒しに”
Reviews.Author: 777jas
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the good place because of the connection of the big shopping mall. It was amazing to see several beautiful flowers arranged at the reception. Those flowers made me quite relaxed when I saw them after I was exhausted through walking and shopping in the center of Singapore. When it comes to the room, it is large enough to feel relaxed with a soft bed and comfortable space. Unfortunately one of the staff members didn't have courtesy when we checked out at the reception. However, the manager acted well against the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Location Excellent....!!”
Reviews.Author: Ram1975
Reviews.Content: A very good location just above the Raffles City Centre and CITY HALL MRT. Otherwise Singapore is expensive city and if you want to explore the city from morning till night there is no point staying in expensive hotels which you cannot enjoy. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: citiexpenses
Reviews.Content: my first time stay at Fairmont is awesome! My wife and I are celebrating our 50th wedding anniversary and we were surprise when we went to our room, there's a red wine waiting for us with a card from a staff named neah guinto. The manager shaik and his staff are very friendly. The food at prego is great! The location is perfect! We can't wait to celebrate more anniversaries in Fairmont Sibgapore!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, lousy internet”
Reviews.Author: cira001
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Singapore is a wonderful hotel. Service was very good, location excellent, rooms a decent size, and a good gym. The only negative - the in room Internet connections are pathetic. 6-800kbps connection speeds, which tech support said were acceptable! Maybe in 1999. If you are a business traveller and require the Internet...prepare to be frustrated. Fitness facility included about 20 pieces of current, well maintained cardio equipment as well as decent weight training area with a reasonable selection of free weights and machines. Very good overall. The pool area was very nice, with a lovely breakfast buffet available on the pooldeck. Wish I could have spent some quality r&r time there:( The neighbourhood is good, close to the financial district, attached to a luxury mall, and a relatively short walk to the water and arab district. The Raffles Hotel and famous Long Bar (home of the Singapore Sling) are right across the street. With the exeption of the Intenet, everything I would expect from a Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Best tourist hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: syloft
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated right above City Hall station, which is the interchange for the different lines of the MRT (train). The hotel is also linked to the Raffles City mall where there are a variety of shops and restaurants to suit every taste bud! As for the hotel room, it is very spacious and clean but the decor is slightly worn. The toilet is huge as well. Definitely a must stay for tourists for the convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Five star hotel - but you still pay for internet.”
Reviews.Author: levi2225
Reviews.Content: A relative of mine took care of the reservations and rooms for us. The lobby was dark and quiet but lots of people are sitting on any available sofa or chair since the lobby is the only place where people get free wifi internet (hence my title). I cannot complain much the hotel delivered on all our requirements but I noticed the carpets on their elevators were worn thin and not clean. The rooms were clean, a decent sized bathroom, with separate bath and shower facilities, a roomy cabinet, large flat screen tv with cable tv, and a king-sized bed. The bed was somewhat raised so it was an effort for me (five foot nothing on socked feet) to lie down and get up but it was not a major issue. An executive type table and chair are also provided where the internet socket is placed. The internet in the room is broadband, not wifi. You pay for the internet by going to their website and type your room number, and charged to your credit card. Internet was complimentary in our case but the hotel insists on charging it on your room then deduct it from your account during checkout so if you get complimentary internet don't forget to check your account if they have deducted it when you check out. The rooms were serviced everyday and local paper was delivered every morning. The gym and spa facilities were shared with its neighbor hotel, Swissotel. The gym was well equipped although some of their equipment on the weights side were a bit updated. The staff were polite and attentive and speak and understand english. We also had complimentary breakfast. We tried Alligator Pear (near the swimming pool) the first morning. The food was so-so and not that varied but at least fruit was fresh and plentiful. The next day we tried Prego. The food was much better and more varied but their fruit platters were somewhat lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel! Amazing Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: pikpik_tm
Reviews.Content: Can't say much. We have stayed as a bunch of friends for the wedding reception & the hotel, rooms, service was amazing. Adjacent to the mall & walking distance to the metro station. Takes time to deliver an adapter, but it did not ruin the stay at all. Great hotel! Breakfast was huge & great variety of food.

Reviews.Title: “Heart-warming Service”
Reviews.Author: njkj07
Reviews.Content: Kudos to the heart-warming service of Shaik Shidek, Resident Services Manager, Melissa and Neah! Shaik went the extra mile to help me with ideas and was very accommodating to my requests when he knew that I am going to propose to my girlfriend in Fairmont Singapore. He came back on his off-day and assisted in the proposal and offered to decorate the hotel room. He even surprised us with a bottle of champagne to celebrate this joyous occasion! My fiancée and I are certainly looking forward to going back Fairmont Singapore in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and caring staff”
Reviews.Author: Ratio3533
Reviews.Content: Can't fault this hotel in general - nice clean rooms with all the modern comforts. Staff were helpful throughout. We had an episode where we checked out early in the morning so that we could go to the airport and try and get on an earlier flight back home. With no luck at the airport, we came back to the hotel and asked them if we could get our room back which they gave us back up to the 12pm check out time - with no fuss whatsoever! So that really embedded my good thoughts about this place. The only drawback for me was the bed itself - way way too soft - so I could not sleep properly for the 2 days we were there. But if you can overlook this, then this is a great place. Another tip - for breakfast there are 2 options - Prego downstairs or by the pool - please ONLY go to Prego - it is fabulous. Truly wonderful meal. Pool is limited choice. All in all a great stay and would consider coming back!

Reviews.Title: “A litte disappointing”
Reviews.Author: JillHAustralia
Reviews.Content: Have previously stayed at the sister property Swissotel Stamford so had very high expectations. Booked a club room and was upgraded to a suite. Our suite overlooked a construction site where work was underaken 24/7 - after complaining we were moved the next day after a sleepless night (hotel was aware that noise from this part of the hotel was an ongoing issue). Suite was lovely, very clean and spacious - all the expected amenities. Housekeeping were excellent servicing room several times during the day with turndown service. Club lounge - offeres limited breakfast options in terms of hot food, however you have the option to eat at Prego or Alligator Pear restaurants. Beverages offered throughout the day with limited snacks (bascally biscuits and a cheese platter, no cakes or fruit). Evening cocktails offer unlimited Moet Chandon champagne, wine, beer etc The location of the hotel was excellent adjoins Raffles City, lots to do in the immediate area. My main gripe with this property are the staff in the Executive Club Lounge, I found them to be rude, unfriendly and stuffy - the staff really spoiled our stay with their attittude. Whilst this is a beautiful property the staff let it down and for this reason I would not recommend club floor (read my review of Pan Pacific Executive room).

Reviews.Title: “definitely not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: rastash
Reviews.Content: Great location and great concierge are the best things I can say about this hotel. We booked last minute and got a reasonable rate. Wish I had gone to my usual Mandarin Oriental/Shangri-la. Check in was good although we were given the hard sell to upgrade to the executive club level which we did not do. Had a deluxe room in the south tower overlooking the pool area. Good bed, waterfall shower. Basic amenities. Room never cleaned before 3pm!! Then not cleaned properly. Coffee spill still left after the clean! Breakfast good. Staff definitely need to have some customer service training. I do not expect to clear away my dirty plates in a 5 star hotel! Pool area needs to have a good clean. The pool bar counter is a disgrace. Filthy dirty and stained it obviously has not seen any form of cleaning agent in a long while. Glasses/ dirty towels remain uncollected all day long and one pair of discarded hotel slippers remained in the same spot for our entire 4 day stay. Watch the catch at the Sechuan restaurant. You get charged $1.50 for pickles which are put on the table whether you want them or not and whether you eat them or not. Minor but annoying. I do not expect to see large cockroaches in the corridor of a 5 star hotel. When i mentioned this I was told there was a lot of maintenance going on! To be fair to the hotel our complaints were taken seriously by the hotel management and they assure us they will be addressed but I don't expect to be spending my hard earned leisure time complaining at a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - huge!”
Reviews.Author: 27sunseeker
Reviews.Content: Stayed October 2009 - not 2010. Clean and comfortable - though the remote control lighting system took some getting used to? A thunderstorm took out all the power and when it came back on in the middle of the night so did all the lights and it took us ages to work out the remote control again! Huge hotel, very clean, too large for personal touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jess012345
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location in the city centre; it was on top of the City Link Mall & the MRT station you can take NS line to the Orchard Rd & the Zoo. It was easy to get to the airport by taking the EW line. We also found that there was a main bus station right across the street. For the night life, it was easy to get to the Clark Quay. The Chijmes (for drink & food) was on the next block. Super convenient!!! We ends up did not buy the hotel's internet plan. There was a 24hr Starbuck in the mall. We just bought our laptop to get online at starbucks. But we got some problem to check-in as the hotel was overbooked. At the end, it was ok & they upgrade us to the executive floor. The room was clean. It has a large balcony & we can see the Marina bay from our room. We enjoy our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MrsKanga
Reviews.Content: Fairmont is right smack in the middle of everything. The supermarket and restaurant are nearby. The MRT is a stone throw away. I simply loved the hotel's spacious rooms and cleanliness. The staff are so efficient in ensuring that the room is always in order. Checking in and out is a breeze. When traveling with children, Fairmont is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Singapore for service, room, location and value”
Reviews.Author: freobhoy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good, really good. I visit Singapore every month and have stayed in lots (and lots) of the premium hotels, this is right up there, in fact anywhere else is a disappointment now. In this price range you get a good sized room, big by local standards, the buffet breakfast is a good spread - not amazing but good, but add to the quality of the hotel a fantastic location and it just tops my list! The building also has a shopping centre with 2 food courts, good shops, is close to plenty other restaurants (chijmes is 1 minute walk), a few mins walk to the Arab Street, not far from Little India and with an MRT stop right there. Just all round good. Looking forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: underthefan
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel, very well located but the hotel is very much a business hotel. Restaurant in particular are extremely busy and have absolutely no charm

Reviews.Title: “Shoppers Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Moose2711
Reviews.Content: As usual with Fairmont we received great prompt, and personal service. The journey was a short four days before continuing on to Bali, but we are glad we experienced Singapore and we are really glad we stayed with Fairmont. As it was our honeymoon, the hotel had a very special small cake prepared in our Suite for us, as well as laying rose petals throughout the bathroom. Overall it was a great four nights, we were busy, and Fairmont was always there when we needed them. The spa are is divided, Mens/Womens and the water in the mens hot tub etc didn't really look or smell clean. This is the only part of the hotel I didn't enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “The best breakfast and pillows ever!”
Reviews.Author: moremountain
Reviews.Content: Our 3night stop over at the fairmont en route to Bali was exceptional. It was our honeymoon and we got upgraded free of charge to a delux harbour view room on the 13th floor. It was fantastic- immaculate bathroom, brilliant bed - crisp clean egyptian linen and the comfiest pillows ever. We had a menu choice of pillow which wasn't needed but I thought it was a lovely touch... the turn down service was very good and the most wonderful staff who, despite this hotel being a chain, felt like they truly cared about your stay and were very discreet yet extremely helpful. The hotel itself is in a great location opposite raffles and offers great facilities once you have tired of the tourist tat and excessive shopping Singapore has to offer. The pool was excellent, pool bar very good and not overly pricey. Concierge services were also very good. All in all an excellent choice and I would definitely return should I need an overnight stop in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in Everyway”
Reviews.Author: Jan11Adelaide
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived it was like we were the most important people there. The rooms are beautiful, the bed really comfortable. The breakfast in the Executive Club is just great. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff. The doorman Robert is a mine of information and a really nice man. Each night our bed was turned down with an orchid left on each side of tlhe bed. On entering the lobby there is a beautiful smell, feels welcoming. Thank you to Shaik, Roslee and all the staff for making our holiday perfect

Reviews.Title: “great hotel well located, super friendly staff but make sure to have a refurbished room at a high floor.”
Reviews.Author: Manunio
Reviews.Content: very decent hotel located nearby almost everything, buzzing but spacious lobby that smells amazing, friendly staff in the entire hotel. nice breakfast buffet on 8th floor at the pool, good spa showers. only thing: try to get a refurbished room on a top floor, because the old rooms are very 80's 'Dynasty' and not modern. but all in all good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best ever stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Baz8perth
Reviews.Content: We have been to Singapore many times and stayed in 9 different hotels. This was easily the best. From the first greeting as we arrived by taxi to the concierge getting and helping us into the taxi on our departure the warmth, friendliness attention to detail and standard of service was outstanding. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable with every amenity including the nightly turn down service with an orchid on the pillow. We enjoyed the food at Prego and the constant attention asking to refill our orange juice or did we want a paper was outstanding. The location being above Raffles City with its variety of shops (and supermarket for in-room refreshments etc) as well as numerous places to eat were a real advantage. We will certainly stay here again when we next return to Singapore and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful attentive service”
Reviews.Author: aussierover
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately my daughter and I stayed here only one night (we normally stay in budget accom)! Our room in the north tower was a little older but was very comfortable spacious and clean. The beds were super comfortable with quality linen and new fluffy towels in the bathroom. The shower was over the bath which was a bit of a surprise, but it worked very well. A good range of quality toiletries was supplied. Our rate included breakfast and as others have said, there is a choice of breakfast restaurants. We chose Prego, which was set up like an Italian cafe complete with large proscuittos hanging from the rafters (smell great!). There was an extensive choice of food from Indian to Malaysian to Western...something to suit all tastes.It was delicious. Fruit shakes were great and cappucino not bad. But the best part of our stay was the wonderful attentive staff, from the boy who brought our luggage to the room to the concierge and restaurant staff. Nothing was too much trouble and we always received a smile and felt like we were being treated with genuine personal service, even when the staff were really busy with a large and rather demanding tour group. Would I stay there again? You bet I would, but would ask for the South Tower. Well Done Fairmont!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkandSuzanne
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a cruise and stay holiday. Location of the hotel is ideal, as it is very central - positioned directly across the road from Raffles and within easy walking distance of the esplanade. The rooms were light and very spacious, including the bathrooms. The bed was extremely comfortable and large in size. Breakfast was not included in our package, but the mall was underneath the hotel so there were plenty of places to choose from. Staff were accommodating to requests. The pool was lovely and large in size.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly disappointing, but enjoyable still”
Reviews.Author: workawhorlic
Reviews.Content: Pluses: Very spacious room with a working desK! Pretty good service. Awesome breakfast. Fabulous spa (jacuzzi and whirlpool, etc) Pretty pool. Relatively comfortable bed. Good view. Great location. So much to eat and shop and do. Downsides: Slightly old, scratched furniture (in some places) Funny smell once you walk into room. Waited 1.5 hours for room (on a higher floor) but a kind service staff took us to wait in a comfortable lounge. A little inflexible with late checkout despite making us wait for room. TV is large but not sharp. All in all, relaxing and comfortable but after reading all the reviews on this site, I was expecting so much more. Perhaps it's because I only paid for a standard room. Service was pleasant, but I've been at 5 star establishments where I felt a lot more pampered.

Reviews.Title: “Love the room plus service deluxe! Had a good experience in this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: IndigoTravels
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel very much. It was in the right location, near the mrt, shopping centers, etc. It was my first time to stay here and the experience was very very pleasant. The rooms were cozy and very clean.The staff would go the extra mile to assist and help in every way they can. This hotel is highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: ShaneMcDonald
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Singapore Fairmont Hotel during a 3 day trip to Singapore. The Fairmont Singapore hotel is ideally located in a central part of town. After checking in our bags were brought to the room for us. The rooms are luxurious with a comfortable bed, luxury bathroom and aromatherapy bath products. Our room came with a balcony and the views are stunning where we could see the Singapore Flyer, the amazing Marina Sands Hotel and towards the city centre. Breakfasts are served in 3 different restaurants but the Asian Market Cafe was the best. In addition, guests of Fairmont Singapore have access to the Willow Stream Spa. Treatments are reasonable and the facilities and therapists are excellent. The concierge staff were also excellent and most friendly. It is an amazing hotel and would cetainly return here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Indy1504
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here at the start of our honeymoon and were totally bowled over by this hotel. The staff were really helpful and professional and nothing was too much trouble for them. We had a delux double room with an amazing view of the city and the Singapore flyer from our balcony. As a honeymoon couple we had flowers and chocolates waiting for us in our room and the champagne we had requested was chilled and waiting for us as promised. Great selection for breakfast and can also highly recommend Prego (in-house Italian restaurant) for an evening meal. Room service is reasonably priced for a 5* hotel and rather than just leaving you the food and disappearing, they lay it all out at your own litle dining table which was a nice touch. The location is great. There is an MRT station directly below the hotel which makes getting around really easy and cheap. It's also not a long walk from China town or Orchard road if you'd rather take in some scenery. Overall, we found nothing to criticise and will definatley be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and really comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Vasselle
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my stay at Fairmont Singapore. All if the staff was great and the accommodations are what I would expect from a higher end hotel. Only complaints are the restaurants. Overpriced and slow on service (Prego) except for the Alligator Pear. Would have liked in-room wireless service (only available in the lobby).

Reviews.Title: “fab as expected”
Reviews.Author: twoplusonetravel
Reviews.Content: believe the reviews on here, the Fairmont was a great place to stay with young kids, for the pool alone, which has a shallow section that our one year old could walk around in happily, kind of big paddling pool and swimming pool in one. Breakfast by the pool was the biggest treat. Staff all lovely, rooms a bit executive/dark, but great views of the cityscape and the new Marina Sands boat building. All needs catered for by teh shopping centre attached. No negatives really, I would say spend a couple of days here as a stopover on the way to Aus with kids as we did, it'll make the whole thing much less painful!

Reviews.Title: “Very good...”
Reviews.Author: OwenLondon30
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, pleasant ambience, hugely spacious rooms and a great pool. Slight unpleasant smell of drains in the bathroom would be my only gripe. Nice location too. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite stay in Singapore.”
Reviews.Author: cougrz007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 3 separate times in the months of March and April as part of a larger business trip across Asia. After staying at a couple of other properties I settled at the Fairmont and it eventually became my top choice in Singapore. The service at the hotel is impeccable. Everyone from the check-in to the room service staff to the bellman gave excellent service at all times. I thought that in many cases the service was not only excellent, but on a more personal basis than at some of the other 5-star hotels in town. For example, I was able to leave a large suitcase at the hotel over the weekend while taking a short weekend trip, and the staff asked me about where I went, how I liked it, etc. I felt valued as a customer here and thought that this set the hotel apart. Now for the hotel itself, the rooms are great, with comfortable beds, immaculately clean, walk-in closets, and large bathrooms. The internet connection was good and there was a good room service selection. The other great benefit of this hotel, in my opinion, is that it's above a large mall that has good shopping, a good restaurant selection, and also has easy MRT access. I prefer to ride the MTR when in Singapore since the taxi situation is often difficult. Here, I could speed to my client's site at Raffles Place in less than 5 minutes without ever going outside. This was a great perk. Also, lots of good restaurants and pubs within an easy walk of the hotel. I'd highly recommend the Fairmont when visiting Singapore for business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Great place and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: kumarsamit
Reviews.Content: Fairmont Singapore is impressive in terms of its place, service, professionalism and customer friendly approach. Their loyalty program "Fairmont President Club" is an awesome program and gives superb value for money right from the day of enrollment, unlike most of the other loyalty programs where benefits really tick off only when you reach level 2 after a good number of night stays. I could have done with a bit more of Indian menu on the in-room dining menu. You can trust Fairmont Singapore with not giving you a negative experience. Try it!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: klbn
Reviews.Content: We (family of 2 adults & 2 boys aged 8 & 4) spent 8 nights at the Fairmont. The service was fantastic (prompt responses to requests, recognition of our boys) and although our room wasn't set up with the 2 double beds as we'd planned that was quickly rectified by bringing in 2 fold away beds (worked better!). As it was also my birthday the room was beautifully presented with petals spelling out a message, cake and a bottle of wine - nice touch. Our room was obviously not one that has been recently renovated but that was more than compensated for with the amazing view over the hotel's pools towards Marina Bay Sands - stunning at night with the laser show. The location over the Raffles City shopping mall was perfect as we could buy breakfast easily (some stores open early enough for breakfast) and stock up on other food and drink items at The Market Place (stored in our fridge that had been cleared of all mini bar items). The complimentary bottled water was also most welcome. The Fairmont is situated an easy walking distance from Suntec Mall and Marina Square through the Citylink airconditioned, underground walk ways and to Makansutra Gluttons Bay for Hawker Centre type food. It was only a few minutes wait for a taxi each time we needed one (if one wasn't there one was whistled over promptly) and the MRT station City Hall is connected to Raffles City. Would absolutely recommend the Fairmont and all 4 of us wish we were still there!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, elegance and wonderful service in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Shraboni
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont envelops you in elegance and charm the moment you enter the lobby which is lit warmly, with a lovely fragrance and attended by friendly staff. Our check in was smooth, speedy and we got a late checkput on asking without any fuss at all. The porter was really friendly and we were delighted with the room. The bed was super comfortable and they provided us with the special pillows we requested. The bathroom was fantastic - bit, clean with a refreshing rain shower. Special mention must be made of the concierge service - both the people we interacted with were knowledgeable about Singapore and went out of their way to find out locations of stores and make restaurant bookings. The locatin of the hotel is fantastic for shopping and other attractions as it connects to City Hall MRT in less than a minute's walk. All in all, we loved being at Fairmont and are planning to stay there the next time as well. Only wish their internet discounted rate included breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Cant beat this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kelenmelisa
Reviews.Content: Best location - city hall, right above the MRT station. Lots of underground shopping, connects to Suntec City. Very close to the new Marina bay sands casino, walkable, if you don't mind walking. Room was beautiful, I believe it's been newly renovated/upgraded. The bathroom was amazing. Overall, extremely happy and very comfortable stay. Definitely worth the money we paid for. Infact this was our 3rd stay in the hotel and will stay again if we go to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient - Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: everunks
Reviews.Content: After staying in this Hotel in Jun'10, I once again chose to stay here. Conveniently located - above the City Hall MRT. The Raffles City Mall is also in the same vicinity and hence the great location. Excellent room service and overall polite staff. The Fitness Centre is excellent and one of its kind. Another great thing about this place is the food, as the Hotel also serves Indian Cuisine. I would specifically mention that the breakfast here is awesome. The Prego restaurant has a wide variety of options and also great juices. Not too mention that they also serve a variety of Indian Vegetarian daily in breakfast! Additional benefits, if you enroll for their membership (offered free): Free local calls and free internet!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great start to our Honeymoon and fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: ChurchillinPlymouth
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect. Thankyou. Room had such a magnificent view over the city and we loved the remote curtains. As it was our Honeymoon as soon as we arrived in the room we were sent flowers, chocolates and a congratulatory card. Such a nice touch. The location is central and taxis are really reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: marniemac
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed staying here for the past week. Location was excellent with fabulous shopping and restaurants nearby. Amazing views from some rooms. They had wifi in club rooms but not on lower floors which was frustrating - wifi should be a given these days.The pool was great as were the restaurants, although service was excruciatingly slow at times (but always friendly). All in all a comfortable stay. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A1 in all areas”
Reviews.Author: jennvale1
Reviews.Content: Second time I have stayed at Fairmont - forgot to do review last time. Great place to stay, incredible shops in complex, has food court and access to public transport underneath. Even has Subway! Free wifi in foyer which is great. Don't be put off my rather 'dark' reception. Everything else is fab. Love the pool area - you can lay out on your deck chair and order your food and drinks - just perfect. Don't miss a real gem across the road (no, not Raffles, which is also across the road) check out Chimes ... an old Orphanage which has been turned into great restaurants. Definitely worth checking out. Pay the extra money to join their Executive lounge area. Wine in Singapore unbelievably expensive - like $75 plus a bottle. Enjoy the Fairmont. You won't be disappointed. Highly recommend. P.s. view of new casino unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: “Unsurpassed Service and Thoughtfulness”
Reviews.Author: Adelinelim22
Reviews.Content: It was a short business trip via Singapore back home to Melbourne from London. Missed my flight and was late by a good 12 hours. What greeted me at check-in was the thoughtful and sincere regards from the staff as well as the Resident Services Manager Shaik who was worried if I was well. They promptly arranged for a room which I found to be all set with soft music playing, lights dimmed, note and a package of cookies to soothe the harried nerves into oblivion. The service was excellent, always a friendly smile and greeting at every corner. The executive club was also well equiped and good value for money. The manager was always obliging and never failed to respond to every request no matter how big or small, as swiftly as possible. Couldnt ask for a better business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere, location, rooms”
Reviews.Author: sundboell
Reviews.Content: Perfect location right in the middle of the hotel district, although even the best rooms do not have sea view. That is to say, our view was impeccable - and having upgraded we had the pleasure of views on two sides. The service is impeccable, things work - and the full lobby during mornings and nights gives a feeling of a busy, popular hotel.

Reviews.Title: “stay in south wing with harbour view only”
Reviews.Author: rubybellissimo
Reviews.Content: I was surprised that the Fairmont has rooms called 'the Fairmont room' in the north wing, which must be the old wing, that are worn out and bleak. So be careful how you book. If you get the north wing, you might as well stay in another hotel, as you will not feel like you are in a Fairmont. We lasted one hour in the 'Fairmont room' before moving into the South Wing. 15th floor, such a stunning view and very comfortable and easy. Great bathroom. Just a little bit worn in places, but they seemed to be upgrading the rooms during the day, I noticed tradesmen about a lot. Not noisy though. May sound bizarre but we spent hours staring out the window at the Marina Sands Hotel and the Singapore Flyer. We went to top of both, and both were great to do. I am glad we did not stay in Marina Sands, as it is much more exciting to look at the 'ship' on the top of those towers and marvel, than stay there where you could not 'see' what was on top of the hotel. That hotel was very artistic to visit, most the clientele seemed to be Chinese gamblers, as it has a casino. Fairmont is a top hotel, the desk service, the breakfast restaurant was 6 star for quality and variety (a personal fresh juice chef even) - all was romantic in the South Wing. Nice pools in the hotel, etc. We used the business centre on several occasions in spite of this being a romantic holiday... not grumbling, we did not expect to have to do business.. and the business centre staff bent over back wards for us and it was very well priced to use the computers and internet. The location was so good, we loved the 3 or 4 floors below the hotel of shopping centres, food mall, services like massage, hair cuts, etc. It is also close to Chimes with its myriad of upmarket cafes/bars. Hotel is related to Swisshotel next door and Raffles across the street (yes we had a sling) We caught local transport so easily. City Hall train station has two lines, red and green, (easy to get train from airport to city hall and hotel is literally right there above you) trains are cheap and quick and best for longer distances, better than cabs. and we got buses into Chinatown in 5 minutes from hotel. As we flew Singapore Air, we caught the free Sing Air hop on hop off bus right at the hotel, too. Noticed that the other hop on hop off buses, also stopped at Fairmont. We walked a lot, to the flyer, Marina Sands, China Town, etc. as this hotel is so convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Third time stay - enjoyed every minute!”
Reviews.Author: twinkle6
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd time at this hotel. We like the location - close to the MRT , and accessability to other shopping areas of the city. THis time we were upgraded to executive club- which was a very nice surprise. We had a room on the 22nd floor in the South Tower so had a great view of Raffles. We spent our last day relaxing by the pool prior to our evening flght - it made a perfect end to the holiday. We like the experience here which is why we like to finish our trips here.. roll onnext year!!

Reviews.Title: “A 'normal' 5 star in a decent location”
Reviews.Author: Mungo888
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here in April last year. The hotel location is good - opposite Raffles. Its a normal 5 star - impressive lobby and service - rooms a little small and bathrooms good but not great. We got a good price - otherwise would have stayed closer to min Orchard Road. Nothing wrong with the hotel - but no wow factor. I think Singapore has better options. Would only be tempted back by a great offer.

Reviews.Title: “excellent for both business and leisure”
Reviews.Author: manishberiwala
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fantastic for both leisure and business trip, the rooms are big, clean and spacious, the location of hotel is very good and is connected with a mall also, the inhouse restaurant is very good , the food is excellent, the swimming pool and gym is also good and well equiped. The malls are nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: profwho88
Reviews.Content: Stay as much as possible at Fairmonts. First time here. Very nice. Glad i stayed. I was on a low floor but only b/c i Hotwired it (so probably lower rate means lower floor, understandable). Nevertheless, QUITE EXCELLENT all of the way around. Bed super comfortable. Bath tub hugely large. Service excellent. Free internet if you are a member of the Free presidents club, which I am. The room was GREAT!! Thanks Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: traxlan
Reviews.Content: During our recent holiday trip to the far east, we had a stop over in Singapore which we spent at the Fairmont Hotel. The hotel offers great values: large rooms, great views, excellent facilities (e.g. shopping mall in the building), and outstanding service. We specifically liked the great location and that the metro station stopped in the building. We can recommend the hotel for stop-over and shopping visits.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing As Always!”
Reviews.Author: LaylaBlu
Reviews.Content: Am a big fan of Fairmont Group and usually make it a point to stay at their hotels where possible. Service was amazing as usual. Received emails asking for my flight details into Singapore a week in advance - although my flight touched down 10am and I reached the hotel by 11am, the room was ready for me (hotel policy states that check-in time is 2pm) and I was given the keycards within a minute of talking to Michelle at President's Club counter. View was good, room was spacious, clean and comfortable - even though it was a smoking room there was no lingering tobacco smell. Service was always prompt, warm, and very thoughtful throughout my stay. Bathroom large and well-equipped. When you ask for a wake-up call they'll call you 15minutes after your original request to check that you are awake. Internal communications processes seem solid as when I walked down to take a taxi at 5:30am the bellboy knew who I was (I assume as it was because I was the only guest who was wandering through the lobby at that time and who had asked for a wake-up call). Hana at President's Club concierge remembered my requests throughout my stay and asked if I was satisfied with service provided by her colleagues when I was checking out. Check out was a breeze - simply informed Hana at check-out and gave her the keycards and that was that. Will always continue to be a fan of Fairmont!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel right in the centre of all the action”
Reviews.Author: ShaunScotland
Reviews.Content: Had a large corner room with 2 balconies so the room was huge for Singa standards but the price did come in at the top end of the scale and for that price I would have liked free internet in the room. Even the most basic of hotels now offer it for free. I did find that every day the gym was full and not sure if it was just hotel quests or if it was open as to outsiders. The only bug bear with the hotel was the electronic curtain shutter controls. Which was the most complicated piece of electronics that I had ever came across. It must have took me 5 minutes to close the curtains and even there was a gap so I had to get out of bed to pull them shut and put a chair across them to stop them opening. Overall excellent hotel but for the money I would go else where.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable family stay at the Fairmont!”
Reviews.Author: dzj744
Reviews.Content: Just had 3 amazing days at the Fairmont Hotel in Singapore, with my wife and 2 young daughters – ages 5 and 8. Can’t praise it highly enough – from start to finish it was perfection – for all of us. The 2 double beds in the immaculate room, the exquisite pool area with kids pool, the food experiences, and the attached Raffles Plaza shopping made it the perfect short break. 10 out of 10 from me, made extra special by Mr Shaik Shidek, the Resident Services Manager. He went out of his way to be helpful and make the stay one to remember!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and city views”
Reviews.Author: NBsailor
Reviews.Content: We were met by the assistant manager and upgraded to a beautiful suite with two patios and beautiful views especially the night lights of the city. We joined the Presidents club on line before our stay and that may have been why we were upgraded. Being a member also gave us access to free Internet connection in our room, and joining the club was free. The hotel lobby was one of the most relaxing and peaceful lobbies we have ever encountered in our travels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Horseboxhero2010
Reviews.Content: Frankly I had expected a little more given how highly rated this hotel was on Tripadvisor (at the time it was rated 5 of 275 hotels in Singapore). Don't get me wrong - it is nice hotel - good sized rooms, nice towels, good gym and pool and good service but it didn't have much 'wow' factor. I found the rooms to be somewhat run down and in needs of rennovation. I suspect there are nicer hotels in Singapore at this pricepoint (US$290) if you know where to find them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: pinkcandle
Reviews.Content: The ambience at the lobby impress us from the scent of the candles that decorated the area to the staffs who welcome us. We were given a room at the 14th floor of the hotel which overlooking the city area. Its breathtaking with the light up from the skyscaper nearby. I love the toilet where the toiletries and towels were lined perfectly neat and the bed had lovely orchids placed at each corner. On the bed listening to our fav station on the Bose system,truly relaxing till we fall asleep. Next day, we went to dine @ Prego for dinner n the Manager-Mr Gorgeous( I cant recall his name-too mesmerize)had excellent knowledge of the wine. Goood suggestion. We would like to thank Mr Shaik for making our stay a memorable ones. We will definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great SPA! Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: chelseapoh
Reviews.Content: Relaxing 2 days stay for my families. Newly upgraded room is comfortable, spacious & clean. Breakfast by the pool & SPA is a MUST GO! Lots of things to do nearby this hotel - shopping, Singapore Flyer, MBS casino, Esplanade, Boat Quay, Chijmes.. City hall MRT station rite underneath.

Reviews.Title: “Relax and enjoy your family in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: jjporter
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend staying at the Fairmont Hotel in Singapore. The staff are keen to serve and always have a friendly attitude. The location is close to world class shopping. The fitness and spa facilities were excellent. The food is delicious. You can't beat the value.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation on floor but overall enjoyable service”
Reviews.Author: Blue10122
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located. Service is warm. There was renovation on the floor so that was a bit of a problem. Joined the Fairmonts President Club and the perks are good! No need to carry your sports shoes or tees. Spa is excellent. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a good location”
Reviews.Author: ColchesterJohn
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with a good location adjacent to Raffles. We wished the rooms were better signposted as we seemed to go around in circles when looking for the room (the hotel is circular). Pleasant pool area which is great after walking around the shopping mails. Visit Raffles and the bar but if you are mean have some German beers on the corner a few hundred yards north of the Fairmont (same side same block) and watch the world go by. After the beers cross the road (north) into a large courtyard for some good open air restaurants. Go to the top of the adjacent Swisshotel stamford for a beer and the fantastic view. Take the Red Bus Tour. Other than taxis singapore is expensive due to our lousy exchange rate

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, First Rate Service”
Reviews.Author: UKEscaper
Reviews.Content: I have been fortunate enough to experience two extended stays at The Fairmont in Singapore. Staying in the same hotel for 6 weeks can be a draining experience, as we all long for home, however, the contrary was experience. All the staff make you feel welcome and nothing is too much bother. The quality of the rooms are of a high standard, and I love the bathroom in the Deluxe rooms, I could stay under the 'waterfall' shower head for hours. Breakfast by the pool is great, except when guys who should not be wearing 'speedo' trunks walk past, almost puts you off the wonderful buffet. I wish I could stay at the hotel all the time, but as a prime hotel for the city, it does carry a premium, but it's nearly always full, so service and style will prevail over cost. The location is not the most calming, busy roads surround the hotel, although it is easier enough to get taxis or to the MRT. One tip about taxis, if it is raining get down to the taxi rank quickly or book a taxi, as they become very scarce. Given the option I would always stay at The Fairmont, the hotel is immaculate and the staff attentive and very friendly. Join the Frequent Users scheme "The President's Club" to get access to Free Internet, although I am still waiting for 9 weeks worth of stays to be added to my account!

Reviews.Title: “A great view in a most comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: John116083
Reviews.Content: We had a great moment in this hotel. the view on the bay is amazing. The sport facilities are very good. The food was freat as well. I strongly recommend this hotel which has a great location in the city, between orchard and the marina

Reviews.Title: “a very warm and memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: isabel_0208
Reviews.Content: our stay at the fairmont was wonderful... every need of ours was taken care of with a great attention to the little details....we were staying there for the new year and were pleasently surprised by the warm and cosy atmosphere .... the staff were great especially a mr sheik shidekh he took such wonderful care of us putting little baskets of fruit and cookies in our room ...making sure i had the tea that i liked ..he took care of every little detail..that really made our stay ..i would recommend this hotel to anyone who would really want to relax and not have to worry about the cleanliness or the efficiency of the staff as i guarantee you ...they are indeed top notch...all in all a perfect stay

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel in the city centre”
Reviews.Author: Cecile083
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Fairmont was very pleasant. The staff is very polite and professional. The room was very clean and the bed so comfortable ! The furniture is a bit old and the room doesn't look very modern. The swimming pool is great and the view amazing. Just a shame that the breakfast is not included and is so expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the best!”
Reviews.Author: MrsTravelHappy
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were given cold handtowels to refresh and my two boys got a balloon each. We stayed 5 nights in the North Tower in a signature room. We were amazed how big the room and bathrooms were. The South tower is the new tower but I really think North tower has the bigger rooms. We had 2 balconies with view of the city and the famous Raffles Hotel. The bed is heavenly. My baby boy didnt want to wake up or get out! My toddler loved the kiddie pool as he could walk in the pool. There is another pool that is for the adults. We went during happy hour and enjoyed the sunset and awesome view. My baby boy got sick on the third night due to suspected undercooked food from a restaurant in another mall. Fairmont staff immediately had a doctor come to my hotelroom. He was great and quickly gave my son medicine. We were amazed by the fantastic staff at this hotel. They truly exceed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: princessdrea
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, excellent service, attentive and friendly staff, and an amazing location. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous stay - great facilities and location”
Reviews.Author: KilbroganHouse
Reviews.Content: A superb location directly opposite Raffles and very centrally located for shops etc. I had a room on 21st floor directly overlooking Raffles – a view to die for so make sure if you choose to stay here, you request a room high up overlooking the city/raffles etc and not the pool which is not quite as stunning.(Specify smoking or non smoking). The room has everything you could want. If you sign up for the Presidency Club when you book your accommodation,you receive a free newspaper each morning plus free internet access in your room. The bathroom facilities are luxurious – a marble surround bath with overhead shower with a huge shower head. The room itself is well layed out. Plenty of space and a wonderful glass topped desk to work at. The fridge was very well stocked. Air conditioning is set low so it's slighly on the chilly side. The outdoor pool is wonderful especially at 9pm when absolutely nobody is about. It’s crowded during the daytime. Perhaps a good spot for breakfast but I didn't check this. The Willow Stream Spa is out of this world even if you are only interested in a sauna, steam and Jacuzzi rather than an area of treatments. A tip – If you arrive in the evening jet lagged from a long flight, go to floor 6, head for the pool (through the Spa area) to start with and then take a spa, sauna and Jacuzzi. You will think you are in heaven – perfect to make you feel re-invigorated. On my first evening I only wanted a snack so checked through the hotel blurb (I would say’a list of suggestions’ rather than ‘recommendations’) in the room and headed for Kopi Tiam in Raffles City shopping centre – This was a mistake. My chicken curry was tasteless and the atmosphere terrible – a bit like eating in a canteen. In hindsight, I should have ordered room service. The concierge did suggest Prego so perhaps that might have been a better idea – Prego is part of Fairmont but Kopi Tiam is in the Mall. If a snack breakfast is all you need, head for An Teng Bakery at Raffles. I had tea and a Chelsea bun which was mouthwateringly full of nuts, raisins etc. A real treat and wonderful surroundings. The Szechuan Court and Kitchen restaurant in the hotel is worth a visit for dinner. Keep in mind that Szechuan dishes can be very spicey – that suited me but not somebody at the next table. Fish dishes seem to be their speciality though I had a very tastey and simple duck dish. The portions are large. I chose the mango dish from the dessert menu as so many of the dessert dishes contained chilli, snow fungus etc which I wasn’t adventurous enough to try. The mango mousse was very refreshing and well prepared. The hotel is so easy to get to.I took the air bus directly to the hotel which cost Sing 9. I returned to the airport on the metro from City Hall which was also very convenient – sing 2.90. The Raffles City Mall complex links the Fairmount to the City Hall metro so you don’t even need to walk outside. The Swissotel is directly next to the Fairmont. I didn’t take the trip up to the 70th floor of the Equinox in the Swissotel as the view from my own room was stunning itself. I booked this hotel on line and I felt that the price I got was excellent value for money. This hotel merits its 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: chriskuo
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of the hotel, atop the Raffles City Shopping Center and the City Hall MRT station. We had a great price by booking a package through a travel agent. However, our travel agent did not specify a non-smoking room and we were first assigned to a smoking room. The disturbing part is that the ashtray in the room had 2 cigarette butts in it. We were moved to a non-smoking room 5 floors up, overlooking Raffles Hotel. The room was satisfactory but had a slightly musty smell. The hotel is not very new but our room had been satisfactorily upgraded. Because of the service error, we were comped with buffet breakfast for both days in the ground floor restaurant. The breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't afford Raffles, so I stayed across the road”
Reviews.Author: StarshipVoyager
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont isn't cheap, but a good online deal convinced me to book one room for myself and my partner, and another for a couple of relatives. We all agreed it was a good choice for a week's stay in Singapore. The rooms are nice and big, each with its own little balcony affording (in our case) a view of Raffles Hotel from the 6th floor. I would have liked something a little higher, but it was fine. The location, next to Raffles City shopping mall and City Hall MRT station (not to mention right across from the aforementioned must-see tourist trap) was superb. It was also on the hop-on, hop-off tourist bus route, which came in handy. The pool area was nice and we used it a fair bit. Our bathroom sink could have been cleaned better, but the disposable (read : free) slippers were a nice touch. The service was pleasant and helpful; when I checked out and explained that the second in-house movie I had tried to watch hadn't worked, they cancelled the charge without a second thought. If you can get a decent deal on the room rate, I'd recommend this as a good sightseeing base.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing !”
Reviews.Author: currieinc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont for only 1 night on our way over to the Netherlands just after Christmas ( December 27 - 28 ) and the hotel is amazing !. This was our second stay at the hotel in 2 years and again was a wonderful experience. We had an inter-connecting room and both rooms were large , well set up and have no end of amenities. The view is fantastic and the thing we love about the hotel is the doors open to a small balcony so you can get fresh air. The location is perfect for all aspects of shopping and restaurants . Cafe Swiss in the Swissotel The Stamford is THE BEST PLACE FOR BREAKFAST .. so if you're going to to Singapore don't go past the Fairmont .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ColinMacF
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Fairmont before, but waited till my second trip to review it. It was excellent both times. It is well situated for shopping, business or night life. The rooms are large, clean and comfortable and the staff are very friendly and helpful. I've always had rooms looking south to the harbour and the view is great - day and night. The choice of restaurants is varied and good and there are other good restaurants and bars in Chijmes - just over the road. Raffles Hotel is next door as well. As an example of the service, I wanted to take flowers to a friends house and asked for a florist at the concierge's desk. Rather than telling me where to go, he took me into the adjacent shopping mall and showed me the florist - great service. This hotel is great for short or long stays. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GarryLee316
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at the Fairmont and could not have been happier. For the price, you get a great hotel, great location (opposite Raffles) and the services was excellent. We arrived to find our selected room level only had smoking left and so they upgraded us immediately to the next level of room without question. The restaurant have a good range of food and the rooms are both well fitted and kept immaculately. Only complaint, lack of a wifi in the rooms, but this is the case in many hotels.

Reviews.Title: “good average hotel”
Reviews.Author: luckyrabit
Reviews.Content: good average business hotel. compared with other hotel in Singapore which I had stayed (PanPacific, Swissotel, MandarinOrchard, Sentosa resort). this hotel shows as following; general room condition - little above average (4.5 star is OK) except bath room (it's 4 start ) cleaness of room - just average not good service-concierge is good and helpful, but reception is not good, no or late reponse for a phone call and long time for check-in food - breakfast is good (it's natural considering the price) other in poolside is just average location - good swimming pool - average (but when I used there's very strong smell from somewhere near and very unpleasant)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Jasmine29
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to stay in the penthouse suite. Service was fantastic, the concierge was extremely helpful with providing information and useful tips. The lounge was amazing every day they had tasty appetizers which changed from day to day. Breakfast was incredible, best I have ever seen! They had so much variety and it was all very good. The location of the hotel can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Baba011
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel the bell boy picked our bags with a smile. we checked in at 10a.m so it took long for us to get our room as the normal check-in is at 2p.m. we got a deluxe room with a full harbour view we got a very nice view of the fireworks. This hotel is very nice and luxurious. Overall this hotel was very good and would recommend this hotel to other people

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the business traveller...”
Reviews.Author: simbaonsafari
Reviews.Content: Location and free high speed internet make this a perfect business hotel. Breakfast buffet is amongst the best I have seen at any hotel and is real value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A good business hotel, but no-frill”
Reviews.Author: Frankieandcharl
Reviews.Content: Overall I would recommend a stay there to any business traveller, particulary if you are after a good central location but I can hardly says this hotel scores very high on any metrics, apart from the breakfast. the service is OK, but not particularly exceptionnal (the reception desk service was not the most welcoming on my last two stays), the rooms are allright and clean, the pool is nice but nobody every seem to go for a swim. Definetely a good business hotel but not a leisure hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: tintoretto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmont for just one night and were quite pleased it was no longer. We found that the reception area was very short of seating and quite dreary as there is no lounge. We ate in the area next to the pool and found that very expensive and the pool area was quite dull. Breakfast is again served at the pool side which is adequate. Shopping is easy as Raffles City starts actually off the lobby of the hotel which is excellent especially if it is raining. Our room looked out over the pool between 2 skyscrapers which I know you can do nothing about, but I think perhaps a little TLC wouldn't come amiss. Our bedroom was ok nothing dynamic, unless drawing the curtains by remote control comes into the 'must have' list. Definately a hotel which is struggling to maintain its 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sagtraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and were not disappointed. The rooms are large, good size bathrooms, my only complaint here is the shower is in the bathtub with a shower curtain. (my pet hate!) I requested a renovated room when booking and a king bed. The bed and linens were fantastic. The staff are well trained and very helpful. We did not dine in the hotel as there are so many choices of local food and sooo cheap. The food court located on the 4th or 5th floor in the shopping centre is a great choice for a quick lunch or there are numerous local eateries in the side streets for great noodle dishes etc. The location of this hotel is excellent. Within walking distance to Clarke Quay, Marina Bay, Singapore Flyer (this is a must, awesome views) and the hotel is over the shopping centre and MRT so easy access then to Orchard rd. We also enjoyed, The Riverwalk, Little India walk, China Town walk, art muesem, art gallery. The night safari was very disappointing and would not recommend. It was overcrowded, the line up to enter the zoo was over 1 hour and the wait for the tram ride was 40 mins and you could not really see too much. I think the day would be much better.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location. Great Hotel Overall”
Reviews.Author: EddieN51
Reviews.Content: We arrived New Years Eve, pretty stressed out as Air France had lost our luggage. Initially they couldn't seem to find our reservation but this was OK as they upgraded us to a "Signature" room which was fantastic with a balcony that gave us a great view of the fireworks. Best bed we've ever slept in Location is perfect as everyone states. Breakfast was great. Health Club and gymn was great. What made it for me is that they have a service that for 10 Singapore Dollars they will lend you gymn kit (everything including socks and trainers) which was great for me due to the Air France luggage fiasco. Well I was imagining to recieve some manky worn in trainers and kit but instead 5 minutes later arrives pristine adidias kit that looked and smelt as if it was surely brand new. To me that really is going the extra mile! One let down has to be the pool area which is too busy and a bit too "concretey" I give this hotel 4.5 stars

Reviews.Title: “It was pleasant”
Reviews.Author: marishcher
Reviews.Content: Reserved Deluxe for 4 nights. On gold card Skywards have made an upgrade to the Signature a room with the free Internet. Service excellent. An arrangement good.The staffs are very attentive & friendly. Easy to reach shopping centers and Esplanade.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Icklehan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 4 nights and found it to be in a great location to explore the city of Singapore from. The hotel is right next to Raffles. We went there one night for the famous Sinagpore Slings. They were ok but actually found the Mojitos to be much nicer - the best I had in Sinagpore. Also a 20 minute stroll to Clarke Quay where we had a lovely dinner one night. We got a taxi there and then walked home. We stayed in the North tower and our room was large and comfortable although slightly dated. It had a nice view over Raffles though and the hotel allowed us to check in straight away when we arrived early in the morning straight off a long haul flight. The bell boy even stood in the queue at reception for us so the we could take a seat when he saw how exhausted we were. The hotel is situated on top of a shopping cente and MRT line. This means great access to lots of food and beverage outlets. We ate in the shopping centre food court once or twice and we went to Starbucks every morning. Didn't eat in the hotel as there was no need. The MRT line means transport about Singapore is easy. We took a taxi a couple of times from the front of the hotel too. The one small complaint I would have about this hotel is the pool. This is shared with the adjoining hotel and can get busy.
