We went there to relax one afternoon and shortly after we arrived they started playing loud music at the pool bar. This consisted of the same few songs being played on repeat and got annoying after a while. I would say the pool scene was more for families than for couples looking to relax. All in all a great base to use for a first visit to Singapore and I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A centrally located, attractive, modern, comfortable hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: TravelGeeks2009
Reviews.Content: Checked out after 8 great days in this hotel. Due to the long stay they upgraded me from a Deluxe room to a room at the 20th floor that’s what you call “a room with a view” on Singapore’s Esplanade, the Marina Bay Sands impressive skyline. Became an instant President’s Club member (recommended to do, internet is free) and went to a spacious room, contemporary style. One thing that may turn down some business visitors: the hotel is huge and when I was there a lot of vacationers with children which makes the restaurant a little noisy at times. The hotel would do good to reserve a special place for a quiet breakfast for business travelers. The advice I got was to go to the 8th floor, however that’s breakfast near the swimming pool, hardly attractive at 31 degrees Celsius if you are on a business trip. Quiet I said? I thought so, unfortunately I had some noisy neighbors, had to call the reception to see if they could quiet them down. They did and it helped. At 3.00 am that same night the hotel fire alarm went off, summoning everyone on the 20th floor to move to three stories lower. As the alarm kept going I called the reception then to hear that is was false alarm. The hotel management resolved this issue well, no complaints here. The rest of the stay was very comfortable, the room is perfect in size, amenities, a large modern, shower, a comfortable bed and pillows. Service is great. The receptionist at the Presidents Club counter was particularly helpful and accomodating. The laundry service is not always very accurate (shoes after shoeshine back next morning 8 am? Had to call twice before they came, several misunderstandings with some departments in the hotel, where some improvement could be made. Overall a very pleasant stay, nice and comfortable. The Spa was terribly disappointing : the 90 minute treatment including massage was unsatisfactory the masseuse was way too soft, and the overall treatment was mediocre, at best. The hotel is very centrally located next to the Raffles City Shopping Centre and at walking distance from most museums and some other tourist attractions (and easy access to the adjacent Raffles Convention Centre.

Reviews.Title: “top staff, top for convenience”
Reviews.Author: awayweekender
Reviews.Content: This hotel occupies an absolutely unique location atop the shopping/convention complex known as Raffles City, including the City Hall MRT interchange. Virtually everything is an elevator ride away from your room: restaurants, shops etc. Hotel staff are exceptional: front desk and guest relations deserve particularly special mention. It's clear the Fairmont group invests heavily in training and in assigning staff internationally. I can attest to the fact that regular guests are very well looked after. Head chef Michael Muller oversees a very broad array of F&B outlets such as 'Prego' (have breakfast here!), Szechuan Court and the (now Halal and teetotal) 'Asian Market Café', all of which are both popular with guests and local residents (always a good sign).

Reviews.Title: “My review may border on the Ecstatic.”
Reviews.Author: theposhfamilyman
Reviews.Content: The Christmas/ New Year Holiday was just Perfect. For a 40 sq.m Deluxe room at floor 20 @ 270 SGD/night, facing the Iconic Raffles hotel, I think I hit the lucky spot. The room was spotless. The bathroom was huge. And the Service was A+++. Requests such as a baby chair/ extra sheet/ firmer pillows were taken care of smooth & fine. The Location is amazing siting on top of Raffles Plaza, for great Shopping/dining and Cityhall MRT- that has both red/green train lines connectivity- we breezed through the entire city with amazing ease and a prepaid card. Housekeeping was fantastic. Overall the entire experince of travelling with an infant became so fuss free, actually enjoyable. I shall Get into this hotel, If & when I can. Recommended " ABSOLUTELY."

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Kvashi1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fairmont in Singapore, for our first half of a two part vacation. I have been the Singapore before, as an exchange student, so it was nice to see the country/city from a tourists perspective. The Fairmont has excellent customer service and are very attentive to our needs. The room was always cleaned when we got back from our day of sightseeing. Our only complaint is an experience we had with a trip the hotel tried to book for us. The hotel booked a day trip to Malaysia for us, that went very poorly. We were told to be ready by a certain time in the morning, with our passports. When the tourist company representative arrived to pick us up, he asked if we had our 'white cards' with us, which we informed we did not. He did not seem disturbed by this and told us to get onto the bus. We didn't think about it twice, thinking that whatever it was, we could get at the company. We got to the meeting location and paid our fees and boarded the bus to Malaysia. As we got on the bus, the bus driver once again asked whether or not we had our 'white cards', which we told him we did not and needed one. Once he explained to us what a white card was, we came to understand that we needed our immigration cards (the cards you get when you enter the country at the airport, which you fill out on the plane). Unfortunately, those were at our hotel, and we were told we could not go on the trip. We were very upset by this, as we really wanted to go to Malaysia. If the hotel had told us to bring our 'white cards', or the tour company bus driver had just tried to explain to us what a 'white card' is when we were at the hotel, we could have just popped up to the room and grabbed them. Let me clarify, I completely understand WHY we needed these cards, my complaint was not that we needed them, rather that the hotel and the tour company both failed to explain to us what it was they were asking us to bring, resulting in us being unable to go on a much looked forward to adventure. The hotel restaurants are very good, albeit slightly pricey. I would recommend eating at them once or twice, but also checking out the Hokien centers, where the food is VERY good and super cheap! The morning breakfast buffet at Verde is very good, and worth the price for the choices of food provided. Check out the new Universal Studios, as well as the Casino with the giant boat on top. For culture, go to China town and India town. For family friendly adventures on the main island, I recommend going to the bird zoo/sanctuary. Also, pop across the street at Raffles Hotel for a Singapore Sling - they aren't very good, but when in Singapore you have to do this! Finally, bring lots of money, because you can't swing a Prada bag in this city without hitting a mall!

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location connected to MRT, rooms in need of renovating”
Reviews.Author: taipa
Reviews.Content: The central location is THE reason to stay here. It is connected to the CITY HALL MRT, so you can get to most places in SG without having to change trains. There is a really nice supermarket + food court in the basement which is extremely convenient. You can also walk to the Esplande MRT via the City Link mall. The world famous Raffles Hotel is right across the street, so you know this location is hot. I dont know why the top hotels on Tripadvisor are all Marina Bay hotels. IMO, Marina Bay is pretty sterile and boring with nothing interesting within walking distance. Orchard Road hotels are also not centrally located unless if your sole purpose in SG is to goto shopping malls. The rooms are dated and spartan. Fortunately, the bed and bathroom are just fine. They definitely need a new interior designer to spruce things up. The all-white tiled bathroom feels like a gym, and the bedroom color palette is real drab and stale. Service is 4 star---not quite the Starwood level of gracious hospitality you get in Asia. During noon checkout, there was a long queue of people checking in / out, yet there were a few caucasian staff members just standing around instead of helping to speed up the queue. The most pleasant staff were actually the Indian doormen, who greeted all visitors with a warm + genuine smile. Bottom line: UNBEATABLE location, 4-star level rooms for a 5-star price. My recommendation to their management is to renovate their rooms and polish up their service.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SPB79
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights as part of our honeymoon. We had a standard room which was quiet, spacious and comfortable. The bathroom was great - dual sinks, separate bath and shower, good lighting and very roomy. The service we received throughout our stay was excellent and the place is well looked after and very clean, The hotel is centrally located (it's opposite the Raffles complex) and a great spot for exploring Singapore. The hotel does have two pools which are shared with another hotel. This does get fairly busy and in the afternoon they play loud music around the pool bar so there is no real quiet outdoor space to relax in. We were on the eighth floor so couldn't hear it in our room even with the balcony door door open. However, if I stayed there again (which I would) I would check that we were in a room which was a few floors above the pool so that this wouldn't be a problem. We ate in the Italian restaurant which is located within the hotel one night, which to be honest was fairly average (although the service was good). We ate breakfast in the hotel one morning which worked out at about £20 each and was also average. However, the hotel is so centrally located this isn't really a problem as there are so many places close by where you can pick something up for breakfast or go out for dinner. If I had to sum it up, I would say it's a good business hotel and good place to stay for 3 nights whilst exploring Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and the best staff!”
Reviews.Author: 4cdns
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here for two weeks in Oct/Nov and we loved this hotel: It had all the amenities of every 5 star hotel but the staff was above and beyond exceptional! My children were treated with extraordinary kindness by everyone at the hotel and this personalized our stay here so that we did not feel as though we were in just another interchangeable hotel. The location of this hotel is ideal, with the MRT located directly below, and many excellent restaurants in the attached mall. The only negative I can think of is that the pool area was ok but not fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations causing havoc”
Reviews.Author: Spike1996
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Singapore on business, and was recommended to stay at the Fairmont by colleagues. What a disappointment. My room had stained carpet, plastic-covered furniture, an uncomfortable bed, and antique bathroom fixtures. The internet access, both dial up and wireless, was never available in my room, and the supposed free wireless in the lobby always returned an error of being "over capacity" if I tried to log on. On the second night of my stay, I returned to find a note saying the power would be out for the entire building (including elevators and AC) for 5 hours during the night. Comically, they provided each of us with a giant glowstick so that we could make our way through the dark if need be. To top it all off, the staff at the front desk was unethical. I discovered that my colleagues had much nicer rooms, and when I asked for a transfer, they said I had reserved my room under the "lesser" rate, which was 100% untrue. Whether for business or pleasure, save your money and stay at one of the other fine hotels in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “The Place to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Lumex87
Reviews.Content: After we had same back experience with another Hotel in Singapore we moved to the Fairmont Hotel. We booked a Deluxe Room with 2 single beds. Arriving at the Hotel and its perfect Location next to the Cityhall MRT and in the Raffles Shopping Complex weve been warmly welcomed at the Reception of the Hotel. While we waited we got some homemade Chocolate which was excellent ! As we stepped into our Room (which was more than just awesome) we felt like beeing home. Everything was new and also we had our own balcony with an awesome view to the Singapore Flyer and Marina Bay. I attached some pictures to give you an idea how great it is. The Beds are really comfortable and if you sign up for the presidential club you can enjoy free internet over the due of your stay ! The Pool Area is large and you can also enjoy breakfast there. I would recommend this Hotel to everyone, the room rates are quite ok for a luxurious hotel like this because you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Sing”
Reviews.Author: AusTravel2010
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, location, service, rooms etc. Stay on the club levels for even better service. Lush bathroom, dining options. Plenty. Head across to the top of the Swissotel to the bar 70 floors up.

Reviews.Title: “idea of hospitality”
Reviews.Author: narkolog
Reviews.Content: stopped on the way to Malaysia and back to the club rooms, very nice atmosphere, staff behaved with great dignity and I felt that they were working not only for money but for the idea of hospitality. hotel is excellent and worth their money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great rooms and spa especially.”
Reviews.Author: Sandst0rm
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at this hotel, choosing it just by name and because I have a “presidents club” membership. Their systems clearly flag platinum members to everyone because everyone I spoke to seemed to know. It means a guy comes out from behind reception when you arrive to put a very elaborate scarf thing around your shoulders and do a little speech about the culture of Singapore. Nice touch but it was a little bit embarrassing, people started looking at me. Room was fabulous and very clean and well maintained, great view, balcony etc. The gym and spa were truly amazing, I was gutted I had work functions in the evening when I could have spent all night hopping between the Jacuzzi and the sauna. A few little problems, people only ever answered the telephone about half of the time, the other half it would ring out and I’d have to try again later. Also, (and this is an absolute pet hate of mine), once I came up to my room and the door key didn’t work. For no apparent reason. I couldn’t go back down to reception, either, because the ‘down’ lift button was broken but I called from the corridor and someone came up right away with a new key, and the button was fixed within 15 minutes. Loved the email checkout, very convenient! Overall, excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms, very consistent (good) service”
Reviews.Author: yua
Reviews.Content: Stay here of choice now when in Singapore. Service is attentive from stepping out of the taxi on arrival to stepping back into the cab on departure. The rooms are very comfortable and well appointed. Range of in house dining options, but there are also very good options close by. MRT station is under 5 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “service!”
Reviews.Author: john_taylor78
Reviews.Content: check-in was assisted by an agent, hana, very friendly..aside from her, only lobby hosts and a guy name sheikh sidek (not sure if i got the name right), and bellmen gave us a warm welcome n smile everytime we walk thru the lobby. other reception team however, seems to be a bit difficult to give a smile even though did acknowledged us. when checked out by Raj (i got to know he's a supervisor level sorta??), he didnt even smile with no eye-contact AT ALL.he definitely turned moment to a memory(their credo) for us. perhaps hana should train him how to smile!

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected”
Reviews.Author: t_hajwane
Reviews.Content: After much indecision on hotels and comparing against the prices of some of the 5* establishments the fairmont was a safe bet for your first trip to SGP. Not only was it safe but in hindsight it was perfect for us, the review seem mixed but the service was great and attentive given we have a child, the location was superb, on the MRT station, opposite raffles, s beautiful stroll away from the esplanade and a view of the marina.. food options in the form of raffles city.. id have no issues staying here, my only issue was with no internet in the rate.. i found myself paying for a day here and there.. i'd stay here and again and completely recommend it to others.. On a final note there have been some reviews thrown up about the rooms, we stayed in the North Tower and it was fine, they were clean, modern enough, comfortable with a nice view.. no walk in shower but heck it was a small price to pay. One thing i didn't know before was that the fairmont and the swissotel city hall are practically connected and they are the shortest walk away from the marina hotels.. SGP looks huge on a map but really it isn't!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but need to focus on details”
Reviews.Author: IlliniRon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week of business in Singapore, and it continues to be a nice property. This time my flight arrived at 6am, and this is a common flight arrival time for Singapore. The hotel was booked for the night before, so I showed up hoping I could shower, change and head to meetings. For some reason the front desk staff struggled to arrange use of the Spa for this, since they could not figure out when it opened in the AM. Some training is needed in this area. The desk person was mainly trained to tell me that check-in time is 2pm. Thanks for that. My room was OK, but the large TV was not working properly, and I needed to continue to get someone to come to the room and program it, so it would turn on properly. For gosh sakes, could you please fix the TV set if your guests continue to have a problem with it? The hotel has some nice restaurants, especially Szechuan Court. Prego is not the place for breakfast unless you want the buffet breakfast. They almost refuse to bring a menu out for breakfast items, and then warn that it will take 30-40 minutes for anything to come out of the kitchen. Even a continental breakfast or oatmeal? Best to skip Prego for breakfast and find the Starbucks in the shopping mall next door. Anyway, this is an overall nice property, they just need better training of front desk staff and maintain the rooms a little better. Prego management should be changed.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel with very good location and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Happytourist098
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right above the MRT station and major shopping malls. The room is roomy, very clean, and we had a very good view facing the Singpoare flyer. I am particularly impressed by their breakfast! There are so many choices and they are truly delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Madatcasu
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights on the 19th and 21th of July, 2010 in a Fairmont Room. I booked directly with the hotel and was able to find out about the Fairmont President’s Club, which is their loyalty program which is free to join and included a surprising number of benefits, such as a dedicated check-in desk, free and very fast in-room internet access as well as complimentary local calls and room delivery of newspapers. I thought it was worth just signing up for the program.The bathroom looked quite impressive. In terms of actual operation, it appeared as if there was only one level of water pressure available for the shower. I filmed the operation of the shower and have it on my youtube page (http://www.youtube.com/AllHotelrooms). I was able to try both the gym and the Willow Stream Spa. The gym was large and equipped with nice and modern cardio and weight-training equipment. The spa area was nice and comfortable and I tried the hot and cold plunge pools as well the steam room and sauna. There was a good area for sitting and having drinks such as iced tea before or after the entry to the spa area. The shower area was quite impressive with very large showers there with nice amenities available, which were of professional spa standard.Another minor quibble was that my requested newspaper was not delivered on the first morning, which was part of the Fairmont President’s Club promise, and there was no explanation given so I had to follow up and found out that they did not have that particular newspaper on the weekend. I was then given two newspapers the next morning, perhaps as compensation. Overall, this was a very satisfactory hotel and I would give it 4.5 stars out of five.

Reviews.Title: “Room in very bad condition - pictures attached”
Reviews.Author: PaulSEA1
Reviews.Content: Checkin took 15 minutes. The room was very worn; the bathroom fixtures were literally worn through. This place appears to have had no work done in twenty years. The shower door had years of calcium buildup and large black areas of uncleaned dirt. The caulking was peeling. (see pictures, room 817 dear management) The tub drain was inoperative in the open position. We had no wireless Internet in our room. When I tried to get a password to log on in the lobby the agent spent five minutes on the phone then handed me the phone for someone in India to reconfirm my name. Then I was put on hold! The agent said they have a third party provider and couldn’t do anything. I hung up when I was put on hold and used free Internet in the Starbucks to write this. The breakfast buffet was extensive and had a great fresh squeezed juice bar. The smoked salmon was very fishy but the staff was friendly. The baby crib was cheap, missing side pads, and of the drop gate style that is no longer available in the USA due to safety concerns. This place might have looked modern in the 80's but time has moved on but the hotel has not. The sofa in our mini suite looked like something out of an 80's garage sale. The once modern light fixture and curtain control was very yellowed with most functions since disabled. It started raining in our room on the last day but the leak was fixed by evening. Our thermostat wandered widely, making the room too hot then too cold. The location was super excellent, right by the Raffles hotel, connected to the MRT on the airport line, and in a mall with a Starbuck with free internet. Shame on the Fairmont chain for putting their name on this relic. Their hotels in the Pacific Northwest such as Victoria, Seattle, Vancouver airport, and Whistler are all excellent, top notch hotels. I expected the same from their brand but am very disappointed. Everyone else likes this place, did I just get a horrible room?

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been made more welcome.”
Reviews.Author: AdrianW1970
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel as a stopover for 3 nights en route to Australia from the UK. From the minute we arrived we felt as if we were important to the hotel. We were properly looked after from the moment of arriving with 2 sleepy children all the way up to departure. Room was fantastic and the breakfast was something else. The swimming pool was great for the children too. The staff were always friendly and helpful and the hotel was very conveniently located if we wanted to wak somewhere or always had taxis available when we needed it. Yes you may well get that at other hotels, but this one seemed to have a bit more to it.

Reviews.Title: “Too much service we have to pay for”
Reviews.Author: redlemon19
Reviews.Content: Yes, it is luxury, yes a smiling lady meets you in the lobby and every evening your bed is kinda prepared for your sleep. But we have to pay for all these luxiries. And after you paid a fortune for staying with them for 5 nights they keep you at 4 am for 20 minutes at check out arguing that you did use 18 dollars taxi on arrival and did not pay for it. Here it comes the true service level. Imagine couple thousands US$ paid for a stay and 20 minute argument at 4 am on 18 dollar for taxi that I didn't use. I did't convince them, they promised to chase and raise a bill later!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay with Fairmont!”
Reviews.Author: Mister7Star
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay with the Fairmont Hotel in Singapore on their Executive Club Floor. We stayed in one of their Plaza View Suites which had an excellent view of the new Marina Bay Sands Hotel/ Casino. The room was spacious with possibly one of the biggest bathrooms we've ever had in a hotel and the beds were very comfortable. We love the Miller Harris toiletries and also the fact that they provide complimentary mouthwash. (I wish all 5 star hotels did this). Unlike our stay at the Westin Kuala Lumpur, the complimentary evening canapes/ drinks in the lounge are still first class. Free flowing Veuve Cliquot and delicious bites to eat are still a wonderful way to relax and enjoy the views of Singapore below. The hotel location is still one of the best. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great service. Rooms need to be renovated.”
Reviews.Author: Ozview
Reviews.Content: Having read so many positive reviews I booked my room for 3 nights with high expectations. The service, location, food and facilities lived up to expectations. The service was memorable and I even received a personalised birthday card and cake during my stay. Terrific. However, the rooms need an upgrade and a makeover. Furniture, wallpaper and decor is quite dated. But, I could over look this thanks to the high level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Simply awesome”
Reviews.Author: chonrock
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the deluxe room with full view of the beautiful bay front. Very nice contemporary design with impressive shower. Breakfast spread was amazing, with American, Japanese, Chinese etc. You name it they have it. Some staff are bit inexperienced but most are superb in their service. Best thing about this place is the location, right next to mall and train station!

Reviews.Title: “one of the excellent place to stay at.”
Reviews.Author: mfarukm
Reviews.Content: i stayed with friends and we had a conference at the same place,it was really nice for us to have indian food all the time and the quality of food was too good,nothing to say about ambience,room cleanliness,service and the staff as all rank high in my review.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, top quality experience”
Reviews.Author: S66gordon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont in Singapore for a week with my son and nephew. The hotel is top class, the breakfast was amazing with huge variety of foods. A huge range of fresh fruits could be juiced to order. The pool was great with towels generously provided, good bar service and an amazing spa area. It was great to be able to wander from the hotel through to the huge shopping mall attached and there was a great supermarket in the basement of the mall which was handy for purchasing juice, snacks and an occassional beer! There was also a huge variety of restaurants and food outlets which were relatively cheap by Singapore standards! Would go back in a minute, the best hotel ever!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTCK
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The hotel has a nice mall downstairs. It is also very centrally located to major sights. We enjoyed the views of the city from our room. Definitely will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby service, tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: JamesSharpe
Reviews.Content: Snotty, unfriendly, unhelpful and tired are the words sadly I have to use to describe this hotel. I guess they are pitching to business travellers who just want to get their head down in a higher class of hotel. This is not a hotel  for vacationers.    I was surprised at the lack lustre greeting at the reception moreover that we had to carry our own bags to the room.  The room finish is shabby with everything extra including the Internet which is extortionately priced in my opinion being used to free Internet  We'd paid for a deluxe room which turns out to be pokey so goodness knows what a standard room would be like  Pool area is ok big thumbs up to Stephanie  working at the pool she actually was the only helpful and courteous member of staff in the entire hotel.  Would I stay again? No, I go across the road again to the Mandarin Oriental and so should you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: allydee
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in Singapore and glad we chose the Fairmont as our base. The Hotel was first class as were the Staff. The breakfasts were superb as was the Restaurant food. The hotel is in a great location, close to Raffles Hotel, the Singapore Flyer and the Marina Bay Sands all of which could be seen from our balcony. The MRt station is directly under the Hotel complex as is a large Shopping Mall with great stores and restaurants which were good for snacks and meals. Hotel rooms were large and bright with bath and shower. All lighting and curtains controlled by bedside controls which was great. A turnover service was provided each night with an orchid laid on the pillow.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: romain524
Reviews.Content: The location is one of the best in Singapore, Rooms are good, but the hotel is too big for me, but staff is smily & helpfull. Also, The breakfast on the lobby floor is perfect, with an amazing variety of food. I recommand this hotel for business trip

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, kids well catered for.”
Reviews.Author: gwiz_oz
Reviews.Content: My first Stay at Fairmont Singapore booked through Qantas holidays. As part of the package we were upgraded to the Executive Club Floor giving us access to the lounge with its free drinks in the evening and soft drinks/fruit juice/water all day which was greate for the kids (need to be 12years and older) Room had great view of Marina Bay sands and CBD and the beds were comfortable to allow kids to share.. Location is great to get around in Singapore with the MRT. Food court below the hotel is very handy to grab a quick/cheap dinner. Can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “As should expected for a hotel of its class”
Reviews.Author: holycap
Reviews.Content: This review was written under the fact that I was able to take advantage of heavily discounted rates at the Fairmont in Singapore, so please take that into account. The hotel itself has changed brand/ownership/franchise/management etc through the years, and it is now managed by Fairmont Raffles Hotels International. The hotel is located in the "Raffles City," with its sister hotel Swissôtel The Stamford within the same complex. The location is, like many high-end hotels in Singapore, ridiculously convenient (MRT located right below complex along with mall, food court). There's a 24/7 Starbucks and McDonald right below too for those that may need those convenience. All staffs were friendly, attentive, and extremely helpful. Although I'm a no frills type of traveler so your results may vary in the type of request/needs you may have. Some minor things I've requested were: turn down service at random hours, power adapter as I forgot to bring mine (given to me for free), and numerous key card replacement as I kept forgetting my key card in the room. Both my stay was in a high floor with decent view, so if a nice view is what you're looking for, request a high floor and you'll be able to enjoy some sights. The rooms itself are well appointed, roomy, fluffy towels, with clean, comfortable pillows, and firm bed. The bed was firm enough that another person can sleep without being disturb. No free WiFi at high-end locations continues to annoy me, but if you're in Fairmont's president club, you should be able to get complimentary internet service (otherwise a steep $13 USD or so per night). Various restaurants are available within the Raffles City complex, and though my friend and I didn't really visit any of them, we gave the Equinox restaurant on floor 70 a try (for the view). Food was average for the price, but the panoramic, ceiling-to-floor glass view of Singapore downtown and central business district can't be beat. If I recall, there was extra fee for a window seating. Overall, the stay at the Fairmont in Singapore was excellent, but certainly won't blow you away if you've been to any of their superb Canadian properties. If you can score a good price and will be needing easy access to the MRT, the Fairmont Singapore can be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you'd expect from a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tutt2
Reviews.Content: We had one night either side of a cruise included in our cruise package. We booked extra nights after the cruise on line prior to a couple of months prior to departure. Hotel staff had no trouble understanding the arrangement and ensured we kept the same room. (if you do have a hotel included as part of package and want extra nights, you'll probably find it a lot cheaper to book the extra nights yourself (it was half the cost the tour operator wanted)). Rooms are tastefully decorated with high quality fixture and fittings and were serviced to a high standard by the cleaning staff. Enjoyed breakfast at the 'Alligator Pear' beside the pool. There was extensive selection of hot and cold food and eggs and omlettes could be cooked to order. Hotel is a great position opposite Raffels and has train station (couple of minutes walk) outside shopping center that hotel backs onto. You can walk to extensive shopping plazas and hop on hop off bus stops opposite. All staff were extremely polite, courteous and helpful and the concierge was particularly helpful in getting on a zoo night tour at short notice.

Reviews.Title: “great place for comfort”
Reviews.Author: marianknits
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel before and always felt it was very comfortable: great bed, nice daybed in front next to tv and across from window. Requests very quickly provided. I had a view of the new casino and ferris w heel which meant a lot of privacy. Room is very quiet and I like the fact that it is just above a lot of shopping and small fast food places with quick access to the MRT. My only complaint is that the staff short sheet the bed so I hve to pull out the sheets in order to keep warm enough. The bathroom includes one of those top shower heads which isn't that easy for me to figure out. I was given some cookies and candy the first night which were delicious and this time I enjoyed the Prego restaurant connected to the hotel. But there's also a large supermarket, bakeries, etc for smaller breakfasts at a fraction of the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JackyYC
Reviews.Content: My first Stay at Fairmont Singapore. i got a great deal through http://www.jagoantravel.com/. Checkin was fast and we believed we were ugraded by the kind-lady (forgot her name) to a deluxe room in the South Tower (with a great view of Marina Bay sands and CBD). The room is perfect for us and the bathroom is my favorite; they have the white glasses all over the place and gave a trendy look. currently, it is my favorite hotel in Singapore (vs Conrad, Marriott and Hilton Singapore). We will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but there's still room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: CoconutHeadHongKong
Reviews.Content: After reading lots of good comment about the hotel, I really have high expectation about the hotel. However when we arrived at the hotel, there is not even a single bell boy to help us unload the luggage(this is min standard for any 4 to 5 star hotel), I only see staff busy directing traffic after a major function that night. It takes about 15mins to check in, to me it is long because there is practically no other guest there except us and the lady keep walking in and out of the back room to access files and bags...... We were greeted by really unfriendly staff when we asked for pillow. He surely had a bad day. Well, I know it wasn't too nice to ask for things when it is about midnight. Luckily, we found out that the "real" housekeeping staff are all very friendly. Operator service is a disaster. Most of the time, there is no one to pick up the call. I need to call about 3 times for each service request. The bed is of really good quality, however we are not used to soft bed at all. It is like we are floating in the sea whole night. The room is big and with a sizable balcony and nice view. I did request for a newly renovated room but judging from the carpet, I think it is not. HHHmmm, I hope that the management will try their best to improve on their service. More friendly, helpful staff that wear a smile and learn to greet the hotel guest despite of where we are from and what we wear. Afterall, we are the "hotel guest".

Reviews.Title: “good position”
Reviews.Author: HellyMbro
Reviews.Content: good position opposite raffles. short walk down to suntec centre where you can get the city tour hop on hop off bus. good sized rooms with great bathroom. ours had a pool view which looked towards the new sands resort. two restaurants for breakfast, both very good. above a large shopping centre which housed many restaurants so very handy if you didnt want to wander too far. all in all a great choice for both location and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel we have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: charltonfc
Reviews.Content: This was a stop off on the way home from oz, and we loved it! All the staff were fantastic,the rooms were perfect and spotless.The only drawback was the noise at night as they were getting ready for the grand prix!, also the breakfast(was included in the price) was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: twofourseven
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont hotel while visiting Singapore for business and for the Singapore Formula 1 Grand Prix. The rooms are clean and impecable. The view incredible and the service first class. I did though think that the fees for using the business facilities were excessive

Reviews.Title: “Have no complaints”
Reviews.Author: fwemhall
Reviews.Content: Having stayed there with my husband in a Raffles Inc room, can heartily recommend it. The breakfasts, room service, concierge were top class, and the security could not be faulted. Loved the bed turn-down, an orchid on the pillow, a mat and slippers by the bed, and rainwater and glass on the bedside table. We thoroughly enjoyed on time there and look forward to a return visit. The staff really made you feel special.

Reviews.Title: “Complete peaceful bliss in a wonderful bustling city!”
Reviews.Author: travelling_solo87
Reviews.Content: My mum and I stayed at the Fairmont Singapore in August. From the moment we walked in at 8:30am we loved every minute of our stay. The lobby area is absolutely gorgeous and has a wonderful scent from the oil burners, lovely soft music playing, gorgeous arrangements of flowers, and the staff and very efficient and helpful without being over-powering. Every time we walked back in after being out exploring the city, the lobby just relaxes you immediately. The hotel is superbly located in Singapore within walking distance to most attractions or public transport. Our room had one of the best beds I have ever slept on and the service was wonderful. I would stay here again and recommend this hotel to anyone. Thanks so much for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a Grand Prix Adventure”
Reviews.Author: Steve from Bristol
Reviews.Content: We were booked in to the Fairmont as part of a motor racing package arranged by a company called Grand Prix Adventures. Hotel is right next to the track - awesome. The whole stay was really good and all aspects of the hotel were spot on, especially as they were so busy with the Grand Prix. Travel operator also excellent if you want to watch Formula One from some of the best places in Singapore in quality surroundings. at the hotel, Initial reception was warm and friendly, rooms were large and well equipped, standard of food was excellent, especially the buffets in the suites that had been arranged by the travel company. Pool and Spa also top notch. I travelled with my son but we will definately return to Singapore with my wife and would stay at the Fairmont again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: SWDM
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel for one night before Cruising in Asia Pacific. The Hotel was great position, and very simple to come to from Chang-hi on Singapore's clean, effective below ground system. The room was up to date and clean, and the the staff were gracious and helpful. We furthermore registered when the title of the Hotel was 'The Raffles Plaza', but will not realize how any person could error it for the Raffles itself. When registration, you only need to gaze at the Hotel photographs, read the recount and gaze at the charges to understand that it's not!!! The Raffles itself is literally over the street, and is a should halt for the Long bar with its well known Singapore Sling, and nutshell enclosed floor

Reviews.Title: “An excellent base in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: CityBreak84
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Fairmont. We were welcomed upon arrival and ushered to reception whilst are bags were dealt with. We were upgraded to a lovely room with a large lounge area. The bed was incredibly comfortable. Bathroom was not the most opulent out there but was of a very good size. We had a balcony overlooking the pool area and skyline. Dinner at the Szechuan restaurant was delicious with stunning views over the city from our booth (don't be surprised that it is connected to both the shopping centre next door and the hotel). The Ink Bar was also lovely with great cocktails - particularly the air mail. In a great location and only a short taxi ride away to all of the main sights. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with great service”
Reviews.Author: beijingnoodle
Reviews.Content: Would recommend this hotel for business and leisure travellers. Not the finest hotel in Singapore, but location is central and staff are most efficient and helpful. Best thing about the guest rooms (I was in room 1037 South Tower with a city view), there are balconies, with sliding glass doors that open - a nice change from most other hotels which don't allow you to open windows at all. Business Center is small but does the job, staff can easily handle requests (unlike those at some other hotels in Asia!). Although I didn't try it, the outdoor pool looked appealing, with a poolside bar and enough patrons so I didn't seem deserted. Would recommend avoiding the pricey hotel restaurant (Prego), and instead trying the many restaurants inside the Raffles City mall, which connects to hotel. Of course, you can always cross the street to the Raffles Hotel, and try a drink at the Long Bar or the courtyard cafe. nice. It's an easy 20 minute walk through the underground shopping links (when the weather is too warm) to the Esplanade, and beyond that a 10 minute stroll (through the park) to the Asian Civilizations museum, which has a pleasant waterside restaurant/bar.

Reviews.Title: “The Fairmont was Mostly Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: joecdn
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Fairmont for 5 days while visiting Singapore. We arrived very early in the morning, so of course our room wasn't ready yet. We decided to have breakfast in Prego - one of the 9 restaurants run by the Swissotel/Fairmont/Raffles complex. The buffet breakfast was absolutely incredible - but very very expensive. We then got to wait in the hospitality suite for our room to be ready. While we didn't expect the room to be ready right away, we were quoted a time that was clearly unrealistic - so it was rather annoying to have to wait several hours longer than we were told. Once we got into our room though, it was fantastic! We were upgraded to a Deluxe Room, which was great! Although we were only on the 7th floor, we still had an amazing room overlooking the Singapore War Memorial, the Marina Bay Sands, the Singapore Flyer, etc.. The bathroom was great, and the minibar well stocked. All of the lights, air conditioning and drapes were operated via bedside control panels. We did have two minor issues - one with the bathroom lights not turning off and the other with the toilet not flushing properly - both were quickly resolved by maintenance. Overall, my major pet peeves were with the ridiculous prices in the outlets - which were easily avoided by going into the several malls that were connected to the hotel. Additionally, they had a fabulous pool and spa area - but you had to pay extra to access the hot tub/steam room/sauna/fitness centre facilities. They also don't have wireless internet access in the rooms, which seems a bit archaic. Otherwise though - it was a fantastic hotel in which to base your Singapore travels!

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: BandonAddict
Reviews.Content: Compared to other 5-star hotels in Asia, the Fairmont may not be at the top of the list, but overall, this was a thumbs-up stay. Usually not the selling point of a hotel, the breakfast at the Fairmont may have been the best part of the stay! - A coffee press at the table for fresh, hot coffee - A fruit juice bar for made-to-order juices (featuring over a dozen different fruits) - 8 or 9 different genres of breakfast food ranging from standard western (bacon & eggs) to asian (chinese, japanese, indian) Located off Orchard Rd. on Bras Basah, there's a lot going on near the hotel: Chinatown, Waterfront, Bugis St., Suntec. The room was relatively spacious and had a nice view of the Marina Bay Sands Casino. The room had a musty smell (likely because of the high humidity in Singapore), but was very clean. The staff were very friendly and were helpful. We had one incident where we asked the concierge if we could get beach towels for a visit to Sentosa beaches, and he came back with facial towels. When we finally got through to him that we were looking for beach towels, he informed us that he would not be able to provide towels of that size. We ended up going to the 8th floor pool and borrowed towels from there, which worked out great. The hotel shares a mall with the Swisshotel, so shopping and dining onsite is a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sdaniel1
Reviews.Content: Just returned yesterday after spending 9 nights at the Fairmont. Stayed in a standard Fairmont room in the North Tower which was very spacious and spotlessly clean. Everything worked perfectly. From the moment I arrived I was treated as if I was the most important person there. Upon arrival I was greeted by three staff members who whisked my bags inside and escorted me from the car to the desk to be checked in. Check in was fast, efficient and friendly. What I found so nice was that all the staff, from very efficient houskeepers to the numerous and very nicely presented staff on duty in the lobby, smiled and greeted you genuinely whenever your paths crossed. One example of the standard of service is when I ordered room service one night. It was only a salad and pizza however the meal was wheeled in on a table complete with complimentary small prawn 'taster' and four different types of bread. I had ordered an ice cream dessert and when I placed the order with room service the lady suggested that they deliver the icecream separately half an hour later so that it didn't melt while I was eating the main course! Sure enough, exactly half an hour later it was delivered. This standard of efficiency was repeated in every contact I had with the hotel staff. As others have said, the location is perfect for exploring Singapore and a little tip for those like me who don't go for big hotel breakfasts. Downstairs at the entrance to the MRT is a 24 hour Starbucks who does a great egg and spinach frittata with turkey bacon, tomato and cheese in a toasted bun and a huge mug of coffee for $5.90 Sing. This was my fourth trip to Singapore and my first stay at the Fairmont and there is now no way that I would stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Singapore Great Service”
Reviews.Author: B2BTraveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location with excellent service. Huge rooms. Great pool area. Great hotel in a great location with 5 star service. I will stay there again Internet access a little high priced but it was excellent speed. Hotel offers efficient service, high quality lodgings and an excellent location (connected to a large shopping mall). We booked via this website and got 20% off - http://bit.ly/buLcik

Reviews.Title: “lovely and worth staying”
Reviews.Author: simone64
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for one night and almost 2 days and enjoyed the location, we didnt have the breakfast and ended up wondering around and spent up at another hotel that wasnt very good--forgotten name, and the foodcourt next door, which is great later in day wasnt open for breakfast...the pool was great for our daughters 9 and 12...and the rooms were comfortable and well appointed. we liked chinatown and one of our highlights were the fantastic food in singapore and all very reasonable price. fairmont checkin was easy and they were very generous in allowing us to stay much later as our plane flew out to greece at 1am....

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: J0lly_R0ger
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located across the road from "Raffles" hotel, near the marina bay area. Stayed in the Raffles deluxe category of room. This provides a dedicated "executive lounge" for breakfast & dinner so you are in quieter surroundings, as use of this is by raffles deluxe room guests only. Access to a private gym is also part of this room category. Complimentary high speed internet access also available Room was a corner room which is bigger then the none corner rooms. Quality was good with electronic controls for controlling all lights and curtains from 1 single box available either side of the bed. En suite was ok but could have done with better shower design as water tended to go over the very low shower rim on the floor for veggies, the "executive lounge" breakfast is limited...never had any of the evening meals there as always eat out. When we did visit on one occasion, there were no veggie options. There is comprehensive 24hr room service menu available which had a good selection of vegetarian options

Reviews.Title: “A modern oasis in the middle of the city”
Reviews.Author: MinasR
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, attached to one of the majos city malls and a metro station. Superb service, rooms and most of all dream breakfast at the pool

Reviews.Title: “Very comfy.....but,”
Reviews.Author: MrLuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: I am a regular at this hotel almost every time I visit Singapore. I will continue to stay at this hotel despite the issues I had with my room. This trip I stayed 4 nights as my family were also visiting from overseas and had rooms of their own. Their rooms were even more spacious by the way. It's a great hotel with excellent location. It's close to the malls, restaurants, entertainment, events, the MRT, etc. The staff are very friendly, courteous, and polite no matter which part of the hotel you're at. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable. Pretty much everything you need for a perfect stay. However, this last trip the internet was very flaky.....and kept disconnecting every few several seconds. I contacted and spoke to technical support, and the hotel even sent a technician up to try and fix it, but nothing worked. I bore with it through the 4 nights as the hotel was fully booked and their were no other rooms available. Another issue was that the ceiling outside the bathroom was leaking quite profusely for three of the four nights I was there. Something to do with the air conditioning unit. It was a bit of a hassle to need to keep calling for the engineers to come up to take a look and fix it, but I put up with it as each time I thought it was fixed for good. Plus again, there were no other rooms available. I did sleep very well through the night though, which was great. The windows are double glazed so it's very quiet.....and for fresh air, you can open the sliding window doors to the balcony. Ok, I won't complain too much about the room as I got excellent discounted rates, even during a peak event season. Yes, I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: ahmlaw
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont this July 2010 (Rm 1832), my second time in seven months. I am in Singapore at least twice a year, and have tried several 5-star hotels, and the best so far is the Fairmont. I will always stay here in the future, if they continue to maintain their exceptional standards. The location is perfect: within the Raffles Mall complex, with the City Hall MRT Station right below the mall. It is a short walk (5-10 mins) to several other malls (Marina Square, Suntec, City Mall), and just 5 minute walk to Funan, the IT Mall for all your electronic/computer needs. The Esplanade, where shows and musical events are often staged, is practically next door to the hotel. The buffet breakfast is awesome, the selection wide and varied. And breakfast is until 11:00am; a consideration if you want to sleep in late. And I cannot say enough about the rooms and bathrooms: large rooms, very comfortable wide double beds with the softest and whitest sheets, well laid out bathroom with fluffy white towels and robes, and a good selection of amenities. Complimentary bottled water provided, and if you need more, just ask. An additional word about the bathroom lay-out: I particularly like the fact that the shower area is separated from the tub, but not a separate stall, so you have easy access/reach to the tub. It is a design that really works. Also, the shower includes both the usual hand-held shower, as well as a large “rain-shower”, which is a great feature. Perhaps the only small negatives – and these are very VERY minor – are the lack of a DVD player in the room, and lousy complimentary coffee. DVD players are fairly standard in several high-end Asian hotels, which recognize the value of having a decent entertainment system for each room. Complimentary coffee: only mediocre instant coffee in sachets; other hotels already have brewed coffee facilities, using branded coffee like Lavazza. But, I must emphasize these are minor details, and do not deter AT ALL from the fact that this is a truly excellent hotel. I had written an earlier review of this hotel (January 2010), but am writing another to include pictures of the room, the bathroom, and the view from the balcony (each room has a small balcony). Note the very efficient bathroom lay-out.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay here.”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowSiobhan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days in July as and we loved it here! We arrived at 8.30 am and within 30 minutes our room was ready. We were also given the use of a suite whilst we waited. Our room was great. Newly decorated, very clean and very luxurious! The bed was massive - If we lay at either side of the bed, we couldn't touch each other when we reached over! Our massive balcony looked over Raffles Hotel. The bathroom was very clean, large and modern with the raindrop shower....... this was amazing! At night, our bed had been turned down and music was playing softly in the room. There was a little fushia sitting on my pillow and a bottle of water next to my bed. Our slippers were sat next to the bed and we were also given ice too. The thing that made this hotel different from others was the fantastic service and the friendly staff. Everyone was so nice and so helpful. The pool was nice, well kept and again, the staff were great. They did so much for you that I felt so guilty. They also came around the pool with water and cocktails for free. You can also order food at the pool to. We didn't eat there but other people's food looked great. There are not showers at the pool but if you take the set of stairs from the pool, you are straight into the spa changing rooms. SPA - clean, modern. Changing rooms are great, all the essentials (and more) that you need. There is also a gym. As others have said - less than 5 minutes to esplanade and city hall stations. Great mall with lots shops and food places attached onto the hotel. It is really central for sightseeing. There is also a business centre of internet, etc. IF YOU ARE IN SINGAPORE - STAY HERE - YOU WONT REGRET IT!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel base for Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Zeusco
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont on our way back from Australia and New Zealand. Service was exemplary and we had a superb room overlooking Raffles. The hotel is within easy walking distance from the river, the museums, the cricket ground and the business centre with a large mall directly below the hotel itself. The staff are extremely helpful and we recommend going on the night safari excursion at the zoo which adds a whole new perspective on viewing the animals.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: glesgatraveller
Reviews.Content: You definatly get more for your money in the far east, im sure our 5stars are considered 3star in asia, we stayed for 3 nights and loved it, yes some may say the rooms could be typical room in any hotel but its the wee touches that make your stay enjoyable. the rooms are spacious, with the robes slippers ice in the buckets for etc, the complimentry fruit kebab and small soft drink that you get by the pool remind you that you arent in europe. taxi to and from the airport was about £10 each way. there is a lot to see and do around the hotel you have to make the effort to go further afield. Breakfast are amazing best ive seen in a long time. go and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: groovyb
Reviews.Content: I don't need to add to the already positive reviews. The place was a very nice and clean hotel. Here's what some of the reviews might not say: -It's about a 7-10 minute walk from the Esplanade Subway Stop -It's connected to a big mall and the downstairs has an awesome grocery store. Great place to get drinks, snacks, etc for the room/traveling around -It took us about 15 minutes to walk to the Arab District -20 minutes to Little India -Across the street from the Raffles Hotel -Nice gym

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: macymae2004
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything you would expect, and a little bit more. The staff are very helpfull. Our teenage daughter was ill, (still is, we're still here! No time like the present.) They organised a doctor very quickly. Also cancelled an expensive pre booked tour. A short but very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hote Perfectly to Explore Singapore”
Reviews.Author: xyz1999
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situted in the heart of the colonial Singapore in direct neighborship to the Raffles Hotel where you should go to drink a Singapore Sling during your stay. With a 5 minutes walk you can reach the river bank where lots of shops and restaurants can be found. Also 5 minutes away is the Orchard road where the big shopping centers are located. The service in the hotel is very good and trips can be arraged. The pool is not to big, but nice.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning, Fantastic and Very classy ++”
Reviews.Author: chocolatefriend
Reviews.Content: Had 4 nights in the South Tower, booked direct on the hotels website at the end of last year. Got a great deal ! Joined the Presidents Club and upgraded to Raffles Inc for $50 extra a night. This then gave up access to drinks and nibbles (which you could use as dinner), free internet on computer provided and daily breakfast all on the 24th Floor. You can have breakfast at Prego instead where there is much greater variety but of course more people. Our room of the 20th floor was the best as it looked straight out across to the wheel and beyond. If you are on the side you can get the Swiss Hotel looking on an angle though towards you. Stay on a Sat night and you get fireworks from your balcony as they practice for the National Day parade. Walk to Clarke Quay for dinner but stay away from the touts at Boat Quay. Staff at the hotel are wonderful, the room and amenties are terrific, bed is great, towels and bathroom wonderful. Just a delight to stay at. Checkin and out quick. Willow Spa staff lovely.Taxi about $18 to airport and about 20 mins away. We wanted to stay longer and will go back again ! Just the most wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service but do ask for a renovated room”
Reviews.Author: Strabo
Reviews.Content: Ours was a complimentary room stay from a credit card package. We requested a room with 2 double beds. I believe we got a suite of sorts as it was huge with a 3.5 seater sofa, with lots of space to move around. However, it wasn't a newly renovated room like you see in the photos on the hotel website. Furniture & fittings looked a bit old. I believe we were allocated this room as it was complimentary. So do request for a renovated room. The furniture looked a bit worse for wear - especially the sofa. The washbasin taps were stiff & had grime caked under them. Shower curtain had mildew (unacceptable for a hotel of this standing). Wall flush button was problematic as it kept on getting stuck after flushing & you had to keep fiddling with it before the water would stop flowing - needs servicing! But where the hotel really shines is their service. Check in & check out was quick & friendly. The doormen were a delight - always cheerful & never failed to greet us! We set up a morning call & presumed it was one of those automated things so when the phone rang, we just lifted the receiver & put it back down. Phone rang the 2nd time & we did the same. In 15 mins someone from housekeeping rang our doorbell to check that we were actually up. 5 mins later another phone call to double check. That is fantastic service. They really do make sure you are up!

Reviews.Title: “A rollercoaster ride - at its best brilliant and its worst despairing”
Reviews.Author: teamflames
Reviews.Content: Without the help of the manager Shaik this 2 week stay would have been a disaster! We arrived to the Presidents check in desk which was going along as expected and Shaik happened to come by and see we were staying for 2 weeks and he really appreciated that it was a decent stay. He went out of his way to make it a great check in and took us to the room and we were very impressed. Unfortunately from then on we had problems with the shower with no hot water and no pressure - every time we asked it to be fixed we were promised it would be fixed. Pleading, begging, screaming didnt work; asking to be changed to another room didnt work. Finally Shaik came back from his exile and immediatly came to the room saw that the shower wasnt right and immediatly upgraded us to a suite. That was a good response but after 9 days it was a bit late. I actually showered in the gym 3 times just to have a hot shower - and the worst was Shaik admitted all my calls, request and complaints were sitting there on the system despite reception continually denying this. I guess if u go here try and get Shaik to look after u because the rest of the reception staff were like brain dead zombies (not unusual in sing) you might be ok. Even Shaik himself as manager asked them to deliver a vase 3 times and it never arrived hahaha. As for the rest of the hotel - rooms were very good size and seem to have been renovated; bathrooms were very large (but pointless when they dont work); balconies. The common areas were a little dated. Breakfast was very good with huge range to choose from (esp in Prego). Gym is very good for those wanting workout and the wet spa area was also very handy. Swimming pool was ok, tennis courts were good. Used room service and this is one area where the service was outstanding. Used laundry several times - got my initial order wrong (despite explaining 4 times) but afterwards was very good. Various eateries to choose from and we ate at the schezuan ct (both the restaurant and the cafe are very good); kopitiam - good for a cheapie but u will get the same food at a hawker centre much cheaper again. Through the President club we received free internet and for only $10 hired the fitness gear which was cleaned everyday (h/w this is a bit of a drama as no one at the hotel seemed to know how it works). Location is great and is connected to shopping centre and plenty of bars and restaurants around there (if u want service worse than this hotel try double bay next door it was so bad u just laughed). So after a 2 week stay - great first day followed by a week of absolute pain (to say that front desk serice was inept would be a compliment!) followed by 4 good days to finish left us feeling very mixed. Could have been a great stay - but after initial promises of potential room upgrade and weekly surprises that were not delivered on and then the unresolved plumbing problems we were very angry and this was softened by the royal treatment being laid put from Shaik on the last 4 days and we left in better spirits. Think management might want to give this man a payrise

Reviews.Title: “Great place for extended stay!”
Reviews.Author: DesiCouple
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont for long periods from Aug 2008 to Apr 2009 (used to check out on alternate weekends); Basically it had become a home-away-from-home!! Location is great, right on top of the MRT station and obviously cabs are also available anytime of the day Great food options - whether in the hotel itself, or in the basement; Something for every taste and cuisine!! Once they figure out your preferences, then everything is like clockwork - right from early check-in, to type of pillows, and not to forget - the great chocolate platter that used to be placed in the room at every check-in!!

Reviews.Title: “The best service ever!”
Reviews.Author: tia_t
Reviews.Content: The staff and service at this hotel would go above and beyond for you. Concierge was extremely helpful - we were after two (very last minute) tickets to Universal Studios, concierge was able to contacted a nearby sales agent and had the the tickets delivered to our hotel. Our room was spacious and clean. The location was great, walking distance to the Singapore Flyer and Marina Bay Sands. City Hall MRT was right at our doorstep and there's also a shopping centre next door with a very cheap food court. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel - great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Surya_Radhika
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Fairmont after reading great reviews on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. The hotel was superb and each and every staff was incredibly polite and helpful at all times. The location was good, the room clean and the bed comfortable. We had a wonderful time and would definitely be staying at Fairmont Singapore in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous hotel at all levels”
Reviews.Author: wendyoodian
Reviews.Content: Warm Welcome. Incredible room. Wonderful view from the room over the city. So much little attentions were found in the room. Dedicated staff. Service went beyond my expectations. Am myself from the hotel industry and is usually very demanding as regards to the level of service but nothing to complain about. No disturbance from the staff. When we wanted our room to be cleaned we just had to press a button and the needful was done in a quick and efficient way, really appreciated it which we cannot find in Hotels in my country. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Retro”
Reviews.Author: frithnow
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel in a good location. Super King plus plus sized bed is an acre of comfort. The interior designers look like they had a pretty free rein when this joint was built. The remote control by the bed that controls the curtains and lights is fun once deciphered (preferably done when sober). The light switches, the taps and the flush button are guaranteed to be different to any others you've ever encountered. We had an enormous corner room, very good value. Pool is large, deep and generally fantastic (there is a second pool which is large shallow and probably fanstatstic as well). The change rooms are a disappointment though, ther're just toilets, nowhere to hang anything no showers, no lockers.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Hotel lived up to my great expectations in every way.”
Reviews.Author: AussiesX5
Reviews.Content: I chose The Fairmont Hotel in Singapore after researching hotels on the Tripadvisor site. I have visited Singapore on several ocassions in the past 30 years and stayed in backpacker hotels right through to other 5 star hotels. However the Fairmont stood out in the reviews and its location on top of Raffles City Shopping Centre and the City Hall MRT station made it the best combination possible. Prior to making my 11 night booking I joined the complimentary President's Club and was offered many privileges free to members of this Fairmont club. It was a smart decision, we received complimentary buffet breakfasts, our room was upgraded from where we had a fantastic view over Raffles, and the new Marina Bay area and casino. So much to look at from our own private veranda. We had free internet, turn down service and bottled water. The room was very comfortable, the bed so comfy I wanted to pack it in my suitcase and take it home. The rain forest shower head was a dream to shower under after living in drought ravaged Australia. Location was great, access to the supermarket and shops underneath the hotel was by escalator, as was the MRT. WE had 12 days in Singapore and still did not manage to see everything or get bored for a single moment. High lights of our stay besides the delicious breakfasts by the pool at Crocodile Pear were the middle of the night sorties to the Mustaffa Centre a 24 hr department store in Little India (Farrer Park MRT station), and a visit to the sky garden on top of the Marina Sands Hotel. Food is cheap and delicious , getting around by MRT efficient and safe at all hours. The different ethic areas are well worth visiting, just coming to Singapore and shopping in Orchard Road is to waste a visit to Singapore. It has so much more to offer than a shopping stop over. And hotels like the Fairmont make your stay perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel and Fabulous Breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: theshannons1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel for 2 nights paying for the 'Raffles Inclusive Deluxe with breakfast' After a long flight from London we arrived exhausted and shell shocked.We arrived on the early morning flight and unfortunately had to wait until 2pm to get into our room.However it was worth the wait.The room was bright, airy ,spotless and we also had fantastic views.We had separate beds which were queensize and extremely comfortable with the biggest pillows I have ever seen. As part of the raffles deal we had access to our own lounge to use whenever we wanted which also included free wi fi, snacks and cocktails in the evening. The pool was well organised with huge sun loungers, free use of huge white towels and an immaculate swimming pool.We were also given fresh fruit and juice by the poolside which was free and the staff at all times were gracious, friendly and so helpful. Now the breakfast!!I have never witnessed such a variety of food.They catered for every nationality and you could sample as many different foods and also eat as much as you wanted.There were several chefs available to cook anything you wished.In fact there was one 'chef' who juiced any fruits you wanted!Everything was spotless and we were made to feel so important without the stuffiness you can sometimes get in hotels. We would highly recommend this hotel and this package which was extremely good value especially if, like us you intend to travel onwards to Australia.My only regret was not coming back here on our return home.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Chrissy1780
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Fairmont during my visit to Singapore. It's in the middle of downtown right above an MRT station and attached to a huge mall. It's so convenient to everything to Singapore, especially since this was my first time visiting. My room was in the South Tower and it was small but newly renovated. My only issue with the hotel is that the bathroom albeit brand new and modern looking completely impractical. It doesn't have any towel hooks, the sink is a little high so I always got my top wet when washing my face and the shower only has a half wall so water would always leak into the rest of the bathroom. But the rest of the room is great and clean. The reason to stay here though is the service, staff are warm and accomodating.Hotel is luxurious but not intimidating.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, if rather impersonal.”
Reviews.Author: rdf88
Reviews.Content: Hotel has towers which it seems to share with Stamford. I stayed in North Tower on a business trip. Breakfast was superb with everything to chose from in either the cafe on level 7 near the pool or the restaurant on the ground floor. You can get good coffee (espresso) if you ask for it. Room clean and well serviced. Person doing my room wouldn't let me back in at one stage and claimed my keycard didn't open the door. Had to point out that it didn't work because the door was already open and was forced to prove this by going out and coming back in again with my key. Got punished for this though by him not leaving me any chocolates! Took AGES to connect to the internet. Spent 30 min on phone with the company to no avail but suspect the problem was a faulty internet plug, which they fixed while I was out. Hotel seemed full of students who were running around making a racket to 1-2 am. Some of my colleagues had the same experience on other floors. Aircond a bit cold but I turned it off and found the room stayed adequately cool without it. Service always turned it back on anyway so the room never got hot. No idea how much it cost as I wasn't paying.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service”
Reviews.Author: ToniaYVR
Reviews.Content: As I arrive at the hotel I had the Guest Relations Manager waiting outside for me.. she then escorted me to my room which was ready! I arrive before 9:00! Normally rooms are available only after 2 pm! I was sooo pleased! The next day I find out that the volcano from Iceland had erupted and it turns out that my flight was the LAST SQ flight out of the UK! So the hotel is of course packed with guests unable to leave etc... Despite all that "chaos" I did not any disturbance. I was comfortable during my full week's stay!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: rini47
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont has a great location- central and very close to some of the best shopping. The rooms specially on the Club floor facing the Bay are beautiful and spacious. The beds are very comfortable and the bathrooms amazing. It has several good restaurants - and all amenities. Highly recommended specially for business travellersl

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in town”
Reviews.Author: BabyJ_11
Reviews.Content: I held my best friend's birthday at Fairmont, it was perfect. Hotel staff cannot be more accomodating. As a result of their great service, we were able to create a great party and the birthday girl was delighted. Plus certain rooms are able to accomodate the fireworks view during the National Day Parade and preview, also the F1 races. Therefore their rooms are very in demand and worth the value for each event. Perfection central location also allows easy access, and the restaurants in the area are great. Located above a shopping center, this is the best location for a city break. Even for locals.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location, Awesome selection of restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Fredrick
Reviews.Content: Great hotel though you can get similar service at a lower price. But the location is to die offer being opposite Raffles, walking distance from the riverside as well as esplanade and one MRT stop away from Raffles place. I can't think of a better place to stay if you're going onbusiness and need to visit the financial district often.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: PerpetualWanderlust
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is a decent option for a stay in the business district. Located right over the City Hall MRT station, it's very easy to get to. Its a regular business hotel. The service delivers what you need. The rooms are spacious and adequately appointed. I thought the food options could be a bit wider to cater to various travellers. I felt the hotel's food choices were few. The sleep was comfortable. The check-in and check-out were eventless. Its a utilitarian hotel and recommended for business stays.

Reviews.Title: “Don't care...”
Reviews.Author: ChrisandDave0
Reviews.Content: The staff at the front desk didn't really care that the bar fridge was leaking, had a broken base and a missing facade. We stayed for 3 nights in May 2010 and were thoroughly dissapointed in the room quality - its quite old and needs an update, has terrible plumbing isn't well sound-proofed and the staff weren't really very helpful, but quite happy to enter the room when it suited them. Internet access is both a pain to access and really quite expensive. The only positive point was the pool area and the nice doorman that led to the adjoining shopping centre. Hardly a reason to stay here. Really disappointing that QANTAS holidays are associated with this hotel - they could do way better and so can you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Rockingg
Reviews.Content: Great to stay in, very comfortable experience...good food and quick service. excellent hospitality

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fantastic views of the city from higher floors”
Reviews.Author: anilutta
Reviews.Content: Besides all state of the art amenities, great location etc the most surprising (pleasantly suprising) part about this hotel is the room size. The rooms are very spacious giveing you ample scope for movement and comfort when sharing it with another colleague. True to the shop till you drop reputation of Singapore, the hotel is located right on top of a mall. Very well connected with mutiple modes of transport right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: hhoul
Reviews.Content: People are nice and the service not bad but the hotel is a little old.

Reviews.Title: “Short but totally sweet...”
Reviews.Author: octopusmessiah
Reviews.Content: Our flight to Singapore was delayed for five hours so we arrived at the Fairmont at 10pm, having to leave at 6am the next morning—missing our dinner reservations at Inagiku and unable to explore the facilities or take advantage of all the perks of our cozy, well-appointed Raffles Club room. That being said, the Fairmont delivered such amazing service for the brief time we were there, I feel obligated to commend them with this review.
