Not only was the staff exceptionally efficient and welcoming given our rushed circumstance but there was a complimentary (and delicious) birthday cake, signed card and bottle of wine already waiting in our room. We ordered room service which was not only excellent and reasonably priced but came with table, chairs, hot pizza oven and perhaps the best Vietnamese-style spring roll I have ever eaten. Having a balcony was treat for the cheeky smoker among us, the view is spectacular, the bed is extremely comfortable and everyone we encountered was unfailingly courteous and helpful. Our short run at the breakfast buffet before our morning flight was also delicious, especially the fruit and cheeses, catered to many international tastes and left us craving more. In short, after trying out three hotels in Singapore of a similar star rating, we will definitely be returning to the Fairmont on our next visit. One final note: make sure to take advantage of their early-booking discounts. If we hadn’t, this fine hotel overlooking the Raffles complex would have been completely out of our price range.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: BLUELAGOON1
Reviews.Content: The stay at "THE FAIRMONT, SINGAPORE" was the beginning of my 40th Birthday trip on a long-haul journey. We were on the 9th floor directly opposite the "Raffles Hotel" and our upgraded room (through Trailfinders!) was lovely. Extra large bedroom and bathroom, Wi-Fi and every whim catered for. The Staff bent over backwards and the pool/bar area was peaceful (Spa fabulous!) relaxing and made you wan't to come back for more Singapore Slings (which I hasten to add are "made" in front of you and not scooped from the VAT of gloop in the Raffles Hotel opposite in the Long Bar with an over-priced price to match !. Fantastic, Lovely, catered to our every need, lovely varied breakfast, wonderful evening meals and overall, the best Hotel Hubbie and I have stayed in so far. We were soooooo impressed that we have booked in again ! Onwards to the Shangri-Lar Rasa Sayang in Malaysia and the Traders, KL.

Reviews.Title: “Every time I've travelled to Singapore I've stayed here - which speaks for itself.”
Reviews.Author: scoobyshunnybuns
Reviews.Content: I've stayed several times at the Fairmont in Singapore, in a variety of rooms - one was musty smelling (like it had gotten damp and not completely dried out) - when I requested a change, staff were happy to move me. A couple of times I've scored free upgrades to the "Raffles Inc" floor - yes, rooms are of a higher quality, and the scrambled eggs are better in the private lounge...but the standard rooms seem to be just as good. A lot of other reviews here have said it all already - its a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Indulge yourself, go Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: Shohreh-Koorosh
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. It is a real 5 stars hotel. We stayed there for 2 nights (checkin 18th May 2010). Everything from the time we arrived till the day we left was superb. Grat location, quick access to City Hall MRT station, shortish walk to Clarke Quay and shopping centers. Our room 1436 (south tower) was spacious, very clean, with a huge bathroom and excellent views, which we appreciated. (THANKS TO Ms. SAKURA) We really recommended this hotel to our friends. Do not hesitate, Indulge yourself, Go Fairmont Singapore Shohreh & Koorosh

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again, but...”
Reviews.Author: Kartvelebi
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect about this hotel, except for upon arrival, as my wife went through the standard inspection of the room before we can unpack and relax, we found stray hairs on the bed sheets and the padding under the sheets had blood stains showing through. The hotel graciously sent us to another room, which worked out fine. Yes, I guess there's no place as clean as your home, but this counts as "two strikes" and a hotel of this caliber should not have allowed that bed padding back into circulation. Moving on to the other aspects of our stay...the location was perfect for shopping and sightseeing. The hotel is attached to an excellent shopping mall. There are lots of food options close by. The rooms were a bit small, but this is SE Asia and space is a premium in Singapore. The bed was fantastic. We stayed on the Club Floor. The Club Lounge was ok, but certainly not as generous or luxurious as many others. It served its purpose. Be careful of the concierge's recommendations. Although I'm always a bit wary of taking their recommendations for restaurants, etc. But, I really wanted Sushi and thought Singapore might have some excellent offerings. The concierge sent us to a place that was fantastically overpriced and hit us for all kinds of charges that are not normal in a Sushi restaurant. There other places that were better (and better value) much closer by that we only discovered after walking around. Did they do this on purpose? Well based on several interactions, I'd say that it wasn't a coincidence. Use them for information, but not recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Singapore and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: DINGDONG1100
Reviews.Content: A right place to stay in Singapore because it's location, just sit on the city hall MTR station and city hall plaza with great shops also walking distance to Suntec city and Esplander center, the marina bay park. Room is very big clean and comfortable with a balcony can walk outside. I am very satisfied with the bath room and their shampoo and shower gel. Complimentary breakfast at the Prego restaurant on 1st floor is perfert with four style of food, Chinese/Indian/Japanese and western, more choice than the 8th floor pool side one. Fresh fruit and Juice is very nice. My baby and parents loves here. Although very noisy on the street but the door is good enough to keep it out.

Reviews.Title: “A thoroughly enjoyable modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulbriden
Reviews.Content: NIce room if on the small side. Very clean. Superb breakfast bar and more smoothies than you could ever imagine. Great Gym. Close to shopping arcade. Two pools but they share them with the Stanford hotel, not an issue though. Nice staff. Not one of the famous hotels here, but very commendable.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded Review deserved!”
Reviews.Author: Global_traveller2000
Reviews.Content: After my catastrophic stays at the fairmont the last few times, I wasn't sure I wanted to return again. This year, I initially wanted book in at the Mandarin oriental, but due to the singapore airshow, MO was booked out completely. So I decided to give the Fairmont another chance and see what goes, still can't beat their location. Book a north tower room with the Singapore airlines travel office together with my airfares. Touched down at T3 Changi from Zurich at 6am, was at the hotel by 7:00am. Cab driver did not want to accept our large notes for the $16 cab fare and his credit card machine did not want to work. Surprise no.1, the doorman of the fairmont came to our rescue and offered to pay for us then charge it to our room. Very friendly malay boy. We had initially requested for early check-in, but did not expect much cause the hotel was also fully booked due to the Singapore airshow. Surprise no.2, the receptionist was very friendly and accommodating. No longer the sultry hostile indonesian women like my last stays, thank goodness. surprise no.3, room was ready for check-in at 7am! What a treat, we couldn't wait for a shower after the long flight. Receptionist apologized because they did not have a room on the top floors (I wanted to avoid the taxi whistles from downstairs!); so he put us on the 13th floor. North tower rooms were as familiar as the last times. Lovely buttons by the bed were still there and working. The moment we entered the room it was !WOW! what a view! The sun was just beginning to rise and we had a full view of Suntec, the Singapore Flyer, and Singapore casino right from our balcony. The view was unbeatable! The balcony makes it much easier to take pictures without having to photograph the glass window! Room was clean, bathroom spotless blanc white as usual. Only complaint - The hotel should probably check the rain shower heads as ours had green rust all around it and I didn't feel like I wanted to shower with rusty water. But water pressure is very good for a strong shower/bath. The mueller harris toiletries are still there OMG! but I think they smell less like liquid detergent at the moment.... Fluffy white bathrobes and slippers provided, as well as a in room safe and coffee/tea making facilities. We had nightly turn down service and the staff would leave a lovely fresh orchid by the ice container. Cannot praise the spa staff enough, the girls are very attentive and good at their work. Worth every penny I paid for the treatment. Hotel staff are very friendly esp the nice man with the turban who kept opening the doors for me and called the bellboy to assist me with my shopping bags! Had booked a room with breakfast at Prego downstairs. The food spread (western, asian, continental) was pretty good and refilled quickly. Most days we took the mrt everyday for a few bucks, and one day we took the Singapore airlines hop on hop off bus from suntec city around the island for less than S$8 per person, very good value. Very good location for access all over the island including chinatown, little india and sentosa. Walking distance to clarke Quay and marina bay, so we could walk to the Flyer and down to the merlion. Hotel is located right on top of the City hall mrt station and raffles city shopping complex. Only too bad that the restaurants and shops at the raffles city mall open around 10am, so we were walking all around the deserted place looking for a proper breakfast. There is a supermarket at the basement of the mall where I got drinking water and alcohol (at half the price of the minibar!!) as well as a good money changer who gave pretty good exchange rates. Check-out was very quick, and we were at the airport within 20 mins and had a very enjoyable ride with a talkative cab driver who told us everything about singapore politics! Overall, the hotel has greatly improved since my last stays. I hope the management keeps up with their standard and thank you to the Fairmont team for making our stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “not really 5*”
Reviews.Author: MichaelofArabia
Reviews.Content: Checked in at 10.30 am and was told that the booked deluxe room was not ready. After an hour wait we were told that they could not provide us with the booked deluxe room on time and were told that we need to wait longer, or a downgrade to a standard room was offered. (First time in my life that I have been offered a downgrade when a room was not ready). We were told that the newly refurbished standard rooms were the same as the deluxe rooms anyway (So what the point paying more for a deluxe-room?). The room was very disappointing. The bathroom had the size of an IBIS hotel bathroom; with a plastic curtain and the shower had to be taken in the bathtub. Overall a rather disappointing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Signature Rooms are bad !!”
Reviews.Author: JamesVki
Reviews.Content: I stay in Singapore every month so have experienced every 4.5 to 5 star properties there are, I stayed at this property only a few weeks before in one of there standard rooms and was really impressed with there service and the rooms and most of all the beds, it was there own mattress system. This time I stayed in one of there Signature Rooms and wow was i disappointed, the bed was ok but not the same mattress, the TV was so small and far away they really needed to issue you with binoculars to watch it form your bed, the TV reception was also bad, the furniture was very old and very worn, stains all over the carpet and lounge, carpet was just literally thread bear, the handles on the vanity were so old, worn out and dirty, lights and AC controls by the bed were unreadable, the Bose stereo system is so old you cant plug your ipod into it. the the bathroom was shocking dust on the lamps, mold on the tiles and on the celling, toilet didnt flush very well, toilet seat chipped. I was really really disappointed with this property, I no that not all there rooms are like this but what a cheek putting me in there and when i was paying top dollar for it too. The room didn't resemble anything like the photos on there website. When you paying $400 + a night I do expect more then this! The plus side of this hotel is its great location in the Raffles / Marina area. Also staff are normally really helpful and attentive, Standard rooms are normally fine if you get then at a good price, they use "miller harris" bathroom amenities. They have a nice pool that is shared with the Swissotel.

Reviews.Title: “City centre service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: shanemat84
Reviews.Content: Booked a room with two double beds for two nights which were more than adequate for my family and I. The hotel is ideally located on top of a large shopping centre (with food court) and MRT station and within walking distance of many of the city sites. The view from our 22nd floor room into Chimes and Raffles hotel were impressive. Hotel contacted me before our check in to confirm our arrival time which was quite late and ensured that we were in our room with miniium time wasted. They also were able to offer us a later check out and access to a hospitality room on our departure. The conceige was very knowledgable and was able to point us to all the required shops. But the real stars were the staff in the spa who found an elegant solution to two small sweaty boys who badly needed a shower before a 12 hour flight. Have to say it is on my revisit list.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Sagar S
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location. Hotel is right above Raffles City Shopping Center bang in the middle of Singapore. MRT is at the door step of the hotel and this means that if you are travelling light, you could take a train from Changi airport (for only S$2 ) and reach the door step of Fairmont in only 27 minutes. A big supermarket (called market place) at the basement of the hotel. 5 mins walk through the under pass (city link) to Suntech convention and expo. thats about location. The hotel staff are friendly and courteous. If you are staying in the higher floors you will be treated to a magnificient view. Nice hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant experience”
Reviews.Author: shaanke
Reviews.Content: Staying at the fairmont Hotel was a treat. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are spacious and clean. The hotel is very accomodating. The breakfast might not be the most delicious, but it caters to all. the spread is wide and options given to you are too many to choose from. The Internet service which was of utmost importance...never failed. I would surely stay at the faimont again when I visit singapore

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: DagFH
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights, 13-17 Feb 2010 at the Fairmont. Went by taxi from the Chiangi Airport, cost SGD 27:- (approx Euro 14:-) at around 19:00 hrs a Friday early evening. We had a Deluxe room (no 1533) in the South Tower (15th floor), with a magnificent view over parts of the Marina Bay; the Padang (the park belonging to the Singapore Recreation Club); the War Memorial Park; the modern financial district with the glassy skyscrapers etc. We found the location to be nice. Had no problems walking to the areas around Clarke Quay and the Fullerton Hotel (which is an incredible nice building). We even went by feet to China Town. However, the heat was very tough (even for the locals) with daily temperatures around 35 Centigrade. Next to the Fairmont is the famous Raffles Hotel. Off course we had Singapore Slings at the famous bar, where we even threw peanut shells on the floor. Very touristic…the price was ridiculous: SGD 104:- (approx Euro 54:-) for the two drinks! Directly connected to the Fairmont is a large shopping mall (there are a lot of them around), this one even with a MRT station. Very easy access; cheap to travel with; extremely clean; very well marked with signs at every station. We did not have breakfast at the hotel, instead we went down to the shopping mall in the basement of the Fairmont and hade really good coffee and sandwiches, yoghurt etc. At reasonable costs. Very nice is that the hotel has a swimmpingpool outside at the 5th floor (sharing that one with the neighbour - really large - Swisshotel the Stamford). We used it with delight! Not crowdy at all during our stay. The Chinese New Year was celebrated during our stay. A lot of shops were closed for a couple of days, and a lot of people had left the city (which could be noticed when looking at the traffic). Fine for us! We walked around and explored the city. The Sentosa Island was a disappointment, like Disney World. The two last days of our stay the business (shopping, traffic etc.) were back as normal and we could do some shopping. It was very nice to see all the large Chinese families out at the restaurants; the big fire-works; outdoor entertainment etc. The Fairmont Singapore was very nice and we would recommend it. Great service.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in the heart of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: LlewllynBren
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel. Right in the centre of Singapore opposite Raffles. Our room had lots of space and an excellent view. We liked the chaise longue and additional comfy chair. Nice bathroom and shower . The room had 'automatic' drapes which gave total darkness at night. Huge king size bed was very comfortable. Good public areas and very helpful staff. I thought the breakfast buffet was very good. ( after I found the missing 40 feet of it!) However , I accept that there were cheaper places nearby. I think the hotel could improve on the bar area, which was small and apt to close early. All in all a good experience in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here over 80 times and the Fairmont always delivers”
Reviews.Author: SphereHopper
Reviews.Content: I must have stayed at this hotel on at least 80 occasions over the last five years and although it's changed hands a few times (Raffles Plaza etc) it is still an excellent hotel with a high level of service. Modernised rooms with plasma TV and sound system. We stayed twice in the last 10 days and the first two nights were given an upgrade to a “Raffles Deluxe” room which was on a corner and attractive in layout if a little cramped with a large TV/stereo cabinet, desk & tables. The hotel offers a good range of dining outlets and those that we tried were very good, but Singapore being a food capital of the world, it was often tempting to eat out. The upgrade gave us access to a lounge for breakfast and pre dinner snacks & drinks (even the Moet is on the house). When we revisited the hotel a week later, we weren’t upgraded but asked for a standard room in the south tower which we were given. This room was designed to the same high standard but was quite a bit larger than the corner rooms. The lobby is large and well staffed so the check in and check out process was prompt and efficient. The Fairmont is our favourite hotel in Singapore, is in an excellent location above City Hall MRT station & shopping centre and right next door to Raffles Hotel and Chijmes with it’s large range of dining and entertainment. For “proper” local food, the Victoria Road Food Centre is 10 minutes walk away. A must do in the hotel is to visit the New Asia Bar on the 72nd floor of the adjacent sister hotel, Swissotel Stamford for cocktails or better still some champagne. The hotel regularly has a champagne promotion and a bottle cost S$77 plus tax which is a bargain for a five star hotel venue like this. There is something special about sipping bubbly overlooking Singapore from such a height although the best views over the business district towers and Boat Quay are reserved for diners in the restaurant that occupies that side of the top floors. Finally a top tip is to join the Fairmont Presidents Club (free via www.fairmont.com) and get complimentary internet (log in to charge to room as normal then discounted at check out). If you forget to join before you get there, it’s no problem to log into the internet clicking the “charge to room” option, visit the Fairmont website, join up and get a membership number and give that to the reception when you check out and the (expensive) internet charges will be removed from your bill.

Reviews.Title: “near to Santosa.....”
Reviews.Author: Ankitjain
Reviews.Content: Easy connectivity and comfortable at very competative rates.......

Reviews.Title: “Not Fairmont Quality”
Reviews.Author: patricia_oq
Reviews.Content: I am a Fairmont President Club Card Holder and travel to many Fairmont's around the world, this is certainly one of the worst. 1. Fairmont President check-in , what a joke! 2. Zero hospitality. 3. Rooms are dated and need a re-bamp. 4. Mattress terrible, pillows terrible. 5. Bathroom old and dated. 6. Constant bad odour (no, not me) 7. Yes a large room, but constant drowning noise throughout the night. 8. Breakfast what a joke, this is a five star hotel, not a motel, minging! 9. Service so impolite and rude. 10. Check out at the Fairmont President desk, nobody there. TAKE A LONG HARD LOOK AT YOURSELF, FAIRMONT SINGAPORE!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: boingville
Reviews.Content: Great stay. Can't say enough word to how fantatic it was. I highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Singapore. It has a great central location close to the MRT transit system and adjacent shopping malls. Make sure to buy a pass for the MRT that last for five years and it comes with ten dollars when you purchase to use right away. It so easy to get around I knew my way around after the first day. The staff was excellent and friendly and service was great. To me that make all the difference inthe world for an excellent stay. A few tips: The internet in the hotel is quite expensive. Just grab your laptop and go to Starbucks downstairs it's free. Eating in the hotel can be quite expensive as well, but there are so many restaurants to choose from you don't have to eat there only if you want to have romantic dinner. Make sure to take the Singapore Flyer and the Duck tour they are both great! Also don't miss Orchard Road and Little India. Very easy to get there using the MRT. I can't wait to go back and see all the things I missed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!! It would be hard to do better than this.”
Reviews.Author: DanO68
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the Fairmont during a business conference at the Raffles convention center. I was thoroughly impressed with everything about this hotel and would love to have the opportunity to stay here again. It is very difficult to find anything negative to say about it. The location is great, centered in a large shopping and restaurant district, a huge variety of shops and eateries to spend your money on. Orchard Road is only about 15-20min walk from the hotel. For those who like to run/walk, the riverside promenade and Fort Canning Park are only a couple of blocks away and make for excellent places to exercise at sunrise or sunset. The trip to the airport only takes about 20 min. The rooms are large and roomy and very well outfitted with large flat-screen TVs, computer desks, mini-bar, safe, and ironing facilities. All the furniture looked to be new and the room was spotlessly clean and well-maintained. No problem at all with road noise or hallway noise. There were beautiful views from the balcony overlooking the Singapore skyline - magical at night! The internet connection was slow and expensive, probably my only complaint about the hotel. The bathroom was spacious and well-outfitted, with all kinds of soaps, shampoos, mouthwash, etc. provided. I didn't dare use the minibar as the prices were grossly inflated, as is often the case in these top-end hotels. I found everything that I needed cheaply at the local 7-11. The fitness center was one of the best that I've ever used. There was a well-equipped free-weights area and just about every weight machine you could ever imagine, all new model Cybex. A separate cardio room had a large variety of high quality treadmills, elliptical trainers, and stationary bikes. About 8 TVs were mounted on the front wall allowing you to watch whatever program you want using the provided headphones. Use of the fitness facility is free to guests. The service at ths hotel was outstanding! From the moment I arrived until the moment I left, everything was taken care of with a smile. All staff were very helpful and friendly, always happy to answer questions and assist. Check-in and check-out were a breeze - very efficient. Overall, I had an excellent stay here and would stay here again given the opportunity. I highly recommend it to all other travellers. Although it is a bit pricey at about US$250, you generally receive value in the standard of the room and service. Likes - fitness center, service, views Dislikes - expensive and slow internet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: lisa23Uk
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel! The rooms are comfortable, great wet room bathroom. Friendly attentive staff, amazing choice for breakfast , ideally located. We stayed in a Club room, well worth the extra. Had Moet champagne and delicious canapes, just wished we'd stayed longer! One tip..get the train to the airport, the station is almost under the hotel. It's fast, convenient and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “great service and value”
Reviews.Author: edjpok
Reviews.Content: the Fairmont isn't the newest hotel, but the staff was extremely helpful and accommodating. as a hotel guest, i had access to the spa facilities without a fee :) the spa services were top notch, and the breakfast buffet was amazing :) love the great selection of fresh tropical fruits and local & western cuisine. the location near the Raffles area is also very convenient - shopping, restaurants, bars :) i would come back and stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “should have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: earlybird10
Reviews.Content: Our stay was a two night stop-over en route to New Zealand and we really wished we could have stayed longer. From our arrival at the hotel, when we were greeted with very welcome iced face cloths, to our early in-room breakfast on the morning of our departure, we couldn't fault a thing. If only we had known how lovely Singapore would be, we would certainly have booked the Fairmont for our return stop-ove. A fabulous view of Raffles Hotel and the busy streets of the city were a real bonus.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: aaceYork
Reviews.Content: With so many hotels to choose from in Singapore we chose this one by location and were not disappointed. The room was huge, the buffet breakfast wasexcellent and the lovely pool was perfect for cooling down. Staff were very friendly and very attentive and at breakfast time encouraged us to take fruit with us to eat during the day. Although it was hot, we were able to walk to or from many places including little India, Orchard Road, Clarke Quay. Other times we used the Singapore Airlines (SIA) hop on/off bus which stops right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: bhaskarsen
Reviews.Content: The service of hotel staff, right from the time we checked in (we arrived early and were provided room at 0930 hours!!) till our suitcases were loaded off, were simply exemplary. Rooms were good and spacious. The bathroom was kind of royal. We were given a room on the 21st floor but the view wasn't very good (overlooking the Raffle's Hotel). Ask/insist for Marina Bay view. Very well located hotel. The MRT was just 3 minutes walk from the hotel lobby through the Raffles City Shopping Mall. Complementary Breakfast was sumptuous with lots of varieties. Would definitely stay there if we go to Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good bed but poor service”
Reviews.Author: lou_lou_in_hk
Reviews.Content: we booked 3 deluxe rooms for ourselves and family for the chinese new year period. good - the bed is prob the most comfortable we've had. my husband said its even better than the fullerton ones - view of the city: they told us the room at xx20 has the best view. sadly the staff really DO NOT KNOW wot they were talking about. we ended up looking at our hotel pool and the glass roof. fortunately for my folks, they got the view of the whole casino-to-be, merlion, padang and all at room xx36. so ask for that when u next check in - since its just above the mrt and shopping mall, u can get to orchard and other area without breaking a sweat going outdoors! - free flow ice water at the pool bar. sometimes, they even serve skewers of cut fruits. bad - poor service, we needed a blackberry charger. we even went downstairs to specifically show them the phone incase they do not know the right model. they still end up giving us a motorola charger for some reason. took about an hour to get that right. surprising for a biz hotel right? - forgot our newspapers the first day. got the wrong language papers for 2 out or our 3 rooms - no parking subsidy - no wifi (for a biz hotel!?) - very expensive breakie with poor selection of food at hotel restaurant. compared the other amazing food paces in the basement of the building, this restaurant is not trying hard at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, well located”
Reviews.Author: MikeCMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Nothing can beat the location. Period. Located at a shopping mall and main transit station, you cant ask for more. Pros: Location, location, location I got a good price Clean Comfortable bed Great breakfast spread Has a nice balcony which you can get out and enjoy the balmy singapore weather at night Cons: Arrived at 11am. No room for me. had to wait till 2pm Less personal than other luxury hotels but I am not a person who needs that The bathroom can be improved. The shower system is not the best I have seen

Reviews.Title: “amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: cyntul2no
Reviews.Content: I was greeted by name (I had received an email requesting my flight time and proposed check in time). I am a member of the fairmont president's club, because of that they comped the internet fee. My room was much nicer than I had expected. It was clean, the staff did turn down service, and I tend to be picky and really have no complaints. The staff all went out of their way to create a 5 star atmosphere. I stayed 2 nights here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay, couldn't have picked better.”
Reviews.Author: haveaplan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in Feb, asked for a high floor room on arrival , didn't think I had a chance but was given the best room couldn't have picked it better myself, Chinese New Year was on when we were there and they had fireworks on 2 of the nights and we had the best view of the spectacle out across the harbour it was fantastic and as we didn't know that they were on was quite a surprise. The breakfast was unbelievable and the staff were so friendly even giving us doggy bags to take food out. Location was excellent and would stay there again no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Splendidly Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: fjve
Reviews.Content: This is an overdue review for a 2 night getaway to celebrate my partner's birthday. Stayed at this hotel primarily as we had a fantastic christmas deal with the Feed at Raffles card which got us a room at S$200 per night, together with the positive reviews here. The only slight glitch was at check-in. I had called the day prior to check in to request for an early 12 noon check in which was acceded. However when I checked in at 1.30pm, the staff said that they could only offer me a twin room with a bay view or a king room without a bay view (I had requested for a king room with a bay view at the point of reservation) at the time. However, they tried very hard to accommodate my requests and could get me the room I preferred with a 30 min wait, which I was ok with. I also mentioned at the time that it was my partner's birthday, so they said they could arrange something special if I could wait another 30 min extra. Upon entering our room, we were pleasantly surprised with a small pot of lilies and birthday balloons, and a full bottle of Moet champagne! Not sure if we got this as I was a Fairmont President Club member, but it sure was generous of them and much appreciated. One of the staff also came to our room, introduced himself and ensured that we had everything we wanted. The room was spacious and the bathroom was posh with a very nice bathtub for a bubble bath. The decor was modern, though one could tell that it was a refurbished room (the hotel has been around for a long time under different management). Amenities were plentiful, generous and frequently topped up. Housekeeping came in frequently enough (but only when we were out) to keep the room clean throughout the day, and the turndown service at night was appreciated. Breakfast at Prego's included a wide spread which was partially varied on the 2 consecutive mornings we dined. There's also a nice big pool with many deckchairs available, with complimentary use of the sauna/jacuzzi facilities at the adjoining Willow stream spa. Overall, this was THE best hotel experience I've had, and the management has been meticulous in ensuring that staff are all well trained and provide a high level of warm, genuine and efficient service all around. I felt almost like royalty during my stay, and would most certainly recommend anyone to stay there, and I would most definitely stay there again in future.

Reviews.Title: “An OK stay at Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: ozTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fairmont for the last 5 nights. We booked our accommodation through corporate rates (around $290 singapore dollars per night). We were put in a room on level 13 when we first arrived. This was meant to be a Deluxe room with a nice view. We didn't really like our view - we were overlooking Raffles hotel and it was just concrete jungle. We asked to move to a marina view, but were still on the 13th floor. Much better view but wished we were higher. We didn't get any breakfast in the price we paid. This would have been an additional $37 Singapore dollars for breakfast buffet. The pool was nice. We spent almost every day there. Sometimes may be hard to get a seat. Location was good - it was near an MRT. And shopping was close by. All in all, about a 7 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “The best - all hotels should be like this!”
Reviews.Author: ianthy
Reviews.Content: We booked the Fairmont - Singapore for 7 nights. Having stayed at the Fairmont in Dubai a few times - I am a big fan of the fairmont. We were given a super room with view of the harbour and pool areas. We tended to get up late but with no pesky housekeeping service - we just let them know when housekeeping can make up our room. Breakfast is a leisurely affair - loads of choice. The gym and spa are both well equiped plus there is plenty of seating areas around the hotel to chill out We did not travel with kids but the hotel seemed happy to offer tennis, pool activities - without intruding on travellers without kids. We particularly liked the number of restaurants available as part of the Raffles complex - 19+. Catering for all tastes and budgets -f rom Equinox in the Swissotel to Sushi Tei - great sushi. The reception staff confirmed our check out time as 3 pm and we were given the use of the hospitality lounge - free tea/coffee/water - great for late flights. The staff at this hotel are just so superb - I can not rate them highly enough. Nothing is too much trouble and always genuinely welcoming. There is only one small downside - paid for internet! For a 5 star hotel the charges are pretty high - S$28.00 for 24 hours. I just needed to check a few emails daily - it would have been great to have 60 mins for free each day. We will definately return - sad to return home to the uK and leave this lovely paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice...Again”
Reviews.Author: photchan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here again on another over night layover and was glad i made the choice. Stayed in the North Tower, which while apparently not as new as the South Tower - I preferred it as the room was a lot more spacious. Oh and the Macaroni and Cheese on the Room Service Menu is to die for......

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rosemin
Reviews.Content: We are a family of five that stayed at the fairmont for four days after a wonderful cruise on the Virgo. Location of the hotel is perfect. We had a raffles room in the south tower over looking the harbour on the 24th floor - Stunning. The Staff in the club rooms were amazing especially Jaqueline and Kelvin, who made our holiday so memorable, and thank you again Kelvin for looking after me with the lovely fairmont tea & honey as I was not feeling well. We will definetely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great public transport location and amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: winter_turtle
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have picked a better location for public transport. It was raining when we got there and we didn't have to leave the building to get to the lobby. The lobby is very limited, but it didn't matter to us. Our room was absolutely amazing and we had a great view of the Esplanade. Everyone was more than helpful, though our room was not turned down on the first evening.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: TravelPassionate
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are the friendliest and most helpful in the world! From the minute we arrived to the minute we departed we were made to feel like royalty. We stayed for a 2 night stopover, and have been to Singapore before, but now would never stay anywhere but The Fairmont. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - again!”
Reviews.Author: Cornish
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at The Fairmont on our way to Australia. We previously stayed two years ago and our opinions of this hotel have gone up if anything since the last review. Again we had a deluxe room with a great view out towards The Merlion & SCG. The room was spotless, bathroom, robes and towels etc great, bed/pillows very comfortable. Staff as ever very courteous and helpful. We had breakfast with our room rate and on our day of checking out had to leave by 6am. We ordered breakfast the night before to be sent up to our room and the room service was exceptional, nothing was any trouble on our request, and it was presented beautifully. Our only regret was not staying here again on our return to the UK, as we wanted to try another hotel (see other review!). However, we will hopefully be back in two years time.......

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, wonderful views, amazing service”
Reviews.Author: Devo1975
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week while on a business trip. Having stayed in Fairmont properties before, I had fairly high expectations. I wasn't disappointed. From the moment I arrived, the staff wen above and beyond to provide a wonderful experience. Doors were held open, luggage was delivered, and my room was cleaned twice a day. I think it is a part of the Singaporean culture, but it didn't feel to me like anyone was expecting to be tipped. The location is great, right in the middle of Raffles Mall with shops and restaurants a very short walk away. I had a room on the 19th floor, overlooking the city, war memorial, and the Singapore Flyer. It was even better at night with the city lights shining. The room itself was nice and clean. I wouldn't say it was overly remarkable, but the two-person bathtub and rainshower head were really nice. The bed was comfortable and there was a work area with Internet connection. About the only negative point I would mention is that Internet is not included in the already high price. I had to pay $140 for the week for wired internet (no wireless available). It really should be included since this is a business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ahmlaw
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont in December 2009, and I have nothing but praises for this hotel. The room we stayed in (with 2 large double beds) was big and spotless: sheets, towels, pillows all fluffy, clean and white. Housekeeping responded to every request promptly and efficiently, check-in and check-out process was very smooth and quick. The buffet breakfast was a feast, with a wide a varied selection of hot and cold dishes (international and local fare), fruits, and drinks. Coffee not limited to house blend brewed, but you have a choice of cappuccino or espresso, as well. And breakfast is served until very late, 11:00am, which is a plus if you want a few more hours of sleep! Location of the hotel is perfect, it is within the Raffles City Mall complex, with great shops and restaurants. Chijmes -- a building with numerous bars and restaurants – is right across the street, and Funan Mall (the IT / electronics mall) is a five minute walk. The City Hall MRT station is beneath the Raffles City Mall, so every other place is easily accessible, including the airport. I am in Singapore at least twice every year, and have stayed in several 5-star hotels. On a hunch, I decided to try the Fairmont for the first time this December and it was a great decision. I will definitely stay in this hotel again! Just a tip, as well: for all my trips to Singapore, I use a local travel agent, C & E Holidays (www.cneholidays.com), and I deal with Wendy. They are by far one of the most efficient agents I have ever come across in all my travels abroad. If you are worried about booking and reservations, I highly recommend this agent for all your Singapore needs.

Reviews.Title: “as good hotel you can stay in brilliant”
Reviews.Author: beauzy
Reviews.Content: we have traveled the world over but i must say this is as good as we have been in from bellboy to top manager l we were looked after, mr b senior uk

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with one dissatisfaction!”
Reviews.Author: Syed27
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights with family (with 2 children below 9 years) from 30th Dec to 4th Jan 2010. It was a leisure trip to be a part of the new year celebrations. Booked a deluxe room with King bed under advance purchase deal (it was SGD 260 incl. taxes). Room was great with a balcony overlooking the pool. Bathroom was oversized and really a size of mini room. Had a comfortable stay and the kids enjoyed the stay. Pool was good and the kids enjoyed spending time there. Location is excellent. Staff was very friendly and courteous and really helpful. Would stay there again. Btw, internet was free as I was a Fairmont President's club (othewise it is exorbitantly high at SGD 28 for a day). Dissatisfaction was that despite mutiple requests (from 3 weeks prior to the stay) for harbour view room, I did not get one. At the time of check-in, I was told that I am getting partial harbour view room but in reality it was limited to getting your head stretched to the maximum from balcony and then you see some buildings! Probably the Fairmont Room (with lower rate) had a better view of the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay: 5* All Around”
Reviews.Author: toga1k
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Fairmont Singapore during X'mas week for 4 nights. We had arrived at the hotel at 1am after a long journey from USA and we were more than exhausted. So it was really great to be greeted by courteously staff, from bellman to the reception desk and they knew already who we were and had prepared the 2 rooms in advance for us. Well, I guess my email to the hotel couple weeks prior helped but still this little gesture can make a big difference esp. on our first impression of the facility. The rooms (one with king bed and one with 2 doubles) are nicely decorated to convey a contemporary style with grace and elegance, with just the right lighting to accentuate the decorations. The swimming pool is not large but it's big enough as most guests are sunbathers more than swimmers. They also have a kiddie pool for the young one. There are 2 tennis courts also but we didn't use them. We also did not use the fitness center but it looks very decent with more than enough new equipments for a good workout. The fitness center also provides headsets to you which is nice touch. The location can't be beat whether you are on foot, or use the subway, or taxi. Raffles city is right in the complex, and the connecting underground halls will lead you to SunTec plaza, or Esplanade area. So shopping options are plentiful and it sure beats walking outside in the heat. We loved the food court on the 3rd floor of the Raffles city, as well as the restaurants in the lower B1 floor. Tried the DinTaiFung place that serves famous dumplings and chicken soup originally from Taiwan and they were very tasty and (almost) just as good as the original ones in Taipei. Overall, our stay at this hotel was a memorable experience. Little details such as the lobby staff opening doors for you, to giving us umbrellas without asking when it seemed to start raining one day, to proactively helping us to take family pictures, etc. I believe the Fairmont Singapore does indeed deserve it's 5* classification.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: sc_myinitial
Reviews.Content: Our friends have blessed us with a night stay in this suite room 2520 on 20 December 2009. The living room, bedroom and bathroom were spacious and all necessary toiletries were provided too! Excellent! The location of this hotel is very convenient, next door to the Raffles City Shopping Centre and the City Hall MRT station is just underground! Walking distance to many shopping centres too! We had complimentary breakfast the next morning and the buffet spread at Prego was superb, with many different kinds of cereals, cold and hot food, desserts and fruits! The only thing was we had to pay for the kids as the complimentary was limited to 2 persons, not sure the cost as it was all paid by our friends! Overall, this hotel is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Christmas at the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: szjam
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights over Christmas at the Fairmont in a Raffles Inc Room which was spacious and comfortable with a great view over the Marina Bay and CBD. Staff in all areas of the hotel were very friendly and efficient. Our rate included breakfast which could be taken at three different locations within the hotel (recommend Prego) and free Moet or other drinks and nibbles between 5pm and 8pm each evening in the Raffles lounge on 23rd floor - also free use of the internet in the lounge if needed. Location is great, right in the middle of Singapore with a MRT below and a good shopping centre with lots of eating options attached. Would recommend to anyone wanting a comfortable central location. Have previously stayed in Exec room at Marina Mandarin but would return to the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful staff, memorable stay!”
Reviews.Author: farrj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this excellent hotel for two nights on our journey to Australia, and for two nights on our return journey. We chose the Fairmont having stayed there previously on two occasions in 2007 when it was named Raffles the Plaza. At that time we were so impressed we decided that on any future visit to Singapore we would return to the same hotel. The hotel really does live up to its 5 star rating, and is well situated in an established part of Singapore directly across the road from the original Raffles Hotel and directly above the excellent Raffles City Shopping Centre and adjacent train station. The entrance to the hotel is impressive and from the moment you arrive, porters are there with a warm greeting to help with your luggage. We booked a “Raffles Inc” room which had its own reception on the 23rd floor of the hotel, and check in was fast and efficient. We requested and were given a deluxe room in the South Tower overlooking the harbour – the views from the balcony were stunning particularly at night. The rooms are spotlessly clean and very well equipped and furnished, down to bedside remote control units for curtains, lighting, air-conditioning etc. The rooms have safes (complimentary), bath robes, slippers, tea / coffee and a well stocked reasonably priced mini bar. The bathrooms are excellent with white marble tiles and glass fittings, including a bath and adjacent wet shower area incorporating a rainforest shower. The Raffles Inc rooms included a nightly turn down service, with orchid flowers being left on the bed, and the ice bucket filled. We also had the use of the Raffles Inc. Executive Lounge on the 23rd floor where breakfast was served between 6.30am and 10.30am and also where cocktails and canapés were served between 5.00pm and 8.00pm - a very nice start to the evening! We chose to have breakfast in the Alligator Pear Restaurant on the 8th Floor overlooking the outdoor Pool and there was an excellent choice of hot and cold food. The hotel has several good restaurants and it is also possible to take meals in the original Raffles Hotel and charge them to your room (reservations needed) – we enjoyed a meal in the Raffles Long Bar Steak House. The hotel also included the Willowstream Spa which has excellent facilities and a wide range of treatments. What really makes this hotel stand out is the friendly and efficient service provided by the hotel staff all of whom go out of their way to make your stay special. In particular, we can’t praise highly enough the Duty Manager of Raffle Inc., Sandra Moses and her team who really do provide an excellent service which makes a real difference. It is fair to say that this is our favourite hotel in the world and we look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, as you would expect from a Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: lazy_diver
Reviews.Content: A flawless stay. The staff combine Fairmont training with Singaporean hospitality, the hotel facilities are excellent, and the rooms are of the highest standard. The hotel is well located near Chinatown, Little India and the east end of Orchard Road, and right opposite Raffles. The hotel is part of the Swissotel complex and is right on top of a mall, so it's easy to find breakfast if you oversleep the restaurant or want something a little lighter. It's convenient for buses and the MRT, and of course taxis are everywhere, so it's also easy to get around. If I had one niggle (other than the high cost of internet access) it's that the pools - which are shared with the Swissotel, I think - are circular and small-ish and while ideal for lounging around and for playing with the kids in, are not a lot of use if you want to swim as a form of exercise. But other than that, it's a really good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: Jeff095
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont Singapore during November of 2009 and realised what all the fuss was about. The service was impeccable with in-room check in, while the gym and willow stream spa were ideal for relaxation after a long exhausting day.

Reviews.Title: “Good tourist location, very good but quite generic hotel”
Reviews.Author: HMax
Reviews.Content: There was a very warm welcome when we arrived at the door. We had booked a Fairmont room on the internet (their lead in room type) and were informed at the desk that as we were early one of these rooms was not available but if we upgraded to a superior room type we could have a room straight away. This was appealing so we upgraded, however I didn't appreciate being told that the 'Fairmont' rooms are classic rooms and the explanation was that since they were first done in the 80's that nothing had really been changed etc etc trying to put us off the room and pushing us to upgrade. - has a hotel of this grade, charging over £120 for a room really not changed carpet etc for over 20 years? perhaps not, I didn't see the Fairmont rooms in North Tower. Anyway we were taken to our superior room (in South Tower), we had requested a non smoking room however the room we were shown to really stank of cigarettes and there was a bottle full of butt ends on the balcony. So the valet with the luggage rang down and arranged another room for us which was a good smoke free superior room. It was very kind of the reception to call us to double check the room was good and as a goodwill gesture they gave us breakfast included which was very unexpected.Unfortunately the internet did not work inour room the entire stay and one day we waited an hour and a half for someone to call back about fixin it- they told us we should use another cable if we had one as theres must have a problem!-not great. we tried their business centre which had its own internet problems, we eventually went to an internet cafe in little India which worked perfectly at about a tenth of the price of the business centre! (check out Banana Apolo restaurant in little india) Overall our stay was very good, the Ink bar and its staff were excellent- great cocktails, the breakfast by the lobby was very good, not such good selection or service if you take breakfast by the pool. The location was great as we could walk back from Marina Bay were we spent New Years eve- the conceirge booked us an excellent restaurant and table at a No signboard seafood restaurant that they recommended. The raffles shopping centre attached to the hotel has loads of choice and we had excellent (if pricey) massages at the willow spa at the hotel. the rooms were kept spotless and we were able to leave luggage at the hotel until our return from Thailand in 3 weeks time. All in all a very good hotel, its just a little bit of a shame that there are few Asian accents- it reflects the brand very well but doesn't give you a true flavour of traditional Singapore. I think next time we will stay in Chinatown to be surrounded with a bit more atmosphere than just the malls.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Wintera
Reviews.Content: Hi I am staying 80% of time in good hotels. For frequent Singapore trips I discussed with the Fairmont a package for weekly stays. I had deluxe rooms, with good view, nice new rooms, great service and super location for Singapore. When I could not get a room, the hotel went out of their way to find an additional room for me ... even so I confirmed some of my weekly trips last minute. I had only breakfast there - great buffet at prego or at the pool - and never lunch or dinner, so no comments there.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing... We highly recommend Fairmont Singapore”
Reviews.Author: MistaJinxx
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, Amazing service and Superbly friendly/caring staff. Great location, Excellent views and a true feeling of comfort and care.

Reviews.Title: “Something for everyone”
Reviews.Author: purplepinay
Reviews.Content: For the first time, I visited Singapore with zero agenda and zero schedule. My husband was there on business. I let him do his work--online with the room internet access, phone calls, business meetings, power lunches and whatever. Everything he needed was at his fingertips. I, on the other hand, could do whatever I wanted. Because it is adjacent to the MRT and there are always cabs available, I could go anywhere anytime...shopping, theatre, sightseeing, food tripping. I could swim in their beautiful pool, have a sumptuous buffet breakfast, go around the adjacent mall. The concierge was particularly helpful when I asked them questions like, "I have 2 free hours, should I go here or there?" I've been to Singapore many times before but this last trip was the most pleasant, so far. Would I go back? Definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Room Quality Par Excellence”
Reviews.Author: rinaldo_lleo
Reviews.Content: I am a regular traveller to Singapore for business purposes and have stayed in this hotel on at least three different occassions. I had stayed for two weeks during my recent visit and am thrilled with the rooms and at the level of service provided by the staff. The rooms have a contemporary feel and tastefully decorated to appeal to a business traveller. I was upgraded to a higher room class (at no extra cost) since I had checked in early. The hotel is centrally located in City Hall above the MRT station. The Prego restaurant at level 1 provides multiple selection of cuisines. The spread of breakfast is quite lavish. Since the hotel is situtated along with a mall, there are ample wining and dining opportunities in case you want a break from the hotel restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel for a person on Business”
Reviews.Author: GurgaonNomad
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd visit to Fairmont and the very fact that I stayed there for the 3rd time in quick succession underlines the fact that it is a very comfortable hotel for people on business. It is conveniently located very near to a MRT station and Raffles Mall. It has great interiors and rooms are large with a great view. Staff is very friendly and reception is remarkably quick wihile check in and check out and for any other queries. It seemed that they were expecting me which makes you feel welcomed unlike any big hotel where they have to search for your reservation etc. The pleasant surprise is that when you arrive from the airport at the hotel entrance, somehow even the doorman addresses by your surname which I cant understand. It happened all 3 times and hence there must be a system/process to it. Definitely recommended for stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in mid town area”
Reviews.Author: amit2207
Reviews.Content: It is good hotel near to down town and commercial area with grt view

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: enr12
Reviews.Content: This hotel has improved since being taken over by the Fairmont group. It is located right above the MRT and connected to a air condition mall that connects with three other hotels, all through air condition comfort. From its central location one could travel in 15 minutes to all parts of the city by inexpensive MRT. Cabs are also plentiful 24/7 as I had no trouble getting a cab to the airport at 5am. The rooms are bright and very comfortable with the controls of light and drapes by your bed side. Two large pools and an excellent fitness center. Free wifi for Fairmont club members, and I will stay here just based on this feature alone

Reviews.Title: “I love my stay at Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: suitejoe
Reviews.Content: First of all, would love to thank all the staffs at the fairmont for such a wonderful stay. The service is impeccable. Front desk was kind enough to let us check in early as we need to set up the decor for our nephew birthday celebration. We got the south tower. We had our cake made to order but delivered to the swissotel stamford but the frontdesk staffs volunteered to collect our cakes and sent it to our room. All calls for request are attended promptly with the most sincere smile! Rooms are great. (Better than the Swissotel Stamford) and bathrooms are lovely. With branded amenities from "Miller Harris". Room with great view of esplanade and the CDB. The kids had a great time at the pool too. And locations are definitely unbeatable. Walkin distance to suntec, marina square, bugis and on top of raffles city shopping centre. The only let down is the parking. No free parking provided. We ended up with a parking of $25 for overnight parking at the Raffles City. Was told by frontdesk that I could opt for valet parking at only $25 unlimited time and in-out of parking. Overall an enjoyable stay, for the kids and the adult.

Reviews.Title: “Rejuvenating!”
Reviews.Author: massymoo
Reviews.Content: I’ve seen good, but Fairmont Singapore is strikingly memorable! My break begun with a surreal bang of courtesy from the wonderful people of Fairmont Singapore, topped with chocolates, flowers, strawberries coated with chocolate, a welcoming message the moment I switched on the TV, a luxurious king-sized bed, a large shower head, and the best of all, a breathtaking view of the Esplanade harbour and city! After too many looong days, and an impending 16-hour work day on Monday, all I needed was a relaxing retreat to soothe out the migraine, with some smiles and laughter to remember that I am well and truly alive. This retreat is definitely it. Having lived in the city of concrete walls and replicas of busy work life, experiencing Fairmont as it really is, in its heartfelt and immensely welcoming form really intrigues me. It was truly a respite. Their warm hospitality and impeccable service really made everything just perfect. A huge special thanks and credits to Mr. Shaik Shidek for pampering my mom and me. I respect his professionalism in delivering the utmost best for Fairmont’s residence. This is my second retreat here in 2 months and I’m loving my enormous dosage of Fairmont already… I certainly look forward to plenty more. Rejuvenating!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service & Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Love_travelling013
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont at the end of October. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, we were treated like royalty by all the staff. In particlular my 6-yr old daughter was made to feel like a real princess. The location is 2nd to none - the hotel is connected Raffles City mall which has some good shops. Chimes for restaurants/bars is right next door, the Esplanade is a 10 min walk away, as are Clarke and Boat Quay. When we checked in, there was a problem with the layout of the room we chose, but this was rectified quickly, and the room we had ( Deluxe category ) was large and well-appointed. The breakfast selection is vast and again the service is superb. Business travellers - pls note the Internet connection ( wired ) was very slow. Overall a great option for business and lesiure travellers in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!”
Reviews.Author: DoktorCB
Reviews.Content: I stood for 5 days during a buiness trip in the Fairmont Singapore. IF been to various places in Singapore (review my contributions) and I can say, that the Fairmont was probably the most luxory one. The rooms, I had a standard room overlooking the Esplanade, are big, very rich equipped, with a private balcony. Comfortable bed, big bathroom and also chair and desk to work. In my rate I had breakfast included, and this is a big institution: wonderful seating, great service and very, very long buffet. Probably one of the best breakfast I ever had in a hotel. The wellness area, expecelly the gym I liked most: big, interesting layout and very convienient. The pool area is good, but I have sen better ones in Singapore. Somthing, probably the decoration of the pool area, can be improved while the water and service around is good. Location: another big plus of the Fairmont - its located in the middle of shopping areas, actually its located in the Raffles City which is a big shopping mall already. Just 5 minutes away from the Esplanade. Go there and you will not be disappointed - I will return very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fair but there are better”
Reviews.Author: rickg6
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is in a great location, opposite Raffles and Chijmes and attached to a decent shopping mall. Clarke Quay/Boat Quay etc a 5 min walk away. Hotel shares a really nice pool area with the Swisshotel next door - also excellent gym and spa located at the hotel too. Food very good and staff pleasant. Room a bit tired - had a Signature Room and to be honest, it was in need of a refresh - bathroom outdated (weird taps!!??) and just a general feel of the room coming to the end of a cycle prior to upgrading. In summing up - great location, great pool/gym/spa - rooms tired and not value for money - paid similar at Mandarin Oriental, and although location not quite as good (but only 10mins walk away to be honest) rooms/style/comfort at MO way better. If you are not bothered about top end room, would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, Spacious room”
Reviews.Author: fusooy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night on 9.10.09. Frontdesk staff very attentive and provided quality service. had a spacious room with balcony overlooking the hotel's pool and the singapore flyer from a distance. a clean and fantastic hotel. shoppers will love it as the hotel is situated next to shopping mall.

Reviews.Title: “exceeding expectation!”
Reviews.Author: yvette21
Reviews.Content: I booked the room on the hotel website with relatively cheap price comparing with other 5-star hotels. I mentioned that I'm celebrating my boyfriend's birthday and requested a room with harbour view as that's the place we fell in love. The check-in was speedy,and the staff pleasantly informed me that they noted my request and gave us a room with the view. And the room is located at 24th floor,with spectacular view! The staff even surprised us with a birthday cake later in the afternoon. We're overwhelmed and totally surprised! the cake is delicious and with "happy birthday" letters. the staff sang the happy birthday song for my boyfriend as well! The room is very spacious and clean. Decent interior design with a balcony facing the pool and Esplanade bay. Housekeeping is very efficient and friendly. Overally,I am super satisfied with the hotel,and will definitely re-visit it for special event! Bravo Fairmont!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: fibiScotland
Reviews.Content: I cannot fault one thing about this hotel. the bedrooms were gleaming , spacious and with the most comfortable beds ever, the staff were delightful, the swimming pool excellent, the raffles club staff outstranding, the doorstaff wonderful, the breakfast excellent...while in Singapore I will never even think about staying anywhere else¬

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Nite”
Reviews.Author: raizei
Reviews.Content: Hi there.. 11th oct 09 my wife undergo minor ops in East Shore Hospital. She is not warded aft the ops.. so i quickly plan of staying in the hotels in town. My 1st cal is to Fairmont Singapore which my wife ever said that it will be nice if 1 day i can bring her to stay there.. I think that day is my best date to bring her there coz she feel so weak aft the ops and i don't want my kiddy to disturb her mum when she back. So after confirm our room and on our way there i received e-call from Shaik Shidek (Resident Services Manager) from that hotels.. So nice of him after he knew that me and wife are comming from hospital he offer us that he himself will wait for our cab to arrive with a wheel-chair... im so touched of his service even wen my wife discharge from the hospital there are no guys there offer us that which my wife walks slowlly by herself.. When we reached Shaik Shidek push my wife wit his collegue up to the room while i do the check-in register and he did update me once he down @ the lobby saying that my wife is already resting on her bed... Im so touched once again.... When i went up to the room yes my wife is resting with a glass of drink prepared by him and so surprised again there is e-bunch of roses with e-card written SPEDDY RECOVERY to my wife.. even myself never bought fowers to her which i know that women love when they received roses.. im so touched.. When he finishing his shift Shaik Shidek call in our romms to check on my wife condition.... The word i should decribed is WOW! His so commited with his job... The next morning i have to go to office for important meetings.. I left my wife alone and told my wife wait for me @ abt 11am once i finish meeting i buy u breakfast.. But u guys know what.... Shaik Shidek call in our room and my wife pick up saying that im out to office... he did offer to my wife if he can bring in breakfast for her as he knew her condition is not that good... I received e-call frm wife saying that i no need to rush as breakfast had already served.... how released myself when i heard that while having my important meetings..... there alot more if i want to share wit u guys... u guys cn check-in out yourself the staff there are so frendly also... and i really strong recomend u guys wit Fairmont Singapore wit Shaik Shidek.... Thank you so much u guys :)

Reviews.Title: “As expected from the Fairmont Chain”
Reviews.Author: Still_Paying_4_Kids
Reviews.Content: Hotel is perfectly located, directly connected to Raffles Mall and the MRT, quick checkin, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: Davarua
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 nights at the Fairmont Singapore. I will definitely return. Incredible staff and service. Pleasant, friendly, and genuinely helpful. I checked in at 2:am - exhausted from a 20 flight. I was greeted with warm smiles, a moist towel, and an exceptionally efficient check-in. The next morning I asked for directions to a nearby venue - the staff didn't just direct me, they actually walked me out of the hotel and all the way to my destination. This happened more than once. Throughout my stay the staff would appproach me and ask if they could be of any assistance. The room (a standard Fairmont Room) was spotless (it actually gleamed) and beautifully appointed (robe, slippers, the works), large flat screen television - even stereo sound system in the bathroom. The ourdoor pool was quite large enough to swim laps in the morning. I recommend the Italian Restaurant on the 1st Floor for breakfast - delicious. Of course, perhaps the biggest draw for the Fairmont is it's location. What you've heard is true. It's sits right on top of a MRT (Metro) hub, from which you can reach anywhere in the city - quickly and cheaply. Additionally, the hotel is connected to a very large and modern shopping mall. Besides shops, the mall contains many excellent and affordable eateries. I suggest an evening drink at the bar atop the Stamford Hotel (next door). The view is amazing! Forget Raffles (across the street). In my opinion, this is the best hotel in Singapore. It is outstanding in every way. I can find absolutely nothing to criticize.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FoodTrails_net
Reviews.Content: When we stayed there it was called the 'Raffles City Hotel'. The room we had was clean, spacious and fitted with the usual mod-cons. We especially liked the Bosch sound system which filtered into the lovely spacious bathroom -- which had both a bath and a (rain!) shower. The location of the hotel is also convenient. You can walk to many of the surrounding malls, or just jump onto the clean and efficient MRT system -- which is just downstairs from the hotel. For food adventures, www.foodtrails.net

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Calypso2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I revisited Singapore for the second time in 2 years and although we stayed at another excellent property in the Marina area last time, we decided to try a different place this time. The Fairmont Singapore more than adequately met our needs. We found it a very stylish upmarket quiet property. The entrance is fairly discreet, the lobby largish but had a subdued classy feel. A welcome change from the busy and noisy hotels used by tourist groups. We upgraded to a Signature room, it was enormous and had every facility a discerning traveller could require. The hotel shares 2 pools with the adjoining Swissotel Stamford with its 70 floors crowned by the Equinox bar and restaurant ,which gives the best views over Singapore for the price of a drink-though not cheap. The Fairmont was quiet, but is in the middle of everything in this growing Marina area being on top of one of Singapore's best shopping centres, across the road from Raffles, Chijmes a converted school now the home of numerous quite good and reasonably moderate restaurants. It is a short walk to Suntek City and Marina Square -more shops and restaurants,and an easy walk to the vast selection of dining facilities on Boat Quay on the shores of the Singapore River. The Fairmont is also right on top of the MTR rail system which gets you everywhere on the island, and very cheaply. Recommended things to do- take the "Hop on Hop Off" Bus or Hippo Tours round city sightseeing and orientation, more shopping in Orchard Road and at the new Ion Shopping complex-which has ALL the designer labels if you are looking for them, we weren't, the Botanic Gardens and its Orchid Garden, Singapore Zoo and the Night Safari (separate from the Zoo), the Singapore Flyer (their "big wheel") and of course take in the cultural and eating kaleidoscope of the Chinese, Malay, Indian and British Colonial culures which made this city what it is today. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, a true five star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: PegususPerth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont for four nights and really enjoyed our stay. We were in fact quite spoilt. The staff are very professional and quietly go about their work quietly and to a very high standard. We upgraded to the club room which I would strongly recommend. They served Moet and Chandon Champagne and other French wines as well as various spirits. Unfortunately they don't serve cocktails as they say they are limited in space. The food between 5.00pm and 8.00pm is very delicious and of a high quality. There is plenty of choices and the staff are very efficient. One guy was our particularly nice, his name was something like manu... They were dressed in special motor sports outfits due to the F! being held this week. During the day there are plenty of soft drinks and muffins available as well as tea and coffee. The coffee is not the best due to the whitener they use. It is a pleasant place to sit and take in the views. There is only one computer but was always available when we needed it. The staff at the front counter will assist you with any questions. The conciearge service could be a little better. He was pleasant and helpful enough but always on the phone when we were at the desk. The rooms are fantastic. They are spacious and have plenty of emenities. The shower is a little strange being next to the bath with no proper recess. The bathroom was meant to be large but we found it to be of an average size. The coffee machine was great but again there was only powdered whitener available so I would suggest buying some milk if you can fit it into the fridge. The turn down service was a luxury, with an orchard left on our bed each night. On arriving to our room we found a huge bowl of fruit and a special box of chocolates left for us, a very nice touch. The automatic blinds were great and easy to use the control system. The coffee machine ran out of water so we called for assistance, to our surprise they filled the system with bottled water even though the water in Singapore is fine to drink but it certainly does make a better cup of coffee. They even supply an electric jug if you want a cup of tea. They gave us a room with a view of the bay and it was even better than the view in the club room. Breakfast at Prego was great. They no longer allow you to go to the Swiss Cafe if you have breakfast included in your rates. I really enjoyed the fresh strawberries and blueberries available. The coffee here is perfect and you have a choice of various varieties such as latte and a choice of teas. The croisants were the nicest I have had. All the food was very good. We didn't dine at the club or the pool cafe for breakfast simply because there wasn't as much choice. The only fault was the selection of cold meats looked dry but I gather not many people eat them, it seems that they are provided to add the Italian touch. Try their orange cream on some fresh fruit, it is delicious. They even had a honeycombe on a stand and fresh honey was dripping from it. The breads and muffins are good but with so many other choices available we did not fill up on them. The foyer is pretty drab and not very exciting or luxurious, I guess it is just a more modern and arty style. The best thing was the King size bed. It is the most comfortable bed I have had the pleasure of sleeping in and after all considering the length of time spent in it, it is an important aspect. Check out the Willow Spa Stream, even if you don't use the spa massages available it is still a treat. The spa's are great and the amenities are of a high class, same as the gym. Try the ginger tea available, it is very cleansing. Thanks go to the staff and management for such a pleasant stay. It made our trip to Singapore very special and memorable. Allowing us a late check out was really generous.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Orphellia
Reviews.Content: Booked for a 2 night stop in Singapore to catch up with some friends, The Fairmont Singapore did not disappoint! Reception staff were quick and friendly making the check in process a breeze! I was early to check in and so the King room that I had booked was not yet available, but they happily offered a twin room for immediate check in which I gladly accepted (they even upgraded me to a deluxe room!) I can't give enough positive feedback on this property. The staff were always friendly and helpful, the location is superb, (above the City Hall MRT stop and the Raffles shopping mall. There is a food court in the basement and also a grocery store) Beds in the twin room were large and comfortable, dressed with lovely soft linens and fluffy pillows. Controls for all lights and curtains were on bedside controllers. There was a Bose cd / radio in the room so that you could play your own music and not get stuck listening to standard hotel background noise and they also had a flat screen tv with cable. The room came with long hallway, bathrobes, slippers, in room safe, iron and ironing board and a balcony. The bathroom was very large and clean and although I don't think that all the glass necessarily made it easy to keep tidy, it did look really nice! My only word of warning would be when catching a cab out to the airport from the hotel in the early hours of the morning - they do what is called a 'midnight charge'.. After all my visits in Singapore I've never heard of it, but it did add about $15 to the bill. (Having said that, this was my first crazy early flight out of Singapore so it may just be something I wasn't aware of).

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont , perfection in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: MonoAuckland
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights and from arrival to departure the service was impeccable. Wonderfully comfortable rooms and a great location. Ive stayed in a few Fairmonts in Canada and Im glad to say the Singapore branch is keeping the very high level up in Asia. A wonderful stay and I would have no hesitation in reccommending to anyone be you in Singapore for business or pleasure to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: seasidedream
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Hotel in Singapore is definately worth a stay. It's location is perfect - only a short taxi ride from the airport, close to Calrke Quay, across the road from Raffles and next to a HUGE shopping centre. The staff couldn't have been more friendly. We were greeted with silk scarves and shown to our room. The room was huge and very modern. There was a balcony but we couldn't see a lot from there. The swimming pool was very clean and during July really wasn't over crowded. The gym was also in a great condition although small. If we were to go back to SIngapore we would stop in the Fairmont again without hessitation!

Reviews.Title: “Singapore mini break”
Reviews.Author: seasidedream
