Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days in Singapore as a break from travelling on our way to Sydney. It was a fantastic experience and although there was a lot more we could have done, the 3 days were enough for us. It is exceptionally clean, (dropping chewing gum has a huge fine). We managed to fit in the main sights - Raffles for a SIngapore Sling, Clarke Quay (although no where really opens until 11am!), shopping centre (again 11am opening), night safari (excellent but there is a taxi charge if you travel during rush hour), boat trip along Clarke Quay (very informative and relaxing). Over all, a fantastic place to visit and we would definately recommend it to anyone. We got a fantastic deal at the Fairmont Hotel and cannot express how fantastic this hotel was. The location is right across the road from Raffles, next door to a HUGE shopping centre and a short taxi ride from the airport and Clarke Quay. The staff were incredibly friendly too!

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Robert064Australia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Singapore for our 25th wedding aniversery as we went there for our honey moon and when the manager Andrea in Prego restaurant heard it was our special time he made it very special. We recieved champain, flowers, chocolates, and a lovely cake when we went back for dinner that night. The service was fantastic and we were made to feel very special. Thankyou Andrea and the Fairmont Singapore. Robert and Carmela

Reviews.Title: “Clean beautiful and spacious”
Reviews.Author: mumtraveller23
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a couple of times and will bring my family soon. The rooms are lovely big clean and very comfotable.You always get a view of some sort , big windows and remote controled blinds (the button is on the bedside clock..took me ages to find that) The staff are fantastic, very helpful and pleasant to you always. I left my mobile phone behind and they wasted no time carefully wrapping it and sending it to Australia registered mail, I got it in a few days. No charge either. The location of the hotel is ideal with a comlex attatched that has pretty much everything. lots of shops MRT restaurants and supermarket on the ground floor. I am pretty fussy with hotels and travel alot this is one of my favourites. Great pool too.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: worldwideexpert
Reviews.Content: We stayed in three similar -priced hotels in Singapore. Fairmont is the best. It is a real 5.stars hotel. Even standard rooms are very spacious with balcony overlooking the bay, you do not have to pay extra like in Pan Pacific Singapore. Very pleasant stay, everything was perfect, next to the Raffles Hotel and the other attractions. Highly recommended! The only minus - very expensive internet!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Kben100
Reviews.Content: Its great to arrive at a Hotel and not be underwhelmed. The hotel itself is beautfil and the rooms clean, modern and fresh. The small touches and regular cleaning service made it an enjoyable stay. Even the bathroom scales were a about 5 kilos out which made us feel skinny and ready to hit the pool! The spa (free) is well appointed and worth an hour of your time to unwind and relax. (they have separate male and female spa rooms so don't plan on hanging out with your partner. The staff, whilst hardly seen, were kind, helpful and courteous. The location is hard to beat with quick access to the City Hall train station, shortish walk to Boat & Clarke quays and the beautiful architecture of Raffles Hotel directly across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: scooter_girl19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Singapore for three nights in Late April 2009. We were able to secure a good rate through the hotel website for a King Room on the business floor. We had a lovely room with good amenities and a balcony overlooking the Raffles hotel. The room was spacious, included a nice desk space, very spacious bathroom with speakers hooked up to the stereo, slippers and such. Squeaky clean Included in our room was choice of breakfast at any of the restaurants, or on the business floor, as well as drinks and snacks at cocktail hour. The breakfast was lovely, if not speedy, and would include eggs if you request them. The location was perfect for us. Central, plenty of restaurants nearby, walkable to transit.. all great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Chris_and_friend
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont for 4D3N and were more than happy with it. Actually one of the best hotel experiences in years. The room: Executive room on level 24 with a balcony, located in the south tower. The view wasn't that breathtaking but still lovely enough to spend a couple of minutes outside every now and then. The room itself was spacious, of course neat and clean and after all very well organized. I even understood the table desk remote control without endless trying. Yes, there's a fantastic flatscreen tv with a good range of programmes including e.g. HBO. The bathroom: Probably the largest bathroom I've ever had in a hotel. Bathtub, shower, scales, toiletries, you name it. The lounge: A wonderful experience. Never too crowded, always relaxed, very stylish and the staff so welcoming, smiling and helpful. Always descrete in the background but at hand in a second, just give them a smile. The lounge even has a seperate business meeting room to ensure perfect privacy for those being around not only for the delicious snacks. Here's some advice: - The internet is quite expensive - if you are not a member of the Fairmont President Club. So just sign up in the lobby. It's for free, and apart from other advantages wifi or cable internet is now complimentary. - Make sure you have a hotel business card at hand when it comes to the taxis. The hotel had been renamed several times and drivers do have their problems with the new name. - Don't miss the mall. There a several eating options. Finally, five stars for the Fairmont and a really wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with very good service staff !”
Reviews.Author: ConradCopperCCC
Reviews.Content: Swift check in. Room was nice with a balcony. Pool was overcrowded as this was shared with Swissotel guest. Room service was the hightlight of this one night stay. Food was great and staff was very friendly from setting up the table in the room to packing and clearing after we finish dinner.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best in the world”
Reviews.Author: satoyuriko
Reviews.Content: from luxury lobby, well-furnished rooms, great toiletries, electric curtains, wonderful room serivce / food to the great breakfast .. what else can you ask for??

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ashbay04
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Fairmont Hotel Singapore for three nights late July. From the time we walked into the Foyer we were very impressed. The hotel staff make you feel welcome and go out of their way to impress. It's the little things that that the Fairmont Singapore does that impresses. I would recommend upgrading to a deluxe room in the new wing. The rooms are very spacious, clean and they have the biggest bathroom I have seen in a hotel. Loved the rain drop shower. The breakfast offering is superb, from dining in the Alligator Pear restaurant by the pool to the main restaurant the food was fresh, tasty and of the highest quality. The service was also excellent (especially from Serena at Alligator Pear). Can't wait to return to the Fairmont Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “A New Lease of Life”
Reviews.Author: t-puk
Reviews.Content: Last weekend was my first visit since the property became Fairmont, and I must say the overall experience felt alot more comfortable. From the lobby scent, to amazingly fast check-in to room amenities (yay huge LCD TV in North Tower room but no okto I wonder why), FS ticked all the right boxes. This was also my first stay in a Fairmont room (North Tower) which I thought was way better than the South Tower Deluxe, since the bathroom is smaller hence more space in the living area, and lounge chair fits the body angle just right. The squarish mini sofa in Deluxe rooms isn't conducive for lazing or relaxing, so a complete waste of space imo, looks nice though. Do take note the room given was on 23rd floor, so amenities in lower floor rooms could be be different. The rooms also come come with green features such as a separate bin under the work table for 'recyclables', and electricity is almost instantly cut off when key card is removed from the slot. Also during check-out, instead of printing the bill on sheets of paper, and then slotting them into an envelop/folder which most people will throw away, FS' invoices can be turned into A6 size foldaways with the logo infront and 'express checkout options' at the back. Simple but fanstastic way of cutting waste. Loves. Cannot wait to try Fairmont Beijing.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a business trip... and leisure too”
Reviews.Author: Jayza_8
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate enough to stay at Fairmont for a week on a business trip. It was always very clean and all toiletries were replaced daily (even new slippers were given when I used a pair). The location is really good as there is a mall directly beneath the hotel and the stores are generally open until late - great for when you only have free time after business hours. The hotel is also located directly next to another hotel (I can't remember which one) but it was great because even if we ate at the restaurants within the mall or in the neighbouring hotel, we were still able to use our room number to charge to. I was fortunate enough to stay just before the first Singapore Grand Prix, so I was able to see where the race was going to happen - along the road directly outside of the hotel! If only I was able to stay for the Grand Prix, it would have been an excellent view! There are also plenty of markets and other shopping complexes nearby. The MRT is also directly connected to the mall beneath the hotel, which makes it easy to get to Orchard Rd or anywhere else you might like to sightsee. The service was always given with a smile. My memories are only happy memories. Wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Service Beyond Expectation!”
Reviews.Author: MelvinL
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay in the hotel recently. Though it was a short 2 nights, I enjoyed myself a lot as I was greeted with a warm smile by the Front Office Receptionist when I checked in at 1045pm on Friday. She was quick in her task and checked me in within 5 minutes to a room with a fantastic view to the ongoing Sand's Integrated Resort which is under construction. Did not had breakfast in the hotel as the Raffles City Shopping Centre is spoilt of choices of F&B and I enjoyed my usual sandwitches! Service at the gym was great and enjoyed a good work out with the assistance of the gym attendant early in the morning! I shall return to the hotel in my next trip to Singapore and do not hesitate to recommend the hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing hotel I've ever been”
Reviews.Author: magoulet
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Singapore is truly a luxurious Asian hotel. Rooms are extra clean, large, extremely well equipped with modern and relaxing furniture. The bathrooms are large and tastefully decorated. This hotel has everything one would expect from an international 5-star hotel: concierge, turn down service, exquisite restaurants and bars. This hotel also has 2 outdoor swimming pools (resort-style) with long chairs (beach chairs) and excellent drinks. It is connected to the famous Singapore underground, from where you can enjoy more shops and restaurants. The gym is large, with both cardio and weight equipment. There is an add-on spa (japanese onsen style) which is a must see. I must write about the breakfast. There is a choice of virtually everything one could think of at a breakfast brunch : fruits, western food, chinese food, japanese food, dozens of pastries, cereals, hot meals, etc ... The food is fresh, the service is exquisite. Perfect execution. I tried hard to find a negative point while I was at the Fairmont Singapore, and couldn't find any.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: paolakarina
Reviews.Content: If you re looking for a 5* hotel avoid Fairmont. We did the reservation through my husband s company and sayed for 3 days. First they gave us a room in the non-renovated area. Room was terrible, smell humidity, dirty carpet, noisy air-con. We asked to change room and we had to wait for an hour until they could manage to do it and went several times downstairs to check for somebody available. The new room was on the renovated area. It was much better than the first one, but still not a 5* standard. Staff is below 5* standard s , too. If you are going to spend for a luxury hotel don t throw your money in Fairmont, check another one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneNikki
Reviews.Content: We normally stay at the Swissotel the Stamford, however after having a couple of disappointing experiences at the Swissotel, decided to try the Fairmont. It was great and much better than the Swissotel. Whilst the view is certainly not as good, the service was impecable. The rooms were nicer and the bathrooms much better than. The location is great for shopoholics as you can go down do your shopping and then bring it back to the room for a rest and then continue again. We wont be staying at the Swissotel anymore now that we have tried the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Fairmont in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: tinseltoes
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the first phase of our honeymoon to The Fairmont - just opposite the infamous Raffles Hotel. As we were Raffles Inc, guests we were shown to a suite until our room was ready. The staff were most pleasant and courteous - nothing was a problem. Our room was very modern, spacious, elegant with a fabulous shower and of course amazing view of Singapore. Food was delicious - breakfast was to a very high standard - taste, service and choice. Between 5pm and 7pm each evening, we had cocktails and canapes before heading down town for dinner to either Boat Quay or Clarke Quay (highly recommended). It was just a short stroll across to Raffles for a Singapore Sling - €13 each approx! Taxi trip was between 5-10 minutes and was inexpensive. There is also the option of hop on - hop off bus ticket from across the road for all the sightseeing you may choose to embark upon! Overall, an excellent hotel from which to explore Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !! Everything is GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: chefaujus
Reviews.Content: Rooms - Big & Luxurious !! Fantastic views !! Excellent service !! Good location !! Highly recommended !!

Reviews.Title: “5* hotel with 4* standards”
Reviews.Author: valtripadv
Reviews.Content: My friends & I booked 2 rooms at Fairmont Singapore for a weekend stay. The deluxe room is very spacious but do not give me feeling of a 5* hotel. Check-in: Is a bit slow but the hotel provides fresh fruit punch for guests waiting for the queue. Room: Stayed at the south tower (the renovated rooms), however, the room still looks old. Very spacious room with balcony overlooking Suntec city, soundproofed walls, large screen TV (not sure how many inch) with HBO, Bloomberg, Discovery channels, plus few others. Double bedroom comes with 2 mini sofa, king bedroom comes with a couch (saw loads of stains though). I would expect a 5* hotel to provide soft bed linens with higher tread counts, bed sheets are a bit rough. The room takes a while to cool and the air-conditioner minimum temperature is 20°c, which can be a bit warm as the room is quite big. Bathroom: Very spacious with bathtub and a very big showerhead. Hotel provides a lot of toiletries like shampoo, moisturizer, shower gel, shower cap, comb, cotton buds, etc. Breakfast: There are 2 floors serving breakfast, one is at Prego (1st floor) & the other at Alligator Pear (8th floor) that serves organic food. We had our breakfast at Prego, it was ok but not the best breakfast so far. Spread includes porridge, hams, salad, fruit juices, bacons, waffles, cereals, fried noodles, miso soup, scramble eggs, etc. If your room do not come with breakfast, eat else where, not very fantastic for a price tag of $40 including taxes & surcharges. Overall, the hotel is ok and it is located in a very good location.

Reviews.Title: “First rate service”
Reviews.Author: silvertraveller76
Reviews.Content: Excellent service. particularly helpful guest services manager Nicholas Longstaff. Nothing was too much trouble. Brilliant Chinese restaurant on 4th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: mikeyyz
Reviews.Content: First of all, I travel internationally all the time, and this was my 5th trip to Singapore. During past trips, I've stayed at the Ritz Carleton (twice), the Grand Hyatt, St. Regis (twice) and the Holiday Inn. I've always had a great experience in Singapore and felt that both the Ritz and St. Regis were as good as it gets in the world. Until this trip. I highly recommend booking the $179 SGD transfer through the hotel if you're in a group. You'll be met at your flight with an escort, taken to the JetQuay VIP terminal, and enjoy a massage in one of Osim's best chairs while your luggage is located and loaded into the hotel's waiting BMW 7-series limo. My two family members were thrilled with their massages while I enjoyed Fiji water and sent all the e-mails I had worked on in the plane. Upon arriving at the hotel, we were greeted by one of the staff, and escorted to our room, with cool towels prior to getting on the elevator, and fresh juice at the room. I highly recommend an upgrade to the Raffles Inc. floors for additional amenities (breakfast + cocktails) As a Fairmont Presidents Club member, they had free gym clothes to borrow and Internet was complimentary. I had used one of my upgrades and we enjoyed a stunning suite - if you want to treat yourself to a bathroom as big as a NYC hotel room, book a Plaza Suite - which includes two balconies and a great view of the city - we were on the 25th floor. Two modern LCD TVs provided ample entertainment - and the housekeeping was typical Singapore perfection - arranging shoes perfectly and folding all the clothes my younger family members had scattered about :) What really takes the 'cake' is that my birthday had been 2 days earlier, and they brought me a fantastic cake and had two of the staff members, including one of the managers, sing happy birthday to us in my room! They even took a photo and brought a framed print of it to me as a memento of the trip. I've stayed at Starwood Hotels around or on my birthday for the last 5 years attending a conference, and I never had any kind of special recognition... let alone a birthday card signed by a dozen staff members! We had breakfast at all three locations offered - the main floor, Alligator Pear by the pool, and the Raffles lounge, and it was excellent everywhere. I recommend Alligator Pear for a quieter experience with a smaller selection of many organic options, and the main lobby for families with a fresh juicer bar. The lounge is great for meetings but there's a 15 minute wait for any fresh eggs as they understandably bring them from the other restaurants. Overall every single staff encounter - from the bell staff, front desk staff (money exchanges, etc.), restaurant servers, and cleaning team - was exceptional. They were friendly and kind, and enjoyed humorous conversations with my younger relatives (when even I might have expected them to be less patient or gracious!) I only wish that the service and training at our very best hotels here in North America could compare. I can't imagine staying anywhere other than the Fairmont on my next trip. I've never experienced a Fairmont outside North America and I'm going to have a hard time renewing my SPG and Hyatt Platinum status for next year because I'm going to have a hard time not staying with Fairmont more often after this great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: ocnrec
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel. staff incredible. so helpful. Everyone Knows your name. Pool great. Bit crowded sometimes. I was in North tower. Rooms better in south tower. Mans spa and gym really top notch. Prefer it if patrons adhered to keeping their pants on though.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Option for Singapore”
Reviews.Author: pdxexpat
Reviews.Content: This is a classy hotel where the quality of the staff and service differentiates it from so many other options. Staff are personable, efficient and on top of things- you can see this by the management roaming the lobby and taking a very hands on role. As other reviewers have noted, the location is excellent. Easy access to MRT, attached to a mall- with inexpensive dining options in the basement and a grocery store. A walk through the lobby takes you to the Swissotel (not a rec to stay!) where you can ride to the 77th floor and a drink while taking in one of the best views of Singapore. If given the option, try to stay in the South Tower, where the rooms have been renovated. My room has a nice contrast of warm wood floors and carpet, great lighting, bose wave sound system, large flat screen and balcony. The price here is not always the best, but if you can get a deal...go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Stay at Fairmont Singapore”
Reviews.Author: VAS27
Reviews.Content: This is excellent and expensive hotel but provides great luxury. The rooms & bathrooms are marvellous. Even rooms have electronic curtains. This is one wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Superb”
Reviews.Author: ashparti
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont for a fortnight on a business cum leisure visit and I had a fabulous time. The rooms are huge and well furnished and each room has a balcony. The hotel is interconnected to the malls and the Swissotel and has an impressive lobby. The bars and restaurants are varied in the experiences and the service is truly outstanding. It woudl be a pleasure to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, best location and will keep coming back to this legend”
Reviews.Author: adrah
Reviews.Content: If there is one thing the is good for Fairmont apart from its outstanding ambience in the south tower, is location location location. Everything is in the same building you absolutely dont have to get out for anything. Service outstanding and food around the place. To me, this is the centre of Singapore city.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Amazing hotel and incredible staff!”
Reviews.Author: Where_I_wander
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and everything about this hotel from the warm welcome we received to the efficient check in blew me away. The room was lovely and the bathroom was huge (we were in an executive room on the 22nd floor). The breakfast was a great start to the day with everything imaginable to eat. Concierge were helpful in pointing us the right direction of places we wanted to see and also in obtaining boxes of orchids for me to bring home. The swimming pool is huge and a lovely way to relax after a hot day's sightseeing. The hotel is interlinked with one of the many malls Singapore has and therefore is handy if you want a cheap bite to eat. The hotel is opposite the Raffles Hotel as well. A taxi from the airport cost about $30 SID, the return taxi cost less than $20 as there were no additional surcharges.

Reviews.Title: “heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: annemarienz
Reviews.Content: Fantastic experience from start to finish. Even arriving at 2.30am off a flight from Vietnam did nothing to dampen the enthusiastic and welcoming customer service of the check-in staff at the hotel. Was offered and accepted a discounted offer to upgrade to an executive room which was well worth the extra dollars. Room was a little oasis from Singapore's humidity and the city view with a balcony overlooking Raffles offered a fantastic view of an overnight thunder/lightning storm. Highlights of the room included the one-touch console next to the bed which operated everything from lights to curtains to the do-not-disturb sign. The comfy chaise at the end of the bed, espresso coffee machine and sublime rain shower and bathtub just completed the picture. While we didn't choose to dine out in any of the restaurants the breakfast served (included) each morning in Prego (sp?) was everything you expect from a 5* buffet and complimentary moet and nibbles in the executive club each evening guaranteed our evening was off to a good start. With a shopping mall at the base of the building and Raffles and Chijmes (sp?) right across the street the hotel was perfectly positioned for a lazy hoiday and the MRT station directly below gave easy access to Orchard Road and other locales. Would highly recommend nearby Loof Bar and The Supper Club when you tire of gin slings at Raffles. The pool area was lovely with plenty of fluffy towels and sunloungers. After reading plenty of reviews raving about this hotel, I was not let down in anyway by my stay.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ck10256
Reviews.Content: I am here at Fairmont Singapore. This is a very nice hotel in a very good location in Singapore. Check In was a breeze. We were upgraded to the corner Signature room on 24 floor with two balconies, one facing "the Durian" (the Centre for Performance Arts/Threatres) and the other balcony faces Clarke Quay. I tried to charm the receptionist of given us the South Tower, but no luck. Very large room with two armchairs and a love seat, 37" LCD TV, Espresso machine, bath robes, remote control drapes, large safe for laptop etc... Location wise, the hotel situates right in Raffle City with direct MRT from airport to hotel. Walking distance to Clarke Quay, Bugis Market Street, Merlion Park, Centre for Performance Arts, Orchard Road and Chinatown. Free Internet in the room if you sign up for President Club membership. We are very happy with our stays at the Fairmont Singapore and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ever Classy...Ever Chic!”
Reviews.Author: mewall21
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Singapore is a very beautiful hotel. It has a great location..., especially because we adjoined to the Raffles Plaza. We stayed in the South Tower. It was newly renovated and had amazing services. We would definitely stay at the Fairmont when returning to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of luxury steps away from Raffles”
Reviews.Author: JGBBristol_UK
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nighs at the Fairmont. A superb hotel, great service, efficient and friendly. We were upgraded as it was a wedding anniversary and had a fantastic view of the city. Great location, across the road from Raffles if you can't resist a Singapore Sling. Ajacent to the Raffles City Mall so convenient for shopping eating and the MRT all without going outside. Nice pool area and good choice of dining in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: GagsDelhi
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a very central part of Singapore. Have stayed here 3 times and its always been a great experience. From the checkin to check out, its always been great. Have always stayed in the refurbished rooms which are fully equipped with the latest amenities inlcuding a Bose Wave system. Large sized rooms, great bathrooms and excellent service. Its also co-located with a shopping mall making it very convenient to pick up those small gifts if you are in for a short Business trip.

Reviews.Title: “A cool oasis”
Reviews.Author: hinaly
Reviews.Content: You step into the lobby of the Fairmont from the sweltering heat of singapore and you enter a different world. The low lights, the candles, the fountain, the cold lavendar compress that is offered to you, and the excellent air-conditioning soothe your nerves and totally relax you. But it is really the service that makes this hotel outstanding.We have stayed at many 5-star hotels around the world but found this one a cut above the others. Do get a room in the South Tower and ask for one with a harbor view. We stayed two days on our way to KL and had a room overlooking the pool. On our way back from KL we stayed for one night and had a room with incredible views. See my photos. Rooms and bathrooms are modern and very comfortable with every amenity including fresh fruits, chocolates and complimentary bottled water

Reviews.Title: “Room mix up”
Reviews.Author: FdV62
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Fairmont during a business trip to Singapore. First, they gave me a room in the old (not refurbished) tower. The room has dirty and old. After complaining, we gave me a complementary upgrade to the new tower in which the rooms are much better. I was not provided any help with relocating luggage and when I entered my new room, there was already someone in the shower! Not a nice experience... I was given another room, but was very disappointed with the overall service of this overpriced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “exceptional”
Reviews.Author: dicko7126
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the fairmont for 5 nights on our way to a cruise and found the hotel exceptional the staff were helpful friendly and courteous and would not hesitate in recommending the fairmont to others. The only suggestion is if you take your laptop with you do not use the hotel as it is quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: nh9801
Reviews.Content: The best thing is the location - above Raffles City shopping complex with lot's or restaurants and shops, and the MRT interchange which allows easy access to all parts of Singapore... We had to connecting rooms on 21st floor which were quite nice. The Sichuan Restuarant was good, breakfast at the Pronto italian restourant also, but there are also so many choices in the shopping center so no need to use the hotel restaurants too often. The kids enjoyed the pool. At check in the staff had a hard time finding the reservation, and even thouigh it was already 7 pm they didn't have two connecting room ready ... but once that was sorted out everything was fine.... Overall there are probably even better hotels in Singapore but the combination of location and price made it an optimal choice for us

Reviews.Title: “Without doubt, the best hotel in the entire world!”
Reviews.Author: bon-travail
Reviews.Content: When I stepped into the lobby of the Fairmont, Sinagpore I was literally blown away. For those of you who havnt been to Singapore, it is a hot and humid place, but when you step into the hotel all of this changes. Not only is the hotel beautifully air-conditioned but there is a cooling sensation made up by the candles, music and water founatins. When you go to the check-in desk (which is about 90 km from the entrance) you are met by a Singaporian girl who gives you a warm towel which smells of lavender-ahhhhhhhhhh - heaven!! And the rooms are even better!!!!!! Ultra-modern with all the new hotel gizmo's, with eletric curtains which open and close the curtains which can either show or hide the 180 degree views of Singapore. But dont think you've died and gone to heaven yet, because you haven't eaten yet!! All restaraunts are situated around the pool and all serve fresh and very tasty food. In conclusion, I enjoyed my time in Singapore immesnly and I would reccommend the Fairmont to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: traveller3530
Reviews.Content: Was staying in Fairmont only 1 night while on transit in Singapore, was recomended by one of my very good friends as he had just finished a conference there a few months earlier. The location is great its right opposite to Raffles. the rooms are clean and huge, the staff is great, service fantastic. Would definately stay there again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: poppinjays1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont for 3 nights, a stop over on route to Perth. We landed very early in Singapore at 8am and they allowed us to check in straight away. We stayed in the North Tower over looking the famous Raffles hotel. The room was clean and spacious, we had asked for high floor but didn't get it. Breakfast was included in our stay which I would recommend. Every requirement catered for. The staff were helpful and always wanted to chat. Had a morning by the pool before leaving and was allowed to use the Spa facilities to shower in before departing the hotel. I would recommend this hotel. Location is close to Quay and Chimes is 10 minutes walk away. Chimes is full of outdoor restuarants.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: perthsingapore
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times in the last few years. On every occassion we have had a very positive experience. The staff are professional, friendly and helpful, and I mean all the staff, from the doormen to the cleaning staff, the front desk to the people who work in the bars and restaurants. The rooms are always clean and comfortable and we especially love the balcony and being able to have the door open to allow the fresh air and sounds of the city in. The location is, I believe, the best in Singapore. I have considered booking elsewhere (just for a change of scenery) but just can't seem to find anywhere that is as central especially with the MRT just under the hotel giving easy access to anywhere in Singapore. Each time we have stayed we've noticed slight changes in the service and though we've always thought it impossible the changes have been an improvement. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore is Fantastic, So is the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: betona
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is located in a great place, connected to a large mall with a food court, the subway and close to many attractions. That makes it easy to grab a bite, find something or hop on the MRT to go to, say, Clarke's Quay or The Orchard. The rooms are plush with nice beds and a control panel by your bed that controls all of the lights and the electric curtains. Speaking of the curtains, when they're closed, the room is absolutely pitch dark which really meant a lot to me as I adjusted to the 12-hour time difference. I've never seen a room get so dark when its bright outside. The staff everywhere are wonderful and smiling, eager to help in any way. I dropped off some laundry one night and found it in my closet the next afternoon neatly folded and hanging. Even at 3:30 a.m. on checkout day, the lobby was bustling with staff who took care of our needs. The Fairmont is clearly a world-class hotel and made my visit to the wonderful country all the better.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: Cat102
Reviews.Content: We made reservations several weeks ahead and needed two rooms. We were told we will be given the refurbished rooms in the South Tower at the time of making the reservations. On arrival, and after spending almost 30 mins at the reception, we were given rooms on the North Tower and we were told that these rooms were newly refurbished (which was not true) because the only thing they refurbished were bringing in a couple piece of new furniture. And some of the furniture does not fit the room in the sense that it was not designed for the room (e.g. the small sofa set was place right in front of the TV in a way that the cabinet drawers cannot be opened and it is just so odd that the sofa and the TV were right next to each other -literally!). The photos on the website showed the Signature Rooms had wooden floors and a smaller carpet but this was not what we got. The rooms were very dusty. There was a layer of dust on the TV cabinet and the bed side tables. They had the old TVs (not the flat screen ones they showed on their website pics - and remember, we were given the better "signature room" as opposed to the usual "deluxe room"). The toilets were dirty and had dark and dirt spots on the white sealant along the bathtubs and the sink area. The sink clogged all the time and required declogging. Other than location of the hotel, I find my stay generally very unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but rooms were disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Suitecaser
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the hotel the week after it changed management to Fairmont so there seemed to be some renovation. We were advised by Amex that one of the towers had better rooms, the front desk suggested the opposite tower - in any case the rooms needed some work - i think they were about to be renovated. Otherwise the hotel was great, the staff were pleasant and I liked that it was attached to a mall. The mall had the coolest stores, including a store called 'That CD shop' - the most amazing shopping experience ever. The location was very convenient. In general i was very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: SuffolkLucchese
Reviews.Content: Two stays in quick succession both in the North tower. Perfectly adequate. Location is good, opposite Raffles and a little away from Orchard Road. Rooms pleasant, well sized and light, particularly like the chaise longe in a each room. Breakfast in the Prezzo coffee bar is good and staff attentive. With plenty of choice around this is fairly priced and a good option for the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Irene060
Reviews.Content: Great location - most restaurants within easy walking. We stayed at the Fairmont for five nights in the north wing and then one night on our way back from Phuket in the south wing. Yes the north wing hasn't been refurbished yet but the room was very comfortable and everything worked very well. For the five days we had a corner room with two balconies and great views. The room in the south wing was refurbished and lovely. We had the option of breakfast on the executive floor or in any of the other restaurants. Coming from the cold UK we generally opted for the pool restaurant as it was so lovely to sit outside. The Fairmont is next to Raffles, everyone has to have a Singapore Sling in the Long Bar. Chimes is also just around the corner which is a development built around a church which has loads of restaurants and bars. The bars put up big screens to show the sport and Harry's Bar definitely leans towards Liverpool supporters. In fact, we watched the Liverpool Chelsea game on 1 Feb and the atmosphere was fantastic. After we'd won all the supporters, both Asian and European - all wearing Liverpool shirts - sang You'll Never Walk Alone and it was fantastic and very emotional. If you're a Liverpool supporter and there's a game in - usually at some ungodly hour - go there it's great fun! Boat Quay and Clarke Quay are definitely worth a visit and most of the bars and restaurants are located here. Prepare yourself to run the gauntlet of restaurateurs trying to get you to eat at their place on Boat Quay. Indochine is a restaurant which faces Boat Quay and the food was superb, not cheap, but then nothing is at the moment with Sterling the way it is! If you're looking for a mad night out go to Howl at the Moon - Orchard Road - this is a piano/singalong bar which is open until about 4.00 am. Great night out!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for business and probably pleasure”
Reviews.Author: johngie
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Fairmont Singapore for seven nights on business - was immediately upgraded to the South Tower by virtue of my Fairmont Presidents CLub membership. Room was great, very business friendly and comfortable - the staff were always very helpful and prompt. Great location - across the street from Raffles, a mall attached, two more across the street and you can really walk or take a quick taxi to anywhere. Pool looked great - all business for me unfortunately :-( Great hotel - great experience.

Reviews.Title: “South tower is great... not sure about North tower”
Reviews.Author: Matfern
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at Fairmont Singapore using my Feeds at Raffles membership voucher. I love the renovated room and I cannot comment on the North tower as I was told that it's not refurbished. The only downside is the expensive carpark rates, it cost SGD$25 per day whereby some hotels provide guest with complimentary car pass.

Reviews.Title: “Love the suites!”
Reviews.Author: MrPanda
Reviews.Content: I initially had mixed feelings when reading the reviews here. We stayed at the Plaza View suites because I enjoy the extra space and luxury. In addition, we had two little kids so the space is a must! Overall, it was well worth the extra money! Great size room, modern furnishings, huge bathroom and great service. The best hotel so far to date.

Reviews.Title: “Location, convenience and quality - one end higher!”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFrier
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is centrally located and nicely decorated - although one end of the hotel is better than the other, with prices to match. My room in the lower end was comfortable and overlooked the pool. The breakfast restaurant next to the pool is a great location. Some of the electronic devices in the room are more distraction than use, but my room was clean and functional with a great bathroom. Staff were friendly. One rip off: the hotel hire car from the airport. Catch a taxi instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bojomania
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Fairmont was excellent. The room was well appointed, breakfast included in our rate was wonderful and the location is perfect. Walking distance to Chinatown, harbour and many other sights. The service at the hotel was excellent and we really appreciated the attention they give to guests. I will book the Fairmont on our next trip and would not hesitate to recommend it to other people visiting Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly staff, Excellent Breakfast.....”
Reviews.Author: laksarawak88
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel from 24 dec 2008 for 3 nights. reservation was done through travelocity for US$156.34 per night including free breakfast for 2. during checkin, requested to have the room in the south tower but was told that additional S$50 for the upgrade. rejected it and was put on the 19th floor in the north tower. this is my first time staying in fairmont. the room had a king size bed, a balcony, bathtub, minibar full of beverages, a nice selection of tv channels. the room looks a bit old due to the wooden furnished. you can double confirm this when you checkout the wooden bathroom door. but besides this, the accessories in the room are top notch. you do not need to bring toiletries at all. they have shampoo, conditioner, moisturizer, dental kit, sewing kit, mouth wash, hair dryer, iron + ironing board, umbrella, bathroom slippers and the list goes... The TV is a flat screen CRT which is ok and nothing fancy. feather liked pillows is nice and soft. there are also some magazines to read. the room had a magnificent view facing towards the Singapore Plaza direction. the room gets cleaned up twice a day. In the morning and late afternoon which is a plus. the morning breakfast can be taken either at the 8th floor near to the swimming pool or at 2nd floor in the plaza market restaurant. the food serve at the swimming is more limited. i feel like it targets more for the western tourist since it lacks of the eastern cuisine but it is enough of you are a light eater. pasteries, cereals, buns, juices, fruits etc. plaza market restaurant however has a more variety of food. they have the fruit juice station where you can request to have your own fruit mixed! u also get to taste some of the eastern cuisine like curry chicken, roti prata, sambal, congee(porridge), soup. From my observation, most of the staff working here are from the mainland china although English is well understood and conversed. Overall, the service was excellent and the hotel was clean.

Reviews.Title: “World of Difference: North Tower vs South Tower Rooms”
Reviews.Author: MouMou
Reviews.Content: The last I wrote a review on Fairmont Hotel, was on Dec 6 2007, and rated it excellent. This year, on Dec 7 2008, I booked into the hotel again. This time, I stayed at the North Tower room, 1419 on Dec 7 2008. The room faces the pool. I finally figured out the vast difference in the reviews for Fairmont Singapore. There is a GREAT difference North Tower (Fairmont Rooms) vs South Tower (Deluxe Rooms). North Tower rooms are definitely shabby and trapped in time. I agree with some of the reviews in this website. Definitely not worth paying for. My brother & his family checked into the South Tower Room. It's a great positive contrast. Refer to my review on Dec 6 2007. The hotel shares the reception and the check-in time is EXTREMELY slow. Service staff is trying their best but overall service is slow. Guests could not be checked-in on time. I waited 2 hours from check-in time (2pm) and finally checked in at about 4pm. My brother could not check-in till 6pm. Service personnel tried to make it up by upgrading him to the club floor. What really puzzles me is that the long lead-time for check-in is consistent year-in year-out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: RichD1975
Reviews.Content: Got a deluxe room at £125/night through lastminute.com and was upgraded to a Fairmont room - very long and thin but spotless and well-appointed. Open screen at the end of the shower meant that the floor got wet and slippery but that is my only gripe. Friendly staff, great location (above a v good mall for the shopaholics), not much to complain about. Excellent pool - they'd come round with cold towels and fruit kebabs occasionally which was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “fairmont was great”
Reviews.Author: allanhFife
Reviews.Content: we booked the fairmont for quality and location and we were not dissapointed.everything from the time we arrived till the day we left was superb.i was a little apprehensive after reading some of the reviews about the hotel but i can honestly say that this was one of the best hotel stays i have ever experienced.could not fault anything even though i tried

Reviews.Title: “Not very personal service”
Reviews.Author: alanyeo76
Reviews.Content: Checked into the hotel at 3pm, requested for a twin bed when i did the booking. However, was given a double bed instead. Although i would say that the front office staff were very polite and always smiling. Was asked to wait in the room as they are getting the room with the twin bed ready and informed me that it will take around 1.5 to 2 hours. However, since they allowed me to stay in the room and wait, i thought it should be ok. Waited in the room till about 6pm and still nobody called me to changed room and therefore, i called the front desk to check and was told that the room was still not ready. therefore, informed them that i will be heading out for dinner first as i was getting hungry. After dinner, around 9pm, i went straight to the front desk to check whether my room was ready and this time round, they have my room ready but was not able to issue a key card to me as the machine was downed. however, they asked the bell boy to follow me back to my room and got my luggage and the bell boy will open up the new room for me and the key card will be sent to my room once it was ready. The key card was subsequently slotted under my door at around 9pm plus. That would mean that i literally only got to my new room at 9pm, remembered i check in at around 3 pm in the afternoon. The very next day, i called the rfront desk to request for a late checkout but was declined straight off. In my mind, i was thinking, wow... that was a fast response. Later when i was checking out at the front desk, i overheard a couple, requesting to check out late, and the front desk officer was quick to say," Not a problem". I was thinking, how come my request was turned down straight away and this couple's request was approved straight away?? Anyway, i had written to the hotel and still waiting for them to get back to me. Anyway, now my comments for the room, the room was clean and neat with 2 single king's size beds. The washroom is very big and clean as well. The views from the rooms wre great and pool was very nice too. Overall, a 5 stars hotel standard. They had the coffee making facilities in the room too. However, what i think is that the hotel though with great facilities and location, was rather "cold" as it seems to me that no one really bothers about the problems that i faced as i needed to repeat myself each time as there was not one person handling my case personally.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: brlau88
Reviews.Content: We were extremely satisfied with our stay at the Fairmont. Here are just a few reasons: - Below rack rate room when booked through Hotels.com - Free room upgrade from the front desk due to a longer than normal wait to process our check-in. - Free breakfast voucher - Luxurious room and bath - Complimentary water - Great location, right next to Raffle City Shopping Plaza and City Hall MRT station - Friendly staff who are customer-focused - Nice pool and gym facility You get the picture. Rooms are normally going for 2x what we paid for so look for a deal. If you find one, book it and enjoy your stay. You'll be glad you stayed at the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic and breathtaking views!”
Reviews.Author: ritafant
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two days in august 2007 (it was still called Raffles The Plaza) and had a deluxe room in the South Tower. The room was well appointed, comfortable and very high tech, modern stylishly bathroom. We had a fantastic and breathtaking views of the Singapore skyline! Great breakfast.; nice and large pool with sunlounges , it was a nice place to relax. Staff very kind and helpful. The location is excellent : next to City Hall MRT station and the Raffles City shopping centre, within easy walking distance of many shopping malls, restaurants and attractions I hope to come back here again !

Reviews.Title: “wonderful city, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: albertst
Reviews.Content: We chose the Fairmont for a 10 day holiday stay because of its location and a good price for a 5 star hotel. (and after reading reviews on Trip Advisor) It didn't disapoint in any way. We previously stayed at the Sheraton Towers 4 years ago and enjoyed that, but wanted a more central location for 10 days. It was a wonderful experience, we felt so relaxed after our stay in SIngapore and that was certainly due to the Fairmont. We will definetly return next year for another holiday in this wonderful city. Many friends had said 10 days was a long time in SIngapore, but we still haven't been to the zoo, Changi or Sentosa, so there is plenty to do there! Our room was on the 21st floor (quick lifts) in the South Tower. Very comfortable and quite spacious with a view on the pool side looking out towards the Padang. The Raffles City Shopping Mall attached is lovely, with a sensational Japanese restaurant bazzar downstairs. The turndown service was great, lovely to come back each night to tidy room, soft lights and music and fresh towels. The bathroom was good, large with a goood sized bath, and a good shower that did splash a bit onto the rest of the floor. The airconditioner was silent and easily adjustable from the bedside console, as were the curtains and lights. Our room came with breakfast included and we alternated between the more traditional restaurant and the poolside buffet, service was personable and very responsive. We felt very well cared for. The buffets were wonderful, fresh tropical fruit juices individually prepared, cooked western breakfast on demand and Chinese and Malay fare with a wonderful array of pastries, the fresh fruits were outstanding. Breakfast on til 11 am as well helped jetlagged guests from Australia! The Fairmont staff were always welcoming and responsive. We had an extended checkout until 4 on the day we were leaving, and the offer of using the courtesy lounge by one of the staff whilst we were sitting in the foyer with our suitcases waiting for a taxi. Cleaning staff were always evident, and housekeeping responsive to our requests for cleaning whilst we were at breakfast. Sheets crisp and changed daily, (only on the last day of 10 days was a card left to say if we didn't need sheets changed to leave card on the bed, sure more water could've been saved!) My husband swam every afternoon in the circular pool on the 8th floor, never too crowded and for some reason a pleasant breeze blowing! Position is wondeful, CityHall MRT is at Raffles City Shopping Mall which is attached to the Fairmont. We walked every day, walking distance to the National Museum, History Museum, Peranakan Museum all highly reccommended. Easy MRT to Chinatown, Little India, Arab Quarter, Orchard Rd, Newton Food Markets, and on and on. Across the street is Raffles with a nice bakery, and good range of restaurants and bars. As you can see we loved the city and the hotel experience was a great one, perhaps the South Tower made the difference for us to the previous post, but thanks to TRipAdvisor we had read previously that the South Tower was the way to go. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Like stepping back to a shabby 1980s”
Reviews.Author: RampantScot
Reviews.Content: Just checked into Fairmont, Singapore (used to be Raffles Plaza...I think!) and not impressed. Been to Singapore many, many times and this was first visit to this hotel. Booked corporate rate of SGD305 plus local taxes per night through company (preferred hotel) but not worth it. Check in was fine, efficient and friendly. Great location but really shabby decor and very, very dated. Shocked to see graffiti on one of the doors in the hall way on the way to the room. Not typical for Singapore. Room on 7th floor is large, corner room but looks like a scene from a 1980's Dynasty show, all I need is my shoulder pads to really fit in. Dated furniture, dirty marked walls, wall paper is that material like stuff....like wool stuck to wall paper. Lots of gold coloured metal lamps, dated and battered furniture. Air conditioning has no adjustable temperature setting that I can find, still quite hot and humid, not good in Singapore. No wifi and cable link costs SGD28 plus tax per 24 hours.......even though I just needed an hour for work e-mails. It’s SGD28 for 24 hours minimum! Booked for 5 days but checking out tomorrow and moving to one of my regular hotels down the street for same price or less. If you get this room for SGD200ish, it's OK. If you are used to decent Singapore hotels, stick to Conrad, Pan Pacific or Mandarin Oriental. I could get the same rate or cheaper and they are more comfortable, modern and better maintained. This booking taught me to stick with my tried and tested favourites......and to check Trip Advisory before I book! Photos to follow!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for business and tourism”
Reviews.Author: onBusiness015
Reviews.Content: The hotel is First Class. Nice room, great view, good location. It is attached to a shopping mall! We were on business and enjoyed the good location, you are centrally located. There is a nice ppol which is shared with the Swissotel, nice poolbar. We had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: sayuna
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Fairmont during the F1 weekend and a few days after. The city hall location above MRT is superb, not to mention the many choices of restaurants and cafes underneath the hotel -- super convenient! Loved it more than staying around the Orchard area. Hotel room is lovely, a nice touch with wooden floor. Ordered room service a few times - reasonable prices and good quality. Only problem with the room is the bathroom design. Aesthetically it looks very nice but unfortunately they didn't extend the shower area with glass door or something to prevent the water from leaking which creates a mess and slippery floor every time. Overall, highly recommend the hotel and would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fairmont!”
Reviews.Author: sxymo
Reviews.Content: My fiance' and I stayed at the Fairmont for the the F1 race, Sept. 27-Oct. 2, '08. We had a fantastic experience, at the race and the hotel. We were on the 12th fl. of the North Tower and had a great view of the skyline and down below-the pool. Although we didn't get in the pool, people were always in the pool and seemed to be having a great time. Our room was big and spacious, the bed was terrific and the feather pillows-heavenly! We didn't use the room service or mini bar options, but the housekeeping services were great...we loved coming back at the end of the day to a sparkling bathroom and a made up bed with the corner turned down and an orchard on it. Bottled water and ice was always replaced as well as well as unused bathroom amenities. The lobby was gorgeous and the staff was friendly and very accommodating! The Fairmont is in the best location for sightseeing...the bus and MRT lines are right in the vicinity, so I didn't have far to walk carrying all of my shopping bags. A mall and supermarket (although pricey) is also in the hotel, below the lobby. We had the best time and we will return soon.

Reviews.Title: “singapore sling”
Reviews.Author: summer08Brisbane
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the time of our lives. We couldn't fault the hotel, the room, the room service, cleanliness. Everyone was so friendly and welcoming and the concierge was definately our best friend. I would highly recommend this hotel. We are looking forward to our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: WharfTrader
Reviews.Content: stayed here for the F1 GP - great location for that and for the rest of the city as it seems to be half way to everywhere (most of the sites, business distrcit, shopping, Clarke/Boat Quay) - lobby is nice - check in was quick - staff friendly - room was ok - good size bathroom - they were a bit stingy with the towels though - balconey a nice touch (i think all rooms have one) - pool area very pleasant - though little airflow so boiling hot even for Sing - Ink Bar a little disappointing, a bit clubby for the clientle - breakfast was good on the Exec Floor - had some in room dining which good but portions a little miserable - overall the staff were excellent - though a little pricey, reasonable value for money all told

Reviews.Title: “Exemplary”
Reviews.Author: Turkeyjay
Reviews.Content: The hotel is approximately a 20-minute drive from Changi airport. The airport shuttle bus costs SD$9 per adult, taxi cost ~SD$14. It is conveniently located next to City Hall MRT station and the Raffles City shopping centre. It is within walking distance (through the airconditioned malls) to the Singapore Flyer. Check-in time is 2pm, but we were given a room straight away even though we arrived at 9am. Check-out time is 12 noon, but we were also allowed a late check-out of 3pm at no additional cost. We stayed in a Raffles Inc Club Room, which we found was excellent value for money. The room was large and included a balcony and impressive electronic day and night curtains. It was immaculately clean, comfortably and stylishly appointed. There was a very impressive Lavazza coffee machine in the room to make your own in-room espresso – perfect after a long flight. Our bags were sent to our room very quickly and there was a complimentary fruit platter and bottled water on arrival. Staying in a Club room allows you plus an invited guest entry to the Raffles Inc Lounge. This lounge offers breakfast from 6-10am (you can have breakfast at 2 other restaurant choices in the hotel if you want, but it is quieter in the lounge), from 10-5 tea/coffee/water/softdrinks and biscuits are available. From 5-8pm is happy hour – complimentary alcoholic beverages are available (beer, wine, champagne (Moet), top-shelf spirits (Johnnie Walker black, Skyy vodka, Bombay sapphire gin, Baileys etc) and hot and cold dishes changing daily. There is also a live cooking station with 2 hot dishes prepared to order, and a delicious selection of desserts. There is a free broadband internet terminal in the lounge, plus some magazines and other reading material. There is also a private gym on this level (23rd) for guests staying on the club floors. There are 2 swimming pools with sunlounges on the 8th floor. There is also the “Alligator Pear” alfresco restaurant that overlooks the pool area – nice for breakfast. All of the staff that we encountered were very friendly and helpful. This is my second stay at this hotel and I will definitely stay here again next time I visit Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: WarwickshireGenie
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay. This hotel was everything we hoped it would be. The staff were so helpful and nothing was too much trouble. Our room on 7th floor overlooked Raffles and had 2 balconies. It was a very high tech room with electronic day and night curtains, CD with speakers in the bathroom, internet access and a range of international power sockets. Attention to detail was fantastic, for example someone came and replaced some fresh grasses in the bathroom. We didn't have breakfast but did eat in the hotel's Italian restaurant, which was good. The kids loved the outdoor pools. We were granted a late check out of 4pm and after this we were able to use a hospitality suite. The location of the hotel is great within easy walking distance of many attractions. It also is incorporated into a large shopping Mall and underground train station. Should we return to Singapore we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: 39er
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel four times before and after it became the Fairmont. I wont be staying there again. The hotel is functional good location but tired and the staff are not to be trusted. Our holiday was ruined when we discovered that my wife's camera with irreplacable family memories had been stolen from our room. I reported it but no action was taken. The manager phoned to say that we could take it up with the police. That was as we were checking out and heading for the airport. Petty thieving by staff reduces the standard of even the best hotels to that of a cheap boarding house.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: palurosi
Reviews.Content: stayed on stopover to Australia with 2 and 5 yr olds. Great location as you can get around easily to shops/cafes etc with going outside as it was so humid when we were there! Hotel was great except the pool was under renovation.... the one reason we booked this hotel!! was very disappointed although they offered a shuttle bus to use of a pool (2 much hassle with stroller etc so didnt) Room had 2 double beds and fabulous bathroom etc. Breakfast was included - amazing... every food you could want was there! staff very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. short walk to merlion and singapore flyer and mrt was right beside us. perfect location and a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad choice”
Reviews.Author: Travel_freak_mas
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel, deluxe room, for three nights and found this hotel is really wonderfull. The room condition is excellent, the location is perfect, the staff are kind enough. The gym, steam bath and sauna are awesome. I would really recommend this hotel. However, if I have to spell out some weakness, I will recommend this hotel to provide some free fruits for guest inside the room (most of the hotel in Singapore doing that). Another part is the bathroom design in the room. The shower area do not have a curtain, everytime I took my bath, the water will spill to the main area of the restroom. Kind of difficult to describe over here, but if you have chance to stay here before, you will understand what I am trying to point out.

Reviews.Title: “Functional!”
Reviews.Author: Brit-abroad-in-Asia
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, the Fairmont hotel is a functional business hotel. The rooms are not large, but are clean and the bathrooms are nice. The location is convenient for most of Singapore and being directly over Raffles City, its easy to pull in some shopping time outside work hours. The amenities are disappointing - the gym equipment seems to be quite old and its difficult to book a tennis lesson. But, on the positive side, the business centre is efficient and the internet connection in the rooms works well, if a little expensive. All in all a good place to rest your head during a business trip, but I'd be disappointed if I was on holiday in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New name but same quality experience...”
Reviews.Author: JazzieB
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Fairmont Singapore for 3 nights. Have stayed at this hotel every year now since 2002 and athough the name has changed our experience has not. When I found out that the hotel had become a Fairmont (from previously being Raffles the Plaza and before that the Westin Plaza) I was slightly apprehensive about any potential changes, especially after reading some reviews, but can honestly say that we were as impressed as ever. If anything I think the customer service has gone up a notch - certainly in the lobby area the staff seemed more attentive. I always book through a local Singapore agent and have never experienced a problem with a booking and manage to obtain an all inclusive rate. I would strongly recommend booking a room in the South Tower as these are more modern and are well worth the extra few dollars. One of the many things I love about the Fairmont is that you can step outside your room onto the balcony and take in the atmosphere and city buzz from above and the views are just amazing. For someone who used to live in Singapore I think that the location is just perfect - shopping centre and MRT attached (just 3 stops to Orchard Rd), within walking distance to Suntec City, the Esplanade, Sim Lim, Bugis, Boat Quay, as well as all of the 'just over the road' places such as Raffles Hotel and Chijmes. I did pay more this year for the hotel but it seems that all hotel rates in Singapore have gone up and this one by no greater proportion than any other. Have also stayed at the Oriental Hotel, The Fullerton, Mandarin, Pan Pacific and others but keep coming back to the Fairmont. Can't wait for next years visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MagdalenaH
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont Singapore for work. The hotel was excellent from the time I checked in, to two weeks later when I checked out. The lobby is beautiful and relaxing. Reception was very friendly and quick. The room had plenty of space and was nicely appointed. Turn-down service every night and they set the music to classical so you feel really relaxed when you come back each night. The bed and pillows were very comfortable, and had great sheets. All lights / curtains are remote controlled. Excellent spa bathroom with great Miller Harris products, walk-in rainfall shower, over sized tub, and glass vanity/sink. Each room has a balcony. The hotel is directly attached to Raffles City shopping center and you can access the subway without leaving the building. Grocery store is located in the shopping center downstairs; very convenient for snacks. Nice gym. Great location: close to downtown, across from the Raffles Hotel (have a Singapore Sling at the Long Bar), and across from Chjmes. A couple of subway stops from Orchard Road. I was happy to return home after two weeks, but sad that I had to leave my beautiful hotel room!

Reviews.Title: “Nice singapore stopover”
Reviews.Author: AlainAntwerp
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Fairmont Singapore on our way to Bali. We initially booked the hotel when it was still called the Raffles Plaza. Overall our stay was nice and we enjoyed the facilities of the hotel. We booked a slightly more expensive room in the South wing which was really nice: excellent and large bathroom, nicely sized room, nice view from the room and all amenities were fine. Hotel pool, though sometimes crowded as pool is shared with the large Swisshôtel nextdoors, was a nice place to relax, though it was sometimes hard to get a bed in the sun (pool deck is in full shade as of ~4pm). Fitness facilities are nice as well. We ate outside of the hotel so have no clue on restaurant service. Check-in was extremely smooth as we could check in as early as 9am. Overall, a nice stay, not stunning but for the price paid very happy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: nz08
Reviews.Content: Overall we were happy with our stay, though it wasn't without a few niggles. We stayed en route to Sydney and New Zealand, for two nights. I booked when it was still Raffles the Plaza. Overall it worked out well for us at the rate we paid. Good: - upgraded due to hotel being busy and having booked early. So in North Tower, but on executive floor. We weren't allowed to use the executive lounge, but with our 11 year old so with us, this was fine. - room large, comfortable & clean. Great views from the high floor - over the Esplanade, part of the Padang and the city. - Location was great for us - across from Raffles (we had booked afternoon tea) and up from Suntec Mall where we did the Hippo tour from. Also walkable to National musuem. - Bell "boy" was very sweet to our son. Could have been better: - the room rate on check-in was more than on my reservation. After quite a while conferring with management, the original rate was confirmed. - there was no bed for our 11 year old, despite several emails after the initial booking to correct where this had got lost. On phoning reception they said that would be SIN $30 / night additional cost. When I'd returned to reception to show them my emails, again the original rate was finally agreed. - we went out to get food, but the bed wasn't there when we returned. In all, it probably took 3-4 hours for the bed to show up. After an overnight flight from London we finally got the bed at about 2300, having put our son to sleep in our bed. Singapore in general we really enjoyed. We would recommend: - Afternoon tea in the Tiffin room at Raffles. There were a couple of tour groups, but they sensitively sat smaller parties in a slightly separate area, which was nice. You are also encouraged to leave by the main lobby, which was a nice touch. Do book ahead though - we booked ages in advance (it was a Saturday). There definitely was no getting in on the day. - Night Safari - National Museum, including History of Singapore wing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: blschwar
Reviews.Content: When I made my hotel reservations, this hotel was originally called Raffles Plaza Hotel. I had wanted to stay at a Raffles chain but could afford the original Raffles so decided to book at the Plaza. As the trip neared, the hotel changed it's name to the Fairmont. Apparently Fairmont owns Raffles and decided to change the name of the hotel to avoid confusion. This hotel was fantastic. We were upgrade to a HUGE room that was perfect for our two day visit to Singapore. We really liked the location and service was impeccable. And the price was great too. You have to check out the pool area, surprisingly large for a hotel in the middle of the city. Breakfast by the pool was great too!

Reviews.Title: “Superb service”
Reviews.Author: AndrewEC1
Reviews.Content: Seamless, smooth and gracious! These are the qualities of both the Hotel and the staff. I had a great 3 nights stop over on my way to Australia, I truly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveler450
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property several times when it was the Raffles Plaza, and was a little concerned to read on TripAdvisor that since converting to a Fairmont, the level of attention and service had deteriorated. Not at all true, in my opinion. Still the same high quality of service and amenities. Towels refreshed twice a day, bathroom amenities replenished, etc. Stayed on the Executive Floor and the Executive Lounge has maintained its excellent qualities. Of course, the location is excellent, and the Raffles City mall has been upgraded to the point of being unrecognizable. Definitely where I'll continue to stay when I travel to Singapore on business, which is frequently.

Reviews.Title: “a beautiful I.M. Pei designed hotel”
Reviews.Author: RubyNYC
Reviews.Content: The I.M Pei designed hotel is reminiscent of the Four Seasons hotel in New York. We were graciously checked in by Karen, who informed us that our travel agent had booked a two-bedded room. When I explained that we were there to celebrate our 25th anniversary, and that a king sized bed would be more appropriate, she immediately congratulated us, changed the room, and asked if we would prefer champagne or red wine. We had little use for the concierge, as a wonderful doorman (whose name I've unfortunately forgotten) showed such concern in answering our questions, making recommendations and providing directions, that we required nothing additional. He never let us leave the hotel without our being sure of how to get where we were going, and being wished a good day. Our room was lovely, and the bathroom impressive, The tub was big enough for two (and a perfect place to share the champagne), and a wonderful overhead shower occupied the balance of the bathing room that was seperated from the sink and toilet areas by a glass wall. The modern furnishings and great view of the city enhanced our experience. The international buffet breakfast that was included in our package was opulent and tasty, served alongside the lovel duel pools. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Raffles Inc. rooms very nice”
Reviews.Author: j889814672
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights in April 2008 at the Fairmont for a conference in the Raffles City Convention center. The overall experience was nice. Check In Check in was fairly slow, but this was my first time to the hotel so they had no guest history, and they did upgrade me to a Raffles Inc. room. Room The room I had was spacious, well lit, and well laid out. It was nice to be on the Raffles Inc floor as the room had recently been renovated and one had access to the breakfast and evening snacks. Two small complaints with the room, however, one is paying high prices for internet connection, and the 2nd very important issue is that the air conditioning didn't work. I complained 3 days in succession about this, and I know that efforts were made to fix it, but this is an older property and while the rennovation was nice, it clearly didn't touch the a/c system. In fact most of the common areas of the hotel, the gym, and the restaurants were quite hot. Because I was only in the room to sleep, I never made a huge issue of it. TV channels in the room were very limited. Gym The gym was well equipped and had some of the latest Life Fitness equipment including ellipticals, treadmills, and cycles. It did have some older equipment as well. There was also a complete selection of weight machines and free weights. Dining Dining in the hotel is nice, but quite expensive. Other options are readily availble in the basement of the attached mall, and across the street at Chijmes. Location Excellent. Walking distance to a number of restaurants, and the attached mall is quite nice. I will stay here again, but I'll probably make certain that I get a room that will cool below 25C next time, and I probably won't risk anything other than the Raffles Inc. floor.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5-star, but a good 4-star”
Reviews.Author: MariaPaula
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmount in December 07 during 7 nights. Halfway through the week, it went from being called the Raffles Plaza to become the Fairmount. I stayed on the Raffles Inc. floor (25th or 26th floor) in the North Tower. It was a huge corner room with big 2 big balconies (1 towards CHIJMES and the other towards the Financial District) and great finishings. I did not see the issues other reviewers saw about tired carpeting and bathroom, everything looked renovated (and trust me that I looked). I expect to be blown away by 5-star hotels. This hotel is a 4-star level. The biggest complaint is that the internet service was not free. One had to call reception, get a code, enter it everyday (and some days it did not work, but we were reimbursed), and I don't remember the price but it was not cheap. For a high-tech country like Singapore, that is just ridiculous. Sure we had access to the internet in the business lounge, but who wants to wait around for a computer to free up and have people lurking around? I loved the mattress and the electronic controls in the room. A few disappointments when the hotel changed management: 1/ the bath supplies offered by Raffles were more exotic and luxurious than the ones offered by Fairmount, 2/ No more chocolates on my pillow! 3/The turndown service became less efficient. The breakfast and "happy hour" at the Raffles Inc lounge were phenomenal. All kinds of choices, and all delicious. The service was spotty. We noticed that some customers were mostly ignored, while others were served promptly. Luckily for us, we were always in the latter group. Some of the reception desk people were professional but cold, others were very helpful (I dislike over-the-top, fake American-style friendliness, but expect a minimum of assistance). Great location for everything, although it's faster to walk half a block to get a taxi rather than wait at the hotel door because the traffic blocks the entrance for the taxis. So overall very good, but not fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: guynz
Reviews.Content: We visited Singapore and were after a hotel with 3 things; Great Location, a good swiming pool and luxury. This hotel delievered all of these things and more. We were surprised at how nice the rooms were, one of the nicest rooms I have ever stayed in. Toiletries were lovely. The pools were good for a 'city' hotel and our teenagers were able to spend a few hours per day cooling down. These pools are not flash but they are better than what you need for a hotel in a large city. We found the location to be excellant. Close to shops, the underground and lots of tourist atrractions.

Reviews.Title: “mmm... not that good, average”
Reviews.Author: MXvoyager1
Reviews.Content: the hotel is nice almost brand new service is not that good front desk staff is a little dissapointing, delayed answers Rooms are smalls. we ask for a rooms with intercommunications (since we have childs), they preconfirm, but we get opposite rooms in the same floor, Do not expect too much, is like any JWmarriot (Asia version) 8th floor Pool is very nice and restaurant by the pool is awsome and the service is great (this saves the stay)

Reviews.Title: “Sick of the North Tower...”
Reviews.Author: skyfriendbrighton
Reviews.Content: This is a huge hotel, linked to the Swissotel next door. The lobby has just been refurbed and is impressive. Unfortunately, it is effectively two hotels in one, the North tower and the South tower. The North tower (I am there now) is depressing and faded, with stained acrylic carpets, chipped sanitary ware and drab decor. The bed is really hard and uncomortable. I made mine bearable by using the bedlinen from the other bed in the room as an extra mattress pad. I mentioned this to the receptionist, and she said housekeeping would come to help. No-one came.
